The caterer rushed out to catch her, “I’m so sorry, are you alright?” Agatha turned and through the pudding, plastered a villainous grin on her face. 

“Clearly I’m never better!” she said in a sing-song sarcastic way. “Now, if you’ll excuse me, I need to see if I can get pudding out of these pants.” She stormed off back toward the restroom, tears began to fill her eyes. As she looked in the mirror she realized the severity of the damage. She was absolutely covered and she would not be able to get the pudding out of her pants or shirt. At this realization the tears overflowed, streaming down her face, taking some of the pudding with them. She hurried to wipe them away, a rush of embarrassment overtaking her. This was not her! She was never this emotional and she didn’t breakdown like this, especially at work. She had to pull herself together. Luckily she had a change of clothes for the gym in her car. She didn’t have any other in person meetings planned today so it wouldn’t really matter. She could lock herself in her office and finish the day in peace. She ran out to her car and changed in the restroom. 

 

She anticipated the meetings to go through lunch, expecting to have had her fill with catering, but since that did not go to plan she needed to find food and fast. She had just enough time to run to the cafe down the street and grab a sandwich. She hurried out of the building onto the busy city street as she got a call from Sharon. 

 

“Yes?” she barked.

“Oh, Honey! I’m glad I caught you. Are you doing alright after this morning?”

“Is there a reason you called?” Agatha rolled her eyes and checked her watch.

“Herb says he needs to move your meeting to today, are you able to head over to his office now?” Agatha groaned, the sandwich would have to wait. 

“If I must. Tell him I’ll be there in 10, and he owes me.”

“Oh and I heard about the caterer. Do you need me to get you some foo…” As Agatha abruptly turned around she had managed to run into the person walking behind her, dropping her phone in the process. She let out a winy groan and started to bend down to pick it up. Before she could, the other person grabbed it for her. As she handed it back they made eye contact and her heart dropped. 

 

“Well, it appears we’re destined to run into each other.” said the sultry voice. It was her. Of course it was her. Standing before her in fitted black dress pants and a white button up with the sleeves rolled up. The same cool scent of rain and incense filling the air around her, that delicious smirk plastered across her face. 

“I… well…you” Agatha stammered in a fluster. 

“We can’t keep meeting like this.” The woman said with a chuckle. How could she be so alluring and confident?

“I don’t… I didn’t…I have to go.” She started to rush off as she heard the woman behind her.

“Can I at least get your number! Or maybe your name?” Agatha continued on, not daring to look back and deal with that today. 



She managed to make it to Herb’s office only 5 minutes later than she had said. Nearly out of breath and her heart still racing, she made her way in. 

 

“Ah! Agatha! Thank you for being flexible. I know this isn’t ideal but I have to run and meet our guest composer in an hour and wanted to make sure we had everything set for tomorrow. Oh, is everything alright?” He said as he took in her sporty appearance. 

“It will be” She said through gritted teeth. Not entirely hiding her dissatisfaction

“Good, did we get everything set with the vendors?”

“Indeed.”

“Fantastic. I did want to go over seating one more time. It appears we are adding 10-15 additional guests and will need to find room for them.”

“Well, is it 10 or 15?”

“Plan for more to be safe. Dr. Jones on our board has had some new doctors join his staff at the Children’s hospital and we’ll need to accommodate them.”

“Indeed” She quipped with a sarcastic smile “Anything else?”

“Ensure we have enough bar staff to help monitor how much people are drinking. We don’t need a repeat of last year when Dottie managed to go through a bottle and a half of wine.”

“Already addressed.” She could feel her patience waning. 

“Fantastic! Looks like we’re in for a great evening. I’m rehearsing with the conductor and string quartet this evening. I'd like for you to stop by.”

“I’ll do what I can. Are we good?”

“I guess we are. Are you alright? You’re looking a little overwhelmed and a bit disheveled.” Agatha blinked, taken aback by this bluntness. 

“I’m fine, just lots to do, must get to it!” She tried not to sound too pained.  

“Well then by all means. Don’t let me stop you. But Agatha, do make sure you get some rest, we have a big weekend ahead of us and I need you at your best.” Agatha’s face betrayed none of the rage boiling inside her but instead she plastered on the largest smile she could and nodded with a high pitched, “yup”. She rushed to leave his office and return to her cave to review the new task she’d been assigned. 

 

As she made her way into her sanctum she slammed the door behind her. Stumbling her way to the couch in her room she flopped down on her stomach letting out a large sigh. After a moment she rolled over to ponder the ceiling and decompress from the chaos of the day so far. She glanced over at her desk noticing something on it. As she raised herself onto her elbows she could see a plate with a sandwich and a bag of chips and a Dr. pepper. Sharon, somehow always two steps ahead. 

She wandered over to her desk and devoured the sandwich before starting to redo the seating plan. As she worked she could feel herself growing more and more tired. Her eyes began to droop as she was fighting to stay awake. Eventually the pull to slumber was overpowering and she rested her head on the desk telling herself it would only be a moment's rest. 

 

Nearly 2 hours later she was awoken by someone shaking her. 

“Agatha! Agatha, dear, you should go home. It’s past 5:00.” In her hazy stupor, she was able to make out Sharon. 

“What? What happened?” She hadn’t quite settled back into reality. Blinking, she tried to summon her consciousness. She had fallen asleep. At work. At her desk. “Wait what time did you say it was?” 

“Oh, Honey, it’s almost 5:30. You’ve had one heck of a day it seems like. A-hahaha!”

“5:30! Ah I have to go meet Herb, he’s rehearsing and he wanted me there.” 

“Oh no dear. Not today. You need to head home. I’ve already let Herb know you were working on other things and would have to catch up with them tomorrow.” Agatha was so relieved, she didn’t know how she was going to make it through that rehearsal. She had that weak dizzy feeling of having napped too long and she was still so exhausted. 

“Thank you Mrs. Hart.”

“Oh, sweetheart, how many times have I told you, just call me Sharon.” She gave the woman a faint smile and blearily made her way over to grab her things. “Do you want a ride? Or are you ok to drive?” Sharon questioned 

“I’ll be fine, I’m not going far. I’ll see you tomorrow bright and early - lots of work to do setting up.” 



Agatha arrived home and made straight for her bed. Despite having slept for a good portion of the work day she was ready to turn in for the night. She lay there for a moment as Scratchy joined her, purring loudly and nudging her to feed him. 

“I know Mr., give me a moment and I’ll feed you. I just need to rest a minute.” Scratchy, unmoved by this request, advanced his disruptions and made his way to her stomach. His tiny but painful paws stabbing at her abdomen as he made biscuits. He eventually he found a particularly delicate spot and leaned all his weight down. “OUCH! You really are relentless! Fine, I'll get up!” They walked together to the kitchen and she gave him his food. Quickly checking her phone she found a text from Jen. 

 

Alice says she has you covered, just tell her when and where. 

 

She knew she could count on Jen and now she felt she could count on Alice too, at least for this. Breathing a sigh of relief she reached into her fridge and grabbed some cheese, salami, pickles, olives, and a cup of yogurt. Though the sandwich had been filling at the time, she suddenly found herself ravenous. She grabbed a can of tin fish and half a baguette from the pantry and made her way to the couch, turning on the TV as she dug in. Satisfied once again, she could feel the pull of slumber creeping up. Before she could fall asleep in another uncomfortable position she cleared her mess, got ready for bed and went to sleep as the sun was just setting.

Chapter 6: The Fundraising Dinner

Chapter Summary

Agatha's event is finally here and all seems to be going well until the mysterious woman shows up again.

Chapter Notes

This is probably my favorite chapter so far. And yes they finally actually meet each other.

The next morning she awoke to a mound of purring fur once again kneading on her stomach. Shooing Scratchy away she rolled over to check the time. As she did so her daily alarm went off and she groaned knowing she couldn’t ignore it and fall back asleep. Groggily, she shuffled around to get ready for the long day ahead. By the time she made her way out the door she finally felt like she had her head on straight, she couldn’t afford to repeat yesterday’s disasters. 

 

She hurried into the building, running into Sharon in the lobby as they both made their way to the little theatre where the event was to be held. 

 

“Please tell me the florist is already here” 

“Oh yes dear, they arrived about 30 minutes ago and are getting everything unloaded.” 

“Good I’ll need to work with them on getting two more centerpieces, we’ve had to make accommodations for some additional donors. Can you go find the caterer, we need to review things sooner rather than later.”

“Of course dear, Herb said he planned to stop by with the musicians before lunch, do we have something prepared for them or do you need me to bring lunch in?” 

“Ugh, I didn’t even think about that. Yes we’ll need to bring something in.” Sharon stopped her just as they were about to head in. 

“Dear, forgive my asking, but are you feeling alright? You haven’t been yourself these last few weeks. You usually don’t miss a beat.” 

“I’m fine, I just have a lot going on.” 

“I know you probably don't want to talk about yesterday, and your mother…”

“Absolutely not!” Agatha snapped harder than she intended. “Not today, we have enough going on.”

“Alright dear, but if you need anything…”

“I don’t, are we good?” 

“Yes, I’ll go get the caterer.” Sharon scurried off. 

 

As she entered the room she could feel the chaos of set up screeching to a halt as all eyes made their way to Agatha. She loved feeling the power of her presence keeping everyone on their toes. She made her way to the front of the room near the small stage and set her things down as the work began to resume around her. She looked around realizing the additional tables and chairs had not been set. 

 

“Somebody get me Carl” she shouted as she made herself comfortable at a table nearby. A few people flurried about until Carl came rushing up to her. 

“Agatha! Good morning, how’s everything looking?” 

“I’m missing those two additional tables I asked for yesterday.” Nervously, Carl glanced around. 

“Um… sorry, must have missed that. Where did you want them?”

“Well if you bothered to look at the updated seating chart I sent.:.” She stopped short as she was able to log into her computer and see the email she intended to send still sitting as a draft on her screen. 

“Nevermind, I’ll show you myself.” They walked around discussing the adjustments as groups rushed off to get everything reset. She settled back at the table just as Sharon returned with the caterer, an iced coffee in her hand. 

 

“Here you are dear, and don’t worry I made sure they brought some samples for you. You need to eat something.” Despite her hardened demeanor she couldn’t help but have a soft spot for that woman. 

“Thank you Mrs. Hart” 

“Anytime dear” 

 

The meeting with the caterer went off without a hitch thanks to Sharon. Though hectic, all was going well. The florist was accommodating and able to adjust to the new seating arrangements and things were coming together just as Herb made his way in with the musicians. 

 

“Ah Agatha! Glad to see you’re here! I’d like to introduce you to William, our guest composer. This young man has some serious talent! Just wait until you hear the work we’re premiering this evening, positively magical!”

“You can call me Billy. Nice to meet you ma’am.” 

“Likewise. Well the stage is set, you’re free to rehearse, don’t let me stop you.” She didn’t intend to stick around for the rehearsal. She couldn’t stand the tediousness of hammering in the same passages over and over and didn’t want to hear it so, with everything in motion, she headed back to her office. 



As soon as she closed the door she could feel the anxiety she had been carrying begin to melt away. Everything was coming together, as it usually did, but this time it was really exhausting her. As she took a moment to gather herself she got a text from Jen.

 

I know you’re probably busy getting set for tonight but wanted to see if you had time for lunch? 

She had the time, she wasn’t going near the room until the rehearsal was over at 2. Though, she just wasn’t sure if she had the energy to leave and come back more than once and she’d still have to go home and change later. 

 

There’s no way I’m leaving before 4 today so unless you’re coming to me it’s a no.

 

I’ll bring you lunch, besides Alice wants to get the lay of the land before tonight. 

 

Alice? She’s the one bartending?

 

Duh! You thought she was going to fork over her trained staff on a Saturday when she could do this by herself in her sleep? 

 

Agatha was shocked! She barely knew this woman and did her best to make a bad first impression. Jen really had her wrapped around her finger. 

 

I’m in my office so head up when you get here.

 

Wait, what do you want to eat?

 

I don’t care, surprise me. Something light, it’s going to be a long day. 

 

Agatha busied herself with the other work she had been avoiding while preparing for this event. Before she knew it she heard a knock at her door. 

 

“I come bearing food and an Alice!” Jen announced as she and Alice entered and sat at the couch. “How ya holding up? It’s been a while, are you feeling better?”

 

“I’m fine, what did you bring me?”

 

“Turkey Club. You’re welcome.” Jen huffed. She grabbed the bag from Jen and started to devour the sandwich. “Damn Agatha, did you forget to eat again?”

 

“No, but I could eat my way through an entire buffet right now” she said through a mouthful of sandwich. 

 

“What time should I be here tonight and what do you want me to wear?” Alice asked

 

“Guests will start arriving at 6 so if you want to come back at 5 that should be plenty of time. And just all black. It shouldn’t be too difficult but, you have to watch out for Dorris, that woman has a hollow leg and she’ll drink the bar dry and end up on top of a table. Everyone else needs to get drunk enough to put us in their will.” 

 

“You got it. I’m looking forward to it.”

 

“I wish I could be there to see you in action, but alas, babies wait for no one and I have a feeling it’s going to be a busy night. Have you heard from Ralph lately? I thought he was supposed to be back last week?” 

 

“His cruise ended in the Maldives and he decided to take some time off. I guess he found a sugar daddy who has whisked him away to Greece or something. That asshole was supposed to be my plus one for this thing so I’m not very happy with him right now.” Agatha grumbled as she sat back in her chair. 

 

“Good for him!”

 

“Whose Ralph?”

 

“Lady Bohner” Jen and Agatha said in unison. 

 

“Oh! I didn’t realize you all knew each other. He’s been in and out of my lineup for years!”

 

“Yeah he’s a peach.” Agatha said sarcastically. “Well, you want to see where you’ll be trapped for the night?” 

 

“Sure!”

 

“I have to head into work, but I’ll see you later!” Jen leaned in and kissed Alice. Agatha rolled her eyes at the affection. “I’ll see you, whenever?” Jen started to walk towards the door. 

 

“What no kiss for me?”

 

“I would rather give birth.” Jen scoffed and headed out. 

 

“Alright, follow me.” She motioned to Alice and they headed back down to the little theatre. 

“What’s this event for?” Alice asked as they headed down to the theatre. 

“We have a yearly dinner for our top donors and feature one of our guest artists. This year they found some wunderkind twink composer. He’s premiering a new work and they’ll be the first to hear it. They love the exclusivity of it so it’s usually one of our biggest nights for donations.”



As they approached the room they could hear the quartet running through the music. The tones sounded eerily familiar and hauntingly beautiful. Agatha took a moment to let the sound wash over her before quietly entering, gesturing for Alice to follow silently. They walked over to the bar in the back and Alice began to take inventory and get her bearings while Agatha stood transfixed by the music filling the hall. She eventually made her way to sit at one of the tables to finish listening. As they played the final notes she could feel tears welling in her eyes. This was not like her, but something about the simple melody rocked her to her core. Before a tear could fall she shook her head and took a breath, stilling the cacophony of emotions threatening to burst forth, and turned her attention back to Alice. 

 

“Any questions? Anything you need for tonight?” 

“No, I think I’m all set. Do you know what time this usually wraps up?”

“I’m going to try and get people out of here by 11 but you shouldn’t need to stay past then regardless. We have a crew coming in tomorrow to clean and break down and catering will take care of any dishes.” 

“Oh this is going to be a breeze!” 

“Obviously you can keep any tips they give you, I can pay you $700 for the night if that works?” 

“Seriously? Yeah that totally works. Thank you”

“Well you are helping me out of a bind last minute and we have the budget. I’m very good at my job” 

“I’m not at all surprised at that.” 

“Well, if there’s nothing else you need I have to head out and pick my dress up at the dry cleaner. I’ll see you at 5?”

“See you then!” 

 

By the time she got home Agatha had just enough time to grab a snack, feed Scratchy and get ready for the night. She had decided on a bright red dress that she’d had for years that at one time had belonged to Wanda. The top was a tight corset fit with straps over the shoulders and the skirt gathered in cascading waves down the right side. They had always been able to exchange clothes though Agatha was a bit taller than Wanda. As she went to zip up the dress it took a little more effort to get into than she remembered, having to suck in and lift her tits to get it closed. She touched up her makeup adding a bright red lipstick to match the dress and finishing with the perfume oil she got from Jen. She squeezed her feet into a tolerable pair of high heels and grabbed a second pair of flats to change into later, there’s no way she’d make it the whole night in heels. She took one final look in the mirror. The dress was a little tight, but it made her tits look great and she could use that to her advantage with the lecherous donors. Satisfied with the look, she drove back to Music Hall. 

 

She arrived just in time to catch Alice walking up to the building. Dressed in all black, as requested, with her hair tied back, she really knew how to clean up. 

 

“Oh hey Agatha! Oh my gosh you look stunning! How does this look for tonight? I brought a suit jacket just in case.”

“Oh thank you Alice! You look great, I wouldn’t worry about the jacket, it’ll be more trouble than it’s worth.” 

 

They walked in together and headed to the little theatre. Agatha held her breath as she opened the doors hoping everything had come together. She was not disappointed, the air was filled with the scent of the flowers that engulfed the room. Candles flickered on each of the tables and the stage giving the room a warm and inviting glow. The musicians were warming up and all was set. She could now relax and begin to enjoy her evening. This, after all, was her favorite part; prying an ungodly amount of money from these wealthy, decrepit, assholes. After all, they had more money than they knew what to do with, so why not put it to good use. 

 

She headed out to the lobby where she met with Herb. “Agatha, you've done it once again! Everything looks fantastic! If all goes well I think we might break a record.” 

“Oh, I intend to!” She said with a villainous grin. 

“That’s what I like to hear! They are going to be blown away with the music tonight. That kid has some real talent! Did you get a chance to hear any of it?”

“A bit. I’m interested to hear the whole work.”

“Well you’re in for a real treat! As are you my good man! Good to see you Alan!” Herb called out as he wandered to greet the first of the patrons. 

 

Agatha plastered the most charming smile on her face and joined him in welcoming everyone in. Lawyers, executives, and doctors filed in dressed to the nines showing off their exorbitant wealth, all of which Agatha was eager to siphon from them. At last the board members began to arrive, the first of which was Dr. Jones followed by a gaggle of new doctors. As she took in the faces of those surrounding him her heart began to race. There was one new face that was all too familiar, it was her. Dressed in a fitted forest green and black suit with a golden tie. Her hair pulled back in a twist with a few strands falling down framing her face. The woman was more enchanting than ever. Determined not to let her professional demeanor slip she took a breath and made her way over to the doctor. 

 

“Dr. Jones, how lovely to see you! Herb had mentioned you’d be joined by some new colleagues.” She did her best not to make too much eye contact with her but she could feel the weight of the woman’s gaze transfixed on her, that ever familiar smirk glowing on her face. 

“Agatha! It’s been too long! Let me introduce you to some of our new surgeons!” He rattled off the names of the men around him before finally introducing her. “And this is Dr. Vidal, she specializes in neonatology.”

“Pleasure to finally meet you Ms. Harkness.” She said with a wink as she reached out, taking Agatha’s hand in hers before placing a soft kiss on her fingers. “You can call me Rio.” Agatha could feel her face begin to flush and tried to respond.

“It’s mine, the p…pleasure” clearing her throat she tried again. “The pleasure is all mine. Well I’m going to head in. See you all in there.” She turned quickly and rushed back to the little theatre and over to Alice at the bar. 

 

“Wine, now please!”

“Sure” Alice chuckled. “Any particular wine? Or?”

“I don’t care, just get me something to drink, quickly.”

“You got it.” Alice poured her a glass and she quickly drank most of it. “You good?”

“I’m fine” she choked out. “It’s going to be a long night.” 

 

At that moment she saw the group of doctors entering into the hall, Dr. Vidal quickly spotted her as they found their seats. She couldn’t seem to escape the woman’s attention and worst of all she appeared to enjoy how this unexpected turn of events flustered Agatha. Agatha finished her drink and escaped to her table at the front just as dinner was being served. She picked at her plate and attempted to make small talk with Herb and the composer while she used most of her energy to avoid looking in the direction of Dr. Vidal. At last Herb stood up to make his announcement before the concert started. 

 

“Thank you all for joining us this evening, you all are in for something truly remarkable.” As Herb spoke Agatha snuck back to the bar. “Young William Kaplan here has composed something very special and you all have the distinct honor of being the first to experience what I am sure will be one of many notable works. But first let’s hear from our young savant!” The room rang out in applause as William took the stage. Agatha turned to Alice and asked for another glass of wine. 

 

“Thank you Herb, it is really my pleasure to share the premiere of my latest work with all of you” As Agatha sipped her wine she could feel someone approach the bar beside her. 

“Bourbon, neat” she heard the sultry voice of Dr. Vidal. Of course it was her, as if she had been waiting for an excuse to corner Agatha again. Drink in hand she stood next to Agatha, not saying a word, taking in William’s speech. 

 

“This work, in particular, is influenced by the folk songs of my mother’s homeland of Sokovia. Though you may recognize some of the themes used I’ve managed to expound upon them in a way that I hope resonates with each one of you. So without further ado, Lullabies of my homeland. ” 

 

Agatha and Rio stood there, neither one truly acknowledging the other's presence, as the music began, the haunting melodies from before washing over them. It was then that Agatha realized why they had stirred something in her. Sokovia, Wanda was from Sokovia and had sung many of these folk tunes to her. Immediately she was brought back to when she was pregnant with their child. Each night Wanda would hum these very songs to the little life growing inside her. Now those same tunes were echoing in the chamber around her. She could feel a lump beginning to form in her throat as she fought to hold back the tears forming in the corners of her eyes. She took another sip of her wine before making her way to the bathroom. 

Once inside she stopped at the sink running her hands under the cool water and using a towel to cool the back of her neck. It had been one thing to be thrown off by Dr. Vidal’s unexpected presence, but now this music. She could feel herself losing the battle to the tears threatening to fall as they began to stream down her face. She allowed herself a moment for them to pass before she pulled herself together. This was one of her biggest nights and she couldn’t afford to blow it. She adjusted her dress, giving herself a little more room to breathe and fixed her makeup before sneaking back to her seat in the theatre. 

 

Somehow she made it through the rest of the concert without another emotional moment. As the music drew to a close the room erupted in applause. Herb once again made his way to the stage to make a closing statement. 

 

“Let’s hear it again for Mr. Kaplan and our wonderful musicians!” Applause once again filled the room. “It is due to the overwhelming generosity of the people here tonight that we are able to support and honor new and growing talent such as Mr. Kaplan. Which brings me to everyone’s favorite part. With your commitment tonight of continuing generosity we are able to offer William a residency and will continue to premier his works along with several other young and highly talented musicians. So as you enjoy the rest of your evening make sure to connect with myself, Ms. Harkness, or any of our other staff you see around to make your donations, which I’ll remind you are tax deductible!” Herb finished with laughter from the crowd. 

 

Now was Agatha’s time to shine. She schmoozed, and sweet talked thousands out of the pockets of the wealthy people around her. She knew which buttons to push to make them fold to her desire. She was in her element, so much so that she nearly forgot about Dr. Vidal. That was until the woman once again managed to corner her. 

 

“Well well well, if it isn’t Ms. Harkness herself, once again.”

“Dr. Vidal, I hope you enjoyed the music this evening.” She could feel her heart begin to flutter and a heat rise in her chest at the woman’s presence.

“Oh I’ve been enjoying much more than the music this evening. This is quite an event you conjured up. Do you do this often?”

“We have several events throughout the year but this is by far the most extensive.” She was doing her best to not make direct eye contact. She didn’t want to fall apart at the woman’s gaze. 

“Well, you really know how to make an impression. Is it just me or does it seem serendipitous the way we keep running into each other? It’s almost as if the universe is trying to tell us something.” At that she caught Agatha’s direct attention. Rio's eyes glistened as she spoke as if a fire was burning behind them. 

“Oh, and what might that be?” Agatha responded almost sheepishly. Rio leaned in closer. 

“I’m not afraid to admit that from the moment I first ran into you in the bookstore I was enamored by you. Then you appeared again, and again. But each time you managed to slip away before I had a chance to even get your name, let alone your phone number.” She wagged a finger at her. Agatha’s heart was again racing at the boldness of this woman. “And now here you are, Agatha Harkness, radiant as ever. Perhaps it’s fate?” She said with raised eyebrows as she took a sip of her drink. Agatha stood there stunned and speechless, a blush blooming across her cheeks, her mouth agape as she searched for a way to respond. In the end all she could utter was a meek, “Perhaps.” 

 

“Well I don’t want to keep you from what looks to be an overwhelmingly successful night. Though, I’m not letting you get away this time without at least giving you my number.” She handed Agatha her card. Matte black with glossy gold lettering. “For whenever you’re ready to see where fate takes us. Until then, te veo.” And with that she brushed past Agatha to rejoin her colleagues. 

 

The night eventually drew to a close and the final guests made their exit. Agatha slipped into the flats she brought with her and took a moment to rest as workers began to clear dishware from the tables around her. She looked toward the bar and saw Alice helping to clear and clean glasses. 

 

“You know you can head home. They’ve got this covered.”

“Oh I don’t mind helping out. Makes things go faster. Seems like it was a good night, everything went smoothly.”

“Oh yes, I’m guessing we nearly doubled what we made last year. Herb will be thrilled.” She and Alice shared a chuckle at that. “Alice” she paused. “Thank you… for tonight. It wouldn’t have been nearly as successful without you.” The words felt foreign to her but she meant them.

“Oh of course, anything for a friend.” Agatha was touched by the sincerity in her voice. 

“Oh here, before I forget, your check for tonight. If you’re good I am going to head out. I’m afraid if I don’t leave now I might fall asleep on my way home.” 

“Oh be careful, if you want I can give you a ride.” 

“No, I'll be fine, I don’t have far to go. I’ll see you around. Oh and tell Jen I owe you two dinner soon.” With that she headed home.

Chapter 7: twelve

Chapter Summary

Agatha reflects on her experiences at the fundraiser and our gay best friend Ralph returns

Chapter Notes

I know I said the last chapter was my favorite, but this one is even more so. I love writing Ralph and Agatha's interactions. This is also one of the main chapters I knew I was going to write when I first thought of this. Hope you like it :)

Agatha was glad to have the next few days off after the whirlwind of the fundraiser. Though she was used to such events this one had really exhausted her. She spent the majority of her break in bed only moving to feed Scratchy and herself. In that time she was able to reflect on how close she had come to unraveling altogether. The music had stirred up many unresolved feelings she had about not only losing Wanda but also their child. The sorrow felt fresh and raw, especially after this final unsuccessful attempt at rebuilding a part of the family she had dreamed of. She let herself wallow in that grief where before she had kept it small and buried inside her. The pain had always been too overwhelming to deal with but now, with nothing to distract her, it overtook her whole body. 

 

She poured over the photos and memories she had stashed away to help alleviate the sorrow and after a couple of days she could begin to feel the weight of the pain start to lessen. As she started to return to a more neutral state she was able to push herself to leave her house; she had to as she hadn’t been to the grocery in weeks now. Though it felt like going through the motions she also felt a sense of relief at the normalcy of it. After picking out the bare minimum to sustain her she made her way to the cashier. When she went to pay, a card fell out of her wallet. As the woman handed it back to her she realized it was the card Rio had given her. In her grief she had forgotten all about her interaction with Dr. Vidal, but upon seeing the card she felt something spark inside her. This twinge of excitement was nearly immediately squashed with an overwhelming sense of guilt. Was she ready to risk her heart again while she still had such unresolved feelings about Wanda? This was not the time or place to sort through this so she made her way back home. 

 

She was quite skilled in avoiding most of her unpleasant feelings but after these last few days of letting the flood gates open she had a hard time not contemplating how drawn she was to Rio and the proposition she made. It was as if that little spark had already begun to engulf the space she had just cleared within herself. She couldn’t deny, the woman made her feel a way she hadn’t felt since Wanda and even then, this was something completely new. Yet, she wasn’t ready to move forward. At least not yet, she needed time to get back to herself more completely. She stuck the card to her fridge and took the last of her time off to clean and reset as she was back to work the next day. 

 

The first few days back were luckily uneventful and it allowed her to get back to her normal routine. She was finally feeling back to her formidable self when she got an email from her lawyer about planning a trip to Boston. She had managed to forget about the whole inheritance disaster she still had to handle with her mother. For now she was going to continue to avoid dealing with that so, on the way home that night, she stopped and grabbed a random assortment of snacks and treats to deal with the renewed anxiety. 

 

That evening, as she was settling in to watch a murder documentary surrounded by her chaotic feast, she heard a knock at her door. Assuming it was a mistake or a delivery she tried to ignore it but the knocking came again. Who the hell could that be? She thought as she made her way to the door. She paused again at the door before the knocking came again a third time. 

 

“WHAT DO YOU…?” She shouted as she swung the door open. 

“Hey mama!” Ralph purred from the doorway, surrounded by suitcases. 

“Ralph what the fuck are you doing here? Why didn’t you give me a heads up?”

“I thought you’d enjoy the surprise! Are you gonna let me in?” She glared at him for a moment before stepping aside to let him enter. He dropped his stuff just inside the door before settling himself on the couch. “Woah those pregnancy cravings are really getting to you huh?” He said as he took in the smorgasbord splayed across the coffee table. 

“I’m not pregnant you ass.” She snapped at him.

“You sure about that? I’ve never seen you eat half this stuff.” He picked up a jar of kool-aid pickles raising his eyebrows. 

“So maybe I’m going through some shit, doesn’t mean I’m pregnant.” 

“Oh really, what shit?” He asked as he plopped himself down on the couch where she had been sitting. 

“My mother” She said, rolling her eyes. 

“Oh riiiight. Damn, how’s that going?”

“It’s not. I’m eating about it, can’t you tell?” 

“Wanna talk about it?” 

“Not really. How was Greece? I missed you at my fundraiser, remember?”

“I know! I’m sorry about that! But you also wouldn’t have said no to a free trip to Greece!”

“Was it really free?” She questioned judgingly. 

“It was worth the price I paid, I can tell you that. And I brought you some presents so you can’t be too mad at me. How’d the fundraiser go?”

“Eh, better than last year. We nearly doubled our donations.”

“See I knew you didn’t need me!” 

“But it wasn’t a walk in the park! Between Evanora showing up at my office the day before, the fucking Lullabies of Sokovia from the twink composer they brought it, and then that doctor hitting on me. It would have been a lot easier to deal with if you had been there.”

“Wait, woah, back up, walk me through all of that!” Agatha rolled her eyes. 

“Ugh, fine!” She groaned, “Apparently Evanora wants some shit from the house that she can’t get to until I go to Boston and have the deed to the estate signed over and get the keys.” 

“Ugh, when is that happening?”

“I have no idea, I’ve been putting it off, as you can see.” 

“Ok, now tell me about this twink, is he cute?”

“He’s too young and poor for you, honey.” 

“Booo! But his music was good? He’s like a tortured artist or something?”

“I wouldn’t say that. The whole work was his take on Sokovian folk music because of course it was.” 

“Ok, and why does that sound familiar?”

“Really?” She glared at him judgingly. He looked dumbfounded. “Wanda was from Sokovia, bitch.” She snapped at him. 

“Oh shit! Holy shit no way! What are the chances?!” 

“I don’t know, but it’s put me into a dark place. As you can tell.” She gestured toward the buffet. 

“Well good thing I’m here now, help dig you out a bit!” 

 

He tried one of the pickles before spitting it out immediately. “Ugh, you’ve got to be kidding me with that shit. That is not a normal depression craving, those are foul!” 

“Please, they’re not that bad!” She took a bite of a pickle before following it up with mint ice cream. 

“No, nuh-uh, I’m not buying it. Did you actually take a pregnancy test?” 

“Yes.” She said sternly

“You sure you did it correctly?”

“What the fuck is that supposed to mean?”

“Who knows, it could have been a false negative or something. I think you should check again because that is not normal.”

“You’re not serious.”

“Do I look like I’m joking? I’ll go buy one now if that’s what it takes.” 

“Don’t bother, I think I still have some.” 

 

Reluctantly she got up from the couch and headed to the hall bathroom with Ralph following closely behind. She grabbed a test from under the sink and sat down to take it as Ralph stood in the doorway. 

“Making sure I’m not cheating or something?”

“Making sure you’re doing it right.”

“If I can’t figure this out I shouldn’t be a parent.” She quipped back. She smacked the test on the counter before washing her hands then pushing past Ralph. “You want something to drink?” she shouted as she made her way back to the kitchen. 

“Just a soda or something. I have to give my liver a break. Hey, how long does this usually take?”

“Give it a few minutes. Might as well get settled into the guest room and come back to check.” 

 

He took his things into the room and eventually came back into the living room carrying the test gingerly with two of his fingers. 

“Well?” She asked

“I haven’t looked yet, I don’t want to read it wrong.” 

“Oh please!” She rolled her eyes and grabbed it from him. “These are idiot proof” She held her breath for a moment before turning the test over. Though she expected it her heart still dropped at the result. “See! I told you, I’m not pregnant.” He took the test back from her. 

 

“Well damn! Then you need to get laid or something because this,” he gestured to the food, “Is beyond pathetic, even for you.” He made his way into the kitchen throwing the test away and washing his hands before going over to the freezer and adding ice to his drink. As he did so he glanced up noticing the card stuck to the fridge. 

 

“Dr. Rio Vidal? Ooooo, is this that doctor that hit on you? They sound promising.” Agatha had rushed over at the mention of Rio and ripped the card off the fridge. 

“That is not something you need to be concerned about. It’s nothing, I don’t know why I even still have this.” She walked over and threw the card in the trash. 

“R iii ght. Because that reaction totally seemed like nothing.” He went over and grabbed the card out of the trash. “So, is she hot?” Agatha sat back down on the couch pretending to ignore the question. “I mean clearly she’s interested or she wouldn’t have given you her number right?” Agatha gave him a sideways glance. “Have you texted her yet? You obviously kept it for a reason. I’m sure Dr. Vidal would love to help you fix whatever it is you’ve got going on.”

“She’s not that kind of doctor. She’s a surgeon.”

“AH! A surgeon! Then you know she has to be good with her hands.” Agatha rolled her eyes. 

“I don’t think I’m interested in starting a relationship right now. I have enough going on.”

“Who said anything about a relationship? No need to make a commitment if you just want to play doctor for a bit. Come on! When was the last time you let loose and just went for it?” She sat there silently mulling over what Ralph was saying. “Agatha, do you really want to end up, old, bitter, and alone like your mother?” she snapped her head around to look at him.

“Excuse me?” she said incredulously.

“Because you are definitely headed in that direction. Seriously, girl, you need to get that pussy ate before it dries up like the Sahara desert.” Agatha’s face was red with rage at that last comment. 

“Ok, I think we’re done here. I’m going to bed.” Agatha stormed off down the hallway to her bedroom.

“Love you girl! I just want what’s best for you!” Ralph shouted down the hallway after her as she slammed the door. 

 

The sudden noise startled Scratchy who was curled up on her bed. With her back against the door she slumped down onto the floor where Scratchy joined her. 

“Sorry mister, didn’t mean to scare you.” She glided her fingers over his fur as he began to purr. She let out a long sigh, maybe he’s right , she thought. No one had touched her in that way since Wanda. Maybe it was time to take a risk, what did she have to lose? For now she let the thought marinate, resolving to sleep on the idea and see how she felt in the morning. 

 

As soon as her head hit the pillow she fell into a deep slumber. As she slept, visions of Dr. Vidal began to fill her dreams. They were back in the little theater where Rio had cornered her, the space between them practically non-existent. She could smell the scent of fresh rain and grass as the woman leaned in, their lips almost touching. Agatha stared into her large doe eyes, aflame with desire. Her hands reached to grab Agatha’s waist, her fingers dug into her back as she pressed her lips against Agatha’s. The delicate sensation quickly gave way to a ravenous hunger as Rio leaned in further, pushing her back into what should have been a wall but instead they began to fall back onto her bed. Rio was now on top of her, her mouth making her way down Agatha’s body. She could feel the woman sucking and biting her nipples as she scraped her fingernails down each side of her body, making their way down around her legs. She felt Rio get up to stand at the end of her bed. She sat up on her elbows to take in the woman’s naked form, her burning eyes pinning Agatha to the spot. “You know you want me” echoed the voice of dream Rio, her mouth curling into that delicious smirk she always wore. “ All you have to do is ask” She leaned down, her arms curling around Agatha’s legs at her hips as she drew her closer to the edge of the bed. Her gaze never left Agatha’s as she lowered her head between her thighs. Agatha could feel the heat building in her as she drew closer to her core. Just as she was about to make contact, 

BWAH BWAH BWAH, 

her alarm jolted her awake from the dream. Agatha was breathing heavily and lying in a pool of her own sweat. Scratchy, having heard the alarm, pounced onto the bed as she began to sit up. “Oh mister, I’m in trouble.” Her heart was still racing, pounding throughout her body. “I think Ralph may have been right. FUCK!”

Chapter 8: Dinner with Friends

Chapter Summary

Ralph, Jen and Alice bug Agatha into texting Rio about going on a date.

Chapter Notes

I am leaving town next week so I'm not sure how much I'm going to be able to write. I'm hoping to get a few more chapters out before I go.

Agatha, not being one to admit when she was wrong, did her best to avoid Ralph as the day unfolded. The feeling must have been somewhat mutual as it appeared Ralph was doing his best to avoid Agatha’s attention anytime they were in the same room. This didn’t last long though as Jen sent them both a text around dinner time.

 

So which one of you was going to tell me you were back in town, Ralph!? And, Agatha, Alice reminded me you still owe us dinner for helping out at the fundraiser. 

 

“Whose Alice?” Ralph asked as he made his way into the living room. 

“Oh, right, I guess you haven’t been here since that started. Jen has a new girlfriend.” 

“Oh boy, is this another Madison situation?” 

“No, I think you might actually like Alice. She seems good for Jen.” 

“Oh, well, good for Jen then. Look, Agatha, about last night.”

“Don’t worry about it, I'm over it.” 

“Really though, I’m sorry for bringing your mother into it, that was too much.”

“Like I said, don't worry about it.” She said with a forced grin. 

“Ok, fine, I’ll drop it. Just know that I really do care about you. I just want you to be happy.”

“That doesn’t sound like dropping it.” He gestured to zip his lips and throw away an imaginary key. 

“So, you buying dinner for me too or just Jen and Alice?”

“Don’t push it and I just might, if you’re lucky.”

“Maybe if you see what I got you in Greece you might be persuaded?” 

“Perhaps, show me to me.” He rushed off to the guest room, returning quickly with a gift bag and a wrapped gift. 

“Here, start with the bag.” She first pulled out a bottle of olive oil followed by a bag of greek coffee. 

“Oooo, alright this is a good start.” She held out her hand anticipating the wrapped item. 

“This I found on Lesbos island and immediately thought of you. I mean, it’s lesbian island, how could I not?” Agatha snorted and rolled her eyes as she opened the package. She pulled out a navy robe adorned with leaves, flowers, purple butterflies, and snakes winding themselves throughout the foliage. 

“Ok, now this might get you dinner!”

“It better, it was not cheap! But worth it, considering I did miss your function.” She flashed Ralph a cheeky smile. “So you like it?”

“Yes, I like it very much. So, when do you want to do dinner with Jen?”

“Let’s see if she’s free tomorrow.”

 

Hey Bitch! Yes I’m back. Agatha’s buying dinner tomorrow if you’re in? - RB

 

Hell yeah! Alice says that works for her too. So Agatha, where are you taking us? - JK

 

Anywhere Alice wants. - AH

 

Alice says she’s thinking mexican. Mazunte work for everybody? - JK

 

I can swing that but you’re buying your own drinks. - AH

 

Seriously?! You’re gonna be that cheap? - JK

 

With the way you and Ralph drink, yes. Alice, I may make an exception for. - AH

 

Fine, we’ll see you at 7? - JK

 

Works for us. - RB




As they arrived at dinner the next night Agatha was already regretting agreeing to Mexican food. It was just her luck that once again her stomach felt like it was doing backflips. 

“You sure you’re good?” Ralph asked her as they got out of the car

“I’m fine, I’ll just have to take it easy tonight. Ugh, I am so sick of feeling like this like every other day.”

“Well if you didn’t eat shit like those kool aid pickles you probably wouldn’t feel like shit. Here, have a mint, maybe that’ll help.” 

 

“Ugh, that was one time!” She glared at him as she took three mints and shoved them into her mouth. Ralph held the door open as she stormed in. They were greeted by a beaming Jen beckoning them over. Alice was sat in the corner and gave them a small wave and a smile. 

 

“Oh my gosh hey girl! Long time no see!” Ralph said as he rushed over to hug Jen. “Oh shit, Alice? This Alice is your Alice? Well damn so good to see you too.”

 

“Oh right, I guess you two know each other.” Agatha grumbled. 

 

“Uh, yeah, I’ve only been doing drag on and off at her bar for the last, what’s it been 10 years? Ok, this makes sense. How did you meet Jen?” 

 

“I guess it was the last time you performed actually. I met her that night and we just kind of hit it off.” Alice said, beaming at Jen. 

 

“Wait, wasn’t that when we were there for your birthday?” He turned to Agatha who was guzzling water. She shrugged, “Yeah, I guess so” 

 

“Yeah if you two hadn’t left early that night I might have never met her so thanks I guess.” Jen explained. 

 

“Left early?” He turned back to Agatha who was giving him a death glare. “Oh, right yeah. You’re welcome.” Jen glanced between them both with a questioning look. Pushing past her curiosity she turned her attention back to Ralph. 

 

“So how was Greece?” 

 

“Oh gosh it was amazing! I don’t think I’ve ever eaten as much food as I did there. Everything was so delicious! That reminds me, I have something for you back at Agatha’s. Sorry Alice, no one mentioned you,” he glared at Jen and Agatha  “otherwise I would have brought you something too.” 

 

“Oh don’t mention it! I’m just glad to see you!” 

 

“Wow, I wish I could get that reaction out of these two.” 

 

“Hey! I was happy to see you!” Jen proclaimed. They all looked at Agatha. 

 

“I didn’t know you were coming! You just showed up at my house!” She protested, “You should be grateful I let you through the door.” 

 

“Why? It’s not like I was interrupting anything important.” He quipped, giving her a cheeky smile. She drew back in mock offense. 

 

“You disrupted my perfectly quiet evening at home.” 

 

“Isn’t that every evening for you, Agatha?” Jen chuckled. Agatha shot Jen a mocking sneer. 

 

“That’s what I told her, she’s due for a little excitement.” He winked at Agatha and nudged her. 

 

“Yeah, when's the last time you even went out?” Jen joked. 

 

“I’m out right now aren’t I?”

 

“I mean without us, and not for some work thing.” Agatha bit her tongue, avoiding Jen’s stare. “Yeah, that’s what I thought. If you got laid it might do you some good.” Ralph choked on his drink as he started laughing mid sip. Agatha looked at her unamused. 

 

“That’s what I tried to tell her!” He roared. He gave Jen a high five. 

 

“Oh and here I thought I was being nice taking you all out to dinner. I didn’t realize it was so you two could gang up on me about my sex life. This is the last time I do anything nice for you people. At least Alice has the decency to mind her business.” They sat there silently for a moment before Alice spoke up.

 

“It’s always hard to get back out there when you’ve lost someone.” Alice chimed in, drawing all attention to herself. “But it’s good to push yourself to try new things when you’re ready.” 

 

“Ugh, I forgot you’re like a walking DSM.” Agatha grimaced. 

 

“Does Jen know about Dr. Vidal?” Ralph posed. If Agatha could have strangled him with her eyes he would have died right then and there. 

 

“Agatha?! Do you have something to share with the class?” Jen said smugly. Agatha, in protest, shoved a handful of chips into her mouth before leaning back in her chair, crossing her arms and looking away from the table. Jen and Alice looked back at Ralph who was grinning like the cat who ate the canary, bursting at the seams with excitement, ready to spill the tea. 

 

“Someone got hit on by a doctor and has been keeping her number on her fridge.” 

“STOP! NO! When did this happen?” Jen exclaimed

“At the fundraiser, right Agatha?” Finally having choked down the chips, she resigned herself to the fact that they would not be changing the subject until she gave them the answers they were looking for. 

“That was technically when I met her, yes.”

“What do you mean technically?” Jen and Ralph asked in unison

“We may, or may not have, run into each other before.”

“You didn’t tell me that!” Ralph admonished her, “When did you meet her before?”

“I met her at the fundraiser. I ran into her before, a few times actually.” 

“Wait, what do you mean, ran into her?” Jen questioned

“I physically ran into her. Or, she ran into me. Not sure exactly.” Agatha was starting to enjoy being withholding. 

“Well?” Ralph asked

“Well what?” Agatha snapped

“Oh don’t be like that, come on, give us details!”

“I know virtually nothing about the woman, other than her name and the fact that she works at the children's hospital under Dr. Jones on my board.”

“My children’s hospital? What does she practice?”

“I think I’ve said enough.”

“She’s a surgeon apparently” Ralph answered for her

“OOO was it that woman in the green suit?” Alice added helpfully

“Can’t I have anything for myself with you people?” Agatha bit back. 

“AH! It was, wasn’t it! I knew it!” Jen and Ralph turned their attention to Alice. “I would have kept her number too… if I was Agatha” She added, seeing Jen’s twinge of concern. 

 

“Have you texted her?” Jen asked. Agatha had returned to her silent stewing. 

“I never did get a clear answer about that” Ralph added, “So?”

“No.” She muttered as she took another drink of her water. 

“What’s stopping you?” Alice asked

“I’m not looking for a therapy session, thank you Alice.” She sighed, “Nothing, I just… haven’t felt like dealing with it. I have a lot going on right now.” 

“When don’t you have a lot going on?” Jen asked incredulously 

“She’s got a point” Ralph added

“Will you drop it if I agree to text her later?” 

“Text her now.” Ralph countered

“Well I don’t have her number in my phone yet.” she said condescendingly 

“That’s fine I have the card on me, just in case. I didn’t want to risk you trying to throw it away again.” 

“Well that’s…convenient” she chided. They all sat there in silence, waiting for her to pick up the card. “Well, what would I even say?”

“What did she say when she gave you the card?” Jen asked. Agatha bit her tongue again as a blush grew across her face. She was going to make Ralph suffer for bringing this up in front of Jen.

“She said to reach out…when I was…readytoseewherefatetakesus” she trailed off.

“What?” They all leaned in. Agatha let out a groan.

“She said to reach out when I was ready to see where fate takes us.” Agatha wanted to slap the look of delight from each one of their faces. 

“Agatha!” Ralph shouted

“And you haven’t texted her yet?” Jen scolded her

‘Ok, ok, let me get this straight. You’ve physically run into this woman on more than one occasion. She is very attractive, from what Alice says,” he nodded in her direction.

“Oh yes, very attractive.” Ralph emphasized his gesture to Alice with a whine.

“Very attractive, she’s a surgeon who is interested in you enough after these run ins that she gave you her number to reach out when you’re ready to see where fate takes you. How are you not in her bed right now?”

“I’ve had a lot going on!!” she emphasized. They each groaned and rolled their eyes. “Again, I ask, what am I supposed to be texting her?” 

“Honestly give me your phone, I’m afraid if you do it you’ll screw it up somehow.” Jen reached her hand out as Agatha drew it closer to herself.

“What if I don’t like what you want to send?”

“I’ll let you read it first!” 

“Fine.” She handed the phone over.

 

Hello Dr. Vidal, It’s Agatha Harkness. I thought about what you said the other night and I think I’d like to take you up on your offer to see where fate takes us. When would you like to grab a coffee?

 

“See, I’m not locking you into anything, just in case she is a freak. You never know with surgeons.” 

“That can be fun though too, as long as you match each other’s freak.” Ralph added with a wink. 

“Ugh, that could be dangerous for everyone involved.” Jen grimaced

“Sent, ok! Can we drop it now?” She slammed her phone back on the table. 

“Sure… until she texts you back.” Jen said with a grin. 



Luckily for Agatha they made it through the rest of their dinner without a word from Dr. Vidal. In fact she managed to make it all the way home and settle into bed with her book before she heard her phone buzz. At first she convinced herself it had to be a spam text and chose to ignore it. Then it buzzed again and curiosity overtook her. She reached over grabbing her phone off the nightstand. Her heart skipped a beat as she saw the notification. 

 

Dr. Vidal - Message(2)

As she stared at it contemplating opening the messages, her phone buzzed again 

Dr. Vidal - Message(3)

Her heart pounded faster and she bit her lip as she unlocked her phone. 

 

Hey Beautiful! 

 

What a wonderful surprise to hear from you at last! I thought my luck might have run out. 😏

 

I’d love to take you out for coffee sometime. Any chance you’re free Saturday?

 

She checked the time, nearly midnight. She read and re-read the texts a few times, contemplating. She started and deleted a few texts debating on whether or not it looked desperate to reply right away. As she drafted another text another message came through. 

 

Come on, I’ll make it worth your while! 😎

 

Agatha could feel her heart beating faster in her chest. There was no hiding at this point so she resigned herself to respond. 

 

Yes, Saturday. 10:00 Espresso Emporium. 

 

She threw her phone back on the nightstand, attempting to push the thought of this now impending date out of her mind. BUZZ BUZZ, another text. 

 

Yes Ma'am 🫡. See you then gorgeous!

Chapter 9: Fourteen

Chapter Summary

Agatha and Rio go on their first date

Chapter Notes

This is gross and cute and i hope you like it.

Saturday morning the pieces slowly came together as Agatha awoke. Dread and panic began to fill her chest as the realization hit, she had agreed to go on a date and today was the day. Maybe she didn’t have to follow through. She could blow it off and no one would know. Though Ralph and Jen and now Alice likely wouldn’t buy it. They surely would be digging for details. She finally gathered herself enough to roll out of bed and head to the kitchen only to find all three of them settled on her couches in the living room. 

 

“What the hell is this? Does everyone live here now? I don’t remember giving any of you a key.” She scoffed indignantly. 

 

“Ralph invited us over, to go to brunch while you go on your date.” Jen chided. 

 

“ I swear if you three show up I will leave.” 

 

“Relax, we’re going to The Pancake House. But not before we make sure you’re ready! Are you excited?!” Ralph asked. 

 

“I’m anxious and nauseated. I can’t believe I let you all talk me into this!” 

 

“Oh, this is going to be so good for you. Who knows you might even enjoy yourself!” Jen offered. 

 

“I highly doubt it.” With that she grabbed her cup of coffee and turned around, heading back to her room to get ready. 

 

After a long shower to help clear her mind and calm her down she rested on her bed staring at her closet. What was she going to wear? Agatha had always prided herself on her sense of style but in this moment her mind was drawing a blank. She was skeptical about how this date would go and didn’t want to send the wrong message. What was the message? She couldn’t deny it, the mere idea of this woman made her stomach flutter in a way it hadn’t since Wanda. And even then, this was very different. As she mulled it over there was a knock on her door. 

 

“Heyyyyy. How’s it going, you almost ready?” Ralph hummed as he slowly cracked the door open and peeked in. Seeing Agatha staring blankly just sitting on the bed in her robe he closed the door behind him and walked over to sit next to her. “Everything ok?” He asked gently. 

 

“I don’t know what to wear.” She said in a monotone, not breaking her stare at the closet before her. 

 

“I can pick something out for you if you’d like?” He said cautiously 

 

“Sure.” She muttered as tears began to pool in her eyes. 

 

“Hey, hey, what's wrong? What’s going on?” He cooed at her. Agatha inhaled sharply and blinked away the tears. She couldn’t bring herself to admit, even to Ralph, the fear and guilt that was pooling in her chest. She finally turned her attention to him and flashed a smirk. 

 

“Nothing, I’m fine.” She stood and made her way to the closet. “Are you going to help or just sit there?” She barked. 

 

Ralph sorted through some options before finally pulling a nice pair of light wash jeans, a clean white t-shirt, and a pair of black boots and matching belt. 

“This with your black glasses and a red lip. Classic, stunning, and casual enough for coffee. Come out when you’re ready, everyone wants to see you off.” 

 

“Oh, Great” she groaned as she took the outfit from him. 

“It’s gonna be fine. It’s just coffee, at most you can call it quits 30 mins in if it’s really that bad.” 

“We’ll be lucky if I make it 10 mins. Now get out so I can finish getting ready.” 

 

She readied herself in silence before taking a final look in the mirror and heading back into the living room. There she was met with whooping and cheering from the three gathered there. 

 

“Alright settle down!” 

 

“You look great! Just try and relax and don’t overthink it, you’re just grabbing coffee.” Ralph reassured. 

 

“I’d say be yourself but that’s usually a bit off putting. So, be yourself but nicer. Try and actually give her a chance.” Jen added 

 

“And no matter what happens, this is a huge step so recognize that. It’s something to be proud of.” Alice finished. Agatha stood there dumbfounded, a look of disgust and judgement spreading across her face. 

 

“What are you, my fairy godparents?” She scoffed as she made her way to the door. 

 

“And we expect a full report when you get back!” Ralph shouted after her. 

 

“Oh goodie” she squealed as she closed the door behind her. 

 

The drive to the coffee shop went faster than she wanted it to. Though she hoped to get this all over with as quickly as possible she needed more time to find her usual courage. In every other part of her life Agatha was formidable, a pillar of confidence, but something about this woman shook that foundation within her. Her hands were clammy as she reached for the door handle and entered the shop. With a quick glance around she caught no sight of Dr. Vidal. A wave of relief washed over her as she realized she was the first to arrive. This feeling was quickly replaced by a rush of doubt. What if she didn’t show up? She took a look at her watch, well, it technically wasn’t 10 yet. She went and joined the que for coffee as she waited for the woman to show. 

 

A few minutes passed before she heard the door open again. Her heart raced as Dr. Vidal entered the shop. She was not as Agatha had expected; black jeans, doc martens, a band T peeking out from under a fitted leather jacket. Her hair fell in waves loosely around her face. She raised her Ray Bans to sit on top of her head, revealing her captivating honey amber eyes which were encircled by a dark smokey makeup look making them particularly fierce. A smirk grew across her face as she spotted Agatha in line. Despite the woman’s casual appearance she was no less stunning than she had been at the fundraiser. 

 

Agatha swallowed and straightened herself up as the woman approached her and stopped only a few inches away. 

 

“Hello, Gorgeous!” the woman purred as she stared into Agatha’s eyes. 

“Hello… Dr. Vidal. Nice to see you again.” 

“Please, call me Rio. You’re not my patient, I’m not your doctor. Though I’m not opposed to giving you a physical…if you play your cards right.” She said with a wink. Agatha was speechless once again at this woman’s boldness. 

 

“I…um…Rio, right.” She choked out as heat began to rise in her chest. 

“Oh, before I forget!” Rio reached into her jacket, pulling out a small bouquet. “My lady” Agatha gingerly took the flowers and rolled them between her fingers. 

“Thanks… thank you for these.” She stuttered. Rio tilted her head as her grin widened. 

“Do I make you nervous?” Agatha chuckled in response. 

“No.” She gasped, unconvincingly. “I just… I don’t do this often.” 

“This as in…dating?”

“Yeah, you could say that.” 

“Well, I’ll take it easy on you then.” 

 

They made it to the counter and ordered their drinks then settled into a couple chairs in the corner. 

 

“So, Agatha Harkness, what made you finally decide to take me up on my offer?” 

“Well, I have to admit, it took a little convincing.”

“Oh really?”

“I may have been influenced.”

“Oh, do tell”

“I may have told the wrong people about our… encounters and they were relentless about me reaching out. They were convinced it was meant to be and I was an idiot for not reaching out sooner.” She said with a smirk

“And what about you?”

“Me?” Agatha puzzled

“Do you think we’re meant to be?” 

Agatha let out a chuckle. “I don’t even know you.” 

“That can change.” Rio leaned forward, a sly grin on her face “What does your gut tell you.” Her eyes bore into Agatha causing her heart to skip a beat. She bit her lip as she could feel the tension between them building. Her arms prickled with goosebumps.

“Perhaps” she let it spill from her lips. If Rio’s grin could have been any bigger, she didn’t know how it was possible. 

 

“You said you don’t date often. When was your last date?”

“I…uh… 6, or 7…”

“Months?”

“Oh no, years” Rios eyes widened at that. 

“Really, why?”

“Why? Well… I didn’t really think about it.”she replied a little flustered. 

“Didn’t think about it?”

“It wasn’t really a priority. I wasn’t really looking or interested. What about you?” She attempted to shift the focus of the conversation anywhere else. 

 

“It’s been a little more recent but nothing particularly stimulating. You on the other hand.”

“Me?”

“There’s something about you I find very fascinating.”

“Fascinating?”

“Intriguing, really. I can’t seem to get you out of my mind.” Agatha blushed at that. Rio was so direct and shameless. Both qualities she would typically pride herself in; however, Rio’s intensity left her feeling unsteady. 

“You don’t hold back do you?” 

“Why would I? Especially when I know what I want.”

“That’s admirable. Still, you don’t really know me. What if I’m a serial killer or something?”

“Are you a serial killer?”

“No, but you don’t know that.” 

“Well, you just said you weren’t, and you don’t seem like the type. I think I’ll let my guard down. Besides, I’m pretty sure I can handle myself.” She leaned back in her chair sipping her coffee. “I’d like to get to know you, if you’ll give me the chance. So far I like what I’ve seen.”

 

“And what’s that?”

“Well when we first ran into each other in that bookstore I thought you were kind of a bitch.” Agatha choked on her coffee. 

“And that was a good thing?”

“Are you kidding me? The most gorgeous woman I’ve ever seen literally ran into my arms and nearly killed us both. You were so flustered yet aggressive, a part of me wished you would have just pushed me down the stairs.”

“Thanks?” Agatha muttered as she recalled how enamored she had been at first running into the woman. 

 

“Then I think it was that same night you rammed the door into me at the bar.” 

“Hey, I didn’t ram anything! I was just trying to go to the bathroom.”

“Suit yourself but I had bruises under my eyes for a week.” She laughed

“And again, that was a good thing?”

“Not that part, but later, somehow I convinced you to dance with me. Best night of my life since I moved here. You can be fun when you want to be.”

“ Right”

“But you snuck off before the song was over so I never got a chance to get your number. Or your name for that matter. I started referring to you as bookstore girl.” 

“Charming.”

 

“I had gone back to the bar a couple times hoping to see you again but no such luck.”

“Yeah, that’s not a typical night for me. I was there with a few friends.”

“I see. Well luckily for me the universe was on my side when out of the blue, after weeks, you ran into me head on once again.”

“If you hadn’t been following so closely that wouldn’t have happened.”

“I didn’t expect you to randomly turn around and head straight into me.” She chuckled, “But I’m not complaining! After the third time of this happening I knew fate was intervening. Once is a fluke, twice a coincidence, three times? That is fate.” 

“I see, and the fundraiser, was that fate too?”

“Oh definitely fate! It was right after you ran into me that last time. I was meeting with Dr. Jones that afternoon, he’d asked how I was settling in, if I’d had a chance to check out the symphony yet. I mentioned one time in passing that my father was a musician and now he asks me if I’ve gone to the symphony every time I see him. Anyway, I told him no I hadn’t gotten a chance and he jumped at the opportunity to invite me to your soirée. To be honest I wasn’t inclined at first, he rambled on and on about being on the board and everything, but then he showed me a photo.” A devilish grin returned to her face. “And someone caught my eye.” She pointed a sly finger at Agatha. “I knew then fate was once again intervening, as if this,” she gestured between the two of them, “was inevitable. And who am I to deny fate?” 

 

Agatha sat there for a moment mulling over Rio’s version of events before asking, “What brought you to Westview, was that also fate?” 

“Most likely, but primarily this opportunity at the children’s hospital and a chance to be closer to my aunt. She’s my last living relative.” 

“I see, and where were you before?”

“Boston medical center. I’d done my residency there.” 

“Is that where you’re from originally?”

“No, I grew up in Puerto Rico and my mother moved us to New York when I was 8.” 

“Whose us?”

“At that point it was just my mother, my younger brother and I. Our father had just passed away.” 

“Oh I’m sorry to hear that. You mentioned your aunt is your only living relative?”

“Yes.”

“What, I mean, you don’t have to talk about it but…”

“What happened to my mother and brother?” Agatha nodded slowly. “They died in a car wreck about six years after that.” She had said it so casually, so matter of fact like she was talking about the weather. 

“That must have been difficult for you.” Agatha finally responded. 

“Oh yes, probably the worst year of my life. But my aunt took me in. Helped me finish school, encouraged me to go to college and supported me through medical school. I don’t know where I would be without her.”

“She sounds like an incredible person.” 

“I’m very lucky to have her. And what about you? What’s your family like?” 

 

Agatha grimaced at the thought of delving into the chaos of Evanora. 

“I um…my family is…”she struggled to find the right word. 

“Let’s start here. Are both of your parents alive?”

“Yes? Or no? I’m not really sure.” Agatha strained in response. 

“You are an endless well of mystery. What does that even mean?” She laughed

 

“Well my mother is, unfortunately, still living. My father may be alive, may be dead. I don’t really know anything about him.” She waited for a response from Rio but the woman just sat back in her chair patiently waiting for Agatha to continue. “I grew up living with my mother and her father. It was…difficult. She and I don’t really see eye to eye on most things.” Again she waited for some response but Rio just sat there taking everything in allowing Agatha to continue in her own time. “My grandfather on the other hand was more understanding, but after I was sent away at 16 it made it difficult to see him.” 

 

“Sent away?” Rio finally asked. 

“Ah, yes, first to a conversation camp then to a religious boarding school until I turned 18 and was able to get out on my own.”

“Fuck! I guess I should be glad that didn’t stick.” 

Agatha snorted, “No, it definitely didn’t stick.”

 

“So how did you end up at the symphony?”

“I managed to work my way through college where I studied business and communications with a minor in music. I worked as a financial planner for a while but that wasn’t particularly stimulating. Music was always something I shared with my grandfather and when I saw that they were hiring a donor engagement coordinator I figured it’d be a great opportunity for a career switch. With my connections as a financial planner it was a no brainer. Besides, I can be very persuasive.” 

“I don’t doubt that at all! So do you play any instruments? Sing?”

“My mother insisted I learn to play piano as a child. Eventually I picked up the cello as well. I don’t really sing, but I am very good at karaoke.” 

“Oh really?!” Rio raised an eyebrow, a mischievous glint filled her eyes. “Well I’m going to have to see that in action.”

“What?!” Agatha’s face dropped revealing a brief look of panic. 

“You can’t brag about your karaoke skills and not expect to perform at some point.” Her signature smirk had returned to her face. 

“We’ll see if you last that long. I don’t sing on a first date.” Agatha said teasingly

“Oh? Well that’s a privilege I’m willing to earn.” The glint in her eye gleaming brighter. “Well I seem to have finished my coffee.” She said as she stood and started to grab her things. Agatha, startled at the sudden shift, stumbled to get up and gather her things as well. “I’ve really enjoyed getting to know you Ms. Harkness.”

“That’s it?” Agatha gasped in shock. Rio looked back at her with a grin. 

“Unless you’d like to continue this elsewhere? I’m not opposed, I just didn’t want to push my luck.” Agatha blinked back at her, mouth agape. This woman was so unpredictable. 

“I…uh…what do you have in mind?” 

“I have a few places I’ve been meaning to check out around the city. Care to join me?” Agatha hesitated, she hadn’t anticipated leaving the coffee shop but she couldn’t imagine ending things here. 

“Sure.” 

“Great, I'll drive. Meet me out front?” Before Agatha could respond Rio was out the door. She stood there for a moment as it began to sink in what she had agreed to. Before panic and doubt could overwhelm her she walked out of the coffee shop to wait for Rio on the sidewalk. For the first time since she got there she took a glance at her phone. 

 

Ralph Bohner - message(2)

 

Hey girly-pop! Hope you made it there alright. If you can, get a picture, I need to know what this woman looks like! 

 

Hope things are going well, let me know if you need me to call and get you out of there! 

 

She rolled her eyes and started to reply when the roaring sound of a motorcycle jolted her from the conversation. She looked up to find Rio dismounting the bike before taking off her helmet. 

“You have got to be kidding me.” She scoffed nervously. 

“Nope.” Rio replied with a grin, handing her the helmet. 

“I don’t know that I’m dressed for this?” She panicked, looking into the mirrored visor of the helmet. 

“Don’t worry, you can wear my jacket.” She peeled off the coat and held it open for Agatha to put on. 

“Won’t you be cold? Shouldn’t you also be wearing a helmet?”

“I run hot, I’ll be fine. Also I have a spare helmet in the bike.” She wandered back over to the bike and pulled out a second helmet from the seat. “You don’t look convinced.” She laughed. 

“I just… this is new for me.” 

“Well aren’t I the lucky one to pop this cherry for you! Don’t worry, I’ll be gentle.” Agatha let out a breathy laugh before reluctantly putting the helmet on her head. As soon as it was on, the intoxicating aroma of Rio filled her nostrils. She was thankful the visor was covering her flushed face as the scent began to make her heart race. Having situated her own helmet Rio made her way over to adjust Agatha’s. She flipped the visor open, causing Agatha to jump, and reached her hand in to press a button. She heard the sound of a headset turning on before hearing Rio’s voice in her ear. 

 

“It can get pretty loud when we’re riding. This way we can hear each other so don’t be afraid to shout if you need anything.” Rio snapped the visor back down, causing Agatha to jump once again, then she made her way back onto the bike. She reached out a hand to Agatha inviting her to join. Agatha slowly approached the bike and less than gracefully swung her leg around to sit behind Rio. 

“Hold on tight!” Rio warned as she started the bike. 

“Where and the handles?” Agatha shouted into the helmet. A laugh echoed through the speakers. 

“Right here.” Rio grabbed Agatha’s wrists and wrapped them around her waist before gliding away from the curb. 

 

As soon as they were off Agatha was glued to Rio’s back. At first, despite the helmet, she squeezed her eyes shut too afraid to look at how close the cars were beside them. She was thankful for Rio’s jacket as she could feel the air whipping around them as they sped through the city. As she squeezed Rio close she could feel the heat radiating off of her. A permeating warmth that grounded her as they flew across town. As they started to slow, nearing their destination, she chanced a look at the world passing by around them. Terrifying at first, she quickly relaxed into the ride just as they were pulling up to the library. 

 

Rio rolled the bike to a stop and dismounted, holding a hand out for Agatha. After taking a moment to gather herself Agatha shakily took Rio’s hand and slid off the back. 

“How was it?” Rio asked as she helped Agatha out of the helmet. 

“Not as terrifying as I expected.” She said breathlessly. 

“That grip you had on me said otherwise.” Rio joked. 

“So, the library?”

“Yes!” Rio said excitedly as she started toward the entrance. Agatha rushed behind to catch up with her. 

“Why the library? Not that I’m complaining.”

“New city, new library card. I have one from every city I’ve lived in.” Agatha followed Rio in and up to the information desk. “Hi! We’re here to get a library card.”

“Just you or both of you?”

“That depends,” she turned to Agatha. “Do you have a library card?” Agatha couldn’t remember the last time she set food in a library. 

“I don’t think so.” She admitted. Rio turned back to the librarian. 

“Both of us then.” The woman grabbed two forms and handed one to each of them. Rio thanked the woman then led them both over to a table. Once again this was the last thing Agatha had expected to do today but the analog simplicity of it was endearing. She glanced over at Rio who was diligently filling out the form and began to do the same. They returned the forms and handed over their IDs for the librarian to scan. 

“Here you are. Welcome to Westview library.” 

“Excellent!” Rio cheered. 

“Now what?” Agatha asked, staring at the plastic card in her hand. 

“We could take a tour of the facility or move on to the next destination? It’s up to you.”

“Next destination?” 

“Yeah, like I said, I have a few places I want to check out. Here, what do you like to read?”

“I’m pretty open. Just nothing political.” 

“Good to know. I’m a big fan of nature. Love adventure stories, fiction or nonfiction.”

“Ok?” Agatha responded confused. 

“I’m giving us 10 minutes, I’m going to find a book for you, and you’ll pick out a book for me. Read? Set? Go!” Rio rushed off down one of the aisles of books while Agatha stood there for a moment processing what was happening before she turned to search on her own. She barely knew where to begin. Nature. Adventure. Very wide parameters. After running down a couple aisles and finding nothing she returned to look at some displays at the front. The first one was sports related. Fine but not what she was looking for. Another display featured classic mysteries. Better but none of them were particularly outdoorsy. The last display featured Unlucky Explorers. Stories of adventure where one wrong move caused unforeseen tragedy. That’s it! The Worst Journey in the World by Apsley Cherry-Garrard. Tales of polar tragedy. Satisfied with her selection she sauntered over to Rio who was already leaning against the counter. 

 

“So what have you got for me?” Rio questioned.
