“I’m fine. You might want to call an ambulance for this asshole. I may have dislodged one of his testicles.” She turned to head into her home slamming the door behind her. Jen and Ralph looked at the pitiful Christian lying on the floor then looked back at each other.

 

“I’m not calling shit.” Jen stated as she stepped over Christian to follow Agatha into the house. Ralph leaned down to Christian who was writhing in agony. 

“You’re really lucky she didn’t have a knife dude.” He patted his shoulder and followed the others inside.

Chapter End Notes

It felt really cathartic to write about Agatha kicking Christian in the dick. Fuck that guy lol

Chapter 12: Eighteen

Chapter Summary

Rio invites Agatha over to meet aunt Lilia

Chapter Notes

I am finally back and so happy to post! I didn't get to write as much as I would like so the next few chapters might be a little slower coming but I have the most exciting parts coming soon!!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

After the unfortunate encounter with Christian, Agatha reached out to her lawyer and finally set up a time to go out to Boston and settle this once and for all. She was tired of dealing with her mother’s antics and knew this would be the only way to shut her up for good. She planned to leave at the end of the month and gave herself a week there to settle things. In the meantime she had her lawyer get started on restraining orders for Christian and her mother. Evanora had crossed many lines and Agatha had had enough. 

 

Later in the week she met up with Rio for a walk in the park between meetings and had the chance to regale her about her harrowing triumph over that imbecile. 

 

“I probably would have killed him if I had been there.” Rio swung her arms about in mock karate moves. 

“Oh stop!”

“No, in fact I’m plotting his murder as we speak. There’s no way he’s getting away with that shit!”

“Oh he’s definitely not! I heard he has a ruptured testicle.”

“Excellent work dear!” She kissed Agatha on the cheek, “Well at least we know he likely won’t be procreating. So, are we still on for Karaoke next week?” 

Agatha rolled her eyes and tried to hide the smirk that flitted across her lips. 

“Yes.” she huffed, pretending to be annoyed. 

“And your friends? Are they able to make it?”

“Oh they’ll be there. They have been dying to meet you! Jen even traded shifts to make sure she and Alice could go.”

“Excellent!” Rio rubbed her hands together plottingly. “Oh, and by the way, Lilia wanted me to check and see if you would want to come by for lunch on Sunday. Any chance you’re free?”

“This Sunday? I could probably make that work.”

“Fantastic, I’ll let her know!”

“Is there anything I should bring? I will warn you I’m a terrible cook.”

“If you want to impress her, she loves a good wine.”

“That I can do! What time should I be there?”

“I’ll pick you up at noon?”

“On that bike of yours? No, I want to look presentable.”

“No,” She laughed, “I have a car.” Agatha stopped in stunned frustration.

“And you drove me around on that death trap of yours on our first date?!” She exclaimed, exasperated.

“Yeah, it was a nice day! Besides, I got to feel you pressed up against me.” She leaned in, wrapping her arms around Agatha, “Your arms wrapped around my waist, holding me close. Why would I not want that!” She kissed her on the cheek before grabbing her by the hand, pulling her to continue on their walk. “So, noon on Sunday?”

“I’ll see you then. I actually have to get back.” She turned to leave as Rio tugged her back in, planting a kiss on her lips. Agatha melted into the sensation as she brought her hand up to cup Rio’s face, deepening the kiss. They stood, locked in for a few moments before Rio finally pulled away. 

“You better get going before you’re late! See you Sunday.” She kissed Agatha on the hand and sent her on her way. 

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

Sunday rolled around and Agatha was a fit of nerves. She was bloated, her stomach had been doing somersaults all morning, and her heartburn was worse than ever. She was excited to meet Lilia but had an ominous feeling about the woman, given all that Rio had said about her. She wasn’t sure how much she believed about fate and destiny but she couldn’t deny that she had fallen for Rio and now she didn’t want to do anything to mess it up. Her mind kept going in circles, bouncing between doubt, fear, anxiety, frustration. Somehow she could hardly contain the irrational storm brewing inside her. Overwhelmed, she had Ralph help her pick out a nice bottle of wine and her outfit. He even helped her fix her hair, which he rarely did, before he headed out to host a drag brunch at Alice’s bar. Right at twelve on the dot Agatha’s doorbell rang. She grabbed the bottle of wine as she opened the door. 

 

“Well, well, don’t you look lovely!” Rio purred as she admired Agatha’s outfit, a calf-length brown suede skirt and a plum colored turtleneck t-shirt. “You ready?” Rio asked

“As I’ll ever be.” She groaned

“Come on, you’ve nothing to worry about! She loves you already!” 

 

As they drove over to Lilia's, Rio could feel Agatha’s tension hovering in the seat next to her. 

“Mi amor! What’s wrong, you seem a bit tense?” Agatha could feel the anxiety bubbling over drawing tears to her eyes. Before she knew it they were falling down her face. 

“I just..don’t want her to hate me.” She sobbed as she could no longer hold back her emotions. Rio reached over grabbing Agatha’s hand tightly.

“Oh, no! Don’t cry! Really you have nothing to worry about. Why would she hate you?” 

“Be…because, there’s something wrong with me and… and I know she’s going to see it.”

“What? No, what gave you that idea?” She said soothingly as she rubbed her leg.

“You said she saw me coming. What if she was trying to warn you about me?” 

“Nonsense! If anything she was whipping me into shape to not blow it with you. You’re gonna love her, though I’ll warn you she’s a little kooky.”

“Kooky?”

“Eh, whispy.”

“Whispy?”

“Just be yourself and I know you two will get along.”

“Really?” She sniffled

“Yes, of course! She is going to love you, I promise. She’s been talking about having you over non-stop. You have nothing to worry about.” Agatha took a shaky breath, trying to calm herself down. Rio reached out grabbing Agatha’s hand and pulled it in to give it a soft kiss. With this gesture of comfort she could finally feel the tension start to leave her body. 

 

“Sorry, I don’t know what came over me! I got myself all worked up.” she said, wiping the last of the tears away from her eyes. 

“No need to apologize. I’m flattered that you want to make a good impression! I am, however, a little worried about you. Is anything else going on?” 

 

Agatha bit her lip nervously. Though she had told Rio about her harrowing triumph over that oaf of a man, Christian, she hadn’t given her the full context of why he had been there. 

 

“I’ve just been dealing with my mother and other family business more than usual lately. I think it’s just got me on edge. Bringing up old wounds.”

“Is there anything I can do to help?”

“Not unless you want to go to Boston.” She joked

“When?”

“I have to go in a few weeks, at the end of the month, to finalize my grandfather’s estate. I’ve been putting it off, but now…” 

“Yeah, send me the dates.”

“What?” Agatha blinked back in astonishment.

“Yes, I’ll go with you, if you want me to. Besides, I still have a few things stashed in a storage unit that I’ve been meaning to get so I can stop paying for it.” 

 

Agatha rolled the idea over in her mind. It would be so much easier to deal with her grandfather’s estate with Rio by her side. It’d be easier to deal with everything with Rio by her side. The woman knew how to comfort and console her and was every bit the foundation she needed to get through this task.

 

“Alright. I’ll send you the information. I am planning to be there for about a week.” 

“Great! That’ll give me time to take you out in Boston! I’d love for some of my friends there to meet you as well! If you’re up for it!” She grinned at Agatha as they finally pulled into the driveway. 

 

Lilia’s house sat back at the end of a long driveway, tucked into the forestline. It was an oddly shaped wooden house that blended into the scenery. On one side was a round dome shaped structure with portholes for windows. The roof seemed to have moss and other plant life growing on it. This building was connected to another large cube shaped structure by way of a glass hallway. 

 

As they parked the car and got out they heard a voice calling from the other side of the large overgrown yard. 

 

“There she is! My girl! How are you darling?” 

 

Lilia, dressed in patchwork yoga pants, a flowy shirt, and a long sweater, flittered across the yard carrying a basket of assorted herbs and vegetables she had been collecting from the nearby garden. This she dropped to her side as she reached both arms out smothering Rio in an embrace. 

 

“I see you’re still getting things ready for lunch!” Rio exclaimed.

 

“Oh you know me, I spaced out and lost track of time.” She looked over, catching sight of Agatha out of the corner of her eye before turning her attention back to Rio. “Well, are you just going to stand there or are you going to introduce me to this radiant creature?” 

 

Rio chuckled in annoyance as she beckoned Agatha over. Agatha straightened herself and plastered a brave smile on her face as she walked over. “Lilia, this is Agatha, who I’ve been telling you about.” 

“So nice to meet you. Rio said you liked wine so I brought some for you.” She handed Lilia the bottle which Lilia immediately handed over to Rio. She stepped closer to Agatha so that their chests were nearly touching, her eyes never leaving Agatha’s like she was trying to read something in them. Out of nowhere her hands lurched up sandwiching Agatha’s face as she stared deeper into her eyes.

 

“Oh come on!” Rio groaned



She moved her hands to Agatha’s shoulders as she leaned back and took her in, head to toe, sizing her up. She narrowed her eyes as she leaned back in, looking into Agatha’s eyes, which were swarming with confusion and worry, before a sly grin grew across her face and she pulled her into a tight hug. Agatha looked back at Rio over Lilia’s shoulder with a concerned grimace. Rio only snickered at Agatha's confusion and gave her a thumbs up as reassurance. 

 

At last Lilia released her from the embrace and grabbed her by the hand. 

 

“Rio, be a dear and grab that basket for me.” She called out as she led Agatha to the front door in the glass entryway. As soon as they crossed the threshold a waft of something delicious filled the air. It smelled of roasted garlic and stewed vegetables. She looked around the plant filled atrium, it felt as if she was back at the botanical gardens. 

 

“I’ll ask that you remove your shoes. I don’t like tracking external energies through my home. Feel free to grab any pair of slippers that fit.” Lilia said as she wandered off into the dome side of the building. Agatha could see where Rio got her playful nature, this woman couldn’t be more flamboyant. Agatha flashed Rio a nervous look as she slid her boots off and selected a pair of purple crushed velvet house shoes. They managed to be the least flashy of all the options on the shoe tree. Just as she had slipped the second shoe on Lilia popped her head out at the doorway. 

 

“Well come on in! Don’t be shy! I’ve not cursed anyone in ages!” She turned back into the room. 

 

“She’s not serious.” Agatha mumbled, a look of dread on her face. 

 

“I’m afraid she’s deadly serious.” Rio chuckled. “Come on, I’m starving!” She threw her arm around Agatha’s waist and guided her into the room. The large circular space was filled with oddities and knick-knacks strewn about in an orderly manner so that nothing looked out of place, yet everywhere you looked you’d find something you didn’t expect. Lilia had taken the helm at the wood burning stove stirring a series of pots simmering with whatever delicious concoctions she was brewing. 

 

“Lunch should be ready in about 15 minutes, make yourself comfortable. I just have to throw together the bruschetta. Can I get you anything to drink?” 

 

“We could open the wine Agatha brought if you’d like?” Rio offered. Lilia spun around shooting a calculating look at Agatha before turning back to Rio. 

“No. I think we’ll be fine.” She dismissed as she turned back to her pots. 

 

“You sure? You’re not one to turn down wine.” Rio responded, confused. Agatha could feel her palms starting to sweat. Had she already managed to offend this woman with the wine she brought? 

 

“Ah! You make me sound like such a lush! We’ll save it for another night.” She turned back around to smile and wink at Agatha. “I have some lemonade or some sun tea if you prefer?” 

 

“Tea sounds great.” 

 

“Rio, the tea is on the back porch. Once you’ve poured your girl a glass, come wash these tomatoes.” Rio disappeared back down the glass hallway to fetch the tea. 

 

“Anything I can help with?” Agatha queried. Lilia finally left her post at the stove and walked to grab Agatha by the arm and led her to a large wooden Hoosier cabinet. 

 

“If you wouldn’t mind setting the table, you’ll find all the plates and silverware in here.” She rubbed Agatha’s arm lovingly as she peered into her eyes once more, seemingly digging for something, before she headed back to resume cooking. 

 

As she gathered the plates and utensils Rio walked over to grab a glass. 

“She’s put you to work already I see!” She elbowed Agatha. 

 

“Your aunt keeps staring at me and giving me odd looks.” She whispered to Rio, glancing back to make sure she wasn’t being watched. 

“Don’t worry about it. She does that sometimes. She’s just trying to get a read on you.” She said encouragingly. “Like I said, Kooky. Don’t take it personally.” She walked back over to help her aunt finish the food while Agatha resumed setting the table. 

 

Before long they were all seated with bowls and plates of food covering the whole table. 

“So Agatha, do you say a blessing for your food?” Lilia asked 

“Um…no…not since I left the church.”

“Well, then you won’t mind then if I say a few words.” She offered 

“Please don’t!” Rio pleaded as Lilia rose to stand at her seat. 

“OH great Goddess Mother Earth Devine!” Her voice rang out as she raised her hands to the sky. 

“I can’t believe you’re doing this” Rio mumbled as she threw her face in her hands. 

“We thank you for this bountiful feast. May your blessings continue to rain down upon us. Great Goddess Moon we thank you for this time of clarity and reflection as we look within ourselves to find truth.” At that she made eye contact with Agatha. “To you both I make this sacrifice in turn for your continued guidance and protection.” She raised a steak knife, clutching the blade in her hand before slicing it above the salad. Agatha yelped as red liquid began to drip onto the salad, a look of horror across her face. At this Rio jumped up grabbing the hand dripping the liquid. 

“Drop it.” She commanded. Lilia grinned as she released something from her hand onto the salad. “It’s a beet.” Rio grumbled as she returned to her seat. 

Agatha could feel her heart pounding in her chest as she began to laugh at the realization. 

“OH! You don’t let me have any fun!” 

“Fun? You’re going to traumatize her!” 

“Oh please! She thought it was funny!” She proclaimed as she wiped her hand of the juice.

“She’s just being nice!”

“I did think it was funny.” She chimed in. “After I knew it was only a beet.” 

“I knew you had a good sense of humor. So, how has my niece been treating you?”

“Great so far! I have no complaints.” She snuck a smile to Rio.

“Good! That’s what I like to hear. Rio says you work at the symphony?”

“Yes, I’m their donor engagement coordinator.”

“Do they give you any free tickets?”

“Lilia!” Rio scolded

“Actually they do! If there’s something you want to see let me know and I’ll make sure to get you good seats.”

“SEE! You don’t know what’s possible unless you ask!” She taunted Rio. “I hear they’re doing a concert version of Candide in the spring. I'd like to go to that.” She said matter of factly. Agatha snickered at the request, “You got it! I can make that happen.”

“Tell me about your family, do you have any siblings?”

“No, no siblings. It was just me, my mother, and my grandfather growing up.” 

“Agatha’s mother is very religious.” Rio explained

“Ah! Well, how unfortunate. I find the religious unbearably rigid.” 

“You are not wrong about that!” Agatha agreed 

“And your father has passed, yes?” She asked with eyebrows raised.

“I..uh…I don’t know, I never met him.” She looked confusedly at Rio who in turn glared at Lilia. “My grandfather passed a few months ago, I think? I’m not exactly sure when.”

“Ah that must be it. Must have gotten my wires crossed. It happens from time to time.” She shrugged, returning to her meal. Rio glanced back at Agatha and mouthed the word, wispy. Agatha nodded in understanding. 

“What are you two up to this week?” she continued in her questioning.
 “Well, Rio’s asked me to Karaoke on Thursday. She’s invited some of my friends as well.” Lilia shoved Rio’s shoulder.

“When were you planning to invite me? You know it’s been too long since I’ve been behind a mic.” 

“I know Thursdays are your salsa nights. I know you’d hate to miss out on that!” She offered pointedly

“Nonsense! Not if there’s something better on the table.”

“Would you like to join us, Lilia?” Agatha asked, trying not to laugh

“Why yes, that would be lovely. Thank you dear.” she turned to Rio, “SEE! Was that so hard?”

“Alright, you can come, but you can’t hog the mic.”

“I will be on my best behavior!” She said with her hand on her chest. 

 

They continued on eating as Lilia asked Agatha almost every question under the sun. By the time she had finished her interrogation, they were each stuffed to the brim. Lilia and Rio rose to clear the table and as Agatha went to do the same she was quickly shooed to a nearby couch to relax instead. Before long Rio came over to join her.

 

“I hope that wasn’t too terrible. I should have prepared you better for the questions. Lilia doesn’t really have a filter.” 

“Oh no! Don’t worry about it. She seems sweet. I feel a lot better now than I did in the car.”

“Good, I’m glad to hear it. I do want to give you a heads up, she is going to corner you and ask to read your cards. Though it won’t seem like an option, you can totally say no.”

“That’s alright. I’m kind of looking forward to that.” 

“OK, just make sure to take it with a grain of salt. She likes to make a show and she doesn’t hold back. Just so you know.”

“You’re telling me the beet lady is a bit dramatic?” She laughed

“Fair point.”

“Thanks for the heads up.” She leaned over drawing Rio’s lips into hers. 

 

“Alright my girls! What kind of trouble should we get into? We could go for a walk around the property - I have a few stones I need to throw at Mr. Burns next door, he stole half my mullberries this season!” she exclaimed

“Oh I’m so stuffed I don’t think I can move.” Agatha sighed, rubbing her stomach.

“Very well then, I have a few board games, we could summon the spirits, or I could read your cards?” She smiled with a glint in her eye. Rio glanced at Agatha with an I told you so kind of look. “Have you ever had your cards read, love?”

“No, can’t say that I have.”

“Ah! A virgin! Well done dear!” She patted Rio’s leg, who leaned back rolling her eyes. “I’m gonna get the good deck!” She said excitedly as she scurried off toward the entryway.

“She didn’t even say yes! Maybe she doesn’t want to do it!” Rio called out to her. Lilia just turned around and blew her tongue at Rio in response before continuing on to look for her cards. 

As they waited for Lilia to return Rio reached out to play with a few strands of Agatha’s hair. Agatha melted into the soft touches, leaning back to snuggle into Rio on the couch. She could hear the calm pulsing beat of her heart as her warmth seeped into her side. Rio moved her hand to glide up and down Agatha’s arm. 

“Careful, if you keep doing that I’m going to fall asleep again.” She looked up at Rio smiling before laying her head back on her chest. Despite the warning, they each lay there as their eyes began to get heavier quickly. 

 

“Alrighty!” Lilia shouted as she re-entered the room. The women bolted up, startled by her sudden reappearance. “Not falling asleep on me are we?”

 

“Please, that meal could have tranquilized a horse!” Rio joked. 

 

Lilia settled into an elaborate marigold armchair across from Agatha, a round coffee table between them. She unwrapped the scarf from around her tarot cards and placed them on the table. 

 

“So I’ll have you shuffle the cards and cut the deck with your left hand.” Agatha did as she was told and settled them back on the table. “We’ll keep it simple, a three card spread, we’ll look at past, present, and future.” She began to shuffle the cards violently until one sprang out onto the table. “Ah! Let’s see what we have here. Three of swords. Oh my dear, your past was filled with turmoil, so much pain, sorrow, and grief.”

“No kidding.” Agatha huffed unamused

“You have suffered great loss and heartbreak. A former lover, a recent relative, and I’m sensing another loss as well.” 

 

At that Agatha could feel her heart skip a beat though she kept a smile on her face. Lilia resumed shuffling cards, before long another popped out. Lilia let out a bursting laugh as she read the next card before slamming it on the table. 

 

“The Lovers!” She exclaimed, pointing at Rio. “I don’t know why you doubt me when I’m always right. You two are a match made by the gods!” 

 

Agatha glanced over to Rio who shrugged. “She’s been pulling that card for me for months.” 

 

“And now your future.” She tossed the cards once again before the final one popped out onto the table. “Well, well my dear! The Empress! You will come into your divine femininity. This card is a sign of beauty, abundance, and fertility.” She beamed at Agatha eyebrows raised, her eyes once again intensely boring into her soul. “Seems like lots to look forward to in your future!” 

 

“Alright, not as bad as I thought.” Agatha admitted 

 

“Were you expecting doom and gloom?”

 

“I was prepared for it!” 

 

“Well, nothing is ever as bad as it seems, and nothing as good as it seems either. Expect neutrality and you’ll never be disappointed.” She said as she rose from her chair and headed back into the kitchen to open up the freezer. 

 

“Curses!” Lilia grumbled “Rio, dear, I forgot the gelato to go with our dessert! Would you be a doll and run down to the market and grab some?” 

 

“Right now?” She said sleepily from the couch. “Couldn’t we just skip it this time?” 

 

“Absolutely not! If you go now you’ll be back just in time for the crumble to be done.” 

 

“You want to come with me?” She turned to ask Agatha. 

 

“Oh leave her be! She’ll be fine to stay here with me.” Lilia grinned. Rio shot Agatha a concerned look. 

 

“I’ll be fine, you go!” She insisted. Begrudgingly, Rio rose and headed for the door. 

 

“Don’t let her give you a hard time while I’m gone!” She called out as she left. 

 

“Oh she’s so dramatic!” Lilia scoffed as the door closed and she began to fumble around in the kitchen. “You’d think I’d tortured her growing up the way she acts! I scare away one of her little girlfriends one time and now she acts all protective any time she brings someone over. Care for honey or lemon in your tea?” 

 

“Both please. Oh really? What happened?” Agatha asked with a chuckle. 

 

“I read her cards and told her the truth. If she didn’t shape up she was in for a world of pain and anguish. Though, I may have implied, heavily, that it would be at my hands. And perhaps she found a raccoon skull in her shoes when she went to leave, but that’s beside the point. I knew that girl was no good for her.” Lilia wandered back over to the round dining table with the tea and invited Agatha to come sit with her. 

 

“Oh, really? When was that?” Agatha asked, suspiciously looking back to where her boots were laying. 

 

“Oh that was years ago! I’ve since reformed my ways, you have nothing to worry about dear! Besides, I think you’ll be very good for my niece. She has an unfortunate proclivity for letting her heart wander too quickly down the wrong roads and into trouble.”

 

“She mentioned she was engaged once.” 

 

“Oh good gods! That was doomed from the start, but she was too blinded by her infatuation that she couldn’t see it for herself. Some lessons we have to learn on our own.” 

 

“But you don’t have the same concerns with me?” 

Lilia let out a bursting laugh, “Not in the slightest! You are exactly what she needs. Someone who is secure enough in their own life to help keep her head out of the clouds. And something tells me she’s just what you need as well.” 

“Oh really, how so?” 

 

“Rio has a big heart that’s aching to smother someone deserving enough to hold it. Through all the grief and pain she has experienced it’s been difficult to find someone who understands. And you, my dear, with all that grief you carry, are more deserving than anyone of that kind of love and understanding.” Agatha could feel her chest tighten at the thought. A mix of fear, sadness, and a touch of anger began to rise within her. 

 

“What exactly has she told you?” 

 

“Not nearly enough though I do try to pry it from her.” Lilia scoffed. The woman clearly didn’t see or seem to care how uncomfortable this was making her. “But I can see the sorrow hovering around you like a cloak you shield yourself with. Tell me of your grandfather.” 

 

“We were close when I was younger. Though we grew apart when I left home. I’ve not seen him in years.”

 

“Ah, so is life. Sometimes our path forward tends to leave others behind. Do not blame yourself for it.” Agatha wasn’t sure how to react to that. The swirl of emotions was tangling itself inside her. Lilia reached out, taking Agatha’s hand, studying the lines in her palm as she continued.

 

“Our bodies tell our story, one way or another you know?” 

 

“Oh, and what is my hand telling you?”

 

“Your love line is broken in two. This first part here is deep but rather short.” 

 

“Meaning?”

 

“Your first love was true but fated not to last. Given the abruptness of where it stops I suspect it was sudden?” She could feel her heart start to race at the clarity with which Lilia was reading her. Though, despite the accuracy, Lilia hadn’t gleaned anything that she hadn’t told Rio. She couldn’t let herself get carried away in the theatrics Rio had told her to expect. 

 

“Death often is.” She said resolutely, removing her hand from Lilia’s grasp. 

 

“Ah! That’ll do it! Well, that and losing a child. It’s not so easy to recover. But it is possible with the right person. What’s important is to not lose yourself in the past. Remember it, cherish it, but don’t let it hold you back from future happiness. Especially with so much to look forward to!” Lilia finished with a gleam in her eye, pointedly looking Agatha up and down  as she took a sip of her tea. The swirling feelings intensified at the realization of what she had said. 

 

“How did you? I mean I haven’t even…Rio doesn’t…”

 

“Rio, dear! Perfect timing!” Just as Lilia finished speaking, the timer on the stove went off. Agatha turned to find Rio carrying in a carton of ice cream. 

 

“They were out of the gelato you like but I grabbed your second favorite.” 

 

“That’ll have to do.” She shrugged. 

 

Rio came to sit by Agatha at the table, placing a kiss on top of her head on the way. 

“I hope she didn’t give you too much trouble!” She said as she smiled cautiously. Agatha, still pondering the conversation, took a moment to come back to reality. She forced herself to shake off the eerie feeling she had, that Lilia knew more than she was letting on, and turned her attention back to Rio. 

“Oh, no, no trouble. We just had a chat… got to know each other a bit more.” She replied with a soft smile reaching out for Rio’s hand to ground her. 

“Glad to hear it!” Rio beamed as she placed a kiss on Agatha's hand. 

 

They enjoyed dessert as Lilia babbled about different neighbors and bragged about Rio’s many accomplishments. Before long they realized their visit had come to an end. Lilia gathered their leftovers in containers to send them both home with and gave the large basket to Rio to take out to the car. Agatha cautiously made her way into the hallway to collect her shoes where she pleasantly found them lacking any animal bones. As she began to slip them back on, Lilia joined her on the small bench. 

 

“I hope I didn’t offend you earlier, bringing up old wounds. I can get carried away sometimes.” 

 

“No, it’s…it’s fine. I just. How did you know? I hadn’t said anything to Rio about the miscarriage.” She glanced up to see Rio in the driveway loading up the car. 

 

“Ah, I suspected as much! Not to worry, in your own time then. Just know, she’ll understand everything, when you’re ready.” 

 

“That didn’t really answer my question.” She chuckled as she stood. 

 

“Doll, I’m a witch! I know more than you realize.” She stood to open the door, gathering Agatha’s hand as she led her to the car. 

 

“Now, you two don’t get into too much trouble before I see you on Thursday alright?” 

 

“We’ll try, can’t promise anything.” Rio quipped as she leaned in to hug Lilia goodbye. 

 

“And you my dear! Take good care of yourself. Make sure to eat and drink plenty of water, get some good sleep! You’re going to need it!” Agatha chuckled again in confusion as she was enclosed in another one of Lilia’s all consuming hugs. As Lilia released her from the embrace she held firmly onto her arms, staring once again into Agatha’s eyes for a moment before she moved a hand and patted Agatha on the stomach as she stepped away. Agatha huffed a breath of confused amusement as she turned to get into the car, shaking off the interaction as another one of Lilia’s oddities. 



They drove back in a contented silence while music filled the space around them. Agatha reflected on the encounter, spinning endless questions through her mind that she wasn’t sure she wanted the answers to. Rio, seeing her caught in thought, rested a hand on her thigh bringing her back into the moment and creating a sense of grounded comfort. She knew that, despite the confusion and questions the visit had brought, Rio was the foundation and security she needed. She didn’t want to hide any parts of her past from her, no matter how painful or traumatic. 

 

As they approached Agatha’s house Rio spoke, “I hope today didn’t change your mind about Thursday. I know Lilia can be a lot.” 

 

“No, not at all.” She laughed, “She actually helped put a few things into perspective for me.” 

 

“Oh really? What’s that?”

 

“There’s…um… something we haven’t talked about yet. I think it’s time I’ve shared with you.” 

“Oh, ok? What’s up?” 

 

“When I lost Wanda…” she cleared her throat, feeling the tension building inside her once again. “We were starting a family.” Rio patiently observed her and gave her space to continue. Eyes full of concern and care. “And then I lost her and everything fell apart.” She could feel the tears already streaming down her face. “I struggled to take care of myself…I lost the baby.” Rio said nothing but reached out and took Agatha’s hand. “I couldn’t bear the thought of living after that. If it hadn’t been for Jen and Ralph… I never would have lived to meet you.” With that a small smile shone through the tears. “I didn’t think I would ever feel this happiness again. I closed myself off to it. But you” She looked up at Rio, her crystal blue eyes glistening with tears. “You changed everything.” The weight of that admission hung in the air, dissolving any tension that remained. She let herself sink into those honey amber eyes and all she could feel was the all-consuming desire to close the distance between them.

Her hands reached up and coiled themselves in Rio’s hair as she drew her closer and deeper, their tongues entangling each other. She could smell the overwhelming scent of rain, and earth, and incense which stoked the fire that was now burning inside her. Her hands began to wander, grasping wildly as she ached to feel her body pressed against her’s. At the urgency of Agatha’s pawing, Rio broke the kiss, panting breathlessly, and rested her head against Agatha’s. She gazed into her eyes as a smile grew across her face. Agatha glanced back as a similar smirk reflected on her face.

 

“Maybe we should take this...AHHH! FUCKER!” She jolted back, startling Rio in the process. Ralph was hovering just outside the driver side window in full drag, smiling and waving his fingers. Rio rolled the window down.

“Hey!” She laughed. “I’m Rio.” She reached her hand through the window.

“Nice to meet you! I’m Lady Bohner.” Ralph said as he shook her hand.

“Ralph you absolute shit head! What the fuck?!” Agatha shouted, still breathless from the shock. 

“I saw you pull up and then y’all were just sitting here so I thought I’d come check in and introduce myself. I didn’t know I’d be interrupting something!” He laughed. “Besides, you’re blocking my space.” 

“We’ll move in a bit, get out of here!” Agatha reached over and rolled the window back up.

“Fine, I’ll move my car later.” Ralph scoffed as he turned to head into the house. 

 

“Sorry about that!”

“No worries, your friend seems nice.” She chuckled. 

“I guess. I’ll see you Thursday?” Agatha asked as she gathered her things from the car.

“Yeah, looking forward to Thursday. We’ll have to pick up where we left off.” Rio leaned over, capturing Agatha in another kiss.

 

“OW OW!!!” Ralph shouted from the porch. Agatha groaned as she hung her head.

 

“I’m gonna kill him.”

Chapter End Notes

Ralph is a total cock block

and Lilia knows, she fucking KNOWSSS

Chapter 13: Karaoke Night

Chapter Summary

Everyone meets up for Karaoke night, Rio and Agatha take the next step in their relationship and Lilia shares some interesting information.

NSFW

Chapter Notes

This took forever to write! I had like no time this week and couldn't get it out of my brain fast enough, but I'm pretty excited to share it with you. This also features my first smutty writing so enjoy - let me know what you think!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

All week Agatha had replayed their last conversation in her head. She felt as though a huge weight had finally been lifted and a barrier broken down. That kiss in the car, she had craved it to go further. She wanted to feel the outcome of all that had been building between them. Now with her full self seen, all her fear, all her trauma, entrusted with Rio, she was ready to give herself over and move forward.

 

Her dreams became haunted with anticipation once again. Rio’s hands, her body, her tongue lighting every nerve on fire with desire. She had tried to ease the tension herself but found the knot of lust too tight to be unwound by her alone. By the time Thursday rolled around the hunger had become almost unbearable. She rushed home straight after work to change and pick up Ralph. 

 

“Remember you’re getting a ride home with Jen!”

 

“How could I forget? Rio’s got your booty on call tonight.” He thrusted the air making moaning noises. 

 

“Gross.” She stated flatly. “Ok, how do I look?” She spun around to show him her fitted dark wash jeans paired with a black blazer, one low button holding it closed, allowing for her lacy black bra to peek through. Her hair was held back in a low ponytail with a few long pieces framing her face. 

 

“Perfect, classy but totally fuckable. That bra is doing some work !”

 

“Ugh! Tell me about it. My tits barely fit, I think I need to go up a size or something. It’s almost uncomfortable, but they do look fantastic!” She turned around checking herself out in the mirror. 

 

“Rio’s gonna love it!” Ralph praised. Agatha tongued her cheek, grinning in anticipation for later that evening. 

 

“Alright, let’s head out. I don’t want Jen to beat us there!” She grabbed her keys and overnight bag and shoved Ralph out the door. 

 

—-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

As they pulled up to the building she could already see Jen and Alice chatting with Rio on the steps. 

“Oh great! I knew I shouldn’t have changed again. Who knows what Jen’s telling her!” 

 

“Oooo! Something embarrassing I hope. Like that time you got lost at that concert because you were too high on shrooms and ended up on stage!” He doubled over cackling. 

 

“We will not be bringing that up!” She snapped at him. “Best behavior or I will kick you all out!” 

 

“Yes, mother!” He groaned

 

As they got out of the car they could hear the three women talking and laughing. Agatha plastered a strained smile on her face, already annoyed at whatever they were laughing at. As soon as Rio spotted Agatha she waved and started to make her way over. 

 

“My love! At last!” She bounded down the last few steps, nearly toppling Agatha as she captured her in an embrace. As soon as she released her she cupped her hands around her face and pulled her in for a kiss. “Damn girl! You look good enough to eat!” 

 

“Better save room for dessert then!” She teased. Rio’s eyes flashed with desire as she tongued her cheek and raised her eyebrows suggestively before leaning in for a deeper kiss. 

 

“Are you two done being gross and gay?” Ralph coughed. Rio laughed, ending their kiss. 

 

“Nice to meet you in this form Ralph.”

“Oh is that what you all were joking about when we pulled up?”

 

“No, actually!” Jen bit back, “We were commiserating about the new head nurse on night shift! Not everything is about you Agatha!” 

 

“She is a total bitch.” Rio shrugged. Agatha rolled her eyes and gave Jen a pointed look. 

 

“Whatever, can we go eat please?” She took Rio’s hand and headed inside. 

 

“Yeah I bet you need to eat. Improve that attitude.” Jen scoffed under her breath as she, Alice, and Ralph followed them. 

 

“No shit! This really is a school! It’s a little weird being here at night… as an adult.” Ralph commented 

 

“I know what you mean. It feels like I’m breaking in.” Alice agreed. They listlessly wandered around taking everything in. 

 

“Over here, hurry!” Rio shouted from the elevator as the doors started to close. The three of them rushed over just as Rio halted the doors with her foot. “Can’t leave you stranded!” She said as the doors creaked back open. Once they filed in she pressed the button for her floor. 

 

“Here, will you take your bang bag now?” Ralph dangled Agatha’s backpack in front of her which she promptly ripped from his hand, eyes glaring, her face immediately flushed. 

 

“Really?!” She spat to which Ralph beamed, clearly proud of himself. Her eyes darted to Jen and Alice who were snickering in the corner. “Don’t you dare!” 

 

Jen threw her arms up in defense, “I didn’t say anything!” 

 

She glanced over at Rio who had an amused smile across her face as she reached her arm around Agatha, pulling her close to her side. She couldn’t help but smile in response. 

 

“Is Lilia coming for dinner?” She asked

 

“Oh, Lilia is making dinner. She got here at 3 and has been cooking ever since!” 

 

“Are we even going to be awake enough for karaoke after dinner?” Agatha laughed, to which the other three exchanged glances.

 

“I told her to keep it light, but then again I said the same thing about lunch on Sunday and you see how that turned out!” 

 

The elevator doors dinged open and they filed down the hallway and into Rio’s apartment. They were immediately hit with the scents of the Italian feast waiting for them. Sounds of pots and pans shuffling stopped as soon as the door closed. 

 

“Rio! You brought friends back!” Lilia lilted as she greeted them in the hallway. “And there she is! My glowing, gorgeous girl!” She swallowed Agatha into a hug then kissed her on both cheeks. “How are you feeling dear?” 

 

“I’m doing alright. Thank you! Lilia, these are my friends, Ralph, Alice, and Jen.” 

 

“Jen and I actually work at the same hospital. Fortunately we haven’t had to work together much yet. Lots of healthy babies! Everyone, this is my Aunt Lilia. She’s feeding us tonight and will dominate all of you in karaoke later.” She said as she scanned her finger to point at each of them. 

 

“Looking forward to it, and that food it smells incredible!” Ralph drooled

 

“Rio’s helped keep me on track so everything’s ready. Grab a plate, mangia!” They filed in, filling their plates with the smorgasbord before them then settling on the couch. 

 

“Anybody want wine?” Lilia shouted from the kitchen. There was a mumbled chorus of absolutelys as everyone dug in. She quickly filled and passed around a series of glasses, as she was showered with muffled compliments on the food. “There’s a charm on the end of everyone’s glass so make sure you're not drinking someone else’s!” 

 

“I’m pretty sure my mom has those.” Ralph leaned over to whisper to Alice, snickering. 

 

“Make sure you leave room for dessert, there’s tiramisu.” She announced as she left to make herself a plate. 

 

“What time is karaoke?” Jen asked. 

 

“I signed us up for the last slot so we have 30 mins before we want to head down there. Also we’ll need a team name.” Rio replied. 

 

“Team name?” Agatha asked, puzzled. 

 

“Yeah, for the karaoke competition.”

 

“The what?!” They all shouted. 

 

“Did I not mention that part?” 

 

“You said they have karaoke on Thursdays. You didn’t say anything about a competition.” Agatha said, a little panicked. 

 

“Oh well don’t worry, it’s pretty chill. But do know, tonight first place gets a $150 in gift cards to Chili’s”

 

“That could buy each of us a chicken crisper combo.” They all turned to Ralph. “Don’t act like I’m the only one who takes advantage of their happy hour!” He exclaimed. 

 

“How does it work?” Alice asked 

 

“Its bracket style. You can sign up by yourself or as a team. Each round is a different musical style. If we make it to the finals we’ll need to have a group number ready.” 

 

“How does that work if you signed up by yourself?” Jen asked

 

“You get to team up with whoever agrees to join you from the audience.” 

 

“What are the genres for each round?” 

 

“Round 1 is Pop, Rock or Country. Round 2 is Funk, Jazz, or R&B. Round 3 is Musical Theatre or Disney. And the final round is a group number. There’s two songs per round except for the finals which is just one. And they will cut you off if the song goes too long or repeats a lot.” 

 

“So what’s our team name?” Alice asked 

 

“Lesbians and the Gay Boy” Ralph offered

 

“Creative.” Agatha scoffed sarcastically

“Janice is one of my go-tos so happy to start us off in round one.” Alice offered 

 

“Well I can’t not sing Dolly so I guess I’m also going in round one.” Ralph stated.

“I’m Billy, and I’m going to be singing Hakuna Matata .”

 

“Excellent, a crowd favorite!” Billy bumbled through Hakuna Matata relying on audience participation for about half the song. Though most people seemed to be enjoying themselves it wasn’t a stellar performance. As the song wrapped up Agatha could feel the pang of nerves come to a peak. This was it, it was her turn.

Rio would swing by for lunch or breakfast, depending on if she was headed to or from work. Agatha would stop by after work, while Rio was on break, and they would take a walk or grab a bite to eat. 

 

They discussed plans for their upcoming trip to Boston. Agatha planned to fly out Friday after work to get her grandfather’s estate into a position to host them. Rio would drive down on Sunday after work in Lilia’s van to collect the rest of her things. Lilia stopped by early Saturday morning, before Rio’s last shift, to drop off her car and grab Rio’s keys. 

 

“Good morning, darling! How’s everything? How’s that girlfriend of yours?” Lilia dragged Rio into a lingering hug. 

 

“Great! We’re both pretty fantastic!” She couldn’t help but smile as she thought of Agatha. 

 

“That is what I like to hear!” She patted Rio on the cheek lovingly. “So, what time are you leaving tomorrow?”

 

“I should be on the road by 9. I’ll get in around 2:00, Agatha should have our space ready by then.” 

 

“Has she left?”

 

“Yeah she got in late last night, no issues. She says the place is in worse shape than she thought but should still be fine to stay in.” 

 

Lilia frowned in concern, “Well, if you smell any mustyness or mold I want you both out. Go rent a room in a hotel!” 

 

Rio chuckled, “You got it!” 

 

“I’m serious, that stuff is toxic, not good for any of you!”

 

“Ok, fine! I swear, if anything seems off we’ll get a hotel room.” she said exasperatedly.

 

“Thank you, I love you both and want you to be safe!” 

 

“I get it! Hey, I have a question for you!” Rio rushed to change the subject and turned to pull out the empty bottle of wine. “Did you mean to buy this?” 

 

Lilia glanced at the all too familiar label, “Yes.”

 

Rio raised her eyebrows in confusion, “Are you cutting back on the booze or something?” she laughed. 

 

Lilia stood there stoically, “It wasn’t for me.” she said in all sincerity. 

 

“Who was it for?” she asked perplexed, “One of Agatha’s friends?”

 

“No.” Lilia stated simply, “It was for Agatha.” 

 

Rio frowned in further confusion. “Did she ask you for this?”

 

“No” Lilia repeated.

 

“Did she know she was drinking this?” 

 

“Not exactly, I asked if she was ok with a Merlot and she said yes.”

 

“Lilia!” Rio scolded “Why would you do that?!”

 

“For her safety.” Lilia said matter of factly. 

 

“What the fuck are you talking about?”

 

“Well, actually, this is what I wanted to talk to you about.” 

 

“Oh, fuck.” Rio threw her head in her hands. “Please don’t ruin this for me!” She begged, “I have never been happier, I feel like I’ve finally found someone who makes me whole. I can’t let you take that away from me!” Tears began to well in her eyes as fear gripped her chest in what Lilia was about to say. Lilia, seeing the panic, grabbed Rio by the wrist and led her to the couch. 

“Sit!” she instructed. Rio flopped down on the couch and wiped away the tears that had started to fall. “I need you to listen to me.” She made sure to look into Rio’s eyes. “Do you love her?”

Rio sat, perplexed by the question and stuttered, “Y-Yes”

 

“Do you care for her?” 

 

“Of course.”

 

“What I’m about to tell you doesn’t have to change anything about that. In fact, I think it will bring you both closer, if you can keep an open mind, and let it.” 

 

“Lilia, do not mess with me.” Rio began to grow angry.

 

“Remember I am always looking out for your best interest and wouldn’t bring it up if it wasn’t important.”

 

“Just tell me!” 

 

“Your girlfriend…” she took a breath

 

“Agatha?”

 

“Agatha… is pregnant.”

Chapter End Notes

The karaoke stuff was so stupid but so funny, hope you enjoyed it.

Agatha was READY, girl was HUNGRY!

and LILIA! Dropping the mic with the cliff hanger - hopefully I can get the next chapter out sooner and we can see what happens next!

Chapter 14: Twenty

Chapter Summary

Rio gets talked off the ledge and goes to visit Agatha in Boston to get to the bottom of things.

Chapter Notes

I couldn't leave you hanging too long!

“What?!” Rio finally asked after staring at Lilia for minutes trying to digest what she was saying. 

 

“I think Agatha is pregnant.” Lilia repeated. Rio let out a nervous laugh, still struggling to comprehend what she was hearing. 

 

“No… what…what do you mean by that?” She shook her head as the information began to settle. A dull ringing slowly crescendoed as her body began to tingle numbly. 

 

Lilia rolled her eyes and picked up Rio’s hands, rubbing them between her’s, coaxing her back to reality. “Sweetheart, your girlfriend is having a baby.” She stared patiently into Rio’s eyes as she saw the news finally settle and her gears start to turn. 

 

Rio’s eyes darted around unfocused as they searched through the memories of the last few months. Every thought denied the words Lilia had spoken. She began to shake her head and laugh at the absurdity of the idea. 

 

“No…no…what?! No, no, no! Ha, Ha! What is this?! Why are you doing this? I thought you liked Agatha?!” She pulled on Lilia as if pleading with her to admit to her cruel joke. “Don’t tell me you’re jealous of the time we’re spending together?” 

 

Lilia furrowed her brow in irritation and offense. “This is not about me ! I’m trying to get you to realize what’s happening so you can make a decision before things go too much further and one or both of you end up hurt!” 

 

Rio let out a huff of air, finally accepting that Lilia was serious in her efforts despite their impossibility. “Ok, Lilia, unless that's an immaculate conception, there’s absolutely no way that’s possible.” She laughed it off. 

 

Lilia stared back unamused, “I’m not saying I know any of the details but I am certain.”

 

“Certain?”

 

“About 99% sure” 

 

“So not the full hundred, but you’re willing to burden me with this revelation! Great! What, exactly, brought you to this conclusion?” 

 

“Well, I saw it when you brought her over for lunch. First off, I can read that woman like a picture book. And two, look at her! She glows brighter than a supermoon! She has that radiance about her.” Rio groaned “Then there was her future card! The Empress, though not a direct indication, it reaffirmed my suspicions. I saw it again when I read her palm, and almost got the confirmation but you were a little quicker with the gelato than I anticipated.” 

 

“Lilia! You sound like that time you ate my weed brownies by mistake! You’re not making any sense. What are you looking to get out of this, huh? Already trying to break us up?”

 

“I’m not looking for anything! You know I just have a sense about these things! And I wasn’t going to ask! Not directly! For one, you’d kill me.” 

 

“Damn right!”

 

“And it’s a sensitive topic, you know, given the miscarriage. So I had an idea.” she said nonchalantly.

 

Rio shot Lilia a glare, “Wait, how do you know about that?” 

 

“It may have come up?” She shrugged guiltily. 

 

“Lilia!” Rio whined, throwing her head in her hands once again. “So, you expect me to believe, based on your hunch, that my girlfriend who hasn’t had a relationship with anyone else, let alone a man, in the last seven years since her wife died, is somehow pregnant?!”

 

“I can only tell you what I know! Like I said, I don’t have details…”  

 

“Or real evidence! Lilia, what do you expect me to do? Drive all the way to Boston and when she answers the door say, Hey sweetheart, so happy to see you, by the way, any chance you’re pregnant and just forgot to tell me ? Lilia’s about 99% sure !” 

 

“I mean I wouldn’t be that glib about it. It might come off the wrong way. And you’re wrong about that.” 

 

“Wrong about what?” Rio snapped, as her anger simmered just below the surface. 

 

“I have evidence.” Lilia admitted as she dug around in her purse.

 

“You do?” Rio’s interest was piqued with a layer of panic growing over the pit of anger in her stomach. With a flourish, Lilia pulled out a ziplock baggie containing three pieces of long white paper. “What the fuck is that?”

 

Lilia shrugged, “A bag of pregnancy tests.” Rio’s eyes scanned the item with a look of horror and confusion growing on her face. 

 

“Lilia, what the FUCK did you do?” 

 

“I tested your girlfriend…obviously!” 

 

“Lilia that’s fucking insane ! HOW did you?! WHEN did you?!” Rio stammered

 

“At the karaoke night. I rigged them in the toilet seat. They all came out positive.” Rio could hear her heartbeat drumming through her ears, her face grew hot with panic and anger. She stood and started pacing behind the couch, attempting to quell her anxiety. 

 

“UGH! I can’t believe you did that ! So…it could be anybody’s right? Maybe her friend Jen, or Alice!” 

 

“I made sure she was the only one who used that bathroom. I had everyone else use yours.” 

 

Rio froze for a moment then let out a bold laugh in astonishment as she stormed back into the kitchen and began furiously cleaning the dishes in her sink, muttering in Spanish. 

 

“If that were real don’t you think she would have said something by now? Or, I don’t know, I would have noticed the other night! We’ve been dating for a couple months, how long could she possibly intend to hide something like that?” 

 

“Dear, again I don’t have answers. I don’t know why or how, I just know before long it’s going to become something the two of you have to deal with and I want you to be ready. If you do indeed love this woman, the way that I see you do, she’s going to need you just as much as that life growing inside her.” 

 

“Lilia enough!” Rio shouted, “I’m done with whatever game you're playing and I don’t think this is funny!”

 

“Oh sweetheart, I wish it was a game! But life is never a straight path, and the fates are ever fickle!” 

 

Rio paused her messing with the dishes in the sink, throwing down the utensils she was holding with a large crash, and let herself believe for a moment that what Lilia was saying and showing her was the truth. How was this possible? Why didn’t Agatha tell her? Was there someone else? Had there been someone else? The idea of bringing any of this up with Agatha felt like stepping on an open wound. Anxiety pricked at the tendrils of her nerves and a cold panic washed over her. She had finally found someone she could see a future with and she couldn’t bear the thought of losing it. The fates indeed had blessed her with Agatha, but oh what cruel tricks they could play. She could feel her breath growing shallow, coming in short bursts, as the panic began to overwhelm her. 

 

Lilia, seeing the inevitable crash out, rushed to her side and forced her into a hug. “Just breathe dear!” She drew calming circles across her back until she could feel Rio’s breath begin to slow, coming now in deep bursts as silent tears started to flow. “Oh sweetheart! It’s going to be alright!” 

 

“I can’t lose her!” Rio whimpered as she wiped away the tears that continued to fall. “But I feel like this could really complicate things!” 

 

“Babies tend to do that! But they can also be a blessing!” Lilia reached up, wiping away the remaining tears. “As I said when we first sat down, keep an open mind! She could be afraid to tell you! Not sure how you’ll react?” Lilia raised her eyebrows. “I mean, think of it from her perspective. Who knows how far along she is? Or how it happened? Maybe she didn’t know when you first met? And you, my dear, were your oh-so-charming self and swept her off her feet. And then that one wild Saturday the month before turns into a happy accident. All I'm saying is, despite how improbable it may be, it’s the situation you’re in and you need to decide if you care enough about this woman to stick around. Because if not - you need to step away now.”

 

“I think that depends on a lot of things! I have several questions ping ponging through my mind right now!” 

 

“That’s understandable!” Lilia brought her hands up to rest on Rio’s shoulders. “If this were anyone else, I’d probably tell you to run for the hills, but I see the way she looks at you…Like you hung the stars and moon. Despite all she may be dealing with, that woman adores you!” Rio cracked half a smile. “And I know how you feel about her!” Lilia hummed. “All I’m saying is it’s worth hearing out.”

 

Rio’s breathing finally relaxed as she let all that Lilia had said sink into her. “You had to do this before I planned to spend an entire week with her didn’t you!” 

 

“It’s a great opportunity to figure things out! Besides, you’ll have all that driving time to contemplate!” 

 

“And now I have to go to work!” 

 

“I am sorry about that!”



————————————————

 

Rio’s entire shift had been a blur. Luckily it was uneventful and she could bury herself in paperwork and answering insurance claims. But the morning came too quickly and before she knew it she was sitting in the parking lot of the hospital in Lilia’s van. She had turned on the vehicle minutes ago but was just staring at her phone screen where Agatha’s last texts were taunting her. 

 

Hope you have a good last shift! I can’t wait to see you tomorrow! 

 

Good night, my love! Let me know when you hit the road in the morning! 

 

Morning hon! I can’t believe I get to see you today! 

 

Rio hadn’t replied to any of them. She was swirling about everything that lay before her. She had been so excited, so sure, then Lilia had to bring her crashing down. She wanted to run. She wished she could run and just forget the last few months like it never happened. But Agatha consumed her every thought. The woman had made her feel whole and loved. For the first time in a long time she felt sure of herself and excited about her future. And Lilia was right, she deserved to find the answers to her questions. Before she could psych herself out any further she typed out a message to Agatha,

 

Morning, mi amor! I’m headed your way. See you in a few hours. 😘 

 

and pulled out of the parking lot. 

 

—————————————————

 

The whole first hour was silent. She was heavy with dread. She bounced between worst and best case scenarios, running through every possible question. Would Agatha leave her? Would she have to leave Agatha? Could she leave Agatha? Why didn’t she feel like she could tell her? Was this yet another trauma that had been inflicted upon her? Was it a one night stand? Given all Agatha had told her that seemed the most unlikely. But the whole situation seemed unlikely. Had it not been for the bag of test strips tucked away in her suitcase she would have thought the whole thing was a fever dream Lilia had cooked up. Even with the “evidence” she had her doubts. She needed to hear Agatha say it before she could really believe it. But how would she even begin that conversation?  My love, is there anything you’re keeping from me? Anything you’d like to share? I promise I won’t be upset, just tell me what’s going on?! No, she had to be subtle. Let Agatha tell her on her own terms. Let her know that she was safe to tell her, that she wouldn’t run for the hills and leave her stranded, unless of course there was someone else. She shook that thought away, she couldn’t get ahead of herself, one step at a time. 

 

She could hardly begin to imagine what Agatha must be feeling. Did she know when they first started dating? Would she really have agreed to the date if that had been the case? She imagined, for a moment, what if the roles had been reversed? Not that she could ever imagine herself in that position, but what if? Would she have the heart to tell Agatha right away? Cariño, I know we’ve only been dating a couple months but by the way, I’m pregnant. Is that going to be an issue? That conversation seemed just as, if not more, difficult than the one she actually needed to have. All around it was an impossible situation. 

 

She let her mind wander to the potential futures. One without Agatha, without her light, and laughter, and all the joy and love she had brought into her life. How empty it would feel, like getting a taste of heaven then being starved for eternity. The shell of the life she wanted to live. 

 

Then for a second she let herself dream. Spending her life with Agatha and this child. Just the three of them. Her own little family. She had almost given up on having any semblance of the family life she grew up with, but now. It was wrapped with a bow on a silver platter. The woman of her dreams and a child with whom she could share all her love and knowledge and adventures. If she really asked herself what she wanted it would be that. A family that she could love and share the rest of her life with. 

 

Then the question is, is that what Agatha would want? Would she trust her enough to keep her around? She hadn’t trusted her enough to tell her, and yet, they were set to spend the week together. Maybe she was planning to come clean, like Lilia said, it’d be a good chance to talk things through. If she could convince Agatha that she wanted this, wanted her, more than anything else, they could try and make this work. Her heart jumped at the thought. Maybe she could have the best of all possible worlds. 

 

After stopping for gas about halfway she resigned herself to come up with a plan. She would wait a couple days, give Agatha a chance to tell her and explain things on her own. Maybe ask a few unassuming questions, and on day three, if Agatha hadn’t said anything, she would find some way to bring it up. She really hoped it wouldn’t come to that. Until then she’d keep tabs and see if she noticed any indication that Lilia was right. She could still be wrong, but for now she had to prepare herself for that to not be the case. After all, Lilia was rarely wrong. Even now she had been right about the drive helping to set her mind straight. Satisfied with her plan she turned on some music and attempted to relax as best she could for the rest of the journey. 

 

—————————————————-



Right at 2:00 Rio pulled through the gate of the estate into a circular driveway. In the center was a large weather worn fountain featuring the Virgin Mary pouring water out of her hands. Heh! She laughed at the irony of it. The other immaculate conception. 

 

She pulled the van up in front of the door of the large gothic mansion that was Agatha’s family estate. The building was ominous, made of dark grey and black stones stacked to peaks that each housed a cross at their steeple. A very stark contrast to the colorful and whimsical childhood home Lilia and her mother had fostered. This felt like a church, in every oppressive sense of the word. 

 

She grabbed her bag and the bouquet of flowers, she had been debating on bringing but was now glad she had, and walked up to the solid oak door. She had to put her bag down to properly maneuver the ornate knocker, and knocked three times. She picked up her bag as a flurry of butterflies filled her stomach. Her heart began to beat out of her chest as she heard footsteps behind the door. She thought she might faint as the door handle clicked. 

 

Then there she was. Hair piled up in a chaotic bun, black glasses askew, a fitted black tank top underneath a large fuzzy cardigan and slouchy jeans. She had the biggest grin on her face as soon as she realized it was Rio and rushed out to smother her in a hug. 

 

“Oh my gods! I can’t believe you’re actually here!” She shrieked with joy. 

 

“I know, me neither!” Rio mumbled half heartedly, in a fuzzy sense of non-reality. Like everything was happening around her. She felt Agatha’s body pressed against her. She took a deep breath through her nose, savoring the ever familiar lilac and honeysuckle, tinged with a spicy punch of ginger and creamy note of tonka. She let her fingers wind their way through Agatha’s tangles, finding a soothing comfort. This felt like home. She peeled herself away, “Here, my love, for you!” She held out the bundle of white roses and baby’s breath, then reached out and kissed Agatha’s hand. 

 

“You are always so good to me!” She leaned in and snuck a quick kiss on Rio’s lips. “If I knew any better I’d say you love me!” 

 

Rio quirked a smile, “More than you know, Cariño!” 

 

Agatha grabbed her hand and pulled her inside. The floor creaked beneath their feet as Agatha guided them through a labyrinth of books and boxes, many stacked taller than they were. Every now and then she’d catch a grandfather clock, an instrument, or some taxidermied animal, until Agatha led them through a swinging wooden door into the expansive kitchen. An enormous marble island dominated the room. An ancient gas range took up the far wall like an iron monster. Cabinets and a deep farmhouse sink were aligned against the back wall with enormous atrium windows that looked out onto the back property. Unlike the rest of the house she’d seen, the black and white kitchen was completely spotless, save for a smattering of snacks Agatha returned to eating. 

 

“Oh I’m so glad you made it alright! I actually just stopped for a snack break as you can see, this place is worse off than expected. And now I’m ravenous!” She moved to dig around in the fridge for items to add to her feast. “Can I get you anything to eat? Drink? I don’t have much, we’ll have to go to the store sooner rather than later.” 

 

“I’ll just take a water. I’m actually quite tired.” Rio yawned. 

 

“Oh, honey! I bet you are! Working then driving all that way!” Agatha said with loving concern. 

 

And stressing about you the entire time, Rio thought. 

 

“Here’s a bottle of water. I’ll take you to the bedroom. Follow me!” She grabbed a handful of nuts then headed out the swinging door, Rio closely behind her. 

 

“Don’t worry, the upstairs doesn’t look nearly as bad, I brought most things down yesterday and this morning.” 

 

“By yourself?” Rio asked, a little concerned. 

 

“Yeah! I mean, some things i couldn’t, they just need two people, but everything else I managed alright.” 

 

“Should you really be lifting heavy things?” Rio asked, more concerned. 

 

“I may look delicate but I could probably out squat you! Though I will say it hasn’t done any favors for my back. It’s been so sore.” 

 

Huh , thought Rio, not the response I would have expected. 

 

They climbed the ancient staircase and headed down a long dark hallway until they reached a creaky wooden door. It opened up to a window filled circular room. Thick curtains hung, ceiling to floor. A wooden four poster bed was aligned against the back wall. The room was covered in a dark plum floral wallpaper, giving the otherwise bright room a rather cave like feeling. There were two Victorian arm chairs and a table set by one of the windows. A wooden vanity and large oval mirror adorned the side wall, opposite the only other door in the room. 

 

“Bathrooms through there when you need it.” Agatha said pointing to the door. “I’m going to run down and put away that food. I’m not sure but there may be mice.” She shrugged then sauntered back out of the room. 

 

Rio dropped her bag on the floor and collapsed onto the bed. Her head hurt, her body ached, and she was so exhausted from everything. Her head was still swirling, now with confusion more than anything, and she just needed a break. She slunk off her boots, flung them near her suitcase, and shimmied out of her work clothes before crawling into bed. She let out an exasperated sigh as her eyes drifted closed. She was nearly asleep when she heard the door creak open and footsteps patter in. She looked up to find Agatha, back toward her, shedding her tank top and jeans. Rio did her best to take a look at her, half asleep, as Agatha glided around the bed and joined her under the covers. 

 

Agatha scooted in to rest her head on Rio’s chest and crook her leg across her body. She let out an equally tired sigh and curled in closer. In this home that had once been hers she had felt like a stranger up until now. Here in Rio’s arms she could finally settle and be at ease. 

 

Rio rolled over to tangle her body with Agatha’s, tucking her head under her chin. She rubbed her hands soothingly down Agatha’s back, taking in every curve. She squeezed her as close as she could and savored the feeling. This calmness, this peace, before everything would change. For now she could let it just be her and Agatha. She wound her fingers back up to tangle in Agatha’s hair, letting the sensation soothe her further. Before long they were both deep in sleep. 

 

—————————————————-

 

Rio stirred first. She blinked her eyes open to the light of the setting sun leaking through the windows. She lifted her wrist from behind Agatha’s head, just enough so she could see the time. 6:35. They needed to get up. If for nothing else than to eat before going back to bed. She brought her hand down, stroking Agatha’s hair, as she took in the sleeping visage before her. Her voluminous waves sprawled out across the sheets and pillows. Her ivory white skin flushed with a rosy red glow in her cheeks. Her lips pressed together so that she was almost frowning. She looked so at ease with her arms draped over her head, like a woman in a romantic era painting. 

 

Rio brought her hand down, daring to brush the back of her fingers against Agatha’s smooth cheek. They kept going, dancing down the length of her arm before resting on her hip. She held herself there in that moment, drinking in the peaceful warmth between them. Then she let her hand fall, landing to rest on Agatha’s lower abdomen. It was soft and fleshy, maybe a little distended, nothing particularly noticeable. As she left her hand there her heart started to flutter. Could there really be a life growing just on the other side of her palm? The idea of it now, after some sleep, after seeing Agatha, holding her, was exhilarating. She pressed her hand a little harder, not wanting to wake Agatha, but maybe feel some proof of her own. She waited, nothing, pressed a little further. Waited, nothing, as she went to press further she heard a mumble.

 

“If you squeeze me any harder I’m going to pee the bed.” Agatha groaned as she stretched her body long. “What time is it?”

 

“Almost 6:45. You hungry?” Rio asked. Agatha blinked herself more awake. 

 

“Yeah, now that you mention it, I could probably kill for a burger.”

 

“Great, want me to go pick something up?”

 

“No, we’ll just get it delivered.” Agatha rolled out of bed and stumbled to the vanity where she grabbed her phone. Rio ogled her as she searched for a place to order from. She was slender, fit and curvy much like a Greek statue. Her breasts were full, nearly spilling out of the bra she was wearing, and in the space just below her belly button was an unassuming pooch. 

 

“Here!” Rio’s gaze was broken by the phone that landed in her lap. “Order what you want, I put my order in and have a card on file. When you’re done, you can join me in the shower, if you’d like?” She winked at Rio and began to strip off her remaining clothes as she waltzed into the bathroom. Rio scrolled through the menu for a while before finally picking something and placing the order. She threw Agatha’s phone on the bed and made her way into the shower to join Agatha. Rio stood in the corner, cautiously looking her over as Agatha washed her hair. 

 

“You just going to stand there checking me out or are you gonna do something about it?” Agatha asked as she turned around to rinse her hair. Rio let out a nervous laugh as she moved Agatha out of the way to stand under the running water. “That’s not really what I had in mind!” Agatha joked.

 

“Later, mi amor! We can be as dirty as you want to be.” She leaned forward, wrapping her arms around Agatha’s shoulders and smothering her in a kiss. “Right now, I want to be clean, I feel disgusting.” They finished up in the shower, each found some clothes to change into and headed back down to the kitchen.

 

“So what’s the plan for this week?” Rio asked

 

“Well tomorrow and Tuesday we have to get the rest of the stuff down to the second floor, outside of our bedroom that is, and, somewhat, sort through everything for the people holding the estate sale on Wednesday. That is going to be an all day thing! Then on Thursday I have cleaners coming to get the house ready for pictures on Friday so they can list it as soon as possible.”

 

“So you are selling the place?’

 

“Oh absolutely! You’ve seen it! It’s too much work, and I don’t want to be in Boston! I’ve already had loads of my Mother’s congregants at my door now that they know I’m in town. If I could get out of here sooner I would.” 

 

“You ok if I pick up my stuff on Friday then, if we’re still planning to leave on Saturday?” 

 

“Yeah that should be fine, I can handle pictures on my own. Hey, if they get done early I can even come help you. But that might be a pipe dream, we’ll see how I feel after this week is over.” 

 

“No, if anything you should rest after the pictures. You’re already doing too much! Besides, that way I can take you to meet my friends for dinner on Friday before we head back.”

 

“That sounds like a plan!” They heard a knock at the door. “OOO that must be the food!” Agatha jumped up from where she was sitting on the counter and bolted for the front door. She came back quickly with the bag of burgers and fries, already stuffing a few in her mouth. “Gods! And I thought I was hungry before! I can’t get this burger in me fast enough!” She rifled through the bags and tore open the wrapper containing her burger just in time to sink her teeth in for a large bite. Rio chuckled at her in amusement as she slowly unwrapped her food. 

 

“Did you forget to eat breakfast or something?”

 

“No, I’ve been eating all day, I’m just so hungry after moving all this shit!” She took another large bite. 

 

“Why do I smell peanut butter?” Rio asked as she looked around and in the bag. 

 

“That would be this. It has a peanut butter sauce, bacon, onion, pickles and mustard. OH and cheese!” Agatha took another bite, now having eaten nearly half of the sandwich. Rio grimaced at the idea of that combination. 

 

“Not my top choice but so la voo, or whatever.” Rio clocked it as an odd craving. Agatha snorted and moved over to the fridge. 

 

“Do you want anything to drink besides water? I’ve got beer, soda, scotch?”

 

“Soda sounds good, I’ll take whatever you got.” Agatha handed her a coke as she pulled out a beer for herself and set it on the counter to look for a bottle opener. Rio opened her drink and paused as she looked confusedly at what was happening. 

 

“You’re having a beer?” She eventually asked

 

“Yes, as soon as I can find a bottle opener.” Agatha replied as she searched through more cabinets. 

 

“You sure about that?” Rio asked, trying not to sound too concerned. 

 

“Pretty sure burgers and beer go well together! AH! There it is!” She shouted as she pulled out the bottle opener and started to pry off the lid. Rio stared at her, confused and concerned, and then it hit her. 

 

Does Agatha not know she’s pregnant?

Chapter 15: Twenty One

Chapter Summary

Rio tries to figure out what the fuck to do with Agatha

Chapter Notes

Y'all the way this took me way too long to write and edit! There was a lot of ground to cover and I had like no time because work bullshit. Sorry for the delay, hope you enjoy.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

From across the island Rio watched as Agatha lifted the bottle to her lips and took a few large gulps before setting it back down and taking another bite of her burger. Her mouth curled into a stunned smirk. She was conflicted, did Agatha really not know or was Lilia losing it? Ok Lilia was definitely losing it. That shit with the pregnancy tests was over the line, but, then again, it was proof! She took in every inch of Agatha as she ate. The way her tank top stretched at her chest. The slight curve of her stomach, peeking out from the bottom of her shirt, that pressed against the waistband of her pants. Her full glowing cheeks as she finished off the last of her questionable dinner choice. The beer gave her pause, but the evidence otherwise was piling up. This was going to be a completely different conversation than the one she had prepared for. In the meantime, she couldn’t let Agatha self sabotage, even if she wasn’t aware she was doing it. 

 

Agatha reached for her beer and took another sip then noticed Rio staring at her. “What?”

 

“Huh?” Rio snapped out of her contemplation. 

 

“Why are you looking at me like that?” Agatha snorted. 

 

“Oh, uh, can I have some of that?” Rio asked, reaching for the bottle in Agatha’s hand. 

 

“Sure…” Agatha shrugged, as she handed her drink to Rio. 

 

“I just want a sip.” Rio took the bottle and swirled the brown liquid. She cleared her throat and tipped the bottle back, emptying its contents. 

 

“Hey! I would have gotten you your own if I knew you were going to finish it.” Agatha grumbled, perturbed. 

 

Rio let out a loud burp, “My bad, you can have the rest of my soda if you want.” She scooted the can closer to Agatha who grabbed it frustratedly and chugged it out of spite. She set down the can with a look of discomfort and regret on her face before letting out an obnoxious belch. 

 

“You good?” Rio chuckled 

 

“That may not have been the best choice.” Agatha admitted before burping again. “Ugh, I’m so full!” 

“I bet! You inhaled that sandwich!” She laughed. “You…uh…feeling ok otherwise?” She asked, changing the subject and wanting to glean any information she could. 

 

“Yeah, just tired mostly, and bloated! Gods, I hate flying. It always messes with my stomach. I’m sure this didn’t help but I swear, I felt like I was gonna die if I didn’t eat that burger!” She rubbed at her stomach in discomfort and walked over to take Rio’s hand and lean against her side. “How about you, how was your drive?” 

 

“Good, quiet, uneventful. Gave me time to think.” 

 

“Oh, yeah? What were you thinking about?” Agatha rested her chin on Rio’s shoulder. 

 

Rio turned her head to take in Agatha’s face. Her crystal clear blue eyes, that sleep was already tugging at, looked back at her with love and curiosity. She thought of all the scenarios she had run through trying to solve the situation before them. Seeing her now made her realize how futile that all had been. “You, mostly” she smirked. 

 

“Me?” Agatha leaned back a bit, spreading her hand across her chest in mock flattery. 

 

“Us, really.” She smiled as she pulled Agatha in so her back was resting against her chest. Her arms cradled her low around Agatha’s stomach. 

 

“Oh, us. ” Agatha grinned as she leaned back pressing her cheek to Rio’s, “What about us?” 

 

“Well, what our future might look like.” 

 

“And what have you dreamed up for us, my love?” 

“Oh you know” She hummed, “a house, 2 cars, 2.5 kids, some pets? Lots of adventures and mischief.” She squeezed Agatha lightly and began rubbing circles with her thumb across her abdomen. 

 

Agatha looked back at her, a glimmer of grief and concern brewing in her mind. “Is that really what you want?” She asked hesitantly. 

 

“That depends, what do you want?” 

 

Agatha looked back into Rio’s eyes as she considered the question. “You.” She finally answered. “This.” She relaxed further into Rio. “I don’t really care about the rest. I just need you.” 

 

Rio hummed in agreement, hugging Agatha tighter and resting her chin on her shoulder. A swarm of conflicting emotions buzzed in her chest. She was relieved at how Agatha cared for her, how she truly needed her here. But that relief was soon squashed by concern. How could she not know? How could she not realize? Seeing her now, feeling her now, knowing everything, how was any of this possible? Would she have to tell her? How could she tell her? How could she begin to reason any of this? 

 

“I’m glad you came.” Agatha murmured in the shared silence. “I was absolutely dreading this.” 

 

“Anything for you, my love!” Rio leaned down and kissed her shoulder. “I’m glad I came too.” Rio held her there, their bodies swaying gently, as she stilled her mind and savored the moment. And she knew, whatever was to come next, however this was to shake out, at the very least, they would face it together. 

 

————————————————

MONDAY:
