I spent my whole journey down trying to figure out what happened and why you didn’t tell me. Was there someone else, was it a one night stand, had you been attacked? So many things went through my mind. And then…I saw you, and all the questions and doubts vanished. I didn’t care why or how, I just knew I wanted you. I wanted us, whatever that looked like.Then it quickly became obvious you didn’t know, which created even more questions, and it turned into how to I even begin to tell you? I came close a few times but each time I just fell apart or clammed up. I was so afraid.” Rio took a heavy breath to keep the tears from falling. “I didn’t want to lose you! You are the best thing that’s ever happened to me.” Rio’s body was shaking as the tears fought to burst forth. “I…I’m so sorry! I didn’t know what to do. I didn’t know what to say. I needed time, I needed to think. I needed help, I needed people who loved and cared for you, who understood you to help. I needed to know they would be there for you if…” Her voice broke as she fought to finish the thought. “If…after…after you knew everything…you wanted to end things.” At that the tears finally fell in silent sheets like rain. “I love you, more than anything in this life. I would do anything to make sure that you’re ok, that you’re both healthy and happy. Even if that means losing you forever.”

 

The four of them stood there in different shades of confusion and concern as they tried to stitch together the pieces of Rio’s confession. Fear and panic pricked at Agatha’s chest seeing the earnest plea for understanding in Rio’s waterlogged eyes. The words had been an avalanche of pent up truths that she was struggling to comprehend. It just wasn’t true, it didn’t make sense. Breaking through the disorienting fog Jen’s voice rang out. “Wait, you said proof. What proof?”

 

Rio’s face grew white with panic. At this point she had already revealed so much, there was just the final kernel of truth that still weighed heavy on her heart. “I wasn’t the one who figured it out. It was Lilia, she told me right before I left.”

 

“Man, does she have the worst timing or what?” Ralph huffed under his breath. 

 

“So, what? All of this is based off your aunt’s witchy intuition and my inconveniently timed digestive issues?” Agatha asked incredulously, trying desperately to hide the panic behind her eyes.

 

Rio gulped as she dared to confess. “Well…yes and no.” 

 

“Great, what is that supposed to mean?” Agatha scoffed, growing more impatient by the second. She was tired of whatever game they thought they were playing. 

 

Rio closed her eyes and took a big breath before heading over to her car. “I just want to be clear, I had no idea this was happening, I do not condone it, and we’ve had a lengthy discussion about boundaries after the fact.” Rio began digging around in her center console as Agatha turned to the others who seemed just as perplexed. Eventually Rio returned holding what looked to be a plastic baggie. “Again, this was a gross violation of your, well everything, and I’m so SO sorry. But, when she told me she gave me this.” She walked over and handed Agatha the bag. 

 

Agatha turned it over in her hand, trying to process what she was looking at. Three strips of paper, all of which appeared to be positive pregnancy tests. “Is this some sort of joke?” She coughed bitterly as the stinging tears returned to her eyes. How could she be so cruel? She knew about the miscarriage, this is not something she could find humor in. 

 

“I wish it was, cariño.” Rio choked out as her heart stuttered, seeing the pain she was putting her through. 

 

“What is it?” Jen asked as they all walked closer. Agatha, still in a state of shock, handed the bag over to Jen. She took a second to examine the package before it clicked what had happened.  “Oh damn! Yeah, that’s…that’s kind of fucked up!” she exclaimed as she passed the bag to the others. 

 

Agatha stood frozen, a numb panic pulsed through her body as her brain fought to understand what was happening. “No…no, that’s wrong. It didn’t work. I checked, Ralph you saw! It didn’t work! It never worked!”

 

“Right?! That’s what I told them! We checked and it was negative.” Ralph reaffirmed

“These things aren’t always reliable! False negatives and positives happen all the time!” Jen explained

 

“So it’s false?! There’s no way! I’m not pregnant! I can’t be. I’m NOT pregnant!” She began to grow frantic as her gut twinged at the possibility. 

 

“Well, It also may not pick it up if you tested too early. Which is why you should always follow up with your doctor! Which is something I would have told you if I had known!” Jen lectured as she handed the tests back to Agatha. 

 

“No, no, it’s not.. I’m not…STOP LOOKING AT ME LIKE THAT!” She screamed at the others who looked on in horror as the pieces began to fall in place. Falling asleep at the office, her swollen joints and aching back, now that she thought about it, when did she have her last period? Two months ago? And that was spotting at best! Her hands began to tremble as her breathing grew ragged. She let her gaze wander down to her stomach as she placed a shaky hand right below her belly button. In that moment she could feel the odd spasm return, light, like she had swallowed a butterfly. Her eyes grew wide in fear and panic. Her head snapped up looking at the crowd around her, their faces a mixture of concern and unease, unsure of what to do or say. She could feel the color drain from her face as saliva began to pool in her mouth. Before she realized what was happening her feet were carrying her through the parking lot, to where? She had no idea. Rio immediately took off behind her, worried about what she might do. The other three looked on in amused confusion. 

 

“Why is she running?” Ralph asked 

 

“I have no clue!” Jen huffed as they watched Agatha come to a stop at the Chili’s sign, spewing the contents of her stomach at the base, to which they all groaned in response. Having watched the commotion from the windows their waitress and a manager rushed out to check on them. 

 

“Everything ok out here? Do you need anything?” Asked the stout balding manager.

 

“Maybe water and a towel?” Jen suggested 

 

“And we’ll take the check.” Alice added

 

“You got it.” They muttered and rushed back inside, quickly returning with the requested items. 



Rio rubbed gentle circles on Agatha’s back and held her hair until the vomiting subsided. She wasn’t sure how she had expected Agatha to react, running had definitely been a shock. She braced herself as Agatha slowed her heaving and moved to lean against the sign. Rio took a step toward her, reaching out to adjust a piece of hair behind her ear. As soon as she neared Agatha’s face she felt a smack push her away. 

 

“Don’t touch me!” Agatha screeched as she looked up at Rio with panic-stricken eyes. “Get away from me!” Agatha pulled herself away from the sign and pushed past Rio to head back toward her friends. 

 

“Agatha? You ok?” Ralph asked timidly as he met her half-way across the lot.

 

“What do you think?!” She spat angrily as she worked to steady herself. Fear gripped her as she accepted the real possibility that they were telling her the truth. If that was the case, who knows what untold harm she had already caused this child. She needed to know, she needed undeniable proof. In that moment her mind went to the one person that could provide her guidance. “Jen! Please, Jen, what do I do?! I need to know! Is it real? Is this really happening?” She cried as her breathing became short and erratic. 

 

Jen, seeing Agatha’s devastation, let her anger fall. Despite their differences and Agatha’s questionable decisions, she couldn’t help but feel compassion for the woman before her. “Hey, hey it’s going to be alright. We’ll figure this out.” She said as she rushed forward to embrace her. “I think it might be a good idea to go to the hospital. We can get real confirmation, either way, and get everything checked out.” 

 

Agatha pulled herself away from Jen, “I…I couldn’t find my car keys, can you see if I dropped them inside? I’m going nowhere without them.” She shuddered through sobs. 

 

“Sure, I’ll have Ralph check. You know you’re not driving right?” Jen gave her a reassuring half smile as she ushered Agatha into Alice’s van. 

 

As the door closed behind her the silence of the car only gave more room for the noise inside her mind to buzz louder in warning. What if something’s wrong, something could be wrong. Her ears rang, trying to catch the muffled conversations happening just outside the vehicle. She stared listlessly out the windshield as her friends organized themselves around her. Jen made a call, Ralph and Rio headed back inside the restaurant, Alice waited patiently for Jen to finish the call before they both joined her in the car. 

 

“I called Vicky, she said she’ll meet us at the entrance.” Jen said, resting a hand on Agatha’s shoulder as they pulled out of the parking space.  Agatha rolled to her side, leaning her head against the door as she tucked her legs beneath her. She let her arms settle in her lap, wrapped tightly around her waist as if she was trying to hold herself together. She glanced out the side mirror and caught Rio exiting the restaurant. 

 

“Is everyone coming?” She mumbled, devoid of emotion, as she stared out the window. 

 

“Yeah, Ralph’s got your stuff, they’re going to meet us there.” Hearing no reaction from Agatha she asked, “Is that ok?”

 

“It’s fine” she breathed, unsure of what to feel. 

 

—---------------------------------------------------

 

Rio gathered Agatha’s bag from the ground and collected the glasses and mints that had fallen out. Ralph walked over and dropped her keys in the bag. “Found them under the table. She must have dropped them when she freaked out. Also, wasn’t sure if you wanted your chicken crispers so I grabbed them just in case.” He held up the bag containing all the food that practically no one had touched. “You driving or should I?” He asked, “I’ll warn you, I downed another margarita when I was in there. What a day! Am I right?” He huffed another breath, slapping Rio on the back in brotherly camaraderie. Rio moved no other muscle than her eyes as she glared up at Ralph, seeing his laissez-faire attitude about the whole thing. “What?” he asked.  

 

“Should I even go?” Rio choked out, half broken.

 

“What do you mean?” Ralph asked earnestly

 

“Does she even want me there? You heard what she said, we’re done. She pushed me away.” She glanced down at the bag, holding onto it in a vice grip, as if it could be the last piece of Agatha she may ever see. 

 

“Oh, well, honestly? Given the context, I wouldn’t take it to heart. Not entirely at least. I mean, you’ve known since before Boston, so that’s not great. Then you practically ghosted her for a week, also not great. She was stressing about that! But it’s kind of hard to blame you. I wouldn’t have known what to do in your situation. You didn’t get her pregnant, you just happened to find out before she did. It’s probably the worst timing ever.” He chuckled 

 

“I know it’s not my fault this is happening, I just…that could not have gone worse! I really fucked this up.” She leaned against her car, burying her face in her hands.

 

“I mean, sure, this could have gone a bit better, but knowing Agatha, eh, not by much. The Chili’s parking lot was a good touch though, gave a nice backdrop for the drama. Which, if you’re planning to stick around, you should get used to.” He reassured her. 

 

“You really think I should go?” She asked

 

“Absolutely!” He hiccuped “Because I’m not paying for an uber.” He wrapped his arm around her shoulder, pulling her into his side. “Despite everything that just happened I do think you’re good for her. I don’t think I’ve seen her this happy in years!”

 

“Really?” she huffed as she cracked a smile.

 

“Definitely! Though, not to say this couldn’t change things, this was… a lot. Just, take it easy, give her some time.” He released her and walked around to her passenger door. 

 

She chuckled as she went to unlock her doors. “You know this means you’re going to be a dad, technically.” she said as she slid into the driver's seat. 

 

“Huh, I honestly hadn’t considered that until this moment.” he grimaced at the thought as he closed the door behind him. 

 

—---------------------------------------------

 

Agatha laid back against the cold, hard, exam room table, the paper crinkled beneath her as she shifted her weight nervously. Jen was out in the hallway chatting with the doctor she had called to meet them. Dr. Victoria Allen, a slight woman with dirty blonde hair and large green glasses. She had greeted them with a calm warm voice and gentle smile though she didn’t entirely understand the context of what was happening at the time. She and Jen had another nurse get her set up in the room while Jen filled her in and they discussed a course of action. 

 

In the waiting silence Agatha couldn’t help but reflect on everything that had led up to this moment. The years she and Ralph had tried with nothing working. Finally giving up and accepting it wasn’t meant for her. Starting to move on, finding Rio, feeling love and hope for the first time since Wanda. Rio’s odd behavior in Boston and the following week and now knowing why. It just didn’t feel real, any of it. It had been months since she and Ralph had their final attempt, could she really be that far along? Until she could see it for herself, it still seemed impossible. She grazed a hand across her stomach feeling the small rise of her abdomen. She had had meals that left her feeling more pregnant than this. Before she could spiral further into denial the door handle clicked. She sat up suddenly, her heart racing, as Jen peeked her head in. 

 

“Hey, you want me in here for this, or…” Jen asked calmly

 

“Yes!” Agatha replied before she could finish the sentence. “Please, stay.” Her eyes gleamed with fear and trepidation. She couldn’t do this alone.

 

“Of course!” Jen nodded reassuringly as she and Dr. Allen entered the room.

 

“Hey, Agatha! Nice to see you again.” Vicky lilted as she reached out and shook Agatha’s hand. “Jen tells me you’ve had quite the surprise today!” 

 

Agatha grimaced at the carefully chosen words. “You could say that!” She breathed nervously, glancing at Jen, who gave her a reassuring half smile.

 

“Well, why don’t we take a look and see what’s going on? I’ll have you lay back and lift your shirt up a bit for me.” Dr. Allen took a napkin and tucked it into the waistband of her pants before squirting a sizable amount of ultrasound jelly right above. She turned off the lights and turned on the machine, grabbing the wand. Agatha took a breath as her heart pounded in her chest. She could feel the tingling numbness of her nervousness engulf her body as she did her best to remain calm. Jen moved to stand behind Vicky, resting her hand on Agatha’s knee for support. 

 

As the wand pressed into her stomach she pulled her head back to stare at the ceiling, none of this felt real. For a moment she hovered in the limbo of not knowing until she felt Jen squeeze her knee as she sucked in a gasp. Agatha chanced a glance down to find Jen’s eyes wide with her hand over her mouth in shock as she stared at the screen. Agatha snapped her head back up as she felt her face getting red with panic. This wasn’t happening. How could this be happening? She could feel the tears once again stinging her eyes as drops began to fall from the far corners. 

 

“So…” Vicky started “I’m not going to keep you in suspense. There is definitely a baby in there.” She turned the screen to face Agatha revealing the tiny profile of the being inside her, a tiny hand pressed up against their cheek. 

 

As soon as Agatha caught sight of the fully formed baby her sobs broke free as she clasped her hands over her mouth in disbelief. How? How was this possible? How had she not known? How had she not realized? Immediately fear gripped her, “Is…is everything ok? Is the baby ok?” She choked out through sobs. 

 

“So far so good. Ten fingers, ten toes. We’re moving around a bit. I’d say we’re a good size for 20-22 weeks? Does that sound right?” Dr. Allen asked. Agatha nodded her head, unable to speak further. “Let’s get a check on that heartbeat.” A few clicks later and the whooshing sound of the baby’s heartbeat was echoing throughout the room. “That’s what we like to hear, nice, strong heartbeat.” Agatha’s sobbing intensified at the sound. The baby was real, and alive, and she hadn’t known. Guilt flowed into every crack this news had created. What had she done? What was she going to do now? In an instant everything about her life had just changed.

 

Jen moved to grab some tissues, handing them to Agatha and taking a few for herself at that point. Dr. Allen moved to turn off the machine and clean the goo off Agatha’s stomach. “I’m sorry, I know this probably wasn’t how you expected your day to turn out. This is definitely a lot to take in. I do want to give you some reassurance that everything looks alright so far, I don’t have any immediate concerns as of yet. However, since we’re just finding out about this little one now, I definitely want to go ahead and run some blood tests. Given how far along you are we would be able to do an anatomy scan as well, make sure everything is developing properly.  I do have to run and check on a patient, but as long as that goes well I should have time, if you’re up for it. I know today has been a long day.”

 

“I…yes, whatever we need to do.” She cried.  “I need to make sure everything’s ok!” She breathed shakily before looking back to Jen as she sat up. 

 

“Great! I’ll send in Elena to take the blood work and I’ll be back before long. Jen I’ll text you if I get held up but I should see you both again in about 45 mins.” she said then quickly headed out the door. 




Agatha leaned forward, resting her elbows on her knees and hanging her head in her hands. “Jen! What the fuck?!” she groaned through her fingers.

 

“You’re telling me! Agatha! What the fuck?!” Jen sighed, exasperatedly, clearing away the last of her own tears. 

 

“I didn’t know! Jen! I didn’t know!” She shook her head raising it to find Jen’s disconcerting stare. 

 

“I know.” Jen hummed reassuringly

 

“What if there’s something wrong? What if I did something to hurt the baby because I didn’t know? For fuck’s sake, I drank nearly a whole bottle of wine earlier this week!” She let out a gasping sigh, “I don’t know if I’ll ever be able to forgive myself!” Her chest shuddered at the thought as her eyes once again misted with tears. Her breathing came in short quick bursts as panic pressed in on her chest. 

 

“Hey! Hey!” Jen rushed forward, capturing her in a hug. “You heard her, everything looks alright so far. I’m sure it’ll be fine! Vicky’s amazing! She’s going to take great care of you both no matter what.” She leaned back brushing a few hairs away from her face. “You’d be surprised how resilient they can be. And this one? Stubborn, a fighter, knows how to make a dramatic appearance. Definitely your kid!” 

 

At that she let out a small laugh, “You really think it’s going to be ok?” She sighed shakily. 

 

“So far so good. Besides, you have an awesome team. There's a whole group out there waiting to make sure you’re ok. This kid’s going to have so many people who love and adore them.” Jen reached over, grabbing a few more tissues for her.

 

“Shit Rio, what am I going to do about Rio?” She gasped, realizing she was one of the people waiting for her. 

 

“Well, what do you want to do about Rio?” Jen asked, crossing her arms and leaning against the counter. 

 

“I have no clue! Trying to think about this and that right now is a little overwhelming.” she admitted, still trying to come to grips with her new reality. 

 

“Then don’t. Focus on this. If Rio really wants this like she claims she does, she’ll wait until you’re ready.” Jen advised.

 

Agatha nodded as she looked back down at her stomach, her hand lazily rubbing circles where the wand had been. She was petrified, intimidated by the future now before her, though a small part of her glowed at the thought, it had worked. Somehow it had worked. She closed her eyes and took a deep breath willing her body to ease into a calm it was struggling to find. 

 

“Agatha?” Jen asked carefully. 

 

“Hmm?” She hummed in reply as her eyes cracked open to look at Jen.

 

“Why didn’t you tell me?” Jen muttered through a half apologetic smile. 

 

Agatha took a deep sigh before replying. “I…uh…didn’t want to worry you.” She laughed at that thought now. 

 

“What?” Jen snickered, bemused.

 

“Yeah, after everything with Wanda and the miscarriage, you really picked up the pieces. I was a mess, I know it wasn’t easy, and I took a lot out of you. I didn't think it would be fair to drag you through what was bound to be another disaster if I didn’t have to. Look how that turned out! I still managed to drown you in my bullshit.” Agatha looked at Jen with guilt ridden eyes.

 

“Agatha, while I appreciate the sentiment, I know what I signed up for. Being your friend comes with disaster and drama around every corner. You are a mess and while it may be exhausting at times I wouldn’t trade it for anything. So thank you, but loop me in the next time you’re trying to have a kid!” She joked “It’s kind of my thing and I give great advice.” Jen smirked with a smug look on her face.

 

“Oh believe me I know! Don’t be surprised if I call you everyday with questions.” She let a smile crack at the corner of her lips. 

 

“You gonna let me in the delivery room at least? I think I’ve earned it at this point.” Jen added pointedly.

 

“You think I’m going to push a human out of my body and not have you there to talk me through it? Please, you’re putting together my birth plan.” Agatha managed a laugh at that, encouraging a chortle from Jen at the thought.

 

“Damn, you’re really having a baby!” Jen exclaimed, still dumbfounded. 

 

“I am really having a baby! Fuck me!” She collapsed back onto the table, laughing at the absurdity of the situation, just as Elena knocked and entered for the blood tests. 

 

“You ok if I go out and check on the others?” Jen asked as she headed toward the door. Agatha nodded as the nurse prepped her to take blood. “You cool if I tell them? They’re going to want an update.” Jen asked

 

“Saves me the trouble of having to do it.” Agatha sighed, feeling the weight of that burden dissipate from her shoulders.

 

“You want anyone else back here?” She thought to check as her hand was on the doorknob.

 

Agatha shook her head. “I’ll catch Ralph at home. Rio, I…I just...” She swallowed, feeling a lump in her throat. “I just need some time.” She choked out. 

 

“I understand. I’ll be back in time for the scan.” She said as she headed out to the lobby. 

 

————————————————

 

Alice sat in the waiting room, flipping through a Highlights magazine as Rio and Ralph skittered in with Agatha’s things in hand. 

 

“Hey! Any news?” Rio asked, rushing to her with Agatha’s things in her hands.  

 

“No, nothing yet. Jen’s been back there with her for a while. I was thinking about running to grab a snack. I didn’t get to eat much of the food we ordered.” Alice admitted.

 

“Don’t worry I got everything to-go!” Ralph exclaimed as he swung the bag of food around to sit on a table nearby. 

 

“You’re kidding!” Alice snickered as Ralph sorted through their leftovers.

 

“Absolutely! There was no way I was going to let them just throw this away!” He opened a clamshell container and began stuffing his face with french fries.  “How much longer do you think it’s gonna be?” 

 

“Depends,” Rio shrugged as she joined them at the table. “They’ll probably have to run a bunch of tests and stuff.” She hung her head, rubbing her eyes with the palms of her hands, before she stared up at the other two in awe. 

 

“How can you eat at a time like this?” Rio asked incredulously, seeing the other two tucking into the food. 

 

“Sorry but I am starving!” Alice admitted

 

“Eh, either she’s pregnant or not, nothing I can do about it now. I’ve already fulfilled my duties.” Ralph explained through a mouthful of chicken.

 

Rio laughed at their nonchalance “You gonna be this calm when she’s pushing the kid out?” she asked

 

“ If she ends up pushing out a kid, I’ll be in the same spot I’m in right now. Patiently waiting in the waiting room, probably eating something then too.” he shrugged

 

“And what if she has it at the house?” Rio asked, curious.

 

Ralph wrinkled his nose in disgust. “Ew, why would she do that?” 

 

“Things happen. Babies have their own timing. Some people prefer it actually.” She explained.

 

“Ugh! Hopefully, I’ll be cruising somewhere tropical if that’s the case.” He groaned before taking another bite of chicken.

 

“You’d really miss the birth of your child?” Rio asked, stunned. 

 

“I know that kid has my DNA but it’s never been mine. I’m more of a gay uncle if anything. I'm happy to teach them how to misbehave, get on their mothers nerves, and take them on expensive vacations when they get their heart broken. Parenting, that’s all Agatha.” He swallowed the bite he was chewing and looked at Rio. “Maybe you too? Did you want kids?” 

 

Rio chuckled at the thought. “I considered it but never thought I’d meet the right person to have them with. When I found out she was pregnant I was scared, sure, but I thought about what it might look like with her. I’ve never wanted anything more in my life.” She gave him a half smile as her eyes misted with tears. 

 

“Well looks like we’re about to find out if your dream is coming true. Here comes Jen.” Ralph nodded, prompting everyone to turn and find Jen walking towards them, arms and eyebrows raised as she shook her head in disbelief. 

 

“Well?” Rio asked anxiously as they rose to meet Jen. 

 

“Oh she’s pregnant alright! Congrats daddy!” She nudged Ralph on the shoulder

 

“Ok we’re gonna squash that right now! Gunkle Ralph, if you please!” Ralph exclaimed 

 

“How’s she doing? Is everything alright? Is the baby ok?” Rio questioned in a panic.

 

“She’s clearly shaken up, definitely in shock, but so far everything looks alright. They're running some blood tests now and Vicky says she has time to do the anatomy scan so I’m going to stick around for that.” Jen explained as she nodded in apology to Alice.

 

“Is she up to seeing anyone?” Rio asked timidly. 

 

Jen shook her head. “This has been a lot. I’m sure she just needs time to process everything.”

 

“Yeah, yeah of course.” Rio breathed, though her eyes shimmered with the weight of disappointment. “I…uh…I’m gonna get out of here then, I guess.” She sniffled as she started to gather her things. 

 

“Of course.” Jen murmured, as she watched Rio try to hold herself together. “I have your number so I’ll keep you updated.” she offered in solace. 

 

“I appreciate that!” Rio flashed her a teary smile. “Here’s Agatha’s stuff. Ralph, you staying here or am I taking you back to your car?” 

 

“Ooo, any chance you’d take me to the house? I don’t want to be here but I probably shouldn’t drive yet.” He grimaced in apology.

 

“Yeah, can do.” Rio chuckled under her breath. “I’ll see you around I guess?” 

 

Jen nodded as she and Alice waved them off.

 

“I better get back there and see how things are going. You going to hang around here or head out?” Jen asked

 

Alice shrugged, “I’ll hang out until you two are done. Someone’s gotta take you back.” She flashed Jen a sympathetic smile. 

 

“You’re the best!” Jen leaned in pressing a soft affectionate kiss to Alice’s lips. “You’d tell me if you found out I was pregnant right?” She asked jokingly.

 

“Is there any chance of that?” Alice giggled, eyebrows raised.

 

“Absolutely zero! This would only happen to Agatha!” She let out a small laugh before planting another quick kiss on her lips. “Alright, we’ll be out before long.” She said as she turned to head back to Agatha’s room. 

 

—————————————————-



A few hours later, after running all possible tests, Agatha, followed by Jen and Alice, crossed the threshold of her home. Ralph jumped up from the couch, switching off the reality show he was watching, to greet them. “So? How we feeling, mama?” 

 

Agatha rolled her eyes to glare at him. “Exhausted!” She said as she dropped her things and immediately collapsed onto the couch with a groan.

 

“How’d everything go?” He asked, looking to Jen. 

 

“Apparently, baby is happy and healthy! No issues or abnormalities. Agatha on the other hand, what’d they say?” She asked, half amused as she already knew the answer.

 

“Dehydrated, high blood pressure, low blood sugar. I’m slightly low on amniotic fluid but if I fix the dehydration that should help the rest.” She droned from the couch, resting a hand on her forehead.   

 

“They gave her some fluids before we left for good measure.” Jen explained.

 

“So, when do we get to meet the little gremlin?” Ralph asked excitedly

 

“Due date is June 2nd?” Jen said as she looked to Agatha who shot a thumbs up from the couch. 

 

“Excellent! And do we know what we’re having?” Ralph was positively buzzing as he tapped his fingers along the countertop. 

 

Jen looked to Agatha to let her take the lead as she sat up a bit on the couch to further join the conversation. “Not sure why you’re holding back now. Are we really keeping it a surprise after everything?” She scoffed at Jen. 

 

“I wasn’t sure if you cared.” Jen shrugged.

 

“At this point no! I’m just glad he’s healthy.” Agatha sighed as she laid back down on the couch.

 

“He? Him? It’s a boy?” Ralph cried giddily

 

“Yes, it’s a boy.” Agatha confirmed

 

“Hell yeah! A little Ralph Jr!” He shouted

 

“Oh absolutely not!” Agatha scoffed as she sat bolt upright on the couch. 

 

“I thought you said you weren’t the father!” Jen smirked 

 

“I mean no, but come on it just makes sense. He’s going to drive you just as crazy as I do!” He chuckled as he pointed to Agatha. 

 

“He already has with all the drama he’s put me through! Gods, what a mess! I have to figure out how to tell work, I have half the time I should to get ready for him, and then of course I’m going to give birth in, what, 4 months?!” She slumped back down into the couch pressing her palms against her eyes. 

 

“Work will just have to deal with it, are you planning to go in tomorrow?” Jen asked

 

“I have to! We have this stupid dress rehearsal on Saturday that I’m still pulling together. They want to do a lunch beforehand for whatever reason.” She rolled her eyes in frustration. Of course all of this had to happen now. 

 

“Anyone you can delegate that to? Might want to take it easy this weekend.” Alice asked concernedly

 

“I’ll be fine. I’d rather try and stick to my regular schedule as much as possible. There’s a lot I have to start putting into place if I’m going to be on leave by summer. I’ll just have to make time to meet with HR tomorrow.” She sighed, dreading the several conversations and questions she was bound to face. 

 

“Ok, just make sure you don’t overdo it. As for baby stuff, we’ve got you covered. I started putting together a list when they hooked you up to the IV. I’ll send it to you now.” Jen offered as she pulled out her phone.

 

“You know this means you’re being evicted.” Agatha chuckled at Ralph. 

 

“Listen, I’ll gladly relinquish my squatters rights to the little guy.” Ralph said gleefully

 

“Does that mean you’ll help me move all your shit out of the room before you leave for your contract?” Agatha questioned.

 

“I may even be persuaded to help paint if we get there in time!” He beamed at her.

 

“I’m gonna hold you to that!” She smirked, pointing at him warningly. 

 

“I’m gonna head to the bathroom then you good to head out?” Jen asked, turning to Alice.

 

“Yeah, sounds good!” Alice hummed as she pressed a quick kiss to Jen’s lips before watching her walk away with heart filled eyes. 

 

Agatha and Ralph exchanged knowing looks. “You two seem to have really hit it off!” Ralph commented once Jen was out of earshot. 

 

Alice blushed before turning to him. “Yeah, I’ve actually been thinking about asking her to move in with me.” She admitted.

 

The two gasped in unison, pleasantly surprised. “Oh my gosh! When?!” Shrieked Ralph

 

“Well her birthday is coming up at the end of the month. I thought it could be part of her present?” 

 

“Have you two talked about it?” Agatha asked, thrilled to have something to talk about besides her issues. 

 

“A few times, but I think it would still be a surprise. Do you think it’s a bad idea?” Alice looked back with questioning eyes. 

 

“No!” They shouted unanimously “She’s going to be thrilled to get out of that box she calls an apartment!” Agatha chuckled before Jen’s voice rang out from the hallway. “Agatha!” 

 

“What?!” She screeched back

 

“Don’t tell me these were the tests you were using.” Jen stormed down the hallway, throwing the box in Agatha’s lap. 

 

“Ouch! Yes, what of it?” she said as she picked up the box.

 

“They’re fucking expired!” Jen growled as she rolled her eyes.

 

“Oh, they expire?” She said, examining the package.

 

“Unbelievable!” Jen huffed sardonically as she took Alice by the hand and headed for the door.  “I swear, if you weren’t pregnant right now I’d slap you for your stupidity!” 

 

“Love you too Jen!” She called as she waved them both out. 




As soon as the door shut a heavy silence rested in the air. Agatha sat, contemplating the events of the day, still trying to settle herself in the reality she hadn’t woken up to this morning. Ralph, seeing her withdraw into herself, glided over to join her on the couch. 

 

“Hey, wanna tell me what you’re thinking?” He said as she nudged her with his toes. 

 

She tore her eyes from the fuzzy haze of the coffee table she had been zoning out at to gaze at Ralph. “I’m still trying to put together how fucked up my life has become in the last, what, six hours?” She groaned as she pressed her face into her palms. “Why me?! Why does it feel like as soon as everything in my life is about to come together it all blows up in my face? How am I going to do this? Any of it?” 

 

“Just take it one day at a time. You'll figure it out, most do, eventually.” He shrugged

 

“Oh, very helpful! WOW! That really solved all my problems!” She bit back sarcastically “My mother sure didn’t figure it the fuck out.” she scoffed under her breath. 

 

“Agatha, you're not your mother. Far from it!” Ralph scolded her

 

“That doesn’t mean I’m not going to fuck him up just as bad! I have no clue what I’m doing!” She let out a frustrated sigh.

 

He chuckled to himself. “You might be surprised by this but I don’t think anyone does. Everyone’s out here just kind of winging it.” 

 

She rolled her eyes at that thought. “You may be over-generalizing based on your own personal experiences.” 

 

“Ok, I’ll admit, winging it may be my specialty, but you should know better than anyone that life throws you curveballs.” He offered pointedly

 

“I’d say this is a bit more than a curveball.” She bit back

 

“So, the timing and circumstances aren’t ideal per-se, but I know you. I know how long you’ve wanted this.” he urged.

 

“I did, I do! It’s just…” she struggled to explain.

 

“Just what?”

 

“I never expected it to go like this! When we first talked about doing this…I don’t know…I think a large part of me was just trying to get back what I had when Wanda was here.” She felt an ache in her heart at the admission. “With her I felt like I finally had a family, I had someone I loved who truly loved me back. The child I lost then was just an expansion of that love.” She admitted, feeling the weight of that truth sink deep into her bones. “When we tried again and it didn’t work I was disappointed but not surprised. I don’t think my heart was really in it. I don’t know why I kept trying or why I even tried for so long? I think I was just holding onto that hope, maybe I could feel that way again one day.” Her eyes strained as they tried to shed tears that would no longer come. “And then, I never expected I’d find Rio. The way she made me feel…like life was worth living again. That I was worth loving.” She ghosted a smile before letting out a shuddering sigh. “After today, I don’t know…it feels broken. I don’t know how to trust her, or myself at this point. This is all so utterly fucked! I feel like I’ve lost the love I never thought could be possible over the child I’ve always wanted but had accepted I’d never have.” She looked back to Ralph as if pleading for some relief. 

 

“That doesn’t have to be the case, Agatha. You haven’t lost anything. Not unless you want to.” He shrugged seeing the conflict in her eyes. 

 

“I just keep thinking about how furious I am at her, at how everything was handled. She couldn’t just talk to me. She had to go hunt you three down to figure out how to tell me. It feels like she hid everything from me, she was practically lying to my face. And that’s not even mentioning HOW she found out. I don’t even know where to begin with that!” She slumped against the back of the couch.

 

“Completely fair, though, you have to admit this is a pretty unique situation you’ve found yourselves in.” He reminded her cautiously. 

 

“Exactly! Which makes everything more difficult. I’m mad at her but I can’t fault her completely, look at me! I’m fucking pregnant and had no idea. If she hadn’t said anything, who knows how long it would have taken me to realize? Clearly it wasn’t even on my radar even with all the symptoms I was experiencing. This is all my fault! I’m the one who put us in this position in the first place. Unknowingly, but still.” 

 

“Come on, you can’t look at it like that!” He urged.

 

“But it’s true! I fucked my life up bad enough that we both torpedoed this relationship. It was probably doomed from the start. Now the idea of being a single parent is crushingly real and I don’t know if I can do it. How can I? I’m already failing him!” She whimpered as her lip quivered. 

 

“Oh, honey! You’re not failing him! You didn’t know!” He reached over, taking her hands in his. “Do you remember what I said to you when I agreed to do this?” 

 

She let out a soft chuckle, “Do you?” 

 

He shrugged, “Most of it, no, but I remember this because I meant it. You are going to be an amazing mother!” He squeezed her hands in reassurance as a smile broke out across his face. 

 

“You really think so?” she hummed doubtfully.

 

“Oh I know so! You are brilliant, resilient, and you are going to love the shit out of that kid! And he has an uncle and a couple aunts that are going to spoil him silly. You’re not alone.” He moved closer, throwing his arms around her shoulders. “Give yourself time. Focus on yourself, and the little guy. If you decide Rio is important enough to include in that life then I’m sure you two will find a way to make things work.” 

 

She sighed, releasing the tension thinking about Rio had brought, even if it was only temporary. “Ugh, you’re right I have enough on my plate right now.”

 

“Speaking of plates, did you ever eat dinner?” Ralph asked

 

“No, there was so much going on, I couldn’t even think about being hungry.” She admitted

 

“Alright, then I’m fixing you something to eat. Anything you’re craving?”  

 

“Now that you mention it I could eat an Everest sized mountain of pasta.” She snorted.

 

“Done!” 

 

Ralph prepared the largest bowl of pasta he could as they sat and thought about all the change that was in store. There was no talk of the fear, drama, or uncertainty that still lay ahead. Instead they pondered which features the baby might inherit. Ralph threw out some potential names, all of which Agatha shot down immediately. They scanned the list Jen had sent, seeing a few items had already been marked off. By the time she was finished and ready to turn in for the night they had even figured out what color to paint Ralph’s room. As she wound down she even let herself dream, if just for tonight, of all the good things to come. Tiny hands wrapped around her fingers, first steps and first words, little laughs and big messes. Things she had waited years for and now were just below her fingertips as she settled her hand on the swell of her stomach and drifted off to sleep.

Chapter End Notes

What do we think? Did it live up to your expectations? There's still lots more to come, don't worry.

Huge thank you to everyone who's left Kudos - really truly appreciate all the love on this. It's the first thing I've ever written so thank you - glad you're enjoying it.

To those of you who've left comments, especially if you've left more than one comment - you have my soul and I hope each and everyone of you has the best day ever.

Chapter 18: The Next Day

Chapter Summary

Agatha struggles to accept her new reality as she goes back to work immediately.

Chapter Notes

Thank you for your patience! I have mixed feelings about this chapter. This is like the 3rd version and I'm finally happy with it so I'm curious to hear what you think.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The next morning she awoke in a haze. The world around her moved in its ever familiar cycles, the sun still rose, its light peeking through the curtains. Scratchy still woke her with his insistent kneading demanding his breakfast. Yet, as consciousness washed over her, she was all too aware of the life altering shift of the day before. She pulled herself from beneath the cocoon of blankets and rested on the edge of her bed feeling exhaustion and an aching heaviness settle in her body. She glanced down at her stomach, the oversized t-shirt she slept in draped down, hiding any indication of the discovery the day before. She guided her hand beneath the hem to rest on the small swell she half expected not to be there. She felt a flutter dance beneath where she rested her hand. It was real. She could feel a cold rush of fear pour down her spine. She quickly rose from the bed, rushing into her bathroom and flipping on the light. She drew her shirt up, examining herself closely in the mirror. As she turned to the side her heart stuttered and she breathed out a soft whimper. Staring at her figure in the mirror she struggled to reconcile the image before her. She was looking at the same form she had always lived with but it was as if only now was she seeing the marks of her condition. The heaviness in her breast, the swell of her feet, the slight protrusion beneath her navel that only the day before had she thought might be a gluten intolerance. But now, as the flutter hummed just beneath her fingertips, it was a crushing reminder of the reality she now lived in. 

 

She looked up into her own eyes, catching worry and fear pooling at the corners. Before she could spiral further into self-loathing she dropped her shirt and brushed away the wetness from her eyes. She couldn’t afford to dwell on the pain and regret now tightening around her heart. She had to bury it deep before she was crushed under the weight of her grief of what was lost and what was yet to come. 

 

As she removed her clothes and tied up her hair she turned on the shower as cold as it could get. Agatha thrust herself under the water hoping the shock would bring her back into this body that now felt so foreign. As the icy water cascaded down it began to settle the panic that had taken root in her chest, though it did nothing to help her feel at home in herself again. Instead she was awash with a dull numbness like the shell of the person she was the day before. Her body continued to move about getting ready as if on autopilot, motioning through the beats of her morning routine. She ran her fingers through her damp hair as she squeezed into a pair of maroon wide leg trousers and a black turtleneck top. She threw on a matching blazer, and took one final look at the stranger in the mirror before heading into the kitchen. As she rounded the corner she caught sight of Ralph, surprisingly awake, and cooking something on the stove as he danced around jovially, oblivious to her arrival. 

 

She sidled up next to him, grabbing the loaf of bread and stuffing a piece in the toaster. Ralph leaned over with a smirk, immediately popping the bread right back out. “I don’t think coffee and a piece of toast is gonna cut it anymore. Go sit down.” He gestured to the island. 

 

Agatha scrunched her eyebrows as a smile tugged at the corner of her lips. She thought for a moment of defiantly resetting the toaster but couldn’t find the energy to summon her usual attitude and instead obliged the order. 

 

“So, how we feeling?” Ralph questioned as he fumbled with what looked like an omelette. 

 

“Fine.” Agatha croaked not intending to engage in further conversation. She had no desire to sift through the maelstrom of emotions threatening to drown her before facing what would likely be a difficult day. Ralph abandoned the food on the stove to set a mug in front of her. She looked down into the nearly translucent contents and frowned, “This is not coffee, what is this?” 

 

“Ginger tea. It should help with your stomach.” He explained as he slid her a bowl of fruit. 

 

“Where did this come from? I don’t remember having any of this.” She asked as she took a disappointed sip of the tea. 

 

“Oh…yeah…um, Rio and I stopped at the store on the way home. ” 

 

Agatha felt a jolt of fear rush through her at the mention of Rio, like lemon juice dripping into a fresh cut. “How thoughtful” she offered, doing her best to sound uninterested. 

 

“Honestly I’m glad she suggested it, we had like no food in the house. I was completely out of my protein bars. She helped me pick out a bunch of food and vitamins and shit for you and the baby.” Ralph prattled as if talking about the weather. 

 

“Oh really?” Agatha replied, fighting to bury the thoughts of Rio in the corners of her mind. 

 

“Yeah, and she made sure I knew what things to avoid, obviously no more drinking, limit your caffeine intake, something about soft cheeses and deli meats. Oh she shut me down for tinned fish night! Said it probably wasn’t a good idea now with the baby.” 

 

“Oh darn! Not the tinned fish night!” She let a breath of a laugh slip, amused at the small victory as she took a bite of the fruit.

 

“Listen, you don’t know what you’re missing!” He said as he sat down the plate in front of her. “Bon appetit!” 

 

She glanced down at the reasonably edible looking omelette before glaring back at Ralph suspiciously “Why?”

 

“Why what?” Ralph asked in complete confusion. 

 

“Why did you do this? Why are you even up right now?” She asked, irked by his convivial nature, as if oblivious to the fact that her life had shattered before her once again. 

 

His face dropped but he didn’t release his amiable demeanor. “Honey, please, yesterday was…a lot, I wasn’t going to let you walk out of here and head to work without checking in. And I figured, since I knocked you up, I could start pulling my weight around here, make sure you and Clyde are taken care of.” 

 

She nearly choked on the bite of fruit she had taken. “First off, gross, don’t go around telling people you knocked me up ! And Second, I’m not naming the baby Clyde!” She spat, bubbling with irritation.

 

“Damn, really? I thought I might have had something there.” He winked and gave her a sarcastic smile which managed to pull a laugh from her lungs.

 

“Absolutely not!” She stared down at the meal for a moment before reluctantly taking a bite. Though she wasn’t hungry she knew Ralph was right, she didn’t really have a choice. 

 

Ralph stood at the end of the island, taking a few bites of his breakfast before asking, “So are you going to tell me how you’re really doing, or are you going to make me guess?”

 

She let out a heavy sigh, annoyed at the question. “What do you want me to say? It feels like everything’s gone to shit but it’s not like I can do anything about it. I’m just going to try to get through today.” She groaned as she forced herself to eat another bite of the eggs.

 

“That great huh. You sure you want to go in today?” Ralph cringed, eyeing her concernedly

 

“What? So I can sit around here wallowing in self pity at my own stupidity instead?” Agatha half shouted as she threw down her fork. “No thank you. I need to at least pretend like my life isn’t completely falling apart so I don’t launch myself over the nearest bridge. Besides, I need to figure out maternity leave, and who’s going to cover me, and decide how and when I’m going to tell people.” Her mind raced at the growing list of things she would have to deal with and figure out before the baby arrived. She felt a shiver run down her spine at that thought; the baby’s arrival, her baby’s arrival. “And it all just feels like I’m living in some weird nightmare that I can’t wake up from.” her voice broke as she uttered the last statement. She swallowed hard, forcing the flurry of emotions to settle deep within her as she returned to her food.

 

“None of that stuff has to happen today, if you’re not ready.” He reminded her, comfortingly.

 

She shook her head as she speared another bite of egg. “What, and wait until I’m the size of a beached whale? I think they’re going to figure it out sooner rather than later. At the very least I need to set up a meeting with HR, get some semblance of a plan together so I don’t feel like I’m going at this blind.” 

 

“I mean, go for it, if you think it’ll help. Just try not to stress yourself out about it. Rio mentioned stress is also bad for the baby.” He explained in earnest. 

 

She glared at him for being so insensible, “No shit, I’ll try to keep that in mind.” She stood from the stool having finished the last of her eggs, and straightened out her clothes. “Do I look as wrecked as I feel?” She asked, turning for him to get a glimpse of the full outfit. 

 

He hummed, contemplating his analysis. “It’s giving, I may be dead inside but I can still pull it together on the outside. You look fabulous.”

 

“Thanks for the endorsement.” She huffed, rolling her eyes as she picked up her work bag. “Well, wish me luck I guess.”

 

“Good luck, mama! You got this!” Ralph called after her as she headed out the door. 

 

————————————————

 

As she walked through the doors of Music Hall her heart was nearly beating out of her chest with anxiety. She did her best to hide this distress with a mask of confidence and determination. It’s not that she was afraid to talk with HR, or for anyone at work to find out, but the moment they did it made everything that more real. She took a breath as she headed through the lobby, trying to calm herself as she felt a flutter just behind her belly button. As she crossed to the administrative corridor she caught Sharon flittering down the hallway in a panic.

 

“Jeeze! Mrs. Hart! What’s the rush?” Agatha asked as she stopped her in her path. 

 

“It’s Freddy, I haven’t had a chance to sit down since I got in. He’s got me running out to get the programs he had me reprint for tomorrow. He convinced the art department to redo the artwork on the front page, again.” She explained, clearly flustered. 

 

“Why? We got everything aligned yesterday. Besides, doesn’t he have an intern for that?” Agatha questioned dismissively. She had no patience for Freddy’s incompetence today. 

 

“Apparently she’s called in sick again so he asked me.” Sharon explained

 

“Don’t bother, you’re not his assistant! If he wants it he can do it himself. Besides, I have something more important I need you to do.” She said as she started to lead her back down the hallway.

 

“Oh, right, you probably need a coffee before you head in there.” Sharon guessed as she turned to go fetch it. 

 

“No, actually, trying to cut back.” She said as she moved to block her exit. “Could you get me a copy of our company leave policies?” She asked as she turned Sharon around to lead her back towards her office. 

 

“Leave policies?” Sharon shouted back, to which a few heads turned. 

 

Agatha flashed a dismissive half smile as she hurried them both down the hallway, “Yes, leave policies. Can you do that for me? Discreetly?” she asked in a hushed tone.

 

“Well I’ll probably have to reach out to HR, I don’t have them on hand.” Sharon explained nervously, as Agatha guided them through the threshold of her office, closing the door behind them.

 

“That’s fine, while you’re at it can you set up a meeting for me to talk with them, as soon as possible?” Agatha requested, rounding her desk to sort through the papers strewn about there. 

 

“Yes.” Sharon replied, suspicious of the request but too intimidated to ask more about it. 

 

Agatha looked over a few vendor contracts and the new program mockup Freddy had designed before glancing up to find Sharon still standing there, “Are you going to set up that meeting or is there something you need?” Agatha asked, as she sat down to check her email. 

 

“Oh, yes actually, now that you mention it...” Sharon busseled out the door for a brief moment only to return carrying a handful of sticky notes. “The caterer asked to push back your meeting to 12, apparently they’re having issues with the oven?”

 

“Tell them we’ll keep it at the same time, we won’t be tasting anything today.” She answered, not looking up from her computer

 

“Alright, Dr. Jones wanted to see if there was any additional availability for tomorrow, he has some colleagues he would like to bring.” 

 

Agatha’s breath caught in her throat at the request and her eyes launched to Sharon. “Did he specify how many? Or who they might be?” she asked, attempting to feign disinterest.

 

“I didn’t get any details.”  Sharon admitted

 

“Alright, try and get a list of who he wants to bring and I’ll see what I can do.” She wasn’t sure if Rio would be on that list but she didn’t want to risk any further surprises at this point. 

 

“Oh, and Herb asked to meet with you and Freddy this afternoon to start going over details for Mayfest.” she announced excitedly.

 

Fuck! With everything else going on Agatha hadn’t even had Mayfest on her register. It was their month-long kick off to spring that drew in the largest crowds of their entire year. Though the key guests and performances had been agreed to months in advance they still had yet to secure several vendors and Herb was fixated on drawing in larger and larger crowds. It was already destined to be one of the most stressful times of her year, and now, she realized, it had the added benefit of being the month leading up to her due date. Agatha felt a fresh wave of nausea roll through her stomach, and swallowed hard. 

“What…what time is the meeting?” She asked as she fought to keep her breakfast. 

 

“I’m still trying to confirm with Freddy, but it looks like 3:00.” 

 

Agatha sighed, this is the last thing she wanted to deal with today. “Is there any chance of convincing him to push it out?”

 

“Well you know he’s leaving for Prague with Mr. Kaplan on Sunday, he’ll be there for about two weeks. Then he’s going out to visit his mother for a week. He was worried if you waited until he got back you all would be behind.” Sharon explained

 

Agatha closed her eyes, frowning in frustration, “And he couldn’t have figured this out sooner?” Sharon shrugged in apology. Agatha’s heart sank as she realized she would need to tell Herb the news before he left, whether or not she was ready to do so. Given his inconveniently timed hiatus and the demands of Mayfest, she also couldn’t afford to wait. “Fine, just see if you can get me some time with him too, either before or after.” 

 

“Absolutely.” Sharon replied. “You sure I can’t get you a coffee or something?” She offered, seeing Agatha’s exhausted frustration.

 

Agatha started to deny her offer but another wave of nausea rolled through her stomach. “Actually, can you find me some ginger tea? Or peppermint or something?”

 

“Sure thing, you alright dear?” Sharon asked, seeing her discomfort. 

 

“I’m fine.” Agatha insisted curtly before returning to her work. Sharon nodded skeptically as she headed for the door, only to be pushed back into the room by Freddy.

 

“Hey Sharon! Glad I caught you! Did you get those programs yet?” He asked as he turned and winked at Agatha. 

 

She grimaced as she drew back repulsed by the gesture. “Hey! She’s not your personal gopher.” Agatha barked at him. “What are you doing here Freddy?” 

 

“Well I thought I’d stop by to see if you’d had a chance to check out the new programs?” He asked with a gleeful grin. 

 

Agatha rolled her eyes as she waved Sharon off to complete her tasks. “New programs my ass, I’d take a second look at these if I were you. They appear to be missing information.” She scolded

 

“Is that so?” Freddy laughed as he crossed his arms smugly. 

 

“I’d say omitting our key sponsors from the cover page is a pretty big miss for a donor preview don’t you think?” She scolded

 

“Come on! You know it looks so much better without all their horrendous logos on the front.” 

 

“Did you even mention them in the program?” She asked, flipping through the mockup.

 

“Yes, they’re right there on the back cover.” He grabbed the book from her and flipped to the back page. 

 

“First off, you’ve put them at the bottom of the back inside cover like an afterthought. Second, even I would need a magnifying glass to decipher who they are. These people didn’t give us hundreds of thousands of dollars to be squeezed into the margins at the back. They want their names and businesses prominently displayed so they can give the impression they care about the arts. You want that full time social media manager? Get your head out of your ass and give them the recognition they paid for. Did you even attempt to get Herb’s approval?” 

 

“I’m still waiting on his input.” He admitted

 

Agatha scoffed a laugh at his thoughtlessness. “Yet you had my assistant running out like the building was on fire to get these disasters printed.”

 

“Disasters? We’ll see what Herb has to say.” He retorted defensively

 

“Even if you got these monstrosities approved, you’re not using Sharon to play fetch for you. You have an intern for that.” she goaded knowing the girl was out of commission.

 

“Phoebe is out sick so I asked Sharon, I didn’t think it would be a big deal.” he reasoned

 

Agatha leaned back in her chair, pleased that he took the bait. “Out sick again?” She gave him a mocking pouty face. “That’s the third day this week. Wasn’t she out a few days last week as well? Is she really sick or are you two having a domestic dispute?” She leaned back in her chair with a wicked grin. If there was anything that was going to make her feel an ounce better it was torturing Freddy. 

 

Freddy’s face glowed bright red with anger and embarrassment. “She’s sick, she has the stomach flu or something.” 

 

“For two weeks in a row?” Agatha couldn’t help but laugh incredulously, “That seems…unlikely.” 

 

“Listen, I don’t think it’s any of your business if my intern is out sick.” he spat.

 

“It is when you try and replace her with my assistant!” Agatha chided just as Sharon returned with her tea. 

 

“Sorry, don’t mean to disturb” Sharon apologized as she handed the mug to Agatha. “I did want to let you know, Herb is able to meet with you after the Mayfest meeting and Janet from HR says she has some time at 2:30 today if that works.” 

 

“Yes, that’ll be fine.” Agatha replied as she took a sip of the tea and waved Sharon out again.

 

“HR? Why are you meeting with HR?” Freddy asked as the door closed behind Sharon.

 

“Wouldn’t you like to know!” She replied with a devilish grin. “I’m sure you’ll find out soon enough. I have a meeting to get to.” She grabbed her mug and her computer and breezed past him as his eyes bulged in panic. 





The unbridled joy she had at seeing the horror on his face had distracted her enough from her own situation that she was able to focus easier in her following meetings. She met with finance in a tedious review of the budget and anticipated expenditures before heading off to meet with building management. They walked through the space they planned to use for rehearsal the next day, reviewing set up and the anticipated changes needed for Dr. Jones’s additional guests. By the time they wrapped her feet and back had started to ache and she was glad to head off to her meeting with the caterer. She was hoping that since they had foregone the tasting it would be a quick discussion and she could head off to lunch as she was starting to grow hungry again. Unfortunately the issues with the oven turned out to be more of a hindrance than they had anticipated and they worked through the entire hour discussing alternatives should they not be able to make the repairs in time. As they neared the end of their time together she could feel her stomach beginning to grumble with hunger. This was soon joined by an excited flutter as the minutes ticked nearer and nearer to lunch. She checked the time on her phone, now regretting the fact that they didn’t have something to sample, and was greeted with a call from Sharon. 

 “Yes?” She answered, abruptly cutting off the caterer.

 

“ Hello dear, your friend is here with lunch again. I have her waiting in your office. I thought I should let you know after last time.” 

 

Agatha’s heart was in her throat, Rio was here? After yesterday? After everything? She felt a flash of anxiety pulse throughout her body. She couldn’t tell if she was furious or relieved. “Tell her I’ll be up in a minute.” She decided as she quickly hung up the phone. 

 

“Everything ok?” The caterer asked as Agatha began to collect her things.

 

“Yes…we uh…we’re gonna have to wrap this up, unfortunately. Keep me updated on the repairs, but at this point I couldn’t care less as long as there’s something to eat.” She flashed an unconvincing smile as she rushed past them and out the doors before they could even respond.

 

She stormed through the entryway toward the elevator as her heart pounded in her ears. Her thoughts boomeranged wildly trying to speedrun the emotional obstacle course she had just been thrown into. What the hell is she doing here? Who does she think she is? To just show up now, what could she possibly have to say? She was furious at the audacity of this woman. At how she had known and not said anything. At how she had gone behind her back to talk to her friends. The pain she had caused her and all the worry and anxiety leading up to it. 

She pressed the button for the elevator, her chest tightening as her breathing came in shallow bursts, her mind recalling memories of the night before. Rio’s honey amber eyes heavy with sorrow and fear as she begged Agatha for understanding despite the earth shattering news she had shared. The numb hollowness that consumed her as Jen and Alice drove her to the hospital. The dread and horror and guilt she felt hearing the baby’s heartbeat echo throughout the room. She bit her lip, fighting to stave off the tears collecting in the corners of her eyes. 

Soon the elevator doors dinged and she quickly stepped inside, pressing the button for her floor before leaning back against the wall. She struggled to stifle the eruption of emotion that was threatening to break free from the well deep within her. Yet she knew if she didn’t pull herself together soon she wouldn’t be able to contain the avalanche of devastation that riled below the surface. She closed her eyes and took a deep breath, trying to regain her composure. Why? Why did she have to do this now? Why did she have to show up and press her fingers into such a fresh wound? As Agatha continued to breathe slowly, attempting to calm the storm inside her, she felt a flutter dance just beneath her skin. She glanced down, eyes wide with trepidation, for the baby, for Rio, for her future and all that was yet to come. 

As the elevator announced its arrival she straightened herself up and brushed away the few stray tears that had fallen. She rolled her shoulders back and fixed her face with determination: she would not let whatever lay ahead get the best of her. She sauntered out and down the hallway, breezing by Sharon’s desk as she blasted through her office door, hoping to catch Rio by surprise. Instead she scared the shit out of Jen. 

 

“Agatha! What the fuck?!” Jen shrieked as she jumped up from the couch. 

 

Agatha stumbled back a bit, surprised and confused. “Jen?! What are you doing here?” She screeched in shock.

 

“I'm a good friend who brought you a burrito!” Jen shouted back defensively as she pointed to the food on Agatha’s desk. “What’s your problem?”

 

Agatha rolled her eyes as she took a step out of her office. “Sharon!” She shouted as the woman bounced out of her seat to answer the call. 

 

“Yes dear? Is everything alright?” Sharon asked nervously, having heard the exchange. 

 

“Sharon, this is Jen. Jen, Sharon.” 

 

“Nice to meet you dear.” Sharon smiled and waved

 

“Oh we’ve met, a few times actually.” Jen nodded, a little irritated. 

 

“Good, now that we know each other, in the future can you specify which friend it is that’s dropped by?” Agatha requested pointedly.

 

“Who did you think I was?” Jen asked, eyebrows stitched in amusedly as a smirk tugged at the corner of her mouth. Agatha glared at Jen as she started to direct Sharon back out the door. 

 

“Oh, sorry dear! Did you think it was that dark haired lady? What’s her name? Reba?” Sharon managed to ask on her way out. Jen chuckled as she rolled her eyes and plopped back onto the couch. 

 

“Thank you Sharon that will be all!” Agatha huffed as she closed the door in Sharon’s face and headed straight for the food on her desk.

 

“You’re welcome for lunch by the way!” Jen chided

 

“Did you and Ralph sign up for shifts or something?” she asked, taking a bite of the burrito.

 

“What are you talking about?” Jen asked, scowling at Agatha as she took a bite of her own food. 

 

“Ralph made breakfast this morning, you brought lunch. Is Alice covering dinner?” Agatha half-joked

 

“Not that I’m aware of.” Jen rolled her eyes unamused. “Sorry if we’re a little worried about you.” she snapped facetiously

 

“I’m fine.” Agatha stated plainly

 

“Riiiight…the way you came in here at a ten screams, I’m handling all of this really well .” Jen chided

 

“Obviously I was under the impression I was walking into a completely different situation.” Agatha bit back

 

“No shit! Did you really expected Rio to randomly show up with lunch after last night? You technically broke up with her.” 

 

Agatha took another bite as she felt a twinge of regret prick at the back of her mind. She was angry at Rio, furious even, yet something in her soul still felt tied to this woman. 

 

“Have you heard from her?” Jen asked, eyebrows raised.

 

“No. Though apparently she took Ralph to the store after they left the hospital to buy a bunch of food and shit. Not really sure what that means.” 

 

“It was thoughtful at least.” Jen nodded approvingly. 

 

“Sure, it was literally the least they could do after…everything.” Agatha took another bite of the burrito and sat back in her chair, letting her hand rest on the slight swell of her stomach. 

 

“How are you feeling?” Jen asked, noticing the gesture. 

 

“Why does everybody ask me that?” Agatha sighed, exasperated.

 

“Well considering you just found out you’re well into growing a human I think it’s a logical question.” Jen reasoned

 

“Physically, I feel as awful as I usually do, at least now I know why.” she grumbled

 

“Have you told anyone?” Jen inquired

 

“Not yet, I’m meeting with HR this afternoon then I’m planning to tell Herb after our Mayfest meeting.” She explained

 

“Mayfest? Is that the festival thing you do every year?” Jen asked.

 

“What does it sound like?” Agatha replied condiscendingly

 

“Really? You’re gonna be like that, after I brought you food?” Jen sassed

 

Agatha rolled her eyes and huffed, “Yes it’s that festival thing.” 

 

“You sure you wanna do that this year?” Jen questioned

 

“Please, they can’t afford for me not to! That would leave tweedle-dee and tweedle-dum in charge of running the most profitable month of our season. Absolutely not!” She chuckled 

 

“You do know you’re going to be exceedingly pregnant by May, right?” Jen scolded

 

“That had occurred to me, yes.” She retorted matter-of-factly. Jen raised her eyebrows in judgement as she took another bite of food which helped her to hold her tongue. “Although it sounds miserable, I’ll just have to make it work.” Agatha reasoned seeing Jen’s restraint. 

 

“Girl, you might not have a choice! You’ve been lucky enough as it is considering everything. You have to be careful to not overdo it! You’re not the only one who’s gonna suffer now if you push yourself too hard.” Jen reprimanded. 

 

Agatha gritted her teeth as Jen’s words sunk in. It felt like a low blow but she felt the stink of the harsh truth. That didn’t make it any easier to take. “I’m well aware of that fact, Jennifer.” 

 

Just then Freddy burst through her door erratically. “Your meeting with HR.” He gasped, a little distressed.

 

“Fuck, is everyone like this here?” Jen gasped as Agatha sat there calmly annoyed at the intrusion. 

 

“What of it?” Agatha snapped.

 

“Is this about last week?” He asked, eyes a fury of panic and determination.

 

“You mean when you touched me and I nearly broke your hand for doing so?” Agatha reminded him, eyebrows raised.

 

“The fuck?” Jen huffed under her breath.

 

“Yes, that’s what I’m referring to! It was a pat on the back, I wasn’t being malicious and you know it! You know I can file a counter complaint for what you did to my hand! ” He warned

 

“You’ve really been stewing about that haven’t you!” She grumbled. “Believe it or not, it’s not about that.” She waved dismissively.

 

“Oh” he breathed as his face fell. “It’s…it’s not…this isn’t about Phoebe is it? Agatha…I swear…it’s not…” He trailed off, only now noticing Jen’s presence.

 

“By all means don’t stop on her account! What were you saying about your relationship with the intern? I’ll need to add it to my notes.” She said, pulling out a notebook. 

 

His head snapped back to her in alarm. “You wouldn’t.” 

 

“Try me!” She grinned maliciously 

 

Freddy swallowed hard as the color drained from his face. “I…uh…I have some work to catch up on. Excuse me.” He quickly retreated out of the room slamming the door behind him. 

 

Agatha took another bite of the burrito Jen brought her smiling contentedly. 

 

“What the hell was that about?” Jen asked in disgusted confusion.

 

“Freddy, he’s a thorn in my side but I love to make him sweat. He thinks I’m going to tell HR about the affair he’s been having with his intern. Which I will, at some point, because that’s what he gets for nosing in my business. He’s just lucky I have enough shit going on in my own life that his indiscretions are low on my list of priorities.” 

 

“You’re gonna give that man a stroke.” Jen chuckled.

 

“Only if I’m lucky!” Agatha laughed. 

 

“Well, I have to head into the hospital.” Jen said as she stood and gathered her things. “Please think about what I said, and let me know how everything goes this afternoon.” 

 

“Yes. Goodbye Jen!” Agatha groaned like a petulant teenager as she waved Jen out.





Now alone in the thick silence of her office her mind buzzed. Despite her dismissiveness, Agatha was reeling from the warnings Jen had placed. It had brought everything into focus as she began to prepare for her meetings with Herb and HR. She spent time reviewing the dismal leave policy Sharon had delivered as well as scanning the upcoming calendar to get an idea of any further potential hurdles between now and her delivery. As she noted that upcoming deadline in her calendar a pit began to grow in her stomach. There really wasn’t that much time, even if she managed to make it all the way to her due date. Seeing it now on screen she bit the inside of her cheek, once again swallowing the fact that Jen had been right, Mayfest might not be on the table this year. At least, not at the capacity she was used to and the idea of Freddy and Herb managing on their own had her lunch threatening to crawl back up her throat. Which left the question of who would pick up the slack? For now she added it to the list of things to cover when she talked with Herb. 




Not long before her meeting with HR Sharon knocked on her door, entering cautiously. 

 

“Yes?” Agatha asked, not looking away from her computer. 

 

“I have that list of people from Dr. Jones for tomorrow.” 

 

Agatha’s eyes snapped to Sharon as she threw her hand out. Sharon rushed forward handing over the note. Agatha hurriedly threw on her glasses as her heart began to race. She scanned the list not seeing Rio’s name among the few and was surprised to find a pang of disappointment settle in her chest. She cleared her throat as she directed her attention back to Sharon, “Let him know we’ll be able to accommodate all of them.” She uttered monotonously. 

 

“Will do. Is there anything else you need, honey?” Sharon replied, visibly concerned. As she pondered the woman before her a thought sprang to mind, if there was anyone in the office equipped to help her manage through the chaos of what would be the next few months it would be Sharon. She was always there when Agatha needed her, brought her anything she asked for, and had heard her rant, more times than she could count, about the imbeciles surrounding them. Hell, she had been more motherly to her than her own mother. It would only make sense to clue her in to what was in store.  

 

“Yes, actually. Sharon, please have a seat.” 

 

Sharon froze, eyes wide with fear, “Uh oh, what’s wrong. You only call me Sharon when there’s something wrong.”

 

Agatha rolled her eyes, “There’s nothing wrong, just have a seat.” She offered calmly as she gestured to a chair in front of her. Sharon timidly inched forward and eased into the seat. 

“There's something I should tell you. I just ask, that for right now, you keep it between us, alright?” Sharon nodded cautiously, unsure of what to expect. 

“I’m planning to take some time off this summer. A few months at least, hopefully not until June.” A rush of butterflies filled her stomach as she realized this would be the first time she would be telling anyone. She bit her lip as she built up the courage to reveal her condition. 

“I’m pregnant.” As the words fell they felt foreign on her lips and settled heavy over her.

 

After a moment Sharon’s eyes grew wide in shock as the news settled. She looked her up and down with her mouth agape before gasping, “Oh my God! You’re kidding!” Her eyebrows raised in shock as her eyes misted with happiness. “You’re going to have a baby?!” She shrieked, more overjoyed than Agatha had expected. She closed her eyes and pursed her lips at the exuberance, almost regretting the admission. Why had she decided on a whim to make her the first person she told? 

“Yes, isn’t that what I just said.” Agatha grumbled harshly. 

 

“Oh my goodness! Well, Congratulations! AHA-ha-ha! Isn’t this just the best news I’ve heard all year! Oh, honey, how exciting for you! A little baby!” she cooed as a tear leaked from her eye.

 

Agatha wrinkled her nose in judgement, “Are you crying?” 

 

“Sorry dear, I’m just so happy for you!” Sharon sniffled, wiping the tear from her eye. 

 

“Well that makes one of us.” Agatha huffed under her breath. “Look, I’m only telling you this because I may need your help getting everything in order between now and then, particularly with Mayfest preparation. I don’t know what Herb is planning nor what kind of condition I’ll be in at that point but you and I both know Herb and Freddy cannot manage this project on their own.”

 

“Oh no, that would be a disaster!  Of course, I’d be more than happy to help, whatever you need.” Sharon reassured.

 

“Excellent. Why don’t you join us for Herb’s meeting at 3 so you’re on board from the beginning. I’ll make him aware of our agreement when I meet with him after. Alright? That’ll be all.” Agatha said, returning to her computer as she dismissed Sharon. 

 

“Oh, how exciting! A little baby!” Sharon buzzed as she headed for the door. 

 

“Just remember, between us for now.” She called out warning Sharon as she opened the door to leave. 

 

“Oh of course, dear, your secret’s safe with me!” She promised as she left, closing the door behind her. 

 

“Secret? I love a secret!” Freddy taunted as he turned around in Sharon’s chair peeling an orange. “Is it a good one?” 

 

“It’s none of your beeswax Mr. Burton.” Sharon chided as she shooed him away from her chair. “Is there something I can help you with?” Sharon asked pleasantly enough, as Freddy moved to lean on her desk. 

 

“No, I’m fine, thank you.” He said, eating a slice of the fruit. 

 

“Perhaps you’d like to eat that elsewhere then.” Sharon suggested politely annoyed

 

“Oh no I think I’ll stick around. Make myself available while she chats with HR. I’m not going to let her make baseless accusations about me and not stick up for myself.” her groused

 

“You’d be wasting your time.” Sharon warned, in a sing-songy voice as she side eyed him while filing away paperwork. 

 

Freddy frowned amusedly as he swallowed another piece of orange. “You seem quite sure about that.” 

 

“The meeting has nothing to do with you.” She chuckled. 

 

“Oh is that so? And I’m guessing you might know what it is about then?” He prodded intrusively.

 

Sharon pursed her lips and turned away from him, deflecting the question. 

 

“AH! You do!” He gasped as he leaned into her line of sight “Any chance it has something to do with this secret you’re keeping safe?” 

 

Sharon turned her chair away from him once again,  pretending to look into her purse as she avoided his inquiries. 

 

“Interesting” he smiled maliciously

 

“Mr. Burton, if you have no further business here I’d ask that you please leave my desk, unlike you I have quite a bit of work to do.” She said, smiling condescendingly. 

 

He scoffed as he threw his orange peel in her trash can. “Fine by me. My plans have changed as it is. See you soon.” He said with a smirk though it felt like a vague threat. 

 

————————————————

 

Agatha’s meeting with Janet from HR went as well as to be expected. She outlined the information Agatha had already read in the policy but was able to give her some options should she need to extend past the meger ten week maternity leave. Janet handed over paperwork and was even able to give her a few insights about their insurance policy that she hadn’t been aware of. In the end it would all depend on what she could work out with Herb. 

 

“Are there any other questions you have for me?” Janet asked as she gathered her things. 

 

“No, this was very insightful. I appreciate your time.” Agatha replied as she rose to usher her out. 

“Just keep me in the loop if anything changes, before or after.” Janet asked as they headed into the hallway. 

 

“Ah, Janet! So glad I caught you!” Freddy hollered as he barreled towards them down the hallway. 

 

“You’ve got to be kidding me.” Agatha groaned under her breath. “What are you doing here?” She spat at him

 

“I’m here to see when Janet would have some time for her and I to have a discussion on the same topic you two were just discussing. Since I’m heavily involved, right?” He replied gleefully as Agatha glared at him in disgust
