But no, this was real, Agatha was just on the other side of the room and of course she was here. Rio had been avoiding facing her for so long that fate once again had chosen to intervene. She slowly began to back away towards the door. Agatha hadn’t seen her yet, there was still a chance she could escape before she inadvertently caused another scene. She turned and pushed through the doors and the line of people still waiting to enter into the brisk winter air. She rushed down the sidewalk towards the car until she heard a voice calling after her. 

 

“Rio?! Rio, where are you going?” Yelena shouted.

 

“I need some air! I can’t be in there!” She shouted back, continuing her escape

 

“What the fuck? Why not?” Yelena asked as she rushed to catch up

 

“She’s in there.” Rio said, not breaking her stride

 

“What?” Yelena shouted, unable to hear her. 

 

“Agatha, she’s in there!” She shouted more emphatically, still not turning to Yelena.

 

“You’re joking!” Yelena giggled.

 

“Does it look like I’m laughing?!” she snapped rounding back on Yelena. “Sorry, I’m just…Fuck! Of course she’s here!” she breathed to herself as she began to pace. 

 

“Oh… shit!” Yelena breathed in shock. 

 

“Yeah oh shit! What do I do? I can’t fuck this up!” She huffed as she paced, one hand on her hip, the other braced against her forehead. 

 

“Well to start you should probably calm down and take a breath. It’s going to be fine!” Yelena replied reassuringly

 

“You don’t know that!” Rio barked

 

“Yes, I do.” Yelena said calmly. “Nat and I are here with you. Whatever happens we’ve got your back! You’ll be alright, either way, I promise.” She gave Rio an encouraging smile.

 

“You’re going to make me go back in there aren’t you.” Rio groaned

 

“I do think you should come back inside with me.” Yelena urged

 

Rio let out a laugh in defeat. “What do I even say to her?” she mumbled

 

“Nothing if you don’t want to,” she shrugged, “but the opportunity is right here in front of you now to at least start the conversation. Will it be awkward and uncomfortable? Definitely! But if it’s what you want you’ll have to push past that and tell her how you feel.”

 

Rio felt the sting in that truth. She was terrified to face Agatha and potentially ruin any hope of reconciliation by catching her off guard or saying the wrong thing. Yet, at the same time, she craved some relief from the inexorable guilt and despair she still clung to in her unresolved grief. As they stood there in the frigid blackness just outside the bar they heard the music blare and the crowd cheer.

 

“The show’s started. Are you coming?” Yelena asked, extending her hand “Nat found a table in the back. We’ll chill out, watch the show, and you can find her afterwards? OK?” 

 

Reluctantly Rio took her hand and let Yelena lead her back inside. 

 

—------------------------------------------

 

Agatha and Ralph had arrived with barely fifteen minutes to spare before the show started, yet Jen and Alice were nowhere in sight. While Ralph went backstage to prepare, Agatha posted up at their regular table and waited impatiently for them to arrive. Her feet ached, her back was sore, her son was doing somersaults within her and she wanted nothing more than to go home and curl into bed, but after all Jen had done for her in these past weeks the least she could do was show up for her birthday. She sat, starkly sober, scanning through her phone while techno pop music blasted through the speakers and hordes of drunk gays mingled around her. It was less than five minutes until the show started before Jen and Alice finally wandered in bubbly and laughing. 

 

“What are you two so giddy about? Did you have a nice dinner?” Agatha asked goadingly.

 

“Oh, there’s some lesbian couple having a weird fight outside the bar!” Jen laughed.

 

“I could have sworn it looked like…” Alice started before Jen’s sharp gaze quickly cut her off. 

 

“Dinner was very nice.” Jen said, looking only at Alice as she tried to hide a knowing smile. 

 

“Too bad you couldn’t join us, Ralph said you were dead to the world!” Alice sighed

 

“Honestly I’m kind of glad that you two weren’t there! It’s been a hell of a week and it gave Alice and I a chance to…catch up.” At that Alice couldn’t help but giggle before she leaned in and kissed Jen.

 

“Gross.” Agatha huffed as she took a sip of her water. “Get a room!”

 

“Someone’s triggered!” Jen scoffed “I take it you still haven’t heard from Rio?”

 

“What do you think?” Agatha snipped as she shot her a sideways glare.

 

“Jeeze! Sorry I asked! Maybe you wouldn’t be so snippy if you just sacked up and texted her!”

 

“OH! Am I being snippy? Maybe if you minded your own business I wouldn’t have to be snippy!”

 

“Maybe we should change the subject.” Alice offered in an attempt to make peace

 

“At this point it is my business with how much I’ve heard you talk about her! You either need to get over yourself and text her or grow up and move on!” Jen chided

 

“For your information I have moved on, which is why I’m not reaching out. I have nothing to say.”

 

“Oh please, you called me yesterday crying about how much you missed her!” Jen scoffed

 

“I was hormonal! In case you haven’t noticed I’m six months pregnant!” Agatha spat

 

“Right, just hormonal!” Jen rolled her eyes, “It had nothing to do with the fact that you still have feelings for her.” 

 

Just then the lights dimmed and the music blasted as the emcee made her way to the stage.

 

“Bite me!” Agatha grumbled

 

“In your dreams!” Jen chuckled

 

“Please, guys, we’re here to have a good time alright!? Now both of you shut up and watch the show!” Alice scolded. 

 

—---------------------------------------------

 

With the thick crowd all focused on the queen on stage Rio and Yelena were able to slip in without drawing any attention and made their way to Nat at a table in the back. Rio settled behind them both, doing her best to obscure any line of sight to her while she narrowed her focus on Agatha. 

 

She was seated at the same table, right by the stage, as when Rio spotted her here that first night. The glow of the lights made her look impossibly radiant, her long hair cascading over her shoulder as she leaned back in her chair, legs crossed, one hand resting on the now evident swell of her stomach. Her face was stitched with an amused smile but her eyes gave away a quiet tiredness. Rio couldn’t help but wonder what her life had been like these past weeks. Was everything alright with the baby? Was she alright? Had she thought about her? Was she still angry? Did she even care? It was strange observing her in this state of unawareness, unbothered, not knowing the person who had devastated her weeks ago was mere feet away. She worked to squash that guilt and mentally prepare for what was destined to be another impossible conversation as the next queen took to the stage.

 

“You all know her, you all love her, and if you’re not hard after this performance you’re probably dead. Please welcome to the stage our resident diva extraordinaire on her final night with us this season, Lady BOHNER!!!” shouted the emcee

 

Rio’s attention snapped to the stage as Ralph strutted front and center and a loud blast from the speakers rang out, “It’s Britney Bitch!” and he began to work the crowd, dancing and lip singing to a Britney Spears medley. He immediately approached Agatha’s table, doing his best to embarrass her as he shook his ass in her face before turning to Jen and motorboating her in his silicon tits. She had been so focused on Agatha she hadn’t even realized Jen and Alice were seated with her. Great! Now they could all witness her pathetic attempt to win Agatha back, as if the pressure wasn’t already overwhelming enough. 

 

She slunk further into her seat as he continued to make his way through the crowd, not leaving any table overlooked. It would only be a matter of time before he was at their table and all eyes would be looking in their direction, including Agatha’s. She could feel a panic rising in her chest again. She didn’t want to be discovered, not yet at least, but as she looked around she found herself trapped, they were in a back corner, she couldn’t even escape to the bathroom without drawing more attention to herself. The best she could do was hide from view as much as possible and hope that he didn’t notice her amongst the others. 

 

The medley changed once again to Toxic as he narrowed in on their table. Nat and Yelena, unaware of who Lady Bohner really was, greeted him jovially and egged him on as he turned his attention to Rio. She did her best to brush off the focus, turning away from him shimmying in her direction, which he only took as a challenge to engage her further. He strutted around the table and plopped onto her lap, swinging an arm around her shoulder as she buried her face in her hands and he continued to lip sync. Eventually he stood and in her relief Rio dropped her hands from her face, just in time for him to turn around and smother her with his breastplate. 

 

It wasn’t until he stood back up that he finally saw that it was Rio. Had the music not been so loud everyone would have heard the shriek of shock that escaped his lips before he quickly gathered his composure and continued on with the show as if nothing had happened. 

 

Rio could feel her heart racing as she dared to look back over at Agatha’s table. While the rest of the crowd had moved their attention with Ralph’s performance, everyone at Agatha’s table was now staring directly at her. 








As the table sat there in stunned shock Alice leaned over to Jen. “I knew it was her! You owe me $20.”Jen looked on, eyes wide in shock and mouth agape as she panned her gaze from Rio to Agatha. 

Agatha was frozen, her icy stare fixated on Rio as her face cycled through a gamut of emotions. Shock, anger, and fear bubbled to the surface. Rio was here! After all this time, after weeks of silence, she was just across the room, staring hopelessly back at Agatha. Could this really be happening? Fate’s cruel sense of humor had pulled them together yet again. All the questions that still lingered swarmed her mind at once, drowning her in a sea of worry and doubt. It was too much, with her pain and exhaustion, her mother suing her, Ralph and Jen’s incessant taunting, and now this? She tried to blink away the tears that were quickly forming as she pushed herself away from the table.

 

“Where are you going?” Jen shouted as the music blasted for another performer. 

 

“I’m leaving! I can’t do this right now!” Agatha shouted back as she hurried through the crowd.

 

“Wait, I thought you were driving us home!” she screeched, but Agatha was already at the door.







As she looked on in horror, Rio could feel the desperation building inside of her. Based on that reaction this might be her only chance to talk with Agatha and she couldn’t let it slip by. She jumped from her seat and pushed her way through to the front door just as Agatha slipped out. She hurried out onto the sidewalk after her, finding her already halfway down the block and called to her.

 

“Agatha! Agatha please wait!” Agatha continued on, pretending not to hear. Rio could feel the tears beginning to sting her own eyes as she rushed towards her, catching her before she turned the corner. “Agatha, please can we talk?”

 

“Oh really? After weeks of hearing nothing from you now you want to talk! Fat chance!” Agatha roared as she tried to walk away again.

 

“Please Agatha, I haven’t stopped thinking about you since that night! I just…I didn’t know where you were at with all of this! With me, with the baby, with everything that happened! I didn’t want to upset you any more than I already have!” Rio pleaded as she blocked Agatha’s escape.

 

“Well you’ve really done a bang up job of that haven’t you!” Agatha snapped as she pressed to keep moving.

 

“Agatha, I’m sorry! I’m so so sorry! I never meant to hurt you!” Rio cried as she followed closely behind.

 

“How am I supposed to believe that?!” She rounded on Rio. “You lied to me! You went behind my back to gossip about me to my friends instead of just talking to me! How can I trust you?”

 

“Please you have to believe me it wasn’t like that! I was so worried about you and the baby! I just wanted to make sure you had the support you needed when you did finally find out. I thought they could help! I never expected it all to happen like that! It was a disaster and I’ve regretted it ever since!” she admitted, hoping it would reach whatever soft spot Agatha may yet have reserved for her.

 

Agatha could feel the sting of her own grief rise to the surface “You knew! You knew for weeks and didn’t say anything!” 

 

“What was I supposed to say?!” Rio asked exasperatedly “I didn’t know how it happened! I didn’t understand how you had no clue either!” she barked back pointedly. “I thought I was going insane! How could my girlfriend who’s not been with anyone in years be pregnant and not even know ? You have to realize how impossible that felt!” She urged as Agatha looked on in silent guilt. “I’ve dealt with lying and cheating before but this was a completely different beast. I didn’t know how to handle it and it felt like I was going to lose you either way! I did what I thought was best at the time and it was a disaster nonetheless. All the pain it’s caused us both, I never meant for any of it!” The last words broke on Rio’s lips as tears were now streaming down her face. “I have been an absolute mess without you!” she sobbed.

 

Agatha struggled to keep her composure as Rio broke down before her. The kernel of resentment she had been feeding was shriveling within her at the truth laid bare. They were both to blame for how things had turned out, but were they really able to move forward past this? Agatha closed her eyes and took a deep breath before responding.

 

“I…I can understand how that must have been difficult for you.” She uttered as her voice cracked, trying to keep her emotions at bay. “I’m…sorry…for putting you in that position. I should have realized what had happened sooner and ended things before they got so serious.”

 

“So that’s it then? That’s what you want? You really want to end this?” Rio hiccuped through drying tears, her honeyed eyes glowing gold in the street light.

 

“Isn’t that what’s best?” Agatha choked out, trying to convince herself more than anything. 

 

“How could it be?” Rio gasped “Every second we have been apart has been utter agony. These past few weeks it’s felt like a part of me was missing, like someone ripped my heart out of my chest leaving a black hole in its place.” She felt a renewed string of tears trickle down her cheek “Agatha, please don’t do this…I love you!”

 

The admission caught her off guard. “You can’t possibly mean that.” she muttered as she felt her eyes begin to prick with tears.

 

“No?!” Rio asked as she took a step towards her. “Every moment I have spent with you has been richer, fuller, and more beautiful than I could have ever imagined my life being. You have brought a meaning to my life that I hadn’t even realized was missing. You are everything to me!” She took a cautious step closer, their breaths mingling in the cold air between them. 

 

“You…you don’t mean that.” She uttered, barely more than a whisper, as the first tear fell.

 

“I mean it more than you will ever know!” She breathed. “Agatha, I want you,” She reached out, taking Agatha’s hand in her’s, “I want this, all of it! Just…please…give me a chance…to prove it to you.” 

 

She looked up into Agatha’s stormy blue eyes, now cloudy with tears, glanced down at her trembling, pouting lips, then returned her gaze to those icy pools of blue. Seeing little hesitation she dared herself to lean in, closing the distance between them as she closed her eyes and softly pressed her lips to Agatha’s. At first it was hesitant, unsure, then Rio felt a hand caress her cheek as Agatha pulled her closer, drawing her further into the kiss. Rio responded with vigor, clutching at Agatha’s wrist as she consumed the woman before her as if she was the first sip of sweet water in a barren desert. 

 

Their tongues and teeth clashed in a furious harmony as raw desire finally overcame the last of Agatha’s hesitation. One hand found its way to Rio’s hair weaving its way through her raven tendrils. The other arm wrapped around her shoulders, holding on to her as if she was the only thing keeping her afloat. Rio’s hands drifted down, clutching at Agatha’s waist before wrapping her arms around her completely so that there was barely air left between them. As Rio continued to chase the high of this requited love, the sweet taste of Agatha on her lips and the heady swirling scents of lilac, honeysuckle, and warm vanilla honey, they started to drift. 

Agatha stumbled backward as they both began to lose their balance in the heat of passion. Rio swung an arm out as Agatha started to stumble off the curb and caught them both on the side of an SUV, inadvertently setting off its alarm. They jumped back onto the sidewalk in surprise, Rio still clinging closely to Agatha, one hand on her back, the other on her ever present bump as they dissolved into a fit of breathless laughter in the aftermath of it all. Rio looked down, catching where her hand was resting and quickly removed it. 

 

“Sorry about that! I didn’t mean to…” Rio started

 

“It’s alright.” Agatha gasped, still catching her breath “I think I can forgive you for that.” she shrugged.

 

There was an awkward pause before Rio dared to ask, eyes wide with pleading regret. “And what about the rest? Do you think you can find it in your heart to forgive me for being a spineless idiot?” 

 

“Oh, I don’t know about that.” Agatha said dryly with pursed lips as she straightened herself out. Rio could feel a sinking disappointment weigh in her chest. “I may need some more convincing.” Agatha smirked as she leaned back in for another kiss. This one was softer, more tender, as if writing an apology words alone could not fully express. 

After a moment Rio reluctantly pulled away, resting her head against Agatha’s as she glanced down taking in the swell of her stomach. Agatha followed Rio’s gaze and ghosted a hand over the bump as she straightened herself out once again. 

 

“How are you doing…with everything else?” Rio asked cautiously.

 

Agatha sighed heavily, “Exhausted but fine, all things considered.” She let a hand rest on her stomach. “Sometimes I wonder how much longer it would have taken me to realize had you not figured it out and said something.”

 

“I’m sure you would have noticed sooner rather than later.” Rio chuckled nervously, trying not to stare at the bump. 

 

“It has become a bit more obvious.” She admitted, “Particularly when he’s doing acrobatics as I’m trying to fall asleep. It’s like he knows I want to relax and decides it’s time to party.” she huffed. 

 

“He? You’re having a boy?” Rio asked, unable to hide a smile. 

 

“Yeah, I figured at this point let’s not have any more surprises, you know?” Agatha chuckled

 

“Fair enough!” Rio laughed, “When are you due?”

 

“Beginning of June.” She admitted. “With everything else going on, it hasn’t quite hit me yet.”

 

“Wow, yeah, that’ll be here before you know it!” She chuckled nervously, chancing another quick glance down. “I’m…I’m glad you’re alright, I’ve been really worried about you, both of you.”

 

“Yeah, we’re fine. A little restless, but fine.” She sighed as she pressed a hand to her side.

“Is…is he…?” Rio asked, apprehensively looking between Agatha and the hand at her stomach.

 

“Kickboxing my bladder? Unfortunately, yes!”  She groaned through a laugh. “Do you want to feel?” she asked, seeing Rio’s inquisitive gaze. 

 

“I mean, yeah, if that’s ok?” she stammered, still unsure. Agatha grabbed her hand and confidently placed it to where she was just holding. They stood there for a moment, Rio’s hand resting on the taught skin of Agatha’s stomach beneath her dress, but felt nothing.

 

“Oh come on! Don’t be shy now! You’ve been rolling around all night!” She groaned. Agatha held Rio’s hand there for another moment before she felt a slight nudge at her palm and her eyes shot up to Agatha’s as a smile broke on her lips.

 

“He’s really in there!” Rio gasped in awe

 

“Oh he’s definitely in there! I’m surprised he’s not showing off for you! He usually acts up when he knows somebody’s watching. It made the last obstetrics visit more difficult than it needed to be!” She huffed

 

“Oh really?” Rio smirked “Did I hear that right? Have you been giving your mother grief, mister?” She asked as she rubbed her thumb gently over the spot. Almost immediately she was met with a firmer kick, startling her to where she drew her hand away in shock and let out a surprised laugh. “Perhaps we should head back in?” Rio suggested 

 

Agatha’s face scrunched in disappointment. “Ugh, you’re probably right. Besides, I remember getting talked into driving everyone home at some point. If I left now Jen would never let me hear the end of it!” 

 

“Well we definitely don’t want to incur Jen’s wrath!” Rio laughed, “Shall we?” She offered up her hand which Agatha graciously took and they both headed back. 





As they rounded the corner they saw all of their friends huddled together just outside the bar. 

“There they are!” Nat shouted, prompting them all to turn and start shouting and cheering obnoxiously. 

 

“Well it’s about damn time!” Jen huffed “I see Rio’s still breathing! I’m guessing you two have kissed and made up?”

 

Rio smiled guiltily, rubbing a hand against the back of her neck as Agatha rolled her eyes and threw her hair over her shoulder. “We may have settled our differences.”

 

“Hell yeah!” Yelena cheered as she nudged Rio’s shoulder. 

 

“Fucking finally!” Jen roared “How many times do I have to be right before you start believing me?” She sassed

 

“Eh…probably a few dozen more at least.” Agatha retorted. “Are we done here? Am I taking you home?”

 

“Yes, we’re just waiting on Ralph. He should be out in a few.”

 

“We should probably head out. Yelena and I still have to check into our rental. Vidal, you coming?” Nat asked

 

“Yeah, go on ahead, I'll catch up in a minute!” She gestured for them to go and turned to Agatha. “If you’re up for it, I’d like to see you tomorrow. Maybe we can grab lunch or something?”

 

“I’d like that.” She hummed through a smile. Rio settled her hands on Agatha’s waist and pulled her close, eagerly taking one final kiss. 

 

“GET A ROOOM!” Jen shouted from the doorway of the bar. Agatha didn’t turn, she didn’t even break the kiss, she simply flipped Jen the bird over her shoulder. 

 

Rio reluctantly pulled away, taking in Agatha as if for the first time. Her crystal blue eyes, her fierce cutting cheekbones, the way her hair tumbled in waves down her back. How lucky she was to not only have found her and won her over, but to have lost her and gained her back once again. She knew in that moment, even if it took the rest of her life, she would prove her love to Agatha until the day she died. 

“Goodnight! I’ll call you tomorrow!” She promised as she stared into Agatha’s eyes. Before she left she glanced down and placed a gentle hand on the rise of her stomach. “Goodnight little man, take it easy on your mama! Let her get some rest, ok?” She felt a gentle nudge in response just below her fingertips. “That seems like a deal!” She chuckled

 

“I’ll hold him to it!” Agatha laughed. “Goodnight!” She hummed as she hooked Rio by the chin and pulled her in for one last peck before watching her walk away into the night. 

 

—--------------------------------------------

 

Nearly an hour later, after she had dropped Jen and Alice off at Alice’s condo and regaled Ralph on the tea of running into Rio, she was settled into bed. Scratchy snuggled closely to her chest as she rubbed soothing circles across her belly, urging her son to settle. As she lay there, struggling to ignore the incessant movement just beneath her skin, she heard her phone buzz on the nightstand behind her. Unable to sleep she rolled over and checked the notification.

 

Rio Vidal - Hope you made it home safely my love! Counting down the minutes until I can see you. 🖤

 

She smiled as Rio’s loving warmth spread through her chest, settling any final doubts she may have had remaining. For the first time in weeks she felt hope more than fear for her future. With Rio by her side the burden of pregnancy and impending motherhood lessened and she let the joy she had been holding at bay begin to seep into the vacant space. As she re-read the message she caught a quick speech bubble appear and disappear in the corner. Soon another message popped up. 

 

If he’s keeping you up, remind your son of our deal! I love you, get some rest!


She typed a quick I love you too back and returned her phone to the nightstand. She rolled over, snuggling back into Scratchy, and resumed her soothing circles. “Alright kid, I know you made a deal with Rio! Now chill out, let me get some rest, and I promise I’ll get you ice cream tomorrow.” She felt him shift a few more times but he eventually settled and she drifted peacefully to sleep.

Chapter End Notes

After all of this angst you have some loving, caring, fluffy, Agathario to look forward to in the next chapter. That is, as long as Evanora will let that happen.

Chapter 21: Twenty Nine

Chapter Summary

Agatha and Rio put the pieces back together

Chapter Notes

Because Lakehousevibe asked so nicely here's the next chapter. I had a lot more planned for this but it's already so long I just decided to cut it up which just means more chapters to come. The next one shouldn't take nearly as long!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Agatha had awoken early that morning, her body tingling with anticipation for her lunch with Rio. The night before had felt like an odd dream. After weeks of separation Rio had appeared out of thin air, laden with grief and regret begging for Agatha not to end their relationship. To her own surprise she had let herself acknowledge her part in their destruction and in that vulnerability allowed Rio back into her heart. Now, in the harsh light of day she was questioning that decision. 

It had been rash, spurred on by her undeniable desire for the woman, but was it really in her best interest and the interest of her child? She was timorous. Sure Rio claimed that this is what she wanted, but what did that entail? What could their life possibly look like going forward? And if she let Rio in and, down the line, Rio finally realized that this is not what she signed up for she wouldn’t be the only one to feel the impact of that loss. All these questions and more were buzzing around her head as she woke and it seemed the only way to dispel them was to follow through on her plans with Rio and ask her herself, though her stomach churned at the idea.

 

She rolled over to the edge of her bed, hovering at the end as her body adjusted to the weight it now carried. She stretched, easing as best she could the ache in her back that had grown to become as familiar as the rolling shift of her son beneath her skin. This morning he was particularly active, as if embodying the nervous excitement of the day. She grunted as she pulled herself from the bed and hurried into the bathroom to relieve herself. Feeling lighter she rose and shuffled over to the mirror. It had become a daily ritual, observing the adjustments being made, the changes taking place as her body succumbed to the growing life inside of her. She had begun to start to see the ripples of his presence on the surface of her skin, and today they were as vibrant as ever. 

A foot or an elbow pressed against the surface and she felt his head settle into her side. She rested a hand on the spot and greeted him warmly.

 

“Good morning little bug! Big day today, huh?” He wiggled beneath her palm, kicking his feet about. “Don’t tell anyone but I’m a bit nervous myself. I can’t tell if I’m making a huge mistake here.” an urgent nudge pressed just below her belly button. “I know, I’m probably overthinking it, but there’s a lot to consider. You for instance!” He rolled about again, settling just below her ribs. “You might be safe now, all tucked away in there, but I’ve gotta make sure that’s the case when you get out here. That means not dating a crazy person!” She moved and began to search about for stretchy yoga pants and a sweatshirt. “She has to be crazy right?” she mumbled to herself as she tied her hair back. Who in their right mind would sign up for this? She slipped on her running shoes, grabbed her phone and headed out into the kitchen. 




Ralph, per his new routine, was dancing away in the kitchen making breakfast. 

 

“What are you listening to this morning?” she asked as he slid her a bowl of fruit. 

 

“Celine, mama! I’m adding River Deep, Mountain High to my set list for the cruise. Those geriatric bitches are going to eat it the fuck up!” He put his headphones away and let the music blare out through his phone speakers as he put on a show for her while he finished the pancakes he was making. 

Agatha chuckled at the performance. Ralph, in his ever effervescent nature, always had a way of lightening the atmosphere around him. She would miss this in just a couple days. He had made all of this not only possible but endurable and for that she owed him everything. 

 

“Someone’s had their coffee this morning!” she snorted as the song finished and he handed over a plate of pancakes. 

 

“I did happen to run down to the coffee shop earlier and grabbed us each an iced latte!” He beamed, as he pulled the coffee from the fridge and placed her’s in front of her. “Figured you could use a treat before your big day! Don’t worry, it's baby safe!” He winked before grabbing his plate and sitting beside her. 

 

“It better be, I don’t need him jumping around today any more than he already is!” Her lips twitched into a pleased smirk as she took the first sip.

 

“Oh, someone’s excited is he?” Ralph cooed as he patted her stomach. “Morning little man! Hope you like the pancakes,” he leaned down, placing a hand to the side of his mouth as if sharing a secret. “I added chocolate chips and sprinkles, but shhhh that’s just between us!” 

 

Agatha chuckled at his antics. “Please, I don’t need you encouraging him, he’s already bouncing off my walls!”

 

“Gross.” He grimaced as he took a bite of pancakes. “Are you excited?” He asked, his voice syrupy with goading joy. Agatha groaned. “You get to see Rio !” he pressed.

 

“We’ll see.” She huffed, not taking her eyes off her plate. 

 

“What’s this, we’ll see ? You were gushing last night about how you two were going to patch things up!”

 

“I don’t know, I’m just…having second thoughts.” She mumbled as she took a bite of the pancakes.

 

“About?” He questioned, his eyebrow raised in skepticism

 

“She can’t really want this, can she?” she admitted

 

“Agatha…” Ralph groaned

 

“And if she does, what does that say about her?” she continued

 

“Agatha…” He repeated, hoping to interrupt this spiral she seemed intent on diving down.

 

“Only an insane person would want to continue this relationship. I mean look at me, why would anyone in their right mind sign up for this?!” she rambled, growing exasperated

 

“Agatha…” He repeated once again, though more emphatically

 

“WHAT?!” She snapped at him

 

“Don’t do this to yourself!” He pleaded

 

“Ralph, I have to be realistic! Once she realizes what she’s agreed to there’s no way she’ll stick around!” she groaned

 

“Why are you talking yourself out of this again?” He asked, confused by her change in perspective. 

 

Agatha wrinkled her nose in frustration “I can’t bear to be disappointed again, and I don’t want to disappoint him!” She half shouted, rubbing her hand against her side as a rippling kick danced across it. “I just, I don’t know if it’s worth that risk, regardless of how I feel.”

 

“And how do you feel?” he asked bluntly

 

Somehow, the question caught her off guard. It shouldn’t matter, not when it came to her son and his well being. “I…I don’t know…” she mumbled as she turned back to her plate, barely letting the words fall from her lips. 

 

“HA! I think you do!” He warned as he leaned back, crossing his arms as he gave her a once over. “You love her!” She could feel her cheeks flush at the observation. “and you’re afraid if you’re vulnerable and let your guard down you’re going to get hurt again.” 

 

“I swear, I don’t know why I let you talk to Alice.” She waived her hand, dismissing his pointed truth.

 

“However, maybe if you are vulnerable with her and tell her how you feel you can avoid that disappointment altogether! Don’t deny yourself this happiness just because of what might happen. And as for crazy…” He rolled his eyes, “I think you both check that box pretty evenly at this point so don’t go judging.”  He wagged his finger at her.

 

“Ugh.” She snarled “Fine, I’ll go to lunch, but she’s still on thin ice.” She pushed herself away from the counter and stretched her back out again as best she could. “I need some air, I’m going for a walk.”

 

—---------------------------------------



As the sun rose high and light began to pour in through the slender window above the chalkboard Rio stirred to the sound of her phone buzzing beside her bed. She lifted her heavy, sleep drenched head, a string of drool hanging down still connected to the pillow, and blinked herself awake enough to grab her phone. She rolled over and through squinting eyes checked the messages that had just come through.

 

Yelena - Messages (4)

 

8:14 - Morning Sunshine! Let us know when you’re up and we can grab breakfast. 

9:37 - Wakey Wakey! Nat and I got tired of waiting so we’re going to grab something and head over. 

 

10:26 - Hope you’re up! We have the food secured and are headed your way!

 

10:41 - Ok, we’re like 5 mins out. Please tell me you’re up and can let us in. 

 

Rio strained her eyes to check the time, 10:45. Shit! She couldn’t remember the last time she had slept this late. She rushed to throw the covers off and sit up, cross-legged at the edge of the bed, her knees resting on the surrounding platform as she stretched herself awake, falling back onto the bed. Just as she let out a heavy sigh her phone began to ring. She searched for it in the covers and quickly answered.

 

“Hello?” Her voice croaked blearily

 

“ Welcome back to the world of the living!” Yelena chuckled at the other end of the phone. “ Did I wake you? ” She asked

 

“More or less.” It came out as a barely audible grunt, “Are you guys here?” she yawned.

 

“ Pulling in now.”

 

“ Sounds good, I’ll come get you. Just give me a second to put on some pants.” she grunted

 

“You better hurry before I eat your breakfast!” Yelena joked as Rio hung up the phone. 

 

Rio groaned as she lifted herself off the bed. Her whole body felt loose and heavy from the deep dreamless slumber she had fallen into as soon as her head hit the pillow. Having seen and talked to Agatha the night before, it was the first restful sleep she’d had in weeks. Her body ached pleasantly, having finally released the tension she had been holding throughout that time. 

She stumbled around her room gathering a pair of sweatpants and a hoodie and as quickly as she could slipped them on along with a pair of slides before heading down to collect her friends. 

As she burst through the front doors the cold air and blaring sunlight shocked her awake. Though her eyes fought to adjust to the change in brightness she quickly caught sight of Nat and Yelena as they made their way up the stairs. 

 

“Sleep alright?” Nat taunted as she passed by Rio into the lobby carrying a tray of coffees. 

 

“Dude, I was dead to the world! I don’t remember the last time I slept that hard.” She yawned as she closed the door behind Yelena. “What did you guys pick up?”

 

“We couldn’t decide. I wanted donuts, Nat wanted a breakfast burrito, so we went to a couple places.”

 

“Well wherever you went it smells amazing!” she said as she grabbed one of the food bags from Yelena and led them up to her apartment. 

 

As soon as they were inside she threw her bag on the counter and hurriedly pulled out her phone. “You guys go ahead and get started, I just have to make a quick call.” She explained as she raised the phone up to her ear and moved to pace up and down the hallway as the phone rang. Nat and Yelena exchanged amused looks as they unpacked the bags.

 

“Don’t mind if I do!” Yelena chirped as she piled 3 donuts onto a plate. 

 

“Who are you calling?” Nat asked, noticing Rio’s strained expression as she began to bite at her nails. 

 

Rio stopped suddenly and held a finger up in pause to Nat as a smile grew across her face. “Hello, my love! I’m sorry to call so late, I slept in later than I meant to!” She lilted with a saccharinely sweet voice as she turned and headed down the hallway to continue the conversation in her room. “Are you still up for lunch today?” she asked before closing the door behind her. 

 

“Dude!” Yelena exclaimed as soon as Rio was out of earshot

 

“I know right?!” Nat emphasized as she tucked into her burrito. “How does she get herself into these situations?” 

 

“No clue, but it’s like they get crazier every time she finds a new one!” Yelena exclaimed through a mouthful of pink sprinkle donut. 

 

“Oh, I don’t know about that! Remember the one who tried to get her to join her family’s weird cult?” Nat snorted as she sipped her coffee.

 

“Oh, right! What was her name? Adelaide?” Yelena asked

 

“No, I thought Adelaide was the one who we found out was already married to some guy.” Nat replied

 

“No, you’re thinking of Margot!” Yelena corrected.

 

“Oh shit! You’re right, I forgot about Margot! Well, and then of course there was Savannah.” Nat grimaced at the memory.

 

“God, I’m so glad that didn’t work out!” Yelena sighed, “I still can’t believe they were ever engaged! Remember when you caught Savannah fucking that buss boy at Hela’s christmas party?” 

 

“Ugh! Don’t remind me! I almost had that image wiped from my mind!” Nat gagged

 

“And I thought Rio was upset then! That was a mild inconvenience compared to this! I'm just glad it seems like they’re sorting things out. I mean, all things considered, at least she wasn’t cheating or secretly taken.” Yelena shrugged

 

“No, just secretly pregnant!” Nat snorted

 

“Exactly, it could be worse! When you really think about it, this is kind of what she’s been after all along.” Yelena reasoned as she finished her second donut.

 

“This…really?” Nat scoffed

 

“Well not this exactly , but a family. This one just happens to come with the baby already included. A two-fer if you will.” Yelena chuckled as they heard Rio’s footsteps patter back down the hallway.

 

“Ok! Crisis averted!” Rio huffed “I just have, shit, 30 minutes to get ready then I’ve gotta go pick her up. Fuck, I should have set an alarm. I really didn’t expect to sleep that late!” She pressed her hands to her face trying to relieve the residual tiredness.

 

“Is there anything we can help with?” Nat asked, seeing her getting flustered.

 

“No! I just gotta get moving. Thanks for bringing the food and coffee.” She grumbled as she rifled through one of the bags to find a hashbrown. “Sorry I can’t stay and hang with you today after you drove all the way up here! When are you headed out?”

 

“We’re not leaving until tomorrow morning so maybe we can catch you later tonight.” Yelena shrugged

 

“Tonight? Yeah that should be fine! If you want you can hang out here, feel free to check out the facilities, I’ll leave you my spare key.” She popped the hashbrown in her mouth and went and grabbed her keys off the hook by the door. 

 

“Cool, yeah we might hang around for a bit, though I think we might see a movie or something later.” Nat explained.

 

“Awesome! Yeah, text me later when you’re done and we can meet up! I’ve gotta go hop in the shower so make yourselves at home!”

 

—------------------------



Hours later, after a long thoughtful walk and a steaming hot shower, Agatha emerged from her room again dressed for her date with Rio. Her hair hung loosely down her back, still slightly damp from the shower. She had wedged herself into a pair of dark wash maternity jeans paired with black boots and threw on an oversized white dress shirt, leaving plenty of room for her son who was still squirming relentlessly inside her. The constant movement along with her trepidation at seeing Rio again was setting her nerves on edge. 

 

“OW OW! Looking good mama!” Ralph cheered as she entered the living room.

 

“Please, I look like a marshmallow!” she scoffed “Have you seen my purse? I’ve looked everywhere for it!”

 

“Right here by the door, where you dropped it!” He said as he grabbed it and tossed it on the couch beside him. 

 

“Of course it was! I swear I’d lose my head these days if it wasn’t attached. Fucking pregnancy brain.” 

 

“When are you headed out?”

 

“She should be here any minute. For a second I thought I got lucky and she forgot or came to her senses, but then she called me right when I got out of the shower.” She grumbled as she began to search through her bag.

 

“Oh you thought you’d get off that easy, huh?” Ralph chuckled

 

“One can dream!” She snorted as she pulled out the lipstick she had been searching for and headed to the bathroom to apply. “Where are you off to?” She hollered down the hallway after him.

 

“Jen and I are going to start taking her stuff over to Alice’s. She’ll be here soon.” 

 

“Oh, did Alice end up asking her to move in?” She asked as she returned to the living room. 

 

“Yeah, last night at dinner I guess. Jen was thrilled!”

 

“Well she’s not wasting any time is she! Honestly, I don’t know how she’s lasted that long in that box she calls an apartment.” she scoffed just as a knock sounded at the door. She gave Ralph a dreadful look as she headed to answer it. 

 

She cautiously pulled the door open to reveal Rio, clad in black slacks a white dress shirt and a blazer. Her hair was loosely pulled into a low bun leaving a few strands falling around her face. Upon seeing Agatha her honey amber eyes gleamed with joy and relief and a bashful smile broke across her lips. Agatha felt her breath catch in her throat, seeing her again in the daylight, Rio was more captivating than ever. 

 

“Hello, my love!” Rio cooed nervously. “You are looking…positively radiant! Here, I got these for you!” She handed over a modest bouquet of white tulips and yellow roses sprinkled with pink carnations and baby’s breath.  

 

Agatha took the flowers from Rio and gestured for her to come inside. “Thank you, these are…lovely.” She muttered nervously as she shot a look at Ralph and moved to find a vase to put them in. 

 

Rio shuffled anxiously to stand at the back of the couch as she waited for Agatha. “Hey Ralph, good to see you again! Sorry if I startled you last night!” She chuckled. 

 

“Oh, honey, don’t worry about it!” He waved his hands dismissively as he rose from the couch to greet her. “Best surprise of the night by far!” He hummed as he swallowed her in a hug. “It’s great to see you again!”

 

“Thanks!” She choked out, a little overwhelmed at the reception. “It’s good to see you too!” she beamed. As she pulled away her eyebrows quickly scrunched in surprised confusion. “Is…is that my jacket?” she asked, seeing the familiar worn leather and patches. 

 

“Oh, shit, it might be!” He laughed “It’s been hanging up by the door, I thought it was Alice’s and figured she must have left it here at some point.” He explained.

 

“You wear it well!” She laughed astonished, only now remembering she had let Agatha borrow it on their first date, which now seemed like a lifetime ago. 

 

“Ready?” Agatha chimed in abruptly as she grabbed her bag from the couch and headed for the door. 

 

“Indeed!” Rio flashed her eyes anxiously as the awkward tension swept by her along with Agatha. “Ralph, good seeing you again!” she flashed him a tight smile as she followed Agatha out the door. 

 

“Likewise! You two have fun now! Don’t do anything I wouldn’t do!” He shouted, tossing finger guns in their direction, causing Agatha to turn and glare as she closed the door behind them. 





“So, are you driving or should I?” Agatha asked, more aggressively than she had intended, as she continued down the porch and out toward the cars parked in her driveway. Seeing Rio had already started to rattle her defenses and despite her best efforts she couldn’t help but find her annoyingly charming and endearing. 

 

“I…I was planning on driving…unless you’d prefer to drive…It’s up to you.” Rio babbled, still cautious about saying the wrong thing. 

 

Agatha stood at the edge of the driveway, digging around in her purse once again, this time in search of her sunglasses, which conveniently gave her time to regain some sense of self-control which was slipping like sand through an hourglass. As she slid on the glasses she finally turned and deigned to answer Rio. “No, it’s fine, you can drive.” she replied dismissively with a wave of her hand as she continued on towards Rio’s car with her closely in tow. 

 

As they approached the vehicle Rio rushed forward to grab the door for Agatha, who gave her a sideways look as she slowly settled into the car. Rio rushed around, trying to brush off the awkwardness as best she could before climbing into the driver's seat and quickly setting them off. 



Minutes ticked by in silence as they drove. Rio kept her eyes focused on the road, merely glancing in Agatha’s direction every now and again. Agatha had herself pressed up against the side of the door, an elbow crooked against the arm rest as her fingers pressed against her lips. Her other arm draped protectively against the swell of her stomach, feeling her son hum beneath her fingers, as she stared out the passenger window. The tension was thick in the space between them, begging for one of them to carve their way through it to reach the other. Agatha, resolute in her aloofness as a means of control, was doing all that she could to deflect any attention that would spark a conversation. Offering a tight, but albeit nervous, smile anytime Rio looked in her direction. Rio, on the other hand, was summoning every ounce of courage she could to form a coherent enough sentence to hopefully relieve the building pressure between them. 

 

“So…” Rio eventually stuttered.

 

“So…” Agatha echoed, though she kept her attention on the world moving around them. 

 

“Did you sleep well?” It was the most benign thing she could think of. 

 

“Reasonably well. And you?” she asked, yet still refused to turn and look at Rio directly. Too afraid of how her feelings for the woman might overshadow her better judgement. 

 

“Best night’s sleep I’ve had in a long while, actually.” She chuckled nervously as she chanced another glance at Agatha. “If Yelena hadn’t texted me I might have slept straight through our lunch!” 

 

“That would have been…unfortunate.” Agatha muttered as she began to bite at her nails. 

 

“You’re telling me! I’ve been over the moon since I saw you last night. I still can’t believe this is real, that you’re really here with me again. I was afraid you’d never want to see me after what happened, which would have been totally understandable, but I can’t even begin to tell you how lost I felt without you.” Rio dared to reach her hand across the center console and pick up Agatha’s, weaving their fingers together. 

 

Agatha’s attention was finally broken from the window as she looked down at their clasped hands. Rio’s palm cradling hers, their fingers perfectly entwined as if they were roots that had grown together. She could feel her pulse quicken at the anchoring warmth that emanated from Rio. That ever soothing aura that had captivated her from the very beginning. 

 

“Yes…I…I’ve missed you too.” It came out shakier than she had expected. She fought to pull her attention back to the passing cars, but in her weakness her gaze flickered over to Rio and paused. A peaceful smile was settled on her lips, her golden eyes twinkled in the sunlight, her raven hair kissed the bow of her cheekbones as it danced across her face. She closed her eyes and forced herself to return to looking out the window. This was going to be more difficult than she had thought. 

 

As they continued on, driving in silence once again, their hands remained intertwined. Rio’s steady heartbeat harmonizing with hers in a calming melody that pulsed between them. After a moment in this peaceful limbo she relaxed into the growing warmth that was spreading throughout her body. It was becoming difficult to deny the safety and comfort Rio’s presence brought her, yet the questions still ticked, Is this enough? Will it be enough for him? As the thoughts hovered in her mind her other hand drifted down to meet him. For the first time that day he was still and peaceful, as if he too had been soothed by Rio’s presence. 

It was then that she felt it, a dull ache that started small and crept down into her back and around the curve of her stomach. She pressed her hand against the surface, finding it stiff and solid. The uncomfortable sensation along with the stillness of her son caused her heart to skip a beat. Her mind pricked with the memory of her miscarriage and she couldn’t help but feel a panic begin to rise in her chest. Had all that movement earlier been a sign of distress? Was it happening again? Feeling the pressure begin to soften she glided her hand over the surface until she found the spot he was pressed against. She dug her fingers into the spot attempting to spur some movement before she let fear overwhelm her. 

 

“Everything alright, Cariño?” Rio asked, feeling her distress in the hand she was holding. 

 

“Fine.” Agatha breathed as she waited for a sign that felt like it may never come. Then, just as the tears of doubt began to gather in the corners of her eyes, she felt a shift. A long rolling stretch that started small then spread across her abdomen, as if he was waking from a deep slumber only to quickly settle back under the covers. She let out a silent sigh of relief. He was alright, perfectly calm and content beneath her fingers.

Just as the final remnants of panic dissipated they pulled up to the restaurant. Rio drove the car around to the front and placed the vehicle in park. She got out and moved around to open Agatha’s door.

 

“You know I’m perfectly capable of walking.” She snickered, trying to regain some of her poise after the startling incident. 

 

“Of course you are!” Rio brushed off the sarcasm with a smirk as she helped her out of the vehicle. “Go ahead, I’ll be in in a moment.” She rushed back around and moved to park the car. 

 

Agatha turned around and began to head inside, feeling more relieved with each step as  her son quickly resumed his jostling at her movements. As she sat and waited just inside the door for Rio she ghosted a hand over the swell, reveling in the life beneath it. “You scared me in there! Don’t do that!” she muttered, quietly as she could, “I thought I’d lost you!” she felt a twinge of grief in her chest at the admission and a rogue tear broke free from the corner of her eye. She hurried to wipe it away as she looked out the windows catching sight of Rio approaching. 

 

“Alright!” Rio beamed as she entered, “I don’t know about you two, but I am starving!” she said, pulling open the second set of doors for Agatha. 

 

As they stepped into the restaurant they were greeted with a host of delectable smells wafting from the kitchen, a mix of grilled meats and roasted vegetables hung in the air. The space held an ambient amber glow that bounced off the wooden surfaces surrounding them. They were immediately handed menus and directed to join the line of people weaving up to the counter to order. 

 

“Have you been here before?” Rio asked excitedly

 

“Can’t say that I have.” Agatha replied curtly as she perused the menu

 

“I wound up here after a lengthy shift with a group of nurses when I first moved here. It’s been some of the best food I’ve had! I’ve been meaning to come back but hadn’t really thought of it until now. They have a little bit of everything so I figured they’d be able to accommodate whatever you might be craving.” Rio babbled nervously

 

“That was thoughtful.” Agatha hummed, not taking her eyes off the menu. 

 

Rio could sense the unease that had followed them into the restaurant and wasn’t quite sure how to resolve it. After the night before she had been hopeful that all this awkwardness was behind them, but as she tried to engage Agatha further she continued to meet the resistance of walls that had seemingly reappeared overnight. Perhaps she was just hungry? Or hormonal? Either way, she was determined not to let Agatha’s prickliness dissuade her.

 

“They…uh…they have a really good veggie burger, though last time I was here I got their Thai rice bowl. The peanut sauce is amazing!” Agatha hummed in acknowledgement but continued to scan the menu, flipping it over to peruse the drinks. “They do a lot of fresh juices and handcrafted sodas too. I’m for sure getting their ginger ale. It’s amazing!” Rio gushed hoping her excitement would damper the tension. 

 

“Is that so?” Agatha lilted, her eyebrow hitched in amusement as a smirk tugged at the corner of her lips, her resolve waning further. Rio’s exuberance, the way she babbled nervously and enthusiastically, she couldn’t help but find her adorably endearing. As they reached the front of the line she felt Rio’s hand press against the small of her back, guiding her to the cashier. The touch was electric and grounding, a loving reassurance that Rio was again by her side, her mere existence somehow soothing the doubt she was struggling to reignite. Distracted by the touch she hadn’t noticed they were waiting on her to order until she heard Rio calling her name. 

 

“Agatha? Do you still need a minute?” Rio asked gently

 

“No.” she breathed as she shook herself back into the present moment. “I’ll have whatever she ordered.” She decided abruptly as she slapped the menu on the counter. “I’m going to go find us a table.”  She sauntered off into the belly of the restaurant in search of a booth in the furthest back corner she could find to regroup.  



“That’ll be $32.95” The cashier repeated, waiting for Rio’s acknowledgement.

 

“OH…yeah…right” She finally tore her eyes away from Agatha and fumbled around with her wallet. She quickly paid and gathered their drinks as she went in search of Agatha. Perhaps the night before had just been an appetizer for the deeper conversation they still needed to have? She knew it had only been the beginning as there was much to sort through and discuss, but she had hoped that the fiercest barriers had been crossed. Instead she was met with a dismissive coldness and lingering tension that was beginning to worry her. Not one to be discouraged, she pressed on and moved to join Agatha. 

 

“Here you are!” she hummed as she set the glass down in front of Agatha

 

“What is this?” she asked, observing the golden liquid adorned with mint and lime.

 

“It’s the ginger ale.” Rio giggled as she took a sip of her drink. “Try it, I promise it’s delicious!” 

 

Agatha at this point hated ginger, she had consumed so much of it over the last couple of months the smell of it alone made her gut wrench. Though not one to admit when she’d made a mistake, she leaned forward and took a confident gulp. She was immediately hit with a burst of ginger followed by a punch of the sour lime that caught in the back of her throat and she began to aspirate. 

 

“Oh my gosh, are you ok?” Rio jumped in alarm. “Shit, I should have grabbed some water too!” She leapt from the booth to remedy the mistake as Agatha continued to sputter. In desperation she took another sip of the ginger ale and grimaced, still sputtering. Luckily Rio returned speedily and she was able to clear the rest with a few gulps of water. Agatha wiped away the wetness from her eyes that had gathered in the coughing fit before finally turning her attention completely to Rio. 

 

“Better?” Rio cooed, face still stitched with concern.

 

Agatha nodded silently and took another sip of water. As she set the glass down she felt her son shift dramatically in her stomach, kicking and pressing emphatically against the underside of her ribs. She winced at the uncomfortable sensation and guided a hand down to soothe the movements. 

 

“Agatha?” Rio hummed nervously, she couldn’t let the tension simmer any longer

 

“Hmmm?” Agatha breathed in reply

 

Rio swallowed hard as she stared down into her drink. “How are you feeling about everything?” her voice sounded small as the words escaped her lips. She knew she was stepping into tender territory and it had taken all of her courage to do so.

 

Agatha had known her bravado would only carry her so far, but she was still taken aback by Rio’s directness. Her lips opened and closed a few times, as if struggling to catch the words she wanted to say. In the end all that tumbled out was, “Conflicted.”

 

“I see.” Rio bit her lip nervously as she let the next question form, “Are you still upset with me?”

 

Agatha sat with the question for a moment, searching for the anger she had expected to still be simmering deep within her. Instead all that came to the surface were remnants of doubt and fear, wrapped around a knot of desire. She chewed on the question for a bit before finally responding. “No…I don’t think so.”

 

Rio let out a small sigh of relief before bracing herself to dig further. After all, something was clearly still brewing between them. “I’m glad to hear that.” She breathed through a soft smile. “Is…is there something else the matter? I feel like I’m making you uncomfortable. I just…I know there's still a lot we should probably discuss. I’m sure you have questions, I certainly do! I just thought…maybe after last night…it’d be easier for us to talk about everything…but it kind of feels like you are trying to keep me at a distance.” Rio let out a nervous chuckle. “I…I know this isn’t going to be easy…for either of us…but I hope you can trust me enough to at least let me know what you’re thinking. I promise, unless you tell me to fuck off, I’m not going anywhere.” 

 

Agatha sat silently for a moment as she held Rio’s gaze, her burning amber irises chipping away at the cracks in her defenses. She swallowed her pride and through pursed lips dared to ask the question that was causing her so much hesitation. 

“Why?” 

 

Rio blinked back in confusion. “Why?” 

 

“Yes, why? Why do you want any of this? You could have just as easily walked away. We haven’t even known each other a year!” she scoffed incredulously.

 

“Agatha, I love you. Why is that so hard for you to believe?”

 

“Sure, you love me now! What about six months from now? Or a year from now, when things are far more complicated? ”

 

“More complicated than now?” Rio prodded with a smirk.

 

“You know what I mean!” Agatha groaned exasperatedly

 

“Alright I’ve got two veggie burgers!” The waiter interrupted in a disillusioned monotone as he set the plates down in front of them. “Anything else I can get you?”

 

“I’m good, do you need anything?” Rio asked gleefully as she immediately took a bite of the sandwich. Agatha shook her head in reply, not taking her eyes off Rio. 

 

“Alright, enjoy” The waiter muttered as he left them to finish their conversation. 

 

Agatha sat silently, watching Rio eat as if they hadn’t just been in the middle of dissecting the very core of their relationship. Rio didn’t seem scared or put off by her questions, if anything she was relaxing further with each bite, more than comfortable to let the tension dangle between them for the time being. 

“You have got to try this! I think this might be better than the Thai bowl!” Rio gushed through a mouthful of burger. Agatha couldn’t help but laugh at the adorable enthusiasm with which Rio ate as she resigned herself to the fact that this was going no further until they’d eaten. The first bite was hesitant as her mind was still focused on the conversation at hand, but that quickly changed as she began to devour the sandwich. She wasn’t sure if the burger was actually that good or if she was hungrier than she thought but she managed to finish everything before Rio was halfway through her meal. 

 

“I take it you enjoyed it?” Rio snickered as she took another bite. 

 

Agatha leaned back in her seat, letting her hands rest on her stomach where her son was once again kicking happily within her. “Ok, I’ll admit that was pretty good.” she replied with a satisfied burp. 

 

“Good! I’m glad you liked it!” Rio beamed, taking a sip of her drink before at last continuing with the conversation they had started. “I do know what you mean by the way.”

 

“Oh, You do?” Agatha sighed, somewhat disappointed that the discussion had resumed.

 

“You’re afraid that I’m not in it for the long haul. That this is just some honeymoon phase and I’m going to dip when the baby comes? Is that it?”

 

“More or less.” She mumbled in agreement as she rubbed her hand against the swell. “I just…I don’t have the luxury of uncertainty anymore when it comes to us. If this continues you’re not just a part of my life, you’re a part of his. I have to be practical about this!”

 

“I can understand that, it’s just…I know you have feelings for me. You wouldn’t have kissed me the way you did last night if you didn’t. We wouldn’t be here right now if we both didn’t want this.” she smiled guiltily “You admitted it yourself, you love me! Are you really going to discount that?” Rio asked, her gaze unwavering as she peered deeply into Agatha’s eyes.

 

Agatha twisted her face in frustration. She had been so weak the night before and now it was coming back to bite her. “Ok, yes! I have feelings for you that could be described as love…”

 

“But…” Rio anticipated before the word left Agatha’s lips

 

“Is it enough? I mean, there’s still so much we don’t even know about each other. Like, did you even want kids?” she chuckled exasperatedly

 

“Always.” Rio breathed, setting down her food, “I just never dreamed I’d actually be in a position where that would be possible. Not to say that he’s mine, but to be a part of his life in any capacity would be a gift beyond my wildest dreams.” Rio reached her hand across the table, palm open in a pleading offering. “Agatha, I was serious when I said I wanted this, all of it. I want to be there for you, both of you, every step of the way, however you need me. I love you and if you feel the way I know you do about me we would be fools to not at least try to figure this out, right?” 

Agatha closed her eyes for a brief moment and searched for any reason left to deny what was all too clear at this point, but all she found was peace. Even her son had once again stilled his movements within her. They had been drawn together by fate, by destiny, perfectly formed to meet in this moment, two halves of a whole, finally finding each other again. She looked back into Rio’s searching gaze, her amber eyes filled with love and hope. Cautiously, Agatha raised a hand to the table and let her fingers settle in Rio’s palm. Rio’s words, her lingering touch as she held her hand atop the table dissolved the last of the fear Agatha had been holding onto. All that was left was the radiating warmth that Rio was pouring into her. A full, consuming love that she could no longer resist. 

“You’re right” she breathed

 

“I am?” Rio gleamed with a cautious smile

 

“If this is really what you want?” Agatha emphasized

 

“More than anything! Is…is this what you want?” Rio held her breath awaiting the final confirmation.

 

Agatha looked down as she felt a nudge in the stillness. “I think we both do.” she chuckled. 

 

“Is that so?” Rio asked as her smile broke free, relieved that she had at last overcome Agatha’s self-induced hurdles. 

 

“He was being a menace all morning but has settled quite a bit since we’ve been talking. He did this earlier in the car too and it scared the shit out of me! For a second I thought something was wrong.” she chuckled

 

“Why didn’t you say anything?” Rio asked, eyebrows stitched with concern.

 

“It happened so quickly, just a flash of panic. It wasn’t really anything to worry about, I was…overthinking.” She waved her hand dismissively. 

 

“I’m glad, just try and clue me in in the future, even if you think it’s nothing to worry about. That’s part of my job now, to help make sure everything is ok.” Rio chuckled as she rubbed soothing circles on the back of Agatha’s hand with her thumb. 

 

“I’ll try to keep that in mind.” Agatha snickered as she took a sip of her drink then grimaced, remembering it contained ginger as soon as the liquid hit her tongue. “Would this job of yours happen to include going to doctor's appointments?” she half-joked

 

“Seriously?” Rio’s eyes grew wide in disbelief

 

“If you’re up for it, that is. It would be nice to have some company that isn’t Jen.”

 

“I… I would be honored!” Rio gasped dramatically, throwing a hand to her chest. “When?! When’s your next appointment? I’ll make sure to be there!”

 

“I think…” Agatha began to dig around in her purse for her phone. “Ugh! I can never find anything in this damn purse!”

 

“What are you looking for?” 

 

“My phone, I can’t remember if it’s next Wednesday or Thursday.” 

 

“This phone?” Rio asked, picking up the device that had been just beside her glass. 

 

Agatha groaned in frustration as she took the phone from Rio. “Yes, thank you. Thursday, this coming Thursday at one.”

 

“I’ll be there! Would you want to grab a bite beforehand?” 

 

“I don’t know if I’ll have time. I have a planning meeting until 12:30 and was going to head out after that.”

 

“What if I pick you up? Bring you something to eat?” Rio offered

 

“Ugh, that would be amazing! I was trying to figure out how to eat lunch at some point during that day!”

 

“Anything for you, my love!” She raised Agatha’s hand to her lips and pressed a kiss to her knuckles. “I know we both just devoured those burgers, but I could really go for some ice cream right about now and I may or may not have spotted a shop on the corner. You up for it?” Rio asked enticingly 

 

“Ice cream?” Agatha huffed a laugh as she felt an insistent nudge flutter under her ribs. “I think I could find some room for ice cream.” 

 

—----------------------------------

 

The week had started rough, as Agatha had anticipated. Early Monday morning she said a teary goodbye to Ralph as he finally set off for his next contract. To show her appreciation she had sent him on his way with a new set of luggage and a pair of noise canceling headphones for the journey. It couldn’t begin to cover all he had done for her but it was something, a small token of her appreciation. 

When she arrived at work she had been greeted with a hushed intensity as people hovered in groups sharing ominous whispers. She quickly learned, after interrogating Sharon, that Freddy had returned early that morning only to clean out his desk. Upon learning the sordid details of the affair, Herb along with HR had found his indiscretions irredeemable, and terminated his employment. When she had blurted out their secret relationship in anger she hadn’t expected it would lead to this. On one hand she was glad to be rid of the irritating pestilence of Freddy’s presence, on the other she and Herb were now stuck with the tasks he had been assigned for Mayfest, at least until they could figure out another solution. This meant another long week laden with meetings that all carried an undertone of anger and frustration. 

 

With all this going on she was growing more grateful by the day that Rio was back in her life. Though she had been hesitant at first to rekindle their relationship, Rio was already showing just how devoted she was to making this work, despite her own hectic schedule. Rio had returned to work that Sunday but made sure to check in throughout each day. Knowing Monday would be stressful, she planned her break to meet Agatha for dinner after work and let her rant about the seemingly insurmountable tasks she was now undertaking. They quickly fell into a familiar routine. Though Agatha was usually stuck in one meeting or another, Rio would stop by, schmooze with Sharon and deliver some sort of treat for Agatha on her way to work. She returned to leaving Agatha voice memos when she got off in the wee hours of the morning telling her about her day, how much she couldn’t wait to see her, and how much she couldn’t wait for Thursday. 

 

When the day finally arrived Agatha found herself cautiously optimistic about the appointment at hand. Though Jen had been kind enough to accompany her previously it had done nothing to quell the anticipatory anxiety of the check ups. In truth she dreaded these days. They always brought back memories of her miscarriage and she would hold her breath each time they dimmed the lights and turned on the ultrasound. She couldn’t help the fears that would hover in the back of her mind. Would this be the time it would all fall apart? Would they tell her he's gone? Or that something was horribly wrong? Then the sound of his heartbeat would echo out into the room, strong, steady, full of life. Only then would she allow herself to glance at the screen and finally breathe a sigh of relief at the impossible miracle growing inside her. The emotional rollercoaster this set her on was exhausting and given the week she was enduring she was relieved that Rio would be there. Her warm, grounding presence and abundant joy at having been asked to join was catching and Agatha couldn’t help but feel a bit excited as she headed into work that day. 

 

The morning had been tedious. She and Herb had interviewed several potential replacements for Freddy, yet none seemed to quite fit the bill, especially with the relatively limited time frame they had. After the fifth objectively unfit candidate Agatha had had enough. 

 

“I swear if I have to sit and listen to one more person walk me through their TikTok strategies I’m going to scream! Herb, this is not what I signed up for!” She leaned back in the uncomfortably stiff armchair she had been sitting in for nearly two hours at this point and brought her hands up to rub at her temples. Her head was beginning to ache, her back twinged in discomfort, and her son was inconveniently perched on top of her bladder. She was at the end of her rope.

 

“I know! I’m sorry!” Herb groaned as he returned to the seat next to her. “I figured this might be difficult but not damn near impossible. I wouldn’t trust most of these people to run a dishwasher let alone our marketing campaign.” He slammed the folder of resumes he was holding down on the coffee table in front of them, and tossed his head against the back of the chair letting out a heavy sigh. “You know, I seriously considered waiting until after Mayfest to fire him.”

 

“Why didn’t you?” Agatha groaned through gritted teeth.

 

“Well, after HR sent me the footage I really had no choice.” He dropped his hands to his lap as he sat up further. 

 

“Footage?” She turned her head, eyebrow hitched in disgusted curiosity.

 

“Oh yeah!” Herb chuckled “Not sure that I should really be sharing this but I know you can be discreet.” She sat up slowly, the air growing thick with suspense. “There were several incidents captured on our security cameras. If they had just been able to keep it off the premises he likely would have kept his job, but that was” His eyes flashed wide as he remembered the disturbing footage “fireable…to say the least.” 

 

Agatha’s mouth hung open as her nose scrunched in revulsion. “UGH! They were doing it here?!” she screeched

 

“I know right? I don’t think I’ve ever been more appalled at someone’s behavior. I had to have a hazmat cleaning crew come in this past weekend to sanitize everything.”

 

“Is that why this place has been reeking of lemons and bleach?” 

 

“Oh yes! I had them clean top to bottom. I couldn’t bring myself to come in until that happened.” 

 

She stared off in horror for a moment before a disturbing thought entered her mind. “Where?” She murmured, unsure if she really wanted the answer to that question.

 

Herb’s eyebrows sprung in surprise as he bit his lip, seemingly considering how to answer. “Um…several…several locations.” He replied, his eyes darting around, avoiding her stare. 

 

“Herb, where?!” She insisted as a sinking feeling began to fill her chest. 

 

“You know…maybe it’s best if I don’t share all the details.”

 

“The conference room?” She couldn’t help but pry

 

“Trust me, you’ll appreciate the peace of mind!” he urged, hoping she would drop the line of questioning.

 

“Not in the theatres?!” She insisted

 

Herb let out a resigned sigh “It would be easier to ask where it didn’t happen.”

 

“Well not in here obviously!” she let out a chuckle which quickly dissipated as she caught Herb’s lack of amusement. Her eyes scanned the room gleaning with horror as she quickly sat up, removing as much of herself from the surfaces around her as she could. 

 

“Don’t worry, they did the upholstery too.”  He huffed in amusement, seeing her disgust. 

 

“You’re right, maybe I don’t want to know! I knew they’d been having an affair, I didn’t realize…” she trailed off as she tried to block the images that were coming to mind.

 

“Yeah, how did you know they were together?” Herb hunched over, leaning further in her direction.

 

“How did you not?!” She scoffed “They were far too familiar to not be exploring each other's bodies! I figured it was inappropriate given their relative…positions. I had no idea any of that was happening!” 

 

“I wish it hadn’t been happening! Then I wouldn’t have to be interviewing marketing managers while we should be planning for the biggest event we’ve ever hosted!”

 

“Well, do we have to hire someone now?” She whined in exhaustion. 

 

“I don’t know that we have another option!” Herb threw up his hand in surrender

 

“We could outsource it? Hire an agency for this event, then hire someone on a more permanent basis after this is all over.”

 

“Our budget may be larger this year but I don’t know that it could accommodate an agency.”

 

“Let me talk with finance, see where we’re netting out so far, we may have more wiggle room than we think, particularly since we won’t be paying a marketing manager for the next couple of months. If there is a gap I can reach out to some of my contacts, see who needs an early break on their taxes. I’d rather spend my time figuring that out than interviewing dozens more people.” 

 

“Eh, you’re probably right. We still have a couple interviews scheduled for this afternoon. I’m happy to take them just in case one of them is a good fit. Why don’t you focus on sorting that out versus sitting in.”

 

“Good plan! I bet I could have this figured out by tomorrow.” She bragged as she pulled herself from the chair. 

 

“I wouldn’t put it past you.” Herb beamed “You headed out?”

 

“Yeah, I have my appointment at one, I should be back by 2:30 at the latest.” She assured as she made her way to the door. 

 

“Do what you need to do. I’ll see you whenever you get back.” he said as he waved her off.

 

—-------------------------------------------------------

 

Rio had been giddy for the day since she had woken up early that morning. The whole week had led up to this. Agatha had granted her the opportunity to go with her to the obstetrics appointment and it felt like Christmas. She was going to get to see the child she had been worrying about for the better part of the last month and a half and the day couldn’t go by fast enough. So, she took herself on a long run, worked out vigorously in the school gym, got ready, did her laundry, cleaned her room and the kitchen all in an effort to make the time go by faster. 

In the end she had planned it out perfectly, walking through the administrative doors at exactly 12:30. She strode down the long hallway, a bounce in her step as she rounded the corner and sidled up to Sharon’s desk.

 

“There she is! How’s it going Sharon?” She greeted jovially, unwilling and unable to hide her enthusiasm. 

 

“Oh hi honey! Well don’t you look spiffy today!” Sharon praised as she stood to greet Rio.

 

“Big day Sharon! I had to look my best!” She turned in place modeling the outfit she had picked out. High waisted bell bottom jeans with a fitted black top tucked away under a cropped green blazer. Sleek, but casual enough to be comfortable. 

 

“Well you certainly do! Are you excited?”

 

“You have no idea! You’d think I was the one having the baby!” That got a chuckle out of Sharon. “How’s she doing today?’

 

“To be honest I haven’t seen much of her. She’s been in interviews with Herb all morning. I don’t think it’s going well.” 

 

“Is that for Freddy’s role?”

“Through the grapevine, of course! Aha-ha” Sharon chuckled. “Ah Ms. Harkness! I was just about to come grab you. How’d the interviews go?”

“Hello, Cariño!” Rio beamed as she took Agatha’s hand and placed a kiss to her knuckles. “Are you ready?”

A familiar panic was already pressing into her chest as she sorted through the bag of food Rio had brought her. 

 

“Hope I got the right thing. I went to that sandwich place you like. Made sure to grab an extra pickle.” Rio flashed her a caring smile as she turned onto the next street.

“That’s what I said! If I didn’t like that man before I fucking despise him now! What kind of disgusting pervert does that?!”

“Of course! I always strive to provide elite service. It’s why I'm rated five stars in the app.” Rio replied with the utmost sincerity.

“Let me see your phone.” Agatha handed over the phone and watched Rio suspiciously as she tapped away.

 

“Here!” She turned the device around to reveal she had added five green stars after her name in Agatha’s contacts. 

 

This tickled Agatha to the point that she was snorting laughing. “That is so stupid! Rio, on the other hand, was pacing in the corner, her body unable to contain the nervous excitement she held. 

 

“You’re going to wear a hole in the floor if you keep pacing like that.” Agatha huffed as she picked at her nail beds. 

 

Rio stopped her pacing abruptly. “Sorry, just a bit nervous.”

 

“ You’re nervous? What for?” Agatha scoffed

“I don’t know. This kind of feels like a big moment, like I’m meeting him for the first time, ya know.” Rio shrugged

“Oh! Dr. Vidal! What a pleasant surprise!” 

 

“Dr. Allen! Good to see you again.” Rio greeted with a tentative wave.

 

“Of course you two know each other! I should have figured.” Agatha rolled her eyes

Her lips held a restrained smirk, as if trying and failing to mask the excitement that was electrifying every cell in her body.
