“We doing this thing or are y’all just going to stand there with your thumbs up your asses? Let’s go!” Chad hollered from the other end of the court. 

 

“Dude, chill! We’re waiting for Darren to get back from the bathroom then we’re ready to go!” Marco shouted back. 

 

“Fuck, I can’t wait to wipe that stupid smirk off his face!” Yelena growled. 

 

“Glad to see you’re getting into it!” Alice chuckled as she patted Yelena on the shoulder. 

 

“Nothing gets me fired up quite like putting an asshole in his place!” Yelena huffed

 

“Damn man, took you long enough!” Marco chided as Darren, a tall slender man with dark curly hair, a shirt that was almost too big and shorts that were almost too small, jogged over from the locker room. 

 

“Sorry man! I had business to take care of! We ready to do this? Whose tipping off?” 

 

“I’m happy to start. Maybe it’ll lull him into a false sense of security.” Marco offered

 

“Heh, one can only hope!” Rio snickered as they all made their way onto the court. 

 

“Finally! I thought we were gonna have to take the win on default since y’all can’t seem to get your shit together.” Chad guffawed as he sidled up to center court to face Marco. “What? We’re none of you ladies brave enough to tip off against me?”

 

“Shut the fuck up and let’s play!” Marco said as he bounced the ball to Chad which he returned to start the game. 

 

Marco dribbled the ball down the court with Rio and Alice flanking him on either side. Yelena and Darren followed closely behind while Chad did his best to block and steal the ball. As they neared the basket Marco faked veering left and snuck around Chad to pass the ball to Alice who immediately passed to Yelena to sink the first basket. 

 

“Just a bunch of girls huh?” Rio taunted as she passed Chad on the way to guard one of his teammates. 

 

“Lucky shot!” He growled as he chucked the ball at an open teammate. They all barreled down to the other end of the court, all the while Chad was dictating the moves his teammates should throw. As they neared the other basket they made an attempt to throw the ball to Chad who fumbled it, giving Darren a chance to steal. As they husseled to the other end of the court Chad berated them for the terrible throw and he positioned himself in front of Darren who managed to sneak a pass to Rio who took the shot. 

 

“Better get your team together Chad they’re looking a little slow!” Alice shouted as she backed up to defend. 

 

Chad’s face grew red with embarrassment and rage, “Enjoy it now, girlypop, that’s the last one y’all are gonna get!” He shouted back as he launched the ball viciously at another teammate. Now, more determined than ever, Chad rushed to the other end of the court and begged to be passed the ball. Reluctantly his teammate passed him the ball and he was able to score the first shot for his team. “Haha! Suck on that” he gloated as me moved to guard Darren. 

 

Marco stepped out and threw the ball to Alice who bolted to the other end of the court with Chad’s teammate struggling to keep up. Just as she positioned herself to take the shot Chad appeared before the hoop with a furious determination in his eye. “Not this time princess!” he growled as he blocked nearly every vantage point with his massive form. Suddenly out of the corner of her eye, Alice caught a glimpse of Yelena open. She charged forward as if she was ready to shoot and as she jumped she threw the ball to Yelena instead who made the shot. 

 

“That’s what I’m talking about!” Marco shouted, clapping with joy as he jogged over to give each of them a high five. 

 

Chad shook with rage as he stormed over to berate his teammate about his poor defense. “Where the hell were you? She’s like 5 feet tall, you should have had that! Get it the fuck together Mark!” He shouted before storming off to grab the ball. 

 

“Gotta get your head in the game man! You’re four points behind!” Rio chuckled as she moved to guard Mike. Chad shot her a scathing glare as he launched the ball to his teammate and hustled down the court. They passed the ball back and forth between them, narrowly missing a steal from Darren before making a 2 point shot. “Good shot Tom, good shot!” Chad called as he positioned himself in front of Rio. “Only two points now bitch! Enjoy your lead while it lasts.” 

Rio scoffed but said nothing as she raced down the court. Darren had the ball and shot it to Yelena who passed it over to Marco. He tried his best to shuffle around Tom who eventually stole the ball and bolted for the other end of the court though Alice was right on his heals. He tried to dodge around her to make the basket but she was relentless and held him off until the rest of the team had made it to their end of the court. Eventually he managed to pass around her to Chad who quickly sunk another 2 points. 

 

“Good hustle Alice, we’ll get ‘em next time!” Darren called out as he grabbed the ball.  

 

“Fat chance!” Chad snickered as he highfived Tom. 

 

“Alright, last round then we’re taking a break!” Marco called as he grabbed the ball.

 

“Ohhh, y’all getting tired already? We’re just getting started!” Chad pouted tauntingly. 

 

Marco rolled his eyes then launched the ball to Alice who rushed it to the other end of the court. She quickly passed it to Darren who was caught up by Tom so he threw it to Rio who was wide open. She positioned herself for a clear 2 point shot and just as she jumped to launch the ball she was pummeled by Chad who threw her off balance on the landing and she crumpled to the floor. 

 

“Not cool man!” Marco yelled as he pushed Chad out of the way. 

 

“Woah, Rio! Are you ok?” Yelena shouted as she and Alice rushed to her side. 

 

Rio sat up slowly. She could feel her elbow throbbing where it had hit the gym floor, but that was nothing compared to the pain in her knee. She stretched it out slowly but could already feel it starting to swell. “Yeah, I think I’m fine” She replied, not wanting to let on how much pain she was in. She reached a hand up to let Yelena pull her to her feet but just as she put weight on her right leg she yelped in pain as her knee gave way beneath her and Yelena and Marco quickly grabbed her.

 

“That doesn’t sound fine!” Alice chided as they guided her to a nearby bench. 

 

“You really couldn’t help yourself could you!” Darren scolded Chad as the rest of them followed to see how she was.

 

“I told her she had no business playing! This is the kind of shit that happens so if you can’t handle it then stay off the court.” Chad replied defensively

 

“Asshole, you fouled her! The same thing would have happened to me if your fat body had slammed into me like that!”  Darren yelled back. 

 

“How’s it looking?” Chad asked as Yelena inspected the injury. 

 

“There’s already some swelling and she can’t walk. It’s not looking good.” She replied as she pressed on Rio’s knee. “Does that hurt?” 

 

Rio bit her lip as she winced in pain. “NO, no, not at all.” 

 

Yelena glared at her skeptically. “We need to take you to the hospital.”

 

“Come on! I’m sure it’ll be fine if we get some ice on it. It’s nothing.” Rio brushed it off and slowly moved her foot to the ground before trying and failing to stand again.

 

“Rio! You probably tore something. We need to go get it checked out!” Yelena scolded 

 

“Ugh, you’re not going to let this go are you?” Rio groaned

 

“Heh, absolutely not!” She confirmed as she tucked herself under Rio’s arm and helped her to her good leg. 

 

“I’ll go pull my car around and meet you at this side door.” Alice said as she rushed out of the gym.

 

“Well I guess that’s game then!” Marco sighed as he slid around to support Rio’s other side. 

 

“Seriously! You guys are forfeiting?” Chad groaned

 

“Forfeit what? We won, she made the shot.” Darren chuckled.

 

“No fucking way! You can’t claim that as a win!” Chad shouted, his face turning redder than a beet. 

 

“Face it, we won fair and square. Maybe if you hadn’t body checked her you would’ve had a chance at a comeback but too late for that now.” Darren chuckled

 

“NO! Y’all are just making up excuses now! That’s a forfeit! We still have the winning streak!” Chad protested

 

“You can tell yourself that if it’ll make you feel better but we all know the truth. You lost to a bunch of girls, again.” Rio sneered as they passed by Chad on their way out the door.

 

“I didn’t lose! We didn’t lose!” She could hear him shouting frantically as the door closed behind them.

 

With Alice already waiting for them, Yelena and Marco helped Rio into the back of her car before Yelena joined them in the front passenger seat. 

 

“You gonna be alright Vidal?” Marco asked as she adjusted to get comfortable.

 

“Oh yeah, I’ll be fine. I’m sure it’s nothing and you’ll see me back next week.” She reassured as Yelena and Alice turned to glare at her disapprovingly. 

 

“Alright! If you get the all clear I’m holding you to it!” He chuckled as he shut the door. “Mind if I give you my number so you can let me know how she’s really doing?” 

 

“Yeah, of course!” Alice said as she handed her phone out the window. 

 

“Do you want me to call Agatha and have her meet us there?” Yelena offered

 

“No!” Rio shouted “Absolutely not! This is the last thing she needs to be thinking about! We’ll figure out what’s going on and I’ll tell her this evening when I get home.” 

 

“Alright! Just thought I’d ask.” Yelena said as she threw up her hands in surrender. 


As they pulled away Rio sank further into the back seat and pressed her hands to her face. The pain in her knee was beginning to throb and grow hot with inflammation. She was furious with herself. How could she have let this happen? Agatha, when she did find out, would likely be irate and this was only going to cause more stress. For now all she could do was hope that it wasn’t as bad as it felt.

Chapter End Notes

I hate and love to make Rio suffer. She just has such a big heart. Also if you're wondering why it took so long, I had no business writing about basketball but it was necessary to the plot so hope it was worth it. Next chapter is the baby shower!

Chapter 26: Baby Shower

Chapter Summary

After Rio's injury Agatha and Rio have the baby shower

Chapter Notes

Surprise! Though it's probably the longest chapter yet it didn't take me a month to write! Enjoy the ride there's a couple surprises at the end.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

Agatha burst into her office again after another long and grueling day of festival planning. They were coming down to the wire with barely a week left and it felt like they had nothing together. The sets and art installations were still in pieces. Vendors had been calling and emailing her all day with stupid questions she had answered numerous times. The management company had been a huge help but they still needed her signature and approval every time they had to make an adjustment or add on to their existing plans. 

If that wasn’t enough her body was protesting the strenuous activity more and more each day. Her feet had swollen nearly beyond recognition to where she was only able to squeeze them into a certain pair of uncomfortable shoes. Her back and hips ached constantly with the added pressures of her growing son who stretched and pressed relentlessly on his ever more constricting enclosure. And then of course there were the false contractions which, just like Jen had warned, became more and more frequent. Sometimes they were a nuisance and other times they were down right debilitating. It all felt like too much and not enough and it was beginning to take a toll. 

 

As she closed the door behind her she strode over to collapse into her desk chair just as a particularly nasty false contraction washed over her. She rested her head against the back of the chair and closed her eyes as she breathed slowly and waited for it to pass. As the muscles began to release she guided her hand along the surface of her swollen belly, feeling her son shift under the release in pressure. 

“Sorry little bug! That was a rough one. You doing ok in there?” As she shifted her hand she felt a resounding kick just above her naval. “I know, but I’m afraid it’s only going to get worse before it gets better. You still have another month in there at least!” Gods, how could she survive another month of this? 

The only way this could possibly be bearable was Rio. The care she had shown, taking on everything around the house, keeping her fed, helping with her medication, and easing her discomforts as much as she possibly could. She was perfect and exactly what Agatha had needed, what they both needed, and she couldn’t help but wonder how her day had progressed since getting kicked out of the house that morning. 

 

She sat up slowly and reached for her phone for the first time since lunch, expecting to see a barrage of texts and missed phone calls, but as the screen illuminated it showed nothing but a few emails and random app notifications. Odd. Sure she had said to focus on anything but her and the baby for the day but she didn’t really expect radio silence. She frowned as she shot her a text. 

 

I’m wrapping up for the day my love. You’re free to return home whenever. I’m excited to hear how your day went. 

 

With that sent she gathered her things as quickly as she could and headed for the door clutching a few contracts she intended to pass off to Sharon on her way out. 

 

“Oh, are you headed home, dear?” Sharon said with that ever present sweetness to her voice. 

 

“Yes. Can you get these to the management company before you go? They’ll need to enter them into their system before tomorrow so I want to make sure they have what they need.” 

 

“Of course dear. Anything else I can help you with?” 

 

She quickly checked her phone, expecting the usual immediate response from Rio but again there was nothing. “Actually yes. Did Rio happen to stop by or call you today?”

 

“No dear, I haven't heard from her. Why is everything ok?” 

 

“Oh yes, I’m sure everything’s fine. She’s been tightly wound lately and I told her to take a day for herself. I just, I hadn’t heard anything from her so it must have been a good day I guess.” She shrugged though her face betrayed the concern she really had. “I’m sure she’s just out and about. She’s always up to something!” 

 

“I’m sure you’re right, dear!” Sharon replied with a comforting smile. “I’ll get the contracts taken care of, you head home and get some rest, you’ll need it before the walkthrough tomorrow.” 

 

“Tomorrow? I thought Herb had planned that for Monday.”

 

“Oh yes dear. It’s tomorrow and Monday. Tomorrow is for everything inside the hall, Monday is for the art installations, rear stage set up, and mural planning.” 

 

“Oh, lovely!” Agatha bit sarcastically “And what time does it start tomorrow? I’m supposed to have an appointment in the morning.”

 

“Oh I let him know, he was able to plan around it. It’s not scheduled until 10:30.” Sharon explained gleefully. 

 

“Well, thank you for that. I should be in by 10 at the latest but I’ll let you know if that changes.”

 

“Sounds good, dear! Say hi to Rio for me!” 

 

“Ok, see you tomorrow!” She waved to Sharon and then headed down to her car in the garage. 

 

After struggling to get situated, she checked her phone one last time for any sort of response from Rio but was met yet again with silence. She considered for a moment giving her a call but she was so exhausted she figured she could wait the 20 minutes it took to get home before ringing her. Besides, surely by then she’d have sent a reply. 

 

On the silent journey home she normally would have been running through her day in her mind, making a mental checklist of all she still had to follow up on. But as each minute passed she grew more and more concerned for Rio. This really wasn’t like her. Even when she worked at the hospital she was quick to respond. Or if she was going to be unavailable and in surgery she would send her a message and let her know ahead of time. Why hadn’t she called or at least let her know where she was? Was she in trouble? Had something happened? She quickly shook that thought from her mind. No, no, surely everything was fine. More than likely she had found a way to sneak back into the house and just didn’t want Agatha to know. She’d probably open the door and Rio would be there with dinner ready as a surprise. 

 

As she turned into her driveway these reassuring thoughts quickly vanished when Rio’s car was nowhere in sight. As she turned off her vehicle she could feel a cold pang of worry prickle down her spine. She reached for her phone again and, seeing it void of notifications, at last called Rio. The phone rang about five times before the voicemail picked up. 

 

“Hey, its Rio. You know how this works.”

 

BEEP

 

“Hey hon! I…uh…I just got home. Haven’t heard from you. Hope everything’s ok. Let me know where you’re at and when you’re planning to get back. Love you, see you soon.” 

 

She hung up the phone and stared at the blank screen as she sat in a nervous silence. She’s fine. Everything’s fine. Right? She bit her lip as she gathered her things and struggled to keep her mind from spiraling. What if something did happen? How would she know? Who would even call her? NO! She shook her head hard as she opened the door to her car. She wasn’t going to go there. Rio was probably out somewhere seeing a movie or more than likely shopping for the baby. She wasn’t going to worry herself just yet. 

 

She hoisted herself out of the vehicle and wandered up to her door. As she fumbled with the keys her mind couldn’t help but ponder on what Rio could be up to. Had she gone swimming and just wasn’t near her phone? Was she at the movies or rock climbing or something? She pushed her way into the empty dimly lit house. There was no music playing, no delicious smells wafting from the kitchen. Clearly Rio hadn’t snuck back in. Where was she?! As she stepped inside Scratchy chirped and ran to greet her, clearly relieved to have her home, and probably more so relieved that he wouldn’t have to go hunting for his next meal. 

 

She closed the door behind her and threw her bag down on the kitchen table. She waddled over to a stool and struggled to remove her shoes, barely able to bend over far enough to do so. She really wished Rio had been here to help her with this and was seriously regretting having thrown her out this morning. With her aching feet now somewhat relieved having been sprung from their prison, she eased her way over to inspect the fridge. Rio had done too good of a job cleaning up. There were hardly any leftovers and most of the ingredients needed to be made into something and she was in no mood to attempt to cook. She grabbed a box of dates and fished out a package of nuts and set them on the counter to nibble on as she fetched food for Scratchy. 

 

With the beast satiated she grabbed what was left of her snack and headed to the bedroom to change into more comfortable clothes. As she began to strip she removed her phone from her pocket and threw it onto the bed. She held her breath as the Home Screen illuminated but there was still no sign of Rio. She slipped as quickly as she could into joggers and a large T-shirt and picked up the phone to call Rio again. 

The phone rang, and rang, and rang. 

 

“Hey it’s Rio. You know how this works.” 

 

BEEP

 

“Rio, sweetheart, it’s nearing dinner time. I’d love for you to come home! I’m thinking of ordering in, maybe Indian food? You certainly don’t want me cooking again. I’m going to place the order when I hang up and it should be here within 45 mins. I better see you or hear from you before then. Love you!” 

 

She hung up and stared at her phone again, begging for it to ring with a call from Rio. Nothing. Silence. She let out a huff of frustration and disappointment and marched out to the kitchen to snatch the menu to the local Indian restaurant off the fridge. She angrily and hungrily chose an assortment of items and called and placed an order for delivery. She had given herself 45 minutes before she could rightfully begin to lose her mind. In the meantime she did what she could to distract herself. 

 

She decided to take a page out of Ralph’s book and flipped on Real Housewives of Salt Lake City, figuring watching someone else’s drama might distract her from her own. She grabbed her phone and set it on the coffee table just in case Rio did call, and then slid onto the floor as best she could to stretch out a bit. 

 

One episode bled into another and before long there was a knock at the door. She quickly paused the show and heaved herself from the floor as she hurried to the door. She took a breath as her hand gripped the door handle and she swung the door open. Immediately her heart sank. She had half expected Rio but instead was met by a 20 something stoner whose arms were filled with the three bags of food she had managed to order. She took the food from him, slamming the door closed behind her and rushed to set the food on the counter. She immediately abandoned the meal and hurried to check her phone. 

 

Nothing. 

 

Something was up. Something was clearly up. She had to figure out something to do. Maybe if she rang Lilia she would have an idea of where Rio was. She searched her phone for Lilia’s number and gave her a call. After the third ring she heard the phone pick up. 

 

“You’ve called Calderu! If you’re trying to buy my home or calling about some sort of insurance you can hang up now.”

 

“Hey, Lilia, it’s Agatha.” 

 

“Agatha! Doll! How’s it going hon?”

 

“Um…alright. Have…have you seen or heard from Rio today?” 

 

“No, dear, can’t say I have. Is everything alright?” 

 

“I’m sure it is. It’s just, I haven’t heard from her since this morning.”

 

“Oh no, did something happen? Did you two get into a tiff?”

 

“No, not that at all. I told her she needed to take a break. Take a day for herself. I did, technically, kick her out of the house but I told her to come back for dinner. She hasn’t tried to call you or anything?” 

 

“No, not today. She’s probably off getting things for the party or somewhere watching a game. I…uh…I wouldn’t worry too much. Though do give me a call back if you don’t hear from her soon!” 

 

“A game! Right. Thanks Lilia, I'll let you know when I talk to her.” Agatha quickly hung up as the comment had sparked something in her memory. Maybe she had met up with Alice for a game! She searched her phone for Alice’s contact info and found nothing. She growled begrudgingly at herself for not getting Alice’s number at any point in their acquaintanceship and shifted to call Jen. 

She began to pace in and out of rooms as the phone rang twice before she heard Jen on the other end. 

 

“If you’re calling to ask me a gross question just know 1) you have 5 minutes and 2) if you’re not in labor we can talk about it on Saturday.”

 

“It’s not about any of that, Jennifer!”

 

“Well, my break’s almost over so you still only have 5 minutes.” 

 

“Whatever! Did Alice meet up with Rio today?” 

 

“How should I know?”

 

“Isn’t she your girlfriend?”

 

“Yeah but it’s not like I have her on a leash… most of the time.” 

 

“I did not need to know that! Look, I’m trying to find Rio, I haven’t heard from her all day and I need to see if Alice ended up with her at any point or might know where she’s at.”

 

“And you called me, why?” 

 

“I don’t have her number, obviously!” 

 

“How?! We’ve been together for like almost a year! We all hang out all the time! How do you not have her number by now?”

 

“I don’t know! It’s never come up before! Will you call her for me?”

 

“No! I’ll send you her number. I do not have the time or the patience to be playing operator! Good luck tracking Rio down. Next time just get her chipped or something.”

 

Jen ended the call abruptly leaving Agatha pacing around her room until her phone buzzed with Alice’s number. She immediately pressed it to dial and put the phone on speaker while she breathed deeply trying to stay calm. As the phone rang and rang and rang she could feel her son moving about, almost as if he was growing just as nervous as she was. Ring, Ring, Ring. She closed her eyes and started rubbing circles on her swollen belly urging him to relax. Ring, Ring. And just as she was about to hang up she heard the front door click and some voices shuffle into her living room. 

 

She rushed down the hall already shouting. “RIO VIDAL! That better be you! And you better have a damn good excuse as to …where…you’ve been.” She stopped suddenly as she rounded the corner to find Alice and Yelena helping a hobbling, braced, crutch stricken Rio to the couch. “Rio! What the fuck?!” She asked, mouth agape and eyes wide with confusion and horror. 

 

“Look! Look! There she is! I told you guys! Isn’t she the most beautiful, wonderful person you’ve ever seen?” Rio babbled, her eyes wide and heart shaped as Agatha walked closer. Then her face turned serious and she gasped, “It’s like she’s not even real! Like she’s an alien or something!”

 

“One of you two tell me what the fuck is going on! With a quickness!” Agatha snapped and pointed to Alice. 

 

“Heyyy, Agatha!” Alice breathed nervously 

 

“Oh, don't hey Agatha me! What the hell happened to my girlfriend?!” Agatha snapped

 

“Oh no! You have a girlfriend?” Rio sighed pitifully from the couch. 

 

“Yes, my love, you’re my girlfriend!” She huffed as she eased onto the couch next to the clearly inebriated Rio to get a better look at the damage. 

 

“Me?! You like me?” Rio blushed as she gathered Agatha’s hands in hers and held them close to her chest. 

 

“Most of the time. Right now I’m not so sure!” She chuckled as she pried a hand free to stroke a piece of Rio’s hair back away from her face. She had to admit it was hard to be too cross when she was this loopy. 

 

“Alright out with it!” Agatha commanded, once again turning her attention to Alice and Yelena. 

 

“So during the pick up game today…” Alice started 

 

“Ugh! What did she do?” Agatha breathed heavily as her eyes fluttered closed, trying with all her might to hold onto her last bit of patience. 

 

“Well it wasn’t really her exactly…” Yelena cut in. 

 

“Yeah, really it was this asshole Chad’s fault.” Alice expounded. “He kind of body slammed her when she jumped to make this shot and I guess she landed weird and then kind of crumpled to the ground.” 

 

“She fought us on it but we took her to the emergency room. Her knee was wicked swollen. I was worried she had ripped it to shreds. She couldn’t even stand!” Yelena explained

 

“Woah your hair is like the silkiest waterfall! It’s so soft and long and it’s everywhere!” Rio giggled in delight as she ran her fingers through Agatha’s hair. Agatha glanced down and with a tight smile removed Rio’s hands from her hair. 

 

“What did the doctors say?” She asked, picking up right where they left off as if she wasn’t dealing with an adult sized toddler. 

 

“She got lucky! It’s a pretty bad sprain, some mild tearing but they said they shouldn’t have to do surgery. She’ll just have to take it slow. Keep the brace on it. Ice it every few hours. Pain meds as needed. She’ll probably need the crutches for at least the next few days but she can walk on it again once all the swelling is down. Overall she’ll heal on her own. Could be 8-12 weeks though.” 

 

“8-12 weeks?!” Agatha gasped. “Oh perfect! Just what we needed! And why exactly is she like…this?” They all looked down to find Rio stroking her hands along Agatha’s stomach. 

 

“There’s someone in there!” Rio whispered as she stared intently at the bump. “Helloooo! How are you? What are you doing in there?” She half sung with somewhat of a French accent. 

 

Agatha sighed deeply as she rolled her eyes and chose to ignore whatever was happening to stare questioningly at Yelena and Alice. 

 

“So about that, bit of a funny story actually.” Yelena started. “At one point they did have to give her a mild sedative.” 

 

“For what?” Agatha groaned

 

“Well they needed to get a CT scan of the knee to see how bad the tear was and she has a thing about tight spaces and loud noises.” Yelena explained

 

“She does?” Agatha’s eyebrows arched in disbelief

 

“Oh yeah! She…uh…kind of started to have a panic attack so they offered her a mild sedative. Which helped but as you can see she’s very much a light weight when it comes to drugs. On top of that they gave her a couple oxy for the pain before we left so yeah, she’s on cloud 9 right now.” 

 

Rio began tapping at Agatha’s arm trying to get her attention. “Hey! Hey!!! Hey you!”

 

“Yes, dear?” Agatha replied, appeasing the request.

 

“You’re my girlfriend right?” Rio asked with a frown.

 

“Yes, my love.” Agatha sighed

 

“Then whose baby is this?” Rio asked, her face scrunched in confusion as she poked the bump.

 

“It’s our baby sweetheart.” Agatha explained as she rolled her eyes and brushed Rio’s hands off of her.

 

“WOAH! I did that?” Rio’s eyes bulged and she gasped in amazement as she stared in awe at her own hands. “I’m like a super lesbian! I’m too powerful!” She moved to try and sit up. “I must be stopped!” 

 

“No, my love, just relax. You’re perfectly mortal I’m afraid.” Agatha said as she guided her gently to lie back down. “And why didn’t I hear from any of you?! I was panicking and this close to heading out to look for her!” She scolded Alice and Yelena.

 

“I know! I know! I’m sorry! Rio begged us not to.” Alice explained. “She didn’t want us to worry you, said you were busy enough and didn’t need the added stress. Also she said she had texted you at some point.”

 

“She did not!” Agatha growled through gritted teeth. 

 

“Oh, well, super sorry about that! Really, I should have texted you!” Alice grimaced

 

“That’d be hard to do considering you don’t have my number.” Agatha snapped

 

“Yes I do.” Alice chuckled

 

“How? When did that happen?” 

 

“Jen gave it to me like a month after we started dating as like an emergency contact to call.” Alice shrugged

 

“Well then yes! You should have definitely called me as soon as they sedated her!! I was worried fucking sick!” Agatha groaned

 

“Well, she’s all in one piece and it could have been a lot worse.” Yelena shrugged. “She just has some pretty horrendous swelling right now which we should probably try and ice soon. Got any?” 

 

“Yeah, there’s a dispenser in the freezer and plastic bags in the drawer by the sink.” She instructed Yelena. “There should be some towels in the bottom drawer if you need it.” She added then turned back to Rio. “What am I going to do with you?!” She grumbled frustratedly as she squished her face between her hands. 

 

“A kisth…perhapths?” Rio managed to squeak out through squished cheeks as she closed her eyes and puckered her lips.

 

Agatha rolled her eyes and placed a peck on Rio’s forehead before moving to join Alice and Yelena in the kitchen. “I guess I should be thanking you both. I have to say I am a bit relieved she’s not dead in a ditch somewhere.”

 

“No! She’s alive and well, just high off her ass.” Yelena snorted as she fixed a bag of ice. 

 

“Are either of you hungry? I may have ordered way too much food in the midst of my panicking.” Agatha offered as she began to unpack the brown bags on the counter. 

 

“Starving actually! Thanks!” Alice said as she helped Agatha unpack the food. 

 

“Alright Vidal, I’m taking off this brace so we can ice your knee. It’s going to be cold but I need you to leave it on there for a bit, ok?” Yelena instructed 

 

“Aye aye, Mon Capitaine!” Rio saluted before gasping in shock at the cold. “AHHHH! I don’t like it!” Rio shook her head with a serious frown.

 

“Yeah, it might be uncomfortable for a bit but it’s not forever so try and tough it out.” Yelena chuckled

 

“Ok.” She grimaced. “Hey! Hey!” She whispered urgently to Yelena.  

 

“What’s up?”

 

“Any chance you can convince that pretty lady to come back and sit with me?” Rio giggled

 

“Agatha?” Yelena snorted “Yeah, I think I can do that. You want me to see if she’ll bring you some food too?” 

 

“AH! She has food? Fuck yeah!” Rio squeaked in delight

 

“Yeah, dude she’s got food. We’ll make you a plate.” Yelena replied as she returned to the kitchen. “She’s not going to remember shit tomorrow!” 

 

“I had no idea she was so sensitive!”

 

“Oh yeah, in med school she had to have her appendix taken out and she was so high on pain meds she thought she could read minds. Really she was just listening to Nat and me studying for finals.” Yelena chuckled 

 

“And where did the claustrophobia come from?” 

 

“That…well…she’s had that since the accident I think.” Yelena explained. 

 

“What accident?” Agatha asked, frowning in confusion. 

 

“Oh…I… I thought she told you about her mom and brother.” Yelena cringed in panic. 

 

“Well, yeah, kind of. She said they died in a car accident.” 

 

“Yeah, she was in the car too. I guess she was trapped with them for a couple hours before help came.”

 

“Fuck!” Alice gasped 

 

“Not sure if I was supposed to tell you that but yeah.”Yelena shrugged

 

“I…I had no idea!” Agatha gasped as she stared at Rio who was on the couch whistling and playing with her fingers. 

 

“She’s a tough cookie! If it were me they would have had to knock me all the way the fuck out. I honestly don’t know how she did it!” Yelena scoffed

 

“Hello? Who is this? Your voice is really tiny, I can’t see you!” They heard Rio’s voice shout from the couch.

 

“Oh, shit!” Agatha gasped as she dropped her plates on the counter to go take her phone from Rio. “Sweetheart, here, give me the phone!” 

 

“Yes please, I have no idea what they’re saying!” She replied as she handed her the phone upside down.

 

“Hello?”

 

“I take it you found her?” Lilia’s voice laughed on the other end of the line.

 

“Oh, hey Lilia. Yeah, she stumbled in with Yelena and Alice about half an hour ago.”

 

“Is she drunk?”

 

“No, actually, she was in the emergency room.”

 

“What?! Is everything ok?”

 

“Yeah, she’s fine, just a bad sprain apparently. They have her pretty drugged up.” 

 

“Oh boy! It doesn’t take much with that one. Do you need any help?”

 

“Maybe tomorrow. I don’t know how she’s going to feel in the morning. Right now I still have Alice and Yelena here. I’m gonna see if they can help me put her to bed in a bit.” 

 

“Alright, doll! Well, you let me know! I’m just a phone call away!”

 

“Thanks, Lilia, I appreciate that. I’ll talk to you tomorrow at some point.” She hung up the phone and went back to plating dinner. “You guys don’t mind, do you? After we eat we can try and put her to bed.”

 

“Oh, of course! Wouldn’t want you to have to try and manage her while she’s in this state! Who knows what would happen!” Yelena laughed as she took her food over to sit in the living room.

 

“I can’t even begin to imagine! Ugh! Lilia just made me realize I don’t know what I’m going to do with her tomorrow! Clearly she’s not going anywhere, but I have an appointment in the morning and another gloriously packed schedule at work. I don’t know that I’d have time to come check on her.”

 

“Don’t worry about it! I’m happy to manage the invalid for you!” Yelena beamed through a mouthful of food.

 

“Really? You don’t mind?” Agatha asked as she settled back on the couch next to Rio.

 

“Of course not! I was planning on hanging with her anyway, that’s why I came up a day early. Also, to help with the party.” Yelena shrugged  

 

“Oh, shit! I forgot about the party! There’s no way that’s happening now!” Agatha gleamed with excitement.

 

“We’re having a party?” Rio asked as Agatha handed her a plate of food.

 

“No, sweetheart, we’re canceling the party.” Agatha explained

 

“What? No party? But why?” Rio’s eyes grew wide as her lower lip jutted out in a pout.

 

“You injured yourself, hon, you shouldn’t be dealing with a party!” Agatha replied, trying to sound more disappointed than she actually was. 

 

“Oh, but I love parties! Please! Please, can we still have the party?” She begged as her eyes grew glassy with tears.

 

“I’m going to say yes because you probably won’t remember this and I don’t want to deal with you being upset right now.” Agatha huffed

 

“Yes to the party?” Rio sniffled to which Agatha nodded and waved her hand as she took a bite of food. “YAY! We’re having a party! Are you guys gonna come?” she asked, turning to Alice and Yelena.

 

“Oh absolutely dude! It’s gonna be a blast!” Yelena snickered

 

“Wouldn’t miss it!” Alice chuckled



Nearly an hour later, once their plates had been cleared and Rio was half passed out, leaning against Agatha, Alice and Yelena helped her to bed and said their goodbyes. As Agatha put away the leftovers and cleaned off the counters she could feel her son also settling in for the night as he turned and stretched inside her. “Not quite the night we had planned, huh little bug?” she cooed as she turned off the lights. She took a few steps down the hallway toward the bedroom and then she felt it, a quiet pressure that rippled from the top of her stomach down and settled into her lower back as it grew in intensity. She latched on to the door frame of the hall bathroom and breathed in deeply through her nose and out through her mouth until the pain passed. As she felt the grip of the contraction begin to lessen she pushed herself free from the doorway and stood, cradling her belly. “Oooo, that was a doozy! I did not like that! How about you bug?” She felt a small shift as she continued down the hallway. “We don’t need any more of that just yet! You still have a few weeks of cooking left to do.” She chuckled to herself though the pang of worry hung in her heart. 

 

She tried her best to shake it off as she pushed her way into the bedroom and slid into bed with a completely passed out Rio. She curled onto her side, snuggling her head into the crook of Rio’s neck and shoulder as she breathed in her intoxicating earthy fragrance. Almost immediately her worries were soothed and she quickly drifted off into a dreamless slumber.



—-----------------------------------------------------------



It was a light rustling and shuffling that first brought Rio into the waking world. She could hear someone moving about around her as her eyes became aware of the lightness in the room behind her eyelids. As she slowly cracked an eye open she began to feel a dull radiating pain that emanated from her right leg. She groaned as she stretched herself awake, feeling the stiffness pop and crack at her movements.

 

“Oh, good! You’re awake.” Agatha huffed as she crossed over to her while she affixed a pair of earrings. 

 

“What time is it?” Rio’s voice crackled with morning weariness

 

“Nearly 7:45. How are you feeling, my love?” Agatha asked as she slid on her watch. 

 

“Like I got hit by a bus. Wait, what day is it?”

 

“Friday, and I’m afraid I’m running late so we’ll have to make this quick. Yelena will be over by 8:30 to help with whatever you need. I’ll call you on my way to work and let you know how the appointment went. There’s a bottle of Ibuprofen and a glass of water on the nightstand, is there anything I can get you before I head out?”

 

“Hold on, give me a couple minutes, I’m going with you.” Rio insisted as she moved to sit at the edge of the bed. As soon as her leg swung out from under the blanket she hissed in pain.

 

“Absolutely not! You are taking some medicine and lying back down in that bed until Yelena gets here.” Agatha scolded as she grabbed the bottle of pills to hand Rio two. “Do you even realize what condition you’re in?” 

 

“I vaguely remember getting pummeled by some dickwad and going to the hospital. After that not so much. What’s the prognosis?”

 

“Bedrest, ice, and anti-inflamitories. So no, you’re not coming with me. You can’t walk, let alone drive, and I don’t have time to bring you back afterward. Which reminds me, you need to call everyone and cancel the party. Sooner rather than later.”

 

“Woah, wait! Why exactly are we canceling the party?” Rio asked as she wobbled to stand on her one good leg and hop over to grab her crutches.

 

“I think it’s pretty obvious, there’s no way you can manage throwing a party in your current condition.” Agatha huffed as she waddled into the closet.

 

“Agatha, it’s not like I lost a limb! I just twisted my knee.”

 

“Sprained your knee, dear. Tore a ligament. You’re in no position to throw a party!” She scolded as she returned with her one pair of shoes.

 

“Oh you’re just looking for any excuse not to have this!” Rio spat.

 

“True, I may not be as upset about that outcome as you are but you have to admit it’s for the best.” Agatha said as she struggled to put the shoes on. 

 

“I do not! I have plenty of people to help me! Nat and Hela are driving in tonight for it! We’re not canceling the party!” Rio protested

 

“Look I don’t really have time to fight you on this like I probably should so if you’re this adamant about still having it then fine, you do what you want.” Agatha snapped as she bolted out of the bedroom.

 

“Agatha! Wait! What’s wrong? Why are you so upset?” Rio called out as she hobbled after her.

 

“Heh, you can’t seriously be asking me that!” Agatha scoffed as she grabbed a yogurt and a banana from the kitchen.

 

“Look I’m sorry, it was an accident. I really didn’t mean to get hurt!” Rio groaned

 

Agatha laughed mirthlessly as she glared at Rio. “You think I’m mad because you hurt yourself?” 

 

“Well, yeah, I know it just made things 10x more stressful at the worst possible time.”  Rio replied as she diverted her gaze.

 

“You’re right, this is probably the worst possible timing for you to hurt yourself but that is not why I’m upset with you.” Agatha spat sternly

 

“It’s not?”

 

“NO! Do you have any idea how worried I was about you?!” Agatha shouted, leaving a silent void in her wake. 

 

Rio stood frozen on the spot as Agatha’s words hit her like a freight train. “I…I didn’t realize...” she dared herself to whisper in response.

 

“No shit! I didn’t hear from you all day! I texted you and called you and there was no response. I waited as patiently as I could but I knew something was up. And then of course my thought was where did she even go? Where would I try and go look for her? Who would even think to call me if…” She stalled her rant as tears of rage began to fill her eyes. “And clearly my fears were not unfounded. You were in the hospital and I’m told, instructed those around you not to contact me.” 

 

“I didn’t want to…” Rio began sheepishly

 

“Save it!” Agatha growled. “If you don’t want to worry me, or stress me out, you have to tell me what’s going on, even if it’s something you know I’m not going to like.” They stood in silence for a moment as Rio let the words sink in. “Did you really have a panic attack?” Agatha asked softly though her fury didn’t waver.

 

“What?” Rio’s eyes flashed in shock. 

 

“Yelena said you had a panic attack when they tried to do a CT scan and they had to sedate you.” Rio swallowed hard looking petrified. “Something about tight spaces and loud noises?”

 

“I…um…” she cleared her throat. “I don’t really remember but it…it sounds about right.” 

 

Agatha sighed, her blue eyes stormy with empathy and worry. “I wish you would have let me be there for you, the way you’ve been there for me.” 

 

Rio hung her head ashamed. “I’m sorry. I should have told you.” 

 

“Yes! You should have. Look, I’m not going to hold it over you. I’m glad you’re ok and it wasn’t anything more serious. Now please, do me a favor and rest, for the both of us! I’m hoping to be home by 6 but we’ll see how that goes.” Agatha grumbled as she gathered her keys. 

 

“I promise, I’ll take it easy. You try and do the same as much as you can.”

 

“I’ll do my best.” She pressed a quick kiss to Rio’s cheek before heading to the door. “Let me know how you’re doing throughout the day. Love you!” she said as the door closed quickly behind her.

 

“Love you too.” Rio muttered into the silence of the empty house. 



—-------------------------------------------



By 8:45 Agatha was seated on the stiff exam room table with her foot bouncing as she picked at her nail beds. The room felt hollow and ominous without Rio pacing about in excitement next to her. She chewed at the inside of her mouth as the many concerns she usually kept at bay were swarming her mind in the silence. Was everything alright? Was he still ok? Was the medication working? Were the Braxton hicks supposed to be that painful? She could feel her heart beginning to race as the minutes ticked by. Then, just as her thoughts were about to spiral further she heard a knock at the door. 

 

“Hey Agatha! Good to see you! How are you feeling?”

 

“A bit tired but alright otherwise.”

 

“Not too surprising. No Rio today? Did she get called in?” 

 

“Um, no, she somehow managed to injure herself playing basketball yesterday so she’s home healing and resting.” 

 

“Oh no! I hope it’s not anything too serious!”

 

“No, just a bad sprain. Hopefully she’ll bounce back quickly.” 

 

“For your sake I hope that’s the case! We’re getting down to the wire here aren’t we!” 

 

“It’s beginning to feel that way!” 

 

“So how’s everything else going? Any changes in movement? Any new aches or pains?”

 

“Oh, he's as active as ever, though definitely running out of room! I think just the usual aches and pains. Back, hips, feet, everything that moves really.” 

 

“That’s to be expected at this stage. What about Braxton hicks? Any changes there?” 

 

“Well Jen had warned me they’d be more frequent as I got closer but the last couple of days they’ve been pretty intense.” 

 

“When you say intense, what does that look like? Are you able to go about what you’re doing and it’s more of a moderate pain or is it stopping you in your tracks?” 

 

“More so the latter. There was one last night that nearly knocked the wind out of me, it was so nasty.” 

 

“Ok, good to know. Well we’ll take a look today and see where everything is.” She flashed Agatha a tight but reassuring smile. “Go ahead and lie back and I’ll get you measured.” Agatha laid back onto the table and exposed her swollen belly to the frigid exam room air as Dr. Allen stretched a tape measure along the surface. “Well I have you measuring a little behind at 32 but I can feel baby’s head right where my thumb is down here.” She pressed in slightly causing him to kick just behind her ribs eliciting a sharp breath in. “Oh! I felt that! He is feisty!” 

 

“You’re telling me!” Agatha groaned. “What does that mean exactly?”

 

“It could be any number of things. There are a few more things I’d like to check first, that way I can narrow it down and let you know if there’s anything we should be concerned about.” She took a brief glance at her chart before she continued. “Your blood pressure is looking good, it looks like the medication is working. Are you still monitoring that throughout the day?”

 

“Yes.”

 

“And how’s that been looking for you? Any spikes or has it been trending down?”

 

“It’s gone down for the most part but there are spikes here and there.” 

 

“Good to know. That’s not uncommon, as you’ve just started taking this medication. Just make sure to continue monitoring. It’s important to be aware of if it’s spiking during a specific time or in a specific situation, to see if something may be triggering it that we can mitigate. Other than that, keep doing what you’re doing there. If you’re ready we’ll go ahead and take a look at the little guy.” 

 

Agatha nodded as she braced herself for the gel. Before long she felt the familiar pressure of the ultrasound wand as her son’s steady heartbeat filled the room. She glanced over at the screen and saw bright and clear the details of his tiny face. He had his little hand tucked under his nose and was contentedly sucking his thumb. It was strange to see how much he’d grown and changed. He’d gone so quickly from this tiny, spindly, roughly human shaped form to now a fully formed, chubby little baby with her pointy dimpled chin. She could almost hear the comments Rio would be making. I swear he gets cuter every time we see him! Hey little guy! Not much longer and it’ll be my turn to hold you!

 

Dr. Allen clicked about for a moment, as Agatha admired him, taking different measurements and pictures, before she spoke again. 

“Alright, fluid is looking good, baby is measuring to be just about 4.5lbs which is on the low end but still within range of where we want him to be at this stage. We are definitely head down which, as long as he stays that way, should hopefully mean a pretty smooth delivery. I do want to go ahead and check your cervix, given you’ve had some changes in intensity with the contractions and then I can let you know where we’re at overall. Ok?” Dr. Allen explained as she helped Agatha sit up. 

 

“Yeah, of course, whatever you think is best.” Agatha agreed though she was not thrilled by the idea, particularly without Rio by her side.

 

“I’m gonna step out and grab another box of gloves, it looks like this room is out. If you wouldn't mind getting undressed the rest of the way. I’ll be back in just a few minutes.” And with the soft click of the door Agatha was alone again in the exam room. 

 

She let out a grunt as she slipped off the table. A large part of her was relieved at everything Dr. Allen had shared but she couldn’t help the flutter of nerves that had ignited at the realization of how quickly everything was progressing. Not long ago it had felt like she would never become a mother, that that chapter of her life had passed, and now she was weeks away from meeting the little life inside her and it was more terrifying than she could have anticipated. Even after all this time she didn’t feel ready, for contractions, for labor, for him. She hadn’t even decided on a name, didn’t have anything in his room ready, and yet time was racing by. 

As she slid off the pants she now regretted choosing that morning, her heart ached for Rio. Her calming yet exuberant presence was exactly what she craved to squash the fears and doubts looming in her mind. She would have known exactly what to say, exactly how to comfort and reassure her that everything would work out, that she was strong enough to face what would undoubtedly be the most difficult trial she had yet to encounter. As she settled back onto the table she considered for a brief moment calling her to sit in on the rest of the appointment, even just to hear her voice, but just as she was about to hop down again and grab her phone Dr. Allen returned with a knock at the door. 

 

“All set?” She greeted cheerily as she closed the door behind her. Agatha nodded briefly with silent anxiety. “Alright, you can go ahead and lie back down.” Dr. Allen instructed as she resumed her seat on the rolling stool. “You have any plans for this weekend?” She asked nonchalantly as she readied herself, catching Agatha a bit off guard. 

 

“I…um…yes actually, we’re…uh… supposed to have a baby shower tomorrow.” She replied as her gaze fixed on the ceiling tiles above her. 

 

“Oh how nice! That should be fun!” She said excitedly as she placed a hand on Agatha’s knee. “Ok, you’ll just feel a slight bit of pressure, just try and relax. Do you have a lot of friends and family coming?” 

 

Why was she trying to have a casual conversation right now?! “I…um…not sure.” Agatha’s mind warred as she struggled to hold her focus while Dr. Allen was exploring the depths of her nether regions. Gods, she wished Rio were here. “Rio planned the whole thing.” 

 

“Oh how sweet! So kind of a surprise party?”

 

“I guess…you could say that.” Agatha let out a breath as she felt Dr. Allen remove her hand. 

 

“Very good. Well I’m all set if you want to get comfortable and we can go over the results.” She snapped off her gloves and threw them in the trash as she rolled over to wash her hands. Agatha pried her legs from the stirrups and pushed herself to sit up. “So you are fully effaced and about 2 centimeters dilated.” Agatha could feel her stomach launch into her throat. “That’s likely due to those contractions you felt.” 

 

“So those were real?” Agatha muttered in shock

 

“It appears so.” Dr. Allen replied with unnerving ease.

 

“Sh…should I be concerned?” Agatha stuttered

 

“I’d be more cautious than concerned just yet. Given you’re somewhat of a high risk there is always a chance it could progress into preterm labor so we do want to avoid that if at all possible. This means limiting any strenuous activity, definitely no heavy lifting, staying off your feet as much as possible. Gravity isn’t really our friend right now. However, given the contractions aren’t consistent, you haven't quite dropped yet, and we’ve seen a decrease in your blood pressure I’m not terribly worried at this point. I’m not going to commit you to bedrest or anything but we do want to continue to monitor closely and make sure things don’t progress too quickly, and make sure those lungs have a chance to fully develop. That being said, I think we might meet the little guy before the end of May.”

 

Agatha’s heart dropped. “May is next week.”

 

“Yes.” Dr. Allen nodded with an amused smile.

 

“Isn’t that… wouldn’t that be too soon? I’m not due until June!” Agatha scoffed in disbelief.

 

“The due date is a rough estimate. Really there’s about a four week window, two weeks before, two weeks after that would be considered within the normal range. The goal is always to get to 37 weeks, which would put you about mid May. Really you’re getting that baby shower in just in time!” 

 

Agatha’s face drained of color as she let out a breath of a laugh. If she had thought her time was running out before, now it was as if the final grains of sand were circling the drain in the hour glass. She wasn’t ready! How could she be? There was still so much to do and of course she had her obligations to the festival. UGH! The fucking festival! She couldn’t afford to tap out early as the only person really holding the whole thing together. Sure Herb was there with the management company overseeing the big picture and Sharon had been a huge help in keeping things organized, but everything hinged on her plan, on her attention to detail as the weeks shifted from theme to theme. This was the last news she wanted to hear. 

 

“Is…is there anything I can do to make sure he holds off on his grand entrance until June? I’ve been working on this festival and May is just really not a good time for me!” 

 

“Ha! I don’t know that I’ve ever had a patient ask me that before! Usually they’re like, get this baby out of me!” Dr. Allen laughed as Agatha stared back at her in a panicked unease. “Oh, forgive me! Unfortunately, no, babies have their own timing, when he’s ready he’s ready. Now, I’m not saying you won’t make it to June, that’s still possible, but looking at where you’re at now it’s best to be prepared for sooner rather than later.”

 

Agatha let her eyes flutter closed as she tried to make peace with this news. “Great! That’s…that’s just fantastic!” she groaned sardonically as she brought up a hand to rub at her temple.

 

“I’m sorry if that wasn’t quite the answer you were looking for, it can be difficult to manage work responsibilities at this stage when the timing is a little uncertain. Would it be helpful for me to write a recommendation that you take some time off?” Dr. Allen offered

 

”NO! No, I can’t really afford to miss a day! Our entire future as an organization hinges on this next month being a success and that falls to me.” Agatha replied a little more harshly than she intended to.

 

Dr. Allen gazed at her with sympathetic concern. “That sounds like a lot of pressure.”

 

“A bit. I can handle it, just as long as no one makes any surprise appearances.” Agatha huffed, trying in vain to bring some levity to the topic.

 

“Well, I’m not here to tell you not to work but I do want to emphasize that unfortunately, much of this is out of your control and I would hope your work would understand that. Your health and your baby’s health has to take priority over anything happening there.” Dr. Allen insisted.

 

The directness of those statements cut her right to the core. It all was out of her control and that knowledge, that fear alone was almost more than she could bear so her mind fixated on the one thing she could control. “Right, of course. In the meantime…I’m fine to continue working, correct?” After all, what else could she do?

 

Dr. Allen cracked a concerned smile. “Yes, I don’t have a problem with you working, if you can appropriately manage the stress of it.” 

 

“Understood.” Agatha replied rather curtly, her nerves growing sharper by the minute.

 

“Do you have any other questions for me before I let you go?” Dr. Allen asked gently, seeing how all this had rattled her. 

 

Had Rio been here, there would have been a whole host of questions she’d ask. But here alone, under the weight of all she had been told, Agatha’s mind drew a blank. “No.”

 

“Very well! Then I’ll leave you to get dressed and I’ll see you back in a couple weeks.” Dr. Allen said on her way out the door. 

 

Agatha sat in the vacuum of silence, heavy in the wake of what could be. Excitement and hope lingered in the back of her mind but fear and doubt overshadowed them completely. Her gaze lingered on her bump as she watched his foot graze against the surface. “Please little bug, not too soon!”

 

—----------------------------------------------------

 

After a precarious and somewhat treacherous shower, Rio had made herself comfortable on the couch playing Zelda as she waited for Yelena to arrive. It was all she could do for the time being to distract herself from her uncomfortable conversation with Agatha that morning, her injury, and the fact that she was missing out on her appointment because of it. She had just been squashed flat by a Goron yet again when she heard a knock at the door. 

 

“It’s open!” She hollered towards the door as she reset herself in the game only to immediately be pummeled by the same Goron as she waited for the person to enter. “I SAID IT’S OPEN!” She shouted again.

 

“Dude, chill! I got my hands full!” Yelena snickered as she closed the door behind her. 

 

“FUCK!” Rio screamed in frustration as the beast squashed her yet again. 

 

“Not your day is it?” Yelena laughed as she put the bags she was carrying down on the kitchen table.

 

“You have no idea!” Rio grumbled as she reset herself once again.

 

“Why don’t we take a break?” Yelena suggested as she picked up the remote and turned off the TV.

 

“Hey! What the fuck? I almost had him that time!” Rio groaned in protest

 

“No you didn’t!” Yelena scoffed, “Sit up, I brought breakfast.”

 

“I’m not hungry.” she grumbled, refusing to move from her reclined position.

 

“I don’t believe that for one second! Have you eaten anything?”

 

“No.”

 

“Then you’re hungry, and pouting, which is pathetic by the way. Here” She tossed a burrito into Rio’s lap. “Eat!” 

 

Rio rolled her eyes as she moved to sit and slowly unwrap the burrito. She let out a heavy sigh and begrudgingly took a bite. Her eyes fluttered closed and she let out a moan as soon as the food hit her tongue, the warm, spicy, cheesy morsel hit her with a wave of comfort she hadn’t realized she needed. She immediately dove back in for a larger bite, and then another in a ravenous hunger.

 

“Good huh?” Yelena nodded with an I told you so kind of smirk on her face. 

 

“Ok, maybe I was hungrier than I thought.” She managed to spit out between bites.

 

“I knew you would be! How's the knee feeling?” 

 

“Like Chad’s gonna wish he was dead the next time I get ahold of him! Dude, it’s fucked! It’s like 3x its normal size.”

 

“Show me to me.” Yelena instructed as she set her food down on the coffee table.

 

Rio huffed as she finished off the first half of her burrito and adjusted herself to stand on her good leg. She tucked her thumbs into the waistband of her sweatpants and pushed them to the ground, practically falling on Yelena as she did so.

 

“Jeez! Thanks for the warning before you put your ass in my face!” Yelena exclaimed

 

“Oh grow up! Don’t act like it’s the first time you’ve seen it!” She growled as she turned her leg to face Yelena. “See!”

 

“Damn, you really got your ass beat! Have you been icing it?”

 

“hAvE yOu BeEn IcInG iT?” Rio mocked “What do you think?”

 

“Dude!” Yelena snapped at her. “Just doing my fucking job here man! I’m gonna need you to chill!” 

 

“Sorry.” Rio mumbled as she tugged her pants back up and threw herself back onto the couch. “UGH! I’m just so fucking pissed at myself right now! I fucked up everything!” 

 

“Yeah, I’m getting that, you’re pouting like a teenager, but you didn’t fuck anything up.”

 

“Bro, I’m hobbling around like a weeble wobble, I have so much shit to get together for Agatha’s party that she doesn’t even fucking want for some reason, she’s pissed at me because I didn’t say anything to her yesterday and though she won’t admit it I’m sure she’s pissed that I’m injured too, I was supposed to go to this fucking appointment with her this morning but instead I get to stay home worried sick about her and be a fucking couch warmer instead, and Chad can lick my sweaty, hairy, ballsack!” She sped through it all without hardly taking a breath. By the time she reached the end her body was nearly shaking with rage as her chest heaved, sucking in air. 

 

“Feel better?” Yelena asked calmly

 

“A bit yeah.” Rio huffed

 

“Good. Now it’s my turn.” Yelena said before taking a bite of food. “So you’re injured. It happens, nothing you can do about it now so sorry but get the fuck over it.” Rio stared at her blankly. “As for this party that Agatha doesn’t want.” Rio’s face scrunched into a frown. “Why the fuck are you having it then?”

 

“I wanted to do something nice for her and the baby. She’s been through so much, is constantly stressed, and I just wanted one day where she could be excited and feel supported. So she wasn’t going into this feeling like she’s alone, that she has to do everything on her own.” 

“As admirable as that may be…if she doesn’t want the party she’s not going to feel the things you want her to feel and it’s probably going to be overwhelming and stressful instead.”

 

Rio scrunched her face in consideration, “I guess I hadn’t really thought about it like that.”

 

Yelena snickered, “Of course you hadn’t. You love parties!” 

 

“I do love parties. Ugh!” Rio slapped her hands to her face “Then what the hell am I going to do? I can’t cancel it at this point!”

 

“You don’t have to. If you wanna throw a party for the baby fucking do it, just don’t involve Agatha. It sounds like that would not go over well. Maybe everyone can help you get the room ready instead. I took a look in there last night and that’s definitely going to take longer than you think. Especially with that bum leg of yours.” Yelena chuckled

 

Rio considered the proposal, realizing just how many of her problems that would actually solve. “You know, that idea's not half bad! Maybe I can tell her it got postponed, have Jen keep her occupied a little bit longer, have people come a little bit earlier. By the time she gets home everyone will be gone and everything’s ready for the baby.”

 

“I have a feeling she’d love that more than coming home to a bunch of people in her house.” Yelena shrugged

 

“Yeah, yeah that’s fucking brilliant! I knew we were friends for a reason!” She said, patting Yelena on the back.

 

“Haha, glad I could help. Now, with regards to her being pissed at you. I can’t say I blame her. She thought you got into a car wreck or something.” 

 

“I know! I should have just texted her when it happened. I was trying to avoid making her worry and stressing her out but it did just the opposite.” 

 

“Yeah, that tends to happen when you don’t communicate. Did you learn your lesson?”

 

”Yes.” Rio grumbled

 

”Did you apologize?”

 

”Yes.”

 

”Then there’s not much else to do but do better next time. And I doubt she’s mad that you’re hurt. If anything she’s just glad you’re alive.” Yelena replied with a caring smile.

 

“You know it’s really annoying how you seem to know exactly what to say to simultaneously make me feel like an asshole but also make me feel better.”

 

”What can I say? It’s a gift.” Yelena chuckled as she ate the last of her burrito. “What time was her appointment this morning?” 

 

“She had to be there by 8:30. Should be wrapping up soon. She did say she’d give me a call on her way to work to let me know how it went.” 

 

“See! All that griping for nothing! It’s all going to work out! If you’re finished with breakfast maybe I can grab you some ice and we can head in and get a start on unboxing all the shit in the baby’s room.” Yelena offered as she stood from the couch and headed into the kitchen.

 

“Yeah it’d be a good idea to get a headstart while I have you.” Rio pushed herself to standing and reached for her crutches. As soon as she had herself situated her phone began to ring on the coffee table. “Shit! It’s Agatha!” She threw the crutches to the floor and practically dove to answer the phone.

 

”Hey baby! How’d it go? How’s our little guy?” She cooed into the phone

 

”Hey, hon. It…uh…it went well. He’s…he’s as perfect as ever. How are you feeling? Did Yelena get there alright?”

 

”Yeah Yelena’s here, she's grabbing me some more ice. What did she say about your blood pressure? And the spikes? Any concern there?”

 

”She said it’s looking good, the spikes aren’t a concern because I just started taking the medicine but to still keep an eye on it. See if there’s anything triggering it that I can avoid if possible.”

 

”I can think of a couple things that should be on that list.” Rio mumbled into the phone.

 

”Oh don’t worry, dear, you’re right at the top!” Agatha snickered

 

“Haha, fair point but you know that’s not what I’m referring to.”

 

”I can only assume it’s festival related.” She could hear the unamused tension in Agatha’s voice.

 

”You said it, not me!”

 

”But you were thinking it and unfortunately sweetheart, like we’ve talked about before, it’s completely unavoidable! Especially now, I really can’t afford to miss any of the planning or execution otherwise this whole thing will fall apart.”

 

”Somehow I doubt that! I’m sure Herb can manage just fine without you!”

 

”You would think so. Fortunately they won’t have to worry, I’ll be there for it all!”

 

“Oh really? She cleared you to work?”

 

”Yes.”

 

”The entire festival?”

 

”As long as he stays put, yes.”

 

“Even though that’s like your primary stressor.” 

 

“Hardly!”

 

”Agatha! Were you completely honest with her? She knows how demanding this all is, right?”

 

”Sorry, my love, I’m having trouble hearing you, I just pulled into the garage.”

 

“Crazy, I can hear you just fine.” 

 

“It’s getting a little dicey! I’ll talk with you more when I get home!”

 

“Alright, have a good day! Try to take it easy! Love you!”

 

”Love you too!” And with a quick click Agatha hung up. 

 

Rio stared at the screen shaking her head in frustration before she threw her phone on the couch. 

 

“That sounded…reassuring.” Yelena smirked 

 

“Hardly! I swear she’s going to put me into an early grave.” 

 

“Eh, tit for tat with that one!” 

 

“What’s that supposed to mean?”

“Dude you practically gave her a heart attack yesterday!” 

 

“Fair enough.” Rio rolled her eyes as she grabbed her crutches from the floor. “Alright, let’s go get this room sorted before I start to spiral again.” 

 

“Ha! Alright, right behind you man.” 

 

—---------------------------------------------

It was nearly 8 by the time Rio heard Agatha’s car pull into the driveway. Two hours past the time she said she would be home and for the first time since Yelena had left earlier that afternoon she felt like she could breathe. 

 

They had managed to make a large dent in unboxing and organizing stuff in the baby’s room which had kept her mind occupied for most of the day but as soon as she was alone all her anxieties came rushing back. She had whittled away the first hour preparing dinner for when Agatha came home, hoping to ease her into relaxing after what surely must have been a draining and demanding day. But then the minutes ticked by. After about 30 minutes past she shot her a text. 

 

Miss you! Hope you’re doing alright! Scratchy and I can’t wait for you to come home. 

 

She paired it with a selfie of her on the couch and Scratchy snuggled tightly in the crook of her neck and shoulder. She threw on a show and waited, her hand never drifting far from her phone hoping for a response from Agatha to say she was on her way home. One episode passed and then another with no reply. Was she ok or was this just payback from the night before? Knowing Agatha it was likely petty retribution or worse she was indeed overworking herself and unable to reply. She decided to shoot her another text hoping it would spark some sort of response. 

 

Let me know when you’re headed home and I can heat up your dinner! 

 

Send. She waited and waited, growing more anxious by the second. Then just as she was about to call the headlights glared through the front window. Rio leapt up to turn off the tv and grab her crutches as she rushed to meet Agatha. 

As the door swung open Agatha stumbled in looking as if she might collapse from exhaustion and threw her bag to the ground beside the door. She padded over to Rio who was standing, leaning against the side of the couch and let herself be swallowed in Rio’s embrace. 

Rio cradled her close, burying her face in  a mess of waves and curls as she breathed in her intoxicatingly sweet fragrance. She could feel the weight of her fatigue as Agatha leaned into her completely, nearly knocking them both over onto the couch. 

 

“Cariño! Beloved! What do you need? What can I do for you?” She cooed as she stroked her fingers through Agatha’s hair and rubbed a hand along her back. 

 

“Put me into a coma until Monday morning when I have to go back.” Agatha groaned into her shoulder. “I don’t think I’ve ever been this exhausted before in my life!” 

 

“I would imagine not! It’s not like you’re doing anything terribly important like growing an entire human for instance!” Rio snickered

 

“Ha! Exactly! And if that weren’t enough I swear I work with a bunch of incompetent morons and I’m including Herb in that statement! That asshole can never just stick to a decision! I finally had to put my foot down and say we’re a week out, we’ve been debating these fucking displays for weeks as this point they’re going to be what they’re going to be we just need to agree where we want them and install them otherwise this is never going to come together in time!” 

 

“Is that what had you there so late?” 

 

“Partly. That meeting ran over and then we still had to connect with the management team on staff headcount and figure out how to add four additional vendor booths so they can start assembling everything this weekend. Sorry I didn’t text you back, I didn’t see them until I got home.”

 

“That’s alright, I’m just glad you’re here now. Are you hungry?” 

 

“Starving! They ordered pizza but it looked so greasy I knew it would just give me heartburn.” She mumbled, still clinging to Rio. 

 

“I made that lemon herbed chicken you like. With roasted potatoes and broccoli. You want some of that?” Rio offered as she squeezed her tight. 

 

“Fuck it’s like you’ve read my mind! I’ve been craving that all day!” Agatha gasped as she straightened herself and headed towards the kitchen. 

 

“No no! You sit down, I’ll get it for you!” Rio insisted as she rushed past her, hobbling with one crutch. 

 

“Rio, please, you don’t have to do that! I don’t want you to hurt yourself trying to do more than you should!” 

 

“Agatha sit! I’ve got this, you need to get off your feet.” Rio commanded, leaving no room for argument. 

 

Agatha slowly moved to the stool to slide off her shoes with a sigh of relief as she did so. She let her eyes flutter closed as she started to release the tension she had been holding through the day and let herself bask in the stillness, the peace, the soft shuffling and clattering as Rio heated up her food. She had managed to survive the week but just barely. After a moment she stood back up, her joints creaking in protest as she wandered over to lie on the couch. As soon as she sunk into the soft cushions she felt the last of the tension dissipate as her body for the first time that day felt at ease. The pressure and weight of her son released a bit as her weight shifted to her side and she could feel him roll to settle with the new positioning. Scratchy quickly joined her, finding his favorite spot above her bump and curling into her as he purred loudly, grateful for her return. She felt calm and tired, so tired as she breathed slowly, deeply. She fought to keep her eyes open as she stroked Scratchy's fur but it was a battle she was losing. She quickly slipped into that light semiconsciousness, still aware of the movements around her but they felt distant, like a TV was on in another room. 

 

Before she could drift too much further Rio hobbled over and placed her food onto the coffee table as she sat next to Agatha on the couch. 

 

“My love,” she cooed as she stroked a hand along her cheek to wake her. “Your food’s ready.” 

 

Agatha hummed as a smile grew across her lips but her eyes didn’t quite open. “Thank you sweetheart.” She lay there for another moment before she pried her bleary eyes open and pushed herself to sit. “This looks delicious!” She croaked wearily. 

 

“Is there anything else I can get you?” Rio asked with a worried furrow to her brow as she tucked a piece of hair behind Agatha’s ear. 

 

“Maybe a glass of water? Other than that this is perfect! Exactly what I needed!” She leaned over and pressed a kiss to Rio’s lips. 

 

“Right away, my love!” Rio hopped up onto her good leg and hobbled back to the kitchen to grab a water bottle. 

 

“How’s your knee feeling?” Agatha asked as she took a bite of food. 

 

“Much better than this morning! I’ve been staying on top of the anti inflammatories and icing off and on. The swelling’s gone down a lot!” 

 

“Good! Now don’t push yourself too hard just because you’re feeling better!” 

 

“Oh really? I shouldn’t push myself too hard?” Rio scoffed as she settled back onto the couch earning a side eye from Agatha. “Now where have I heard that before?” 

 

“I’m pushing myself just far enough.” Agatha grumbled, taking another bite

 

“Cariño, you were practically dead on your feet when you walked through that door!” 

 

“So today may have been a little much but I’m managing. There’s no need for you to worry!” 

 

“You forgot to take your meds this morning.” 

 

“Did I?”

 

“I checked after you called.”

 

“Why?”

 

“Because I’m worried about you! About what this job is doing to you right now! Pushing yourself this far, it has a cost!” 

 

“Oh don’t worry I’m paying the price! My back and feet are killing me!” 

 

“I’m interested to hear what Jen has to say tomorrow. I know Dr. Allen gave you the all clear but Jen knows better than she does what you’re really up to.” 

 

“So I take it the party is still on for tomorrow then?” Agatha groaned, attempting to change the subject. 

 

“Yes. Plans have changed a bit. I’ve pushed it back to give us some more time to set up but the party is happening.” 

 

“And what if I told you I’m too exhausted for a party?” 

 

“I’d tell you it’ll be worth it and you’ll get to have a whole spa day with Jen beforehand so I’m sure you’ll be well rested by the time you get back.”

 

“When I tell you the bar you are setting for this party is in the stratosphere!” 

 

“Then call me Neil Armstrong because I’m clearing that thing! I can promise you that!” 

 

“Ok Neil, can you get my bag for me?” Agatha chuckled. 

 

“You mean this bag?” She stretched herself over the arm of the couch to grab the bag by the door. 

 

“Yes, dear, thank you.” She dug around in her purse as Rio watched on curiously. 

 

“What are you looking for?” Rio asked after a few moments of searching. 

 

“Damn it! I swear I put them in here!” Agatha groaned as she started to take things out. “Ah! Here they are!” She pulled out a small envelope “Pictures from today. I figured you’d want to see them.” 

 

Rio could hardly contain her excitement. “Of him?” Agatha nodded as she finished her food. “Wait right here I’m gonna get the heart monitor!” 

 

“Believe me, I’m going nowhere anytime soon!” Agatha groaned as she laid back onto the couch. After a few minutes of limping up and down the hallway Rio returned with the heart monitor and sat back down beside Agatha. “Up!” She insisted, pointing to Agatha’s shirt as she turned on the device. 

 

“I already did this once today, you know!” 

 

“Yeah and I missed it so please, for me!” Rio batted her big brown eyes and stuck out a pouty lip, looking as pitiful as she possibly could. 

 

“Fine!” Agatha rolled her eyes as she lifted up her shirt. 

 

“Yay!” Rio cheered as she opened the envelope and put the photos on the coffee table before her. She leaned over and kissed Agatha’s bump before pressing the device to the surface. Almost immediately the steady rhythm of the baby’s heartbeat echoed through the little speakers. 

 

“There he is! Hey little guy! Sorry I missed you earlier. Luckily Mama was kind enough to bring me your pictures. Did you behave today or were you squirming around?” She asked as she leaned forward to look at the images. 

 

“He stayed pretty still. I think he was trying to sleep and we were annoying him.” Agatha chuckled. 

 

“Oh my gosh he gets cuter every time! Look at his chubby little cheeks! I just wanna squish them!” She growled in delight. “Ah! Oh my gosh stop it!”

 

“What?” Agatha gasped

 

“Tell me he’s not sucking his little thumb in this one!” Rio exclaimed as she shoved the picture in Agatha’s face. 

 

Agatha smiled tiredly “Oh, yes. He was definitely sucking his thumb there.” 

 

“I can’t believe I missed it! It’s the cutest thing I’ve ever seen!” Rio whispered in awe. “Thank you for bringing these back for me.” 

 

“Of course, my love! I knew you were disappointed you had to miss it and really, I was quite sad that you weren’t there even if it was for the best. It’s a lot more overwhelming going to those things alone.” 

 

“I know! I’m so sorry, Carino! I promise I’ll make it to the next one!” Rio assured

 

Agatha wagged her finger at Rio “No more injuring yourself please!”

 

“Oh absolutely not! This was pretty terrible and I feel like I missed out on so much!” She sighed before she returned her attention back to the photos. “Wow! He really looks like a real baby now! Like he could just pop out at any second!” Agatha’s gaze jumped to Rio as her heart skipped a beat. “I’m just so ready to see him up close, to actually meet him! Ugh! I’d just wish he’d hurry up and get here already!” 

 

“NO!” Agatha snapped, louder than either of them had anticipated. “Don’t say that!” 

 

Rio cowered in shock at the fierceness in her voice. “Agatha…I didn’t mean…”

 

“I’m sure you were just trying to be funny but it’s not!” She continued as she pried herself  from the couch. “He’s staying right where he is until June!” and with that she stormed down the hallway and off to bed. Leaving Rio sitting in a stunned flurry of confusion and disquiet.
