—-------------------------------------------------

 

The next morning, after a long and uncomfortable night, Agatha awoke to the smell of something sweet and cinnamony wafting in from the kitchen. She cracked a bleary eye open to find Scratchy sitting in the empty cavern of sheets on Rio’s side of the bed watching her intently, the blaring light of the sun glowing around him as if he was some sort of magnificent holy deity. Seeing she was finally awake he chirped at her as he moved to walk across her body, pressing his tiny pointy cat feet into her stomach, as he leapt off the bed and headed out of the room, fluffy tail swishing high and proud as he did so. 

 

Agatha rolled slowly to sit at the edge of the bed and stretch herself awake. She could already feel the hum of her son rolling within her as she moved to stand. She waddled over to grab her robe, feeling the stiff tightness in her hips, and knees, and feet, as she made her way down the hall. Rio, despite her injury, was hopping about the kitchen with latin jazz fusion playing softly in the background. The counters were covered with an array of breakfast foods and she was pulling another pan out of the oven. 

 

“How long have you been awake?” Agatha croaked as she settled onto a stool at the counter.

 

“AH! Good morning my beloved!” Rio lilted as she set down the pan and shuffled over to kiss Agatha on the cheek. “I think I got up around 6? How did you sleep?”

 

“Terribly! I don’t think either one of us could get comfortable last night.” She groaned as she rubbed circles along her stomach. “Why are you so chipper? Your leg feeling better?”

 

“Eh, it was pretty stiff this morning when I got up but it’s been feeling better since I put the brace on it. Also, it’s baby shower day, how could I not be excited!” She smiled brightly

 

“Eh, so it is. At least that’ll be over after today.” She groaned as she rolled her eyes. “Wait, is that clock right, or is that a timer?” She gasped as she looked at the stove.

 

“No, my love, it is indeed 10:00. You might want to think about getting dressed, Jen and Alice will be here any minute. 

 

“Why didn’t you wake me sooner!?” Agatha growled as she stormed off down the hallway.

 

“You looked so peaceful!” Rio shouted after her. “Unlike right now.” She mumbled under her breath. 

 

Agatha hurried into her bathroom, stripping her clothes off along the way and jumped into the shower before the water even had the chance to warm up. She scrubbed head to toe as best she could, leaving her hair untouched in the messy bun that she had slept in. As soon as she stepped out, still dripping, she could hear Jen’s voice radiating from her kitchen. Quick as she could she slipped on some stretchy pants and an oversized button down that just fit over her belly before whipping her hair into a long braid down her back. Satisfied with the look she turned in a flash to head back down the hallway to the kitchen.

 

“Finally! How good of you to grace us with your presence!” Jen scoffed

 

“What can I say, perfection takes time, Jenny Kale!” Agatha sneered with a smirk

 

“And clearly you were on a time crunch!” Jen snickered to which Agatha glared at her. “You ready to do this, Harkness?” she asked as she grabbed her bag off the table.

 

“Oh, are you guys not eating with us?” Rio asked, clearly disappointed.

 

“Our nail appointment is at 11 and I am going to need some caffeine in me if I’m going to be dealing with this one all day.” Jen huffed, pointing her thumb to Agatha.

 

“I’m happy to make you some coffee! Pour over? French press?” Rio offered

 

“Latte?” Jen asked, raising her eyebrows in doubt.

 

“It might not be coffee shop quality but I have a moka pot that’ll get you pretty close.” Rio insisted

 

“Come on Jen! Look at this feast! She went through all this trouble and you’re not even going to eat a bite?” Agatha asked, laying on the guilt thick as she plated herself a piece of french toast. 

 

“Fine! Make it an iced moka whatever and you’ve got yourself a deal.” She agreed as she begrudgingly began filling a plate. 

 

“So what will you two be up to today?” Alice asked, grabbing some toast and eggs. 

 

“Nails, massage, hair. The holy trinity.” Rio and Alice looked skeptically at each other. “Obviously the hair appointment is for her! Though I might try and find a wig for your opening gala.”

 

“So you are able to come?” Agatha asked, somewhat surprised.

 

“Yeah, Alice and I will be there. I’ve been seeing the ads, hate to say it but it looks like it’ll be a good time.” 

 

“It better be for how much work has gone into this shit!” Agatha snorted

 

“I keep hearing that there’s different themes, am I supposed to wear something specific?” Alice asked.

 

“That’s entirely up to you! Each weekend is modeled after one of the four elements. Fire, Water, Earth, and Air. The musical selections align with the theme. The art, performers, and displays will change with the themes. It’s been an undertaking to say the least.” 

 

“And you’re managing all of this?” Jen asked with a skeptical glance. “All four weekends?”

 

“That’s what they’re paying me for!” Agatha snapped back

 

“Huh…interesting.” Jen frowned amusedly.

 

“What?” Agatha growled

 

“Nothing, it's just, it sounds interesting.” Jen shrugged though the way her eyes rolled hinted that it was more than just that. 

 

“One iced caramel latte for the lady!” Rio chimed in, breaking the awkward tension. 

 

“You really lucked out with this one didn’t you, Harkness! I mean, for someone who can’t cook an egg, this is really ideal.” Jen snickered, gesturing to the feast before them as she took a sip of her coffee.

 

“I can cook an egg just fine! Though I will admit, Rio has a talent for it.” 

 

“I hear that’s not the only thing she has a talent for!” Jen cackled

 

Agatha’s face contorted into a fit of rage. “I call you one time in a moment of weakness thinking my water broke and you’re going to hold it over me!”

 

“For the rest of your life, Harkness! That shit was funny as hell! Alice and I still laugh about it!” Agatha whipped around to glare at Alice as she diverted her attention to her plate. “Oh come on, even I can admit that was funny despite how scarring it was at the time!” 

 

“Rio!” Agatha growled, seeing her snicker.

 

“What do you want me to say? It was pretty funny if you think about it.” Rio shrugged

 

“I don’t know why I put up with any of you people!” Agatha growled as she stormed off into her room. 

 

‘Because you love me!” Rio called after her.

 

“Because who else would tolerate any of your bullshit.” Jen huffed under her breath as she took a sip of coffee. 

 

Almost as soon as she had left Agatha returned, shoes on and carrying her bag. “Alright Jennifer, let’s do this before I change my mind.” She grumbled as she sauntered through the living room and out the front door. 

 

Jen turned to Rio as she went to grab her purse. “Can I get this in a to-go up. This was actually really good!”

 

“Oh yeah! No worries. Glad you liked it.” Rio took the glass and poured the contents into a green thermos covered in dinosaur images. 

 

“I am not even going to ask.” Jen huffed as she grabbed the mug and started to head out after Agatha. 

 

“Jen wait!” Rio called just as her hand touched the door. “Can you make sure she takes this? She keeps forgetting.” Rio asked as she tossed Jen the bottle of pills. 

 

“Jeez it like taking care of a toddler!” Jen mumbled as she caught the bottle. “Yeah I got it!” She hollered before heading out. 

 

As soon as the door shut behind her Alice turned to Rio, “Are you ready to do this?”

 

“Abso-fucking-lutely! Grab the streamers!”

 

—--------------------------------------------

 

“Any day now Jennifer!” Agatha huffed as she stood impatiently beside the car. 

 

“Cool it! I’m getting there! The door’s unlocked by the way.” Jen grumbled as she made her way down the porch steps. Agatha quickly settled into the car with Jen sliding in just after her. “Forget something?” Jen teased as she shook the bottle of pills Rio had given her. Agatha snatched the bottle of pills and poured one into her hand before grabbing Jen’s coffee just as she was about to take a sip. “Hey!” Jen protested as Agatha chugged a good bit of the coffee before handing it back to her. 

 

“Alright, Kale, let’s get this show on the road!” She grumbled. 

 

“You drank like half of it! You’re buying me another one after this!” Jen said as she turned on the car and pulled out of the driveway. 

 

“Whatever you say Jennifer!” Agatha huffed as she rolled her eyes. As they drove, Agatha sat, silently annoyed, scrolling on her phone. About ten minutes into their journey, after having finished what was left of her iced Dino latte, Jen tempted to get the conversation started. 

 

“So…” 

 

“So?” 

 

“Did you ever read over that shit I sent you?” 

 

“I may have perused it.”

 

“And?” 

 

“And what?” 

 

“Any thoughts?” 

 

“On what?” 

 

“Bitch! On your fucking birth plan?!”

 

“Again I ask, what’s there to plan?” 

 

“Fine! I’ll start with the easy one. Do you want pain meds?”

 

“Obviously! Do you really think I wanna feel this kid split my vagina in half?” 

 

“Some people do it naturally, that’s why I asked.” 

 

“And they’re insane for that!”

 

“Alright, do you want anyone in the room?”

 

“Just Rio…and you I guess.”

 

“Rio cutting the cord?”

 

“If she wants to.”

 

“Oh I bet she does! You open to visitors after?”

 

“Fuck no!”

 

“Fair enough. Are you fine with getting pitocin if the labor stalls?”

 

“If it what?”

 

“If you’ve been in labor for over 24 hours and it’s not going anywhere do you want drugs to help or just wait it out? To be clear, this is assuming everything’s fine with the baby, otherwise you’re getting a c-section.”

 

“Please, if I’m in labor for more than 10 hours just take the kid out the sunroof.”

 

“Girl, 10 hours is nothing! Especially for your first child. We had a woman last week that went 36 hours unmedicated before she gave birth.”

 

“Fuck! Is she still alive?!”

 

“And happy with her 10 pound baby!” Agatha glared at her horrified. “I’m trying to tell you girl, this shit is wild!”

 

“Can she fucking walk?” Agatha gasped

 

“Oh yeah! She was up and moving about a couple hours later.” Jen chuckled as she pulled into a parking space. She turned off the car and went to grab her bag then stopped suddenly, turning to Agatha with a wicked grin. “Have you ever seen anyone give birth?”

 

“No.” Agatha replied cautiously

 

“OOOOO, we’re about to change that!” Jen cackled.

 

—---------------------------------------

 

It was just about 11 at the Harkness abode when the doorbell rang.

 

“Come in!” Alice and Rio shouted in unison. The door cracked open and Nat, Yelena, and Hela stumbled in, hands full of food and things for the baby, looking as if they barely survived the night before. 

 

“What the hell happened to you three?” Rio chuckled

 

“Somebody thought it was a good idea to order a pitcher of margaritas last night.” Hela groaned as she set her stuff down on the table and pushed her sunglasses to the top of her head.

 

“And then another once that one was cleared.” Nat grumbled, setting the food down on the counter as she slumped into the stool.

 

“Not my fault these two can’t keep up anymore.” Yelena snickered as she set down her bags.

 

“How do you not feel like garbage right now?!” Nat asked as her head sunk to the counter.

 

“I took some advil and drank two bottles of water before bed like you’re supposed to.” she shrugged

 

“There’s some advil in the bathroom cabinet above the sink if you want some.” Rio offered. “I also have some left over breakfast if you need food to cure the hangover.”

 

“Yes! All of it! I need bacon in my mouth right now, and toast!” Nat groaned, unable to raise her head.

 

“I’ll get the advil.” Hela sighed

 

“I’m liking the streamers! You want me to start blowing up balloons?” Yelena asked

 

“Yeah! That’d be great! And anything you brought for the baby just pop in the room.” 

 

“You got it!”

 

“When are other people showing up?” Nat grumbled, slowly raising her head from the counter as Rio handed her a plate of food.

 

“We have about an hour to get things together. Lilia might be here before then though and she’s bringing her cookies.”

 

“Oh hell yeah! The ones with the frosting? Those are the shit!” Yelena cheered

 

“So what exactly are we doing now? You said Agatha’s not coming?” Hela asked, returning with the bottle of advil.

 

“Yeah, this isn’t really her thing so instead, we’re gonna party, play some games, and put the baby’s room together before she gets home.” 

 

“Odd, but to each their own!” Hela shrugged. “What do you need from me?”

 

“I’m going to put you in charge of setting up the food.” Rio instructed

 

“Should I be doing something?” Nat asked as she choked down a piece of toast. 

 

“Just focus on not throwing up for now. I’ll find something for you later.” Rio chuckled

 

—---------------------------------------------

 

“AH! AHHH! What the fuck Jen!” Agatha screamed out in the nail salon, slamming the phone down on the table between them as Jen cackled in the pedicure chair beside her.

 

“That was a third degree tear. She almost needed an episiotomy. You can see how his shoulder kind of got stuck there for a second.” 

 

“Do I even want to know about the episiotomy?” Agatha asked, face as white as a sheet

 

“Not unless you need one so you better pray you don’t!” Jen snickered as she grabbed her phone to pull up another video.

 

“NO! Please! I need a fucking break! That…that was…”

 

“Not what you expected, I take it.”

 

“SOOooo much worse than I expected. Did she feel all of that?” 

 

“She had an epidural so no, not really. At least, not in the moment. Later for sure! People tend to tear more when they get an epidural because they can’t gauge what’s going on down there. Another reason some people prefer natural.” 

 

Agatha sat in silence, staring aimlessly at the wall in front of her as images of the video replayed in her mind. If she had been nervous about giving birth before now she was absolutely dreading it. 

 

“Remind me why I decided to do this again.” She mumbled, still in a horrified daze

 

“Girl! I have no fucking clue! Something about wanting to be somebody’s mama. Here, watch this.” Jen said, handing the phone back to Agatha. 

 

“Oh no! What the hell is this going to be?” Agatha groaned as she reluctantly took the phone. 

 

“This one’s a c-section. Enjoy!” Jen giggled maniacally 

 

“Oh FUCK! Jen why?!!” Agatha groaned. 

 

—----------------------------------------------------

 

At 11:45 the doorbell rang.

 

“Come in!” Shouted Alice, Hela, and Nat who were spread out amongst the living room preparing different games. 

 

“Buongiorno, belle signore!” greeted Lilia as she pushed her way into the house. “Any chance I could trouble one of you to help me grab the rest of the things from my van?” 

 

“For sure!” Hela said hopping up and grabbing the platter Lilia was carrying before she followed her outside. 

 

“Do you think those are the cookies?” Alice whispered to Nat, eyeing the covered platter. 

 

“Only one way to find out!” Nat smirked as they put down the games and tip-toed over to the table. Nat placed a hand on the cover of the tray and slowly lifted it up to reveal the ornately decorated cookies. “Do you think she’ll notice if we take one now?”

 

“There’s like 40 of them, I doubt it!” Alice shrugged as she reached for one. 

 

“Well if you’re taking one then I’m definitely taking one!” Nat said as she snuck one off the plate. “Cheers!” 

 

They tapped their cookies together and just as they were about to take a bite, “Hold it right there!” Lilia shouted from the doorway. Nat and Alice froze, mouths still open as they turned to face her. “Put the cookies down!” They both tucked their heads and reluctantly returned the cookies before shuffling off back to their games. 

 

“Is Lilia here?” Rio called out as she hobbled down the hallway on a crutch.

 

“Indeed I am! AH! Just look at you!” She said, clicking her tongue in disapproval. “This is what you get for fooling around!”

 

“I wasn’t fooling around! Some guy clobbered me!” Rio protested as she shuffled over to hug Lilia. “Thanks for coming!” 

 

“Anything for you, doll! So, where’s the guest of honor?” Lilia asked as she started unpacking the boxes Hela had carried in.

 

“Oh, she won’t be here.”

 

“What?” 

 

“I texted you last night! She really doesn’t want to do this so I’m not going to force her into anything.”

 

“Good for you! Are you still planning to um…” she asked cautiously as she glanced around the room.

 

“Yeah, later after I show her the room. Did you bring it?” 

 

“Of course, dear! It’s in my bag!”

 

“AH! You’re the best! What all did you bring?” She asked, seeing the array of containers now spread about the table. 

 

“In Italy it’s considered bad luck to buy any gifts for the baby before it’s born so instead I cooked a bunch of food to throw in your freezer. I also have a few things for Agatha.”  

 

“Oh my gosh! That’s perfect!” Rio gasped

 

“Do you have a moment to help me put it away?” Lilia asked, with a mischievous glimmer in her eye.

 

“Yeah, can do!” Rio replied with a questioning frown.

 

“So how’s Agatha doing?” Lilia asked as she followed Rio further into the kitchen with the food containers. 

 

“She’s been doing alright. Working a lot, kind of grumpy, but you have to expect that at this point. I’m trying not to take it personally.” Rio explained as she rearranged a few things in the freezer to make room

 

“Good! I’m glad you have a level head about it. How’s she feeling otherwise? Everything alright with the baby?” Lilia asked as she handed over the first of the dishes. 

 

“According to Agatha everything’s going alright. She had an appointment yesterday that I had to miss, unfortunately, but apparently the doctor says everything looks alright and her blood pressure is under control.”

 

“That’s good to hear.” Lilia said as she handed over another dish. 

 

“But she has forgotten or has almost forgotten to take her medication the last couple of days. It’s driving me crazy so I’m trying to stay on top of her about it.” 

 

“She’s lucky to have you dear!” Lilia replied with a caring smile. “What about you?”

 

“What about me?” Rio asked as she shoved a dish to the back of the freezer

 

“How have you been feeling dear? Outside of your injury that is.” Lilia asked, her eyes probing Rio carefully. 

 

Rio sighed as she considered. “A bit nervous to be honest. We’re nearly in the home stretch and I just hope that we’re ready.”

 

“Ah, that’s to be expected. Tell me, have you been able to rest much since I saw you on Sunday?”

 

“A bit.” Rio replied tentatively “More so these last couple of nights with the pain meds.”

 

“And before that?” Lilia continued, treading lightly. 

 

“I had a few rough nights there.” Rio said though she eyed Lilia skeptically

 

“Any more nightmares?” She asked, still trying to sound casual as she handed her the last of the dishes. 

 

“Really?” Rio droned, her face falling flat, unamused. 

 

“Yes, really!” Lilia urged as she crossed her arms and leaned against the counter. 

 

“Ugh! Fine!” Rio huffed as she slammed the freezer door shut behind her. “Nearly every night after I saw you until I fucked up my knee.”

 

“About Agatha and the baby?” Lilia asked, raising her eyebrows as if it was a question she already knew the answer to. 

 

“Why am I not surprised?” Rio breathed exasperatedly “Yes about Agatha and the baby, so what?” She threw her hands up in surrender before slapping them against her legs. “It doesn’t mean anything! It’s just my subconscious overreacting to my anxieties about the baby coming. It’s nothing.” She shrugged as Lilia stared at her pointedly. “It’s nothing!” She growled a little more forcefully. 

 

“I’m sure you’re right dear!” Lilia replied with a tight smile as she patted Rio on the cheek and continued moving about the kitchen not saying a word.

 

“What?” Rio groaned

 

“Nothing dear, I didn’t say a thing!” Lilia smiled though the twinkle in her eye glimmered brightly. 

 

“But you’re clearly thinking something! What is it?” Rio pressed, inching closer to her. 

 

“It’s nothing! I’m sure, like you said.” She shrugged as she started out of the kitchen. 

 

“Lilia!” Rio growled as she caught her elbow. “I know you know something! You’re doing that thing!”

 

“What thing?” Lilia replied, her hand clasped to her chest as if she was shocked by the question. 

 

“Oh don’t give me that! You know exactly what I’m talking about. Asking questions you clearly already know some answer to. And don’t think I didn’t see that look you gave me at lunch the other day! Spill it!” 

 

Lilia chewed on her lip as she chose her words carefully. “In truth dear I don’t quite know. It’s all very fuzzy at the moment. Almost as if the universe is at a crossroads, too many paths to choose from.”

 

“Ok? And what does that have to do with anything?” 

 

“I’ve tried to follow them, the ones I can make out and…”

 

“And what?” Rio probed, growing irritated and anxious. 

 

“You’ve seen it, I know you have. It’s not what I would hope for you, any of you to say the least.” 

 

“Ok? Let’s pretend for one second that I’m buying any of this, what the hell am I supposed to do with that ominous warning?” Rio scoffed. 

 

“All I can say is stay close to her, stay prepared and when you lose her in the red sea look for the silver lining.”

 

“Lilia, what the absolute fuck are you talking about?!” Rio spat, “How high are you right now? Are you microdosing again?” 

 

“No! Dear I…” just as she started the doorbell rang. She smiled softly as she continued. “Better get that dear, don’t want to keep your guest waiting. It is a party after all.” 

 

Rio started towards the door but her gaze never left Lilia. “Don’t for one second think this conversation is over!”

 

————————————————-



“So you know when to go into the hospital right?” Jen grilled Agatha as they drove to their next appointment. 

 

“Yes! When my water breaks.” Agatha spat back at her. 

 

“Well yes, if your water breaks then definitely head in, even if you aren’t having contractions, but it might not break on its own. Otherwise you want to head in when your contractions are consistently 3-5 minutes apart.” 

 

“That feels like cutting it a little close.” Agatha frowned

 

“Oh you’ll have more time than you think. I keep trying to tell you this is not a quick process! But who knows, you may get lucky and only suffer for like 5 hours and then he’s here. Everybody’s different and every pregnancy is different.” 

 

“Ugh! If only! Something tells me he isn’t going to make this too easy.” Agatha said as she rubbed her hand against the surface of her stomach trying to ease his pressing and kicking at her side. 

 

“You think?” Jen scoffed “He is your son, I guarantee you whatever happens it’s going to be as dramatic as possible.” 

 

“I wouldn’t expect anything less!” Agatha chuckled as they pulled into a space. Jen turned off the car and grabbed her purse, and as Agatha leaned forward to grab her bag she felt the familiar aching tightening begin to coil in her lower back. She breathed in sharply as she leaned back into the seat to let the wave of pressure roll through her, her hand gripping tightly to the side of the door. 

 

“You coming?” Jen yelled as she stood on the sidewalk, arms crossed in front of the car. Agatha glared at her as she breathed slowly in and out through her nose, the claws of the contraction beginning to release. As the last of the pressure finally eased she slowly began to move and ease out of the car, still feeling the shadow of the pain that had been there just a moment before. “You good?” Jen snickered as Agatha shut the door behind her and waddled over, still feeling a tightness in her hips. 

 

“Perfectly fine.” She grunted, pretending to brush off the contraction that had just stopped her in her tracks as she breezed past Jen. 

 

“You just had a contraction didn’t you?” Jen asked, not fooled by her nonchalance. 

 

“Just Braxton Hicks, it’s fine.” She huffed as she threw her braid over her shoulder. 

 

“You’ve been getting a lot of those lately?” Jen queried, her eyebrows stitched in skeptical amusement. 

 

“On and off throughout the day.” Agatha sighed as she opened the door to the spa. 

 

“Are they always that intense?” Jen asked as she followed her in. 

 

“Jeez Jen! What are you, my doctor?” Agatha scoffed as she approached the desk. “Harkness, I have an appointment at 1.” 

 

“Um yeah, bitch, I’m technically on your birth team.” Jen scoffed 

 

“Jen, please! We’re in a place of business! Be professional for once!” Agatha scolded teasingly. 

 

“Girl! Miss me with that bullshit! What did Vicky say at your appointment yesterday?” 

 

“That everything looks fine.” Agatha shrugged. 

 

Jen’s face fell into deadpan judgement. “That’s all she said, everything’s fine?” 

 

“Ms. Harkness?” Called the masseuse

 

“Ooo, Jen, sorry! Wish I could elaborate but I have to go!” Agatha shrugged with a wry smirk as she followed the technician down the hallway. 

 

“Don’t think I won’t find out!” Jen called after her. 

 

————————————————

 

As the doorbell rang again Rio hobbled over to receive the last of her guests. “Sharon!” She shouted gleefully. “Oh my gosh! I’m so glad you made it! Come on in!” She insisted as she shuffled out of the way to let Sharon by. 

 

“Oh of course dear! I was so thrilled that you invited me. There was no way I was going to miss it! Oh goodness! What happened?” She asked eyeing the crutch and brace.

 

”Oh it’s nothing! Just a sprain, you should see the other guy!” Rio laughed. “Don’t be shy, go grab yourself a plate. Anything you brought feel free to throw in the baby’s room down the hall. We’re going to play a few games here in a bit.” 

 

“Oh how wonderful! Do you mind if I just set this down here for now? I have a few more things to grab from the car.”

 

”Yeah, no worries, do you need any help?”

 

”Oh, don’t worry about it dear, I’m not going to make you wander all the way out to my car! I’ll be back in a jiffy.”

 

”Nonsense! Alice! Yelena!” Rio called as she beckoned them from across the room. “Alice you know Sharon.” 

 

“Hey!”

 

“Sharon this is my friend Yelena. Sharon is Agatha’s assistant, she also helps me keep an eye on her when she’s at work. Makes sure she isn’t pushing herself too far.”

 

”Nice to meet you” Yelena beamed. 

 

“Would you mind helping her bring some things in from her car? Then we’ll plan to get started.” 

 

“Yeah of course!” Alice chimed.

 

As they shuffled back out the door Rio took a moment and glanced around the room observing the clusters of gathered friends eating and engaged in conversation. Her heart was full with the warmth and love that filled the room but even she had to admit, Yelena had been right. This party was for her, her joy, her excitement about the new life she was eagerly awaiting. She had needed this more than she realized as she counted down the days until she could hold him in her arms. It was a welcomed relief from the anxieties that had plagued her and despite Lilia’s warning she was determined to push it from her mind for the time being and enjoy herself. 

 

Minutes later Sharon returned with Alice and Yelena in tow, both their arms full of bags and boxes, and Sharon gleefully carrying a small wooden rocking horse. 

 

“Oh my gosh! Sharon you didn’t have to do all this!” Rio insisted as she held the door for them. 

 

“Oh I know, but I couldn’t help myself! I’m just so excited for you both! I may have gotten a little carried away. Where did you say you’d like me to put things?” 

 

“Oh we’re setting everything up in the baby’s room down the hall. Alice and Yelena will show you and help you get everything set up.” Rio beamed before turning to the rest of her guests. “Alright folks! As you finish your food make sure you write something in the baby book for Agatha and don’t forget to place your baby bets with Lilia! We’ll have winners for birthdate, height and weight, and if you have any guesses on the name feel free to throw it down! Your guess is as good as mine at this point! In about ten minutes we’ll start the games and I challenge any one of you to change a better diaper than me!” 

 

—————————————————

 

After a particularly silent post massage car ride Jen and Agatha finally made it to the hairdresser. As Agatha gathered her things to head inside Jen sat stoically typing on her phone. 

 

“Something the matter Jen?” Agatha snipped as she slid out of the vehicle. “You’ve been unusually quiet.”

 

Jen shook her head “No, no, everything’s fine!” She said dryly as she continued to text away on her phone. 

 

“Well are you coming in then?” Agatha grumbled as she leaned against the car door. 

 

“You go on ahead, I’ll be in in a minute. I’ve got to make a call.” Jen muttered, refusing to look at Agatha. 

 

Agatha narrowed her gaze suspiciously, “If you say so.” She huffed and closed the door, not blinking twice as she headed inside. 



Nearly 20 minutes later Jen sauntered in with a smug look on her face as she settled into a chair near to Agatha. Agatha glanced in her direction but spoke no word of acknowledgment as the hairdresser, unaware of the tension babbled on. 

 

“…And then with my second kid I worked until he practically walked out of me. My water broke over near the color station and luckily my husband doesn’t work far from here so Gloria gave him a call and he rushed over. But then he typed the wrong hospital into the map so it routed us like an hour away instead of the one 20 minutes down the road and I ended up giving birth in the hospital parking lot. I just remember a bunch of nurses rushing out and I’m laying there in the passenger seat with the kid on my chest like what the fuck just happened. The whole thing was so wild! This is your first kid though right?” 

 

“First and only at this point. There’s no way I’m ever doing this again!” Agatha chuckled though her gaze was fixed on Jen who was eying her suspiciously in the corner. 

 

“Oh, has it been a rough pregnancy? I remember with my first I was so horribly nauseous pretty much the whole time and I told myself I was never going to do it again but here I am now three kids later. You forget the worst of it honestly and they’re so sweet, for the most part. I swear once they start talking it makes you miss the baby phase and you start thinking about having another.”

 

“I’ll see. It took a bit to get to this point and I don’t know that I’d go through all of that again.” Agatha sighed to which Jen snickered in the corner. “Something funny Jennifer?” Agatha snipped

 

“What, you don’t want to surprise yourself again?” Jen chuckled 

 

“That’s not what I’m talking about and you know it!” Agatha bit back. 

 

“Surprise? Was it unexpected?” Asked the hairdresser. 

 

“You could say that.” Agatha sighed as she glowered at Jen. 

 

“Please! You’d been trying for what was it, three years, and when it finally worked it took you what five months to realize? And not even that your girlfriend had to tell you!” Jen cackled. 

 

Agatha clenched her teeth in frustration, “It was a unique situation but yes I don’t want to repeat that either!” 

 

“Oh wow! So you like didn’t have any symptoms or anything?” The hairdresser asked in awe

 

“Oh she had symptoms, she just didn’t put two and two together.” Jen snickered 

 

“I took two pregnancy tests and they both came back negative, what was I supposed to think?” Agatha sighed as she threw her hands out to the side in exasperation. 

 

“Oh shit! That happened to my cousin but she didn’t figure it out until she went in for appendicitis and came out with a baby!” 

 

“See! It happens! At least I figured it out before I gave birth!” Agatha snorted as she pointed a finger at Jen. 

 

“At least Rio figured it out you mean.” Jen said with a wry smirk. 

 

“How much longer until you’re on maternity leave?” Asked the hairdresser. 

 

“I’ve just got to make it through May. That festival I was telling you about goes through the end of the month then I should be in the clear.” Agatha explained 

 

“Cutting it a little close don’t you think?” Jen snickered from her seat.  

 

“Well I’m not due until June so that shouldn’t be a problem!” Agatha spat back

 

“Oh really? Is that what your doctor said?” Jen pressed. 

 

“Yes, Jennifer!” Agatha growled. 

 

“You sure about that?” Jen narrowed her gaze pointedly. 

 

“Yes, Jennifer!” Agatha huffed sharply, growing more irritated by the minute. 

 

“Ok, Agatha.” Jen relented as she rolled her eyes and pursed her lips dubiously. 



———————————————-

 

“Alright guys!” Rio shouted over the clamoring of her guests. “Jen just text me and said she and Agatha are headed home, so unfortunately our fun has come to an end!” She announced receiving a series of disappointed groans. “Really, truly, I cannot thank you all enough for coming and indulging me in my silly games and for all the wonderful gifts you brought. It means so much to me and though she might not admit it herself I know how much this is going to mean to Agatha! Please make sure to take food and cookies on your way out!” 

 

In a flurry everyone shuffled to gather their things and clean up what mess they had made in the various games as they began to make their way towards the door. Sharon, in her flustered urgency nearly knocked Rio over as she b-lined for the exit. 

 

“Woah Sharon! Damn, were you a linebacker in a previous life? What a hit!” Rio chuckled as she steadied herself on the table. 

 

“Oh dear! I’m so sorry! Just trying to make sure I’m out of the way. Ah-ha-ha! Thanks again for inviting me! I love parties and I haven’t been to one this fun in ages!”

 

“Well don’t worry! You’re at the top of my guest list for the next one! Oh don’t forget your trophy!” Rio said as she quickly grabbed a small golden statue. “I thought I had it clenched but you really pulled it out with those diaper changes. Mind if I put you on the roster for babysitting?” 

 

“Oh that would be just lovely! Yes please anytime day or night! I just love babies!” Sharon grinned. 

 

“You got it! Take care! I’m sure I’ll see you at the festival next week!” Rio said as she waved her out the door. 

 

“Alright I think we’ve got everything!” Hela grumbled as she, Nat, and Yelena made their way to the door. 

 

“Thank you guys so much for driving all the way out here for this! Really I couldn’t have done all of this without you!” Rio sighed with a grateful smile. 

 

“Of course man! We wouldn’t have missed it for anything!” Nat said as she leaned in for a hug. 

 

“You guys still up to meet for brunch tomorrow? I’m sure Agatha would like to see you while you’re still in town.” 

 

“Oh absolutely! 10 still work?” Yelena asked

 

“Yeah, it sounds like a plan!”

 

“Cool then we’ll see you then! Good luck!” Yelena winked as she closed the door behind them. 

 

“Lilia…” Rio groaned as she let the woman pull her into a hug. 

 

“Oh don’t give me that! Good job today sweetheart! The room looks lovely, I’m sure she’s going to be thrilled when she gets home.” 

 

“Thank you.” Rio muttered as Lilia stepped back, her arms still braced on Rio’s shoulders as she looked her over. “What now?”

 

“Nothing dear! Just admiring the woman you’ve become. So strong, brilliant, and caring. I’m so proud of you!” She cracked a smile as her eyes began to mist and she brought her hands up to cup Rio’s cheeks. “You’ve got this! Whatever lies ahead, just trust yourself, ok?” 

 

Rio frowned in confused unamusement “Ok…? Promise me you’ll lay off the mushrooms.”

 

“I swear I’ve sworn off the things!” She groaned, giving a playful slap to Rio’s shoulder as she picked up her bag. “I put your box on the dresser in the baby’s room so you should be all set. Just remember what I said and I’ll see you both before long.” She said as she pointed her finger and was out the door with a wink. 

 

Rio let out a deep sigh as the door closed behind her. She was relieved for how the party had gone, the joy and camaraderie soothing the noxious anxieties that had been weighing on her these past days, but as the excitement quickly dissipated she could feel her nerves begin to prickle at the thought of Agatha’s return. 

 

“How you feeling?” Alice called out to her from the kitchen. 

 

“Like I’m going to be sick, or maybe my heart is going to explode.” Rio groaned as she pressed her palms into her face. “I hate this part, the waiting. My mind likes to think of every horrible outcome when it has nothing to do.”

 

“Well then come help me put away the leftovers. I’m sure by the time everything’s packed away they’ll be pulling up.” Alice said as she beckoned her over. “Are we taking down the streamers and balloons and stuff?”

 

“No those can stay. It’ll still be a celebration, hopefully.” 

 

“Don’t sweat it! I’m sure it will!” 

 

———————————————-

 

At 4:00 on the dot Jen’s car pulled into Agatha’s driveway. 

 

“So…does Rio know?” Jen asked as she turned off the vehicle.

 

“Does Rio know what?” Agatha replied, pretending to be aloof.

 

“Agatha…I know what Vicky told you. He’s going to be here before the end of May. Don’t you think Rio deserves to know?” Jen prodded

 

“We don’t know that for sure! She only said he might!” Agatha sneered

 

“You can’t be serious!” Jen scoffed, “The chances of you making it to June, especially with you working like this are like 20% at most. You need to get it together!” 

 

“I am together! I have everything together! I’ve been planning for months for it all to fall together perfectly and it will! I have just enough time to do what I need to do and then he’ll be here!” Agatha shrugged as she aggressively grabbed her things from the car. 

 

“Agatha it doesn’t fucking work like that! It’s not really up to you!” Jen scolded

 

“Don’t you think I know that!” Agatha snapped, “I don’t need a lecture from you Jen! Now, if you don’t mind, I have to go pretend to be excited about this stupid party my lovely girlfriend planned.” With that she slammed the car door and stormed off towards the house. 

 

As she ascended the steps she took a deep breath in and did her best to shake off the argument with Jen. She didn’t need that kind of negativity! Not now, when she was struggling so hard to be excited about whatever Rio had conjured behind the door. She took another calming breath in through her nose and out through her mouth before plastering a strained smile across her face. Then, as her hand reached for the door, it suddenly shot open.

 

“Oh hey Agatha!” Alice lilted cheerily. “Jen still in the car?” 

 

“I assume so, she’s not here is she?” Agatha droned as she glanced over her shoulder. 

 

“No she is not! Well, I’ll just go and check on her then, if you’ll excuse me.” Alice said as she snuck around her, grinning awkwardly at the tension hovering in the air. 

 

As soon as she was past Agatha pushed open the door and stepped inside. The house, though adorned with streamers and balloons and confetti, was eerily silent and empty, save for Rio leaning nervously against the counter dressed in a clean white button down and black slacks. 

 

“Hello, my love. Did you have a good day?” Rio hummed though her voice was shaky with nerves. 

 

“It was pleasant…” Agatha started as she looked around cautiously. “Rio, I swear, if a bunch of people try to pop out and surprise me I’m going to strangle you!” She grumbled.

 

“No.” Rio giggled “No one is here, it’s just us.” 

 

Agatha frowned in confusion. “I thought you said the party was pushed back to 4?” 

 

“That may have been a fib.” Rio cringed

 

“A fib?” Agatha’s eyebrows raised in surprise.

 

“A little white lie. The truth is everyone has already come and gone.” Rio explained sheepishly.

 

“Ok…then what’s happening?” Agatha asked, still unsure of what Rio was up to.

 

“Follow me.” She said as she took Agatha’s hand and began to hobble down the hallway.

 

“You sure you’re ok to walk without the crutches?” Agatha asked skeptically

 

“I’m fine, I’ve got the brace on and it’s just a few feet.” She said as she stopped in front of the baby’s room. “You ready?” She asked, almost unable to contain her excitement. 

 

“For what?” Agatha huffed. 

 

Rio grasped the doorknob and slowly creaked the door open to reveal the room. Everything was bathed in the warm glow of the afternoon sun as light trickled in through the windows on the far end. The dark wooden floor was covered in a plush ornate rug, its gold and coffee colored patterns blending nicely with the sage green walls. A mobile displaying different bugs and insects hung delicately above the crib along the left side of the wall, with a matching quilt hung along the rail. Beside that was a tiny wooden rocking horse and matching wooden toy chest filled to the brim with various books and toys. On the walls hung various colorful illustrations of bugs and insects like those out of a vintage entomology book. In the corner sat a cream colored gliding recliner and ottoman with a soft sage crochet blanket draped along the arm and a cozy standing lamp hovering behind. Along the other wall was an old hoosier cabinet that had been transformed into a changing table and in the corner near the closet was a tall wooden dresser, above which hung framed ultrasound photos. Agatha hovered at the doorway, her mouth agape in awe as she took in every detail.

 

“So? What do you think?” Rio asked as she stepped into the room, pulling Agatha in behind her.

 

“Rio, it’s…it’s…I don’t even know what to say!” Agatha gasped as her eyes darted around the room. She stepped carefully, her hand hovering along the edge of the crib as she passed, too afraid to touch anything as if it might all disappear the moment she did. 

 

“Go ahead, check it out!” Rio insisted as Agatha approached the chair. Agatha let out a soft chuckle then eased her way into the recliner. The plush cushions welcomed her aching body and she felt herself melt as the chair rocked gently back and forth. She could imagine herself here in the wee hours of the morning holding him close, soothing him back to sleep. “Comfy huh?” Rio smiled “Not going to lie, I totally took a nap in that yesterday when I was getting everything together. I knew you’d love it!” she beamed as she reached out a hand. “I hate to make you get up but there are a few other things I want to show you.” She pulled Agatha out of the chair and walked her over to the changing table. “This thing is awesome! Yelena helped me put it together, everything you need just within reach!” She said as she pulled out drawers and opened the cabinet doors revealing the carefully organized diapers and wipes and other baby accoutrement. “And then over here I have all of his little outfits organized!” She said as she pulled out drawer after drawer of the dresser. “And we should be good on diapers for at least a month!” Rio chuckled as she opened the closet to reveal it stuffed to the brim with cases of diapers in different sizes. 

 

Agatha had followed her silently, too stunned to speak seeing the care an effort Rio had gone through to pull the whole room together. It was more than she could have ever asked for or expected and Rio had gifted it to her willingly. The relief she felt that it was done his room was ready, the joy she felt at seeing all the tiny pieces in their place, the gratitude she had for the magnificent woman standing before her, it was all too much in the best possible way and she could feel the tears welling in her eyes.

 

“Rio…this is…it's perfect!” She choked out just as the first tears began to fall. 

 

“I’m so glad you love it, carino!” Rio beamed. “But you haven’t even seen the best part!” Rio hobbled over to close the blackout curtains and turn off the lamp before scurrying back to Agatha’s side. 

 

“What are you up to now?” Agatha chuckled as she wiped the tears from her eyes. 

 

“Really it’s the best part in my opinion.” Rio grinned. “Look up!” 

 

Agatha’s eyes fluttered as she tilted her head to look at the ceiling. Glowing back at her were little hand painted stars and constellations shimmering in the darkness as if she were staring at the night sky. Immediately a stream of tears trickled from her eyes. “When? How?” She sobbed as she walked around looking at every detail.

 

“I have to admit, this took a few weeks but I think it was worth it.” Rio admitted as she crept around the room.

 

“This…this is unbelievable! It’s beautiful! Rio, I…” As she glanced down her train of thought was immediately broken. There sitting somewhat awkwardly on the ottoman was Rio with a small satin box in her hand. “What are you doing?” She breathed though the air got stuck in her throat. 

 

“I was really hoping to get on my knee for this but the brace is making it a little difficult so I hope you’ll forgive me.” Rio started

 

“No, Rio no, you don’t have to do this!” Agatha mumbled in a panic.

 

“I know!” Rio chuckled nervously, “Agatha, from the moment I ran into you in that bookstore I knew my life had changed forever. I mean, what are the chances the most beautiful, perfect, brilliant, enchanting woman would literally fall into my arms? But there you were and I knew this was something different. In more ways than I realized at the time, but each and every day I’ve only grown to love you more and more. Being near you it’s as if I’ve captured pure sunlight, your glow, your radiance, it warms parts of me that I hadn’t even realized were cold. And this life that we’re building, that you’re creating, is so precious to me, I can’t imagine a moment passing without it. So, if you’ll let me, I want to do all that I can, for the rest of my days, to make you the happiest woman in the universe. Agatha Harkness, will you marry me?” 

 

From the moment Rio had started a stream of steady tears was pouring down Agatha’s cheeks. She could feel herself shaking, biting her lip as she did her best to hold it together until the end of Rio’s speech and when the words finally came she could feel her heart nearly explode under the weight of Rio’s love. She wanted to shout but in the heat of the moment, as the tears rushed out, her voice escaped her. So instead with a vigorous nod she pulled Rio into her arms. 

 

“I’m guessing this is a yes then?” Rio chuckled over her shoulder.

 

With that laugh the weight of the moment lifted off of her and she pulled Rio back to cup her face in her hands. “Yes! Yes! It’s definitely a yes!” She cried as she pulled Rio’s lips into hers, consuming her with every fiber of her being. They stood there, locked at the lips, both crying tears of joy until the sound of the doorbell broke the spell. “I thought you said the party was over.” Agatha panted as she rested her forehead against Rio’s.

 

“It is…” Rio huffed, “But I have one last surprise I think you’ll enjoy.” She smirked as she pulled away from Agatha and hobbled back down the hallway to the door with Agatha closely behind. 

 

“If this is Jen and Alice, tell them to come back tomorrow!” Agatha huffed as she approached the door.

 

“Trust me! I know better!” Rio laughed as she swung the door open. 

 

“Heyyy mama!” Ralph lilted in the doorway

 

“RALPH! What the hell?! I thought you were in the Virgin Islands until August!” Agatha shouted as she pulled him into a hug.

 

“I renegotiated my contract. I’ll be staying with them until October in exchange for a couple of months off now while we wait for this little guy to get here. You didn’t really think I’d miss it did you?” He laughed as he pushed his way into the house. “Besides I hear there’s a killer festival coming up next week, you know how I love a festival!” 

 

“I…I just can’t believe you’re really here! How did you do this?” Agatha gasped as she shoved Rio playfully

 

“Surprise! I asked him about it when we sent over the documents from Valentina.” Rio shrugged

 

“Which I have for you by the way!” He chimed in as he plopped himself on the couch.

 

“Ah! Amazing! Thank you!”

 

“Fuck I love you so much!” Agatha moaned as she launched herself at Rio.

 

“Hey! Hey! I’m still here!” Ralph groaned as Agatha pressed her up against the back of the couch. 

 

“Sorry, Ralph, got a little carried away!” Rio chuckled. 

 

“I take it you popped the question?” He grinned as Scratchy joined him on the couch.

 

“Yeah, yeah I did.” Rio beamed as she pulled Agatha in tight.

 

“And?” 

 

Agatha grinned “I said yes!”

Chapter End Notes

Surprise again! So what do we think? Happily ever after or should we heed Lilia's warning?

Chapter 27: Thirty Five

Chapter Summary

Let the festivities begin!!!

Chapter Notes

I know I'm getting this in just in time for an A03 outage so enjoy while you can!

See the end of the chapter for more notes

The next week flew by in a whirl of highs and lows. While the demands and expectations of preparing for the festival increased day by day, and the aches and pains of late pregnancy only seemed to worsen, in the spare moments Agatha hovered in a surreal cloud of joy and bliss in the aftermath of her engagement to Rio. They celebrated with an utterly shocked and surprised Nat, Hela, and Yelena at brunch the next day. Hosted a congratulatory and welcome back dinner with Jen, Alice, and Ralph that Wednesday. And though she had tried to keep it under wraps as much as she could at work with everything else going on, by Thursday someone had let the news slip to Sharon who was practically beside herself with excitement. 

 

“You’re engaged?!” She shouted as she burst into her office that morning, breakfast in hand. 

 

Agatha groaned and rolled her eyes. “Who told you that?” 

 

“Your dear friend with the blonde hair. I think his name is Randy? I was down at the cafe picking up your smoothie and we were talking about the party on Saturday and he asked if I was there for the engagement. And I said what engagement and he told me sweet Rio proposed!” Sharon squealed in delight. 

 

“Ugh! I knew I shouldn’t have asked him to come and help!” Agatha grumbled as she continued sorting through emails. 

 

“So? Where’s the ring?” Sharon asked, too delighted by the news to be intimidated by Agatha’s sullen demeanor 

 

“Shouldn’t you be meeting with the management team to go over the staff list instead of here prying into my personal life?” Agatha droned as she reviewed her nearly endless list of tasks for the day. 

 

“Oh, right, of course! I didn’t mean to overstep. I’m just so excited for you both! Rio is such a delight and I see how happy you two are and with the baby on the way you’re just going to make the sweetest little family!” 

 

“Focus, Heart! Management team, staff list! I’ll need that before lunch today!” Agatha scolded

 

“Yes! Yes, I’m on it!” Sharon muttered as she headed to the door. 

 

“Sharon!” Agatha called after her just before she disappeared. “Not a word of this to anyone! I need these people focused on the task at hand, not flittering about gossiping about this nonsense.” 

 

“Oh absolutely!” Sharon twittered. 

 

“And if you see Ralph tell him I need to see him asap!” Agatha barked 

 

“Will do, dear!” 

 

“And…thank you.” Agatha muttered

 

“For what?” Sharon turned, a bit confused. 

 

“For the gifts. The quilt, and blanket, and stuff. That was…kind of you.” She said without lifting her gaze from her work. 

 

“Oh of course dear! It was a wonderful excuse to craft again. I haven’t made anything like that since my grandson was born and it…”

 

“I don’t need the details!” Agatha snipped, cutting her off. “Just go get the staff list.” 

 

“Yes! Right away.” Sharon said as she shuffled out and with a click of the door behind her Agatha was alone in her office. 

She leaned back in her chair with a sigh as her hand glided around the swollen orb of her belly. Over the last few days, as she trapsed nearly every corner inside and out of Music hall, and in doing so the weight of her son had sunk low pressing into her hips and as he shifted within her it sparked an urgent pain in her lower back. She closed her eyes and breathed through the worst of it with a hum. 

“Alright little bug, enough of that now!” She warned as the pain subsided. “I know this week hasn’t been easy but there’s no need to rush these things! There’s still too much to do!” She groaned as she looked back over her list. She added a few more items before her gaze caught the time. Shit! She was going to be late for her meeting with Herb on the opening ceremony. She gathered her things as quickly as she could and heaved herself from the chair. The first few steps were strained as her hips and feet protested the movement but she eased into a tolerable pace just as she reached the door which miraculously swung open before her. 

 

“Hey mama!” Ralph gleamed practically bouncing on the balls of his feet. His light and buoyant energy striking a jealous nerve within her. “Sharon said you wanted to see me?” 

 

“Yes.” She groaned, shoving past him. “Walk with me.” She commanded as she waddled down the hallway toward the elevator. 

 

“Girl! You look like you’re having a rough time today!” Ralph snickered

 

“Oh, what gave it away?” She glowered 

 

“You’re breathing heavily and walking like a penguin. Can I carry something for you?” He offered

 

“If you insist, I’m not going to argue.” She grunted as she turned and handed him her things. “Did you tell Sharon about the engagement?” 

 

“She was at the party! I thought she already knew!” 

 

“Well she didn’t, and no one else here needs to know especially right now. I didn’t bring you here to gossip about me to my coworkers, I need you and them focused on getting everything in its place before tomorrow.” She scolded as she pressed the button for the elevator. 

 

“Which is exactly what I was doing before you called me up here!” He scoffed. “Don’t worry, I’ll keep my mouth shut. Even though it’s not as big of a deal as you’re making it out to be. So what if they know you and Rio are getting married?!” 

 

“Shhh! Keep your voice down!” She spat. “I am nothing more than an employee and acquaintance to these people and I like to keep it that way. I don’t need them to know any more about my personal life than they already do.” 

 

“What, you don’t want people to be happy for you?” He huffed

 

“Honestly no, I’d prefer them to be wary and a little intimidated, makes it easier to get things done and there’s too much left to do. This pregnancy has already broken more of that illusion than I would like.” She scoffed as she glided a hand against the surface. 

 

“I don’t know about that! I think at this point everyone’s just scared if they set you off you might go into spontaneous labor.” He chuckled earning a vicious glare from Agatha

 

“Not funny!” She growled as she stepped into the elevator. 

 

“Oh come on! It was just a joke! Though I have to say it doesn’t seem too far-fetched, you are looking pretty rotund these days.”

 

“Ralph!”

 

“Could you imagine! You’ve done all this work and the kid decides now’s the perfect time to pop out?” He cackled. 

 

“RALPH!”

“Sounds like something I would do! HAHA! Hate to miss a good party you know!” 

 

“Ralph! I swear if you don’t shut the fuck up right now…” She started just as the elevator opened to Herb standing before her on the ground floor. “Heyyyy Herb! I was just coming to meet you!” She lilted, plastering a grin across her face. 

 

“Agatha! Good morning! I was just about to check and see if we needed to move this to your office. I know you’ve been on your feet a lot this week so I don’t want to force you into anything unnecessarily.”

 

“No need! I’m here now, just moving a little slowly today.” She grimaced

 

“Understandibly so!” He grinned as he eyed Ralph beside her.

 

“I, uh, I’m just gonna go back to setting up the vendor booths, I’ll catch you at lunch.” Ralph said as he handed her things back and scurried off. 

 

“Friend of yours?” Herb asked with a frown

 

“Unfortunately so. Shall we?” She huffed as she headed into the lobby with Herb in tow.

 

—------------------------------------

 

The rest of the morning did nothing to ease her aches and pains. After running through the set up, timing, and Herb’s speech a few dozen times for the initial kickoff she had to rush to help manage a sound system issue with the rear stage. Just as she had quelled that fire she was called to the front of the building where she had to walk the lighting and special effects crew through their set up plans for the umpteenth time. By the time lunch rolled around she was barely able to make it back to her office before collapsing onto the couch in the corner. She quickly kicked her shoes off of her aching feet and slumped onto her side. Just as she got relatively comfortable there was a knock at her door. 

 

“Ugh! Whoever it is, go away and come back in 10!” She wined 

 

“Even me?” Rio’s voice lilted from the other side of the door as it began to creek open. 

 

“You, my love, are the only exception!” She sighed as a hint of a smile flashed across her lips. 

 

“Oh Cariño! You look positively exhausted!” Rio cried as she hobbled over with her cane to sit near Agatha’s feet. “You’ve been doing too much again haven’t you!” 

 

“It’s been a bit of a hectic morning running from one end of the building to the other, but nothing I can’t handle.” Agatha chuckled though her eyes betrayed the true strain of the day. “I’ll have enough of a break now that I’ll be able to finish out the day.” 

 

“I thought when you hired Ralph to help he’d be doing more of the running around for you! Wasn’t that the whole point?”

 

“Oh he is, and it's taken a lot off my plate but things keep popping up and it’s easier if I just handle it myself.” 

 

“Easier for who, exactly?” Rio asked, eyebrows hitched in skepticism. 

 

“Me mostly, that way I know things are being done correctly!”

 

“Mhmmm.” Rio rolled her eyes and hummed doubtfully. “Tell me you’re not staying late again at least!” Rio urged as she gathered one of Agatha’s feet and began to rub. 

 

“No, no! I should be home by six. There’s just a few more things we have to set for today and then I’m done.” 

 

“And you have to be here for all of it?” 

 

“Ugh! I shudder to think what would happen if I wasn’t! Do you know, they tried to set up the flame launchers along the main stairway out front!” 

 

“Oh how could they!” Rio gasped as if she had any idea what Agatha was talking about. 

 

“Luckily I intervened in time to move them to the proper location along the pedestals, away from passing patrons! The last thing we need is to set someone on fire with some stupid pyrotechnics trick.” 

 

“Good thing you were there to save the day!” Rio chuckled 

 

“And our asses!” Agatha snorted “Ahhh, I’m so glad you’re here, and you’re rubbing my feet, and you brought food, maybe?” 

 

“You know I did! A sandwich from your favorite place!” Rio beamed as she pulled the food out of her bag

 

“Ugh! I knew I said yes for a reason! You are the absolute best!” Agatha sighed as she struggled to sit, wincing in pain at every movement. 

 

“You sure you’re going to make it the rest of the day?” Rio chuckled skeptically 

 

“As long as this kid stops kicking me in the kidneys I’ll be fine.” She groaned as she pressed a hand to her back, trying to ease another growing ache.  

 

“Sweetheart, you look so uncomfortable!” Rio sighed

 

“What gave you that idea?” Agatha scoffed

 

“You really should go home and rest. Especially if you’re going to try and make it through opening night tomorrow.” 

 

“I’ll be fine!” Agatha grumbled as the pain crested and began to release. “As long as nothing else goes awry, this afternoon will mostly be registration prep and printing out credentials for the people working tomorrow. Nothing strenuous.” 

 

“If you say so…” Rio frowned. “I do worry about you.”

 

“I’m well aware, dear.” 

 

“You missed your medication again this morning!” She scolded as she pulled the pill bottle out of her bag. “You really need to stay on top of this!” 

 

“I know! I know, it just slipped my mind as I was rushing out the door. Thank you for bringing it.” She said with a half smile as she pressed a kiss to Rio’s cheek before heaving herself up from the couch. 

 

“How’s your blood pressure been?” Rio questioned. 

 

“Fine! Perfectly fine.” Agatha replied dismissively as she dug into the sandwich. 

 

“When was the last time you checked?” 

 

“This morning, I think.”

 

“You think?”

 

“Or maybe it was last night. I can’t quite remember.”

 

“Agatha!” 

 

“Sorry, the days just all blend together at this point.” 

 

“Which is exactly why you need to slow down and rest before you end up in the hospital before this baby’s even born! Please! I couldn’t bear it if anything happened to you! Either of you!” 

 

Agatha stood frozen and silent in the wake of Rio’s pleading, her gaze avoidant and fixed on the mess of paperwork on her desk. She felt a pang of guilt for the worry and stress she was causing her but what could she do? The success of this event that she had already poured so much of herself into was riding squarely on her shoulders, not to mention her reputation and obligation to the donors. Failure in this moment was unconscionable. 

As she struggled to find words of reassurance she felt Rio’s warm and comforting presence ease into the space behind her. Her cautious, delicate fingers entwining themselves in the tresses of her long hair, pulling a heavy sigh from Agatha’s lips as she leaned into the touch. Carefully Rio inched closer, her hands wrapping around the underside of Agatha’s swollen belly, lifting and easing some of the weight she was carrying, eliciting a soft moan of relief as she rested her chin on her shoulder. 

 

“It’s ok to rest. To take a step back.” She whispered, her lips grazing along the shell of Agatha’s ear. “Come home with me.”

 

Her mind ached in protest, as her body softened at the relief of Rio’s hands fully supporting the weight of their child. It felt like she could finally breathe as the pressure, the strain that had been plaguing her was lifted if only for a moment. She could almost feel tears of relief begin to well in her eyes as her will slowly started to crack. 

 

“Rio, I…” she began, but just as the words left her mouth the door to her office swung open. 

 

“Sorry it took longer than I thought but here is the finalized version of the staff list and then Jerry from the management team wanted…OH! Oh I’m so sorry I didn’t realize you were…that you two were…oh dear I should have knocked.” Sharon blabbered in a flustered panic. 

 

“Hey Sharon!” Rio smirked as she slowly removed her support from Agatha’s bump and took a step back. “No worries, we weren’t doing anything too indecent.” She chuckled with a wink. 

 

“Oh I… um…well, aha-ha, how…uh…how’s your leg doing, dear?” Sharon stumbled trying to recover her composure. 

 

“Doing much better! Still taking it easy. Wish I could say the same for this one.” She pointed a thumb in Agatha’s direction who was standing at the edge of her desk, one arm bracing her weight as the other curled under her bump trying to ease the pressure and aching that had returned all too quickly. 

 

“What…um…what were you saying about Jerry?” Agatha managed to croak out through her unsteady breaths. 

 

“He wanted me to let you know they’re having an issue wiring some of the vendor booths and he needs to go over some options with you.” 

 

“Ok, tell him I’ll be down in a bit. You can put the staff list on my desk for now.” 

 

Sharon dropped the papers on her desk and started to bolt for the door. 

 

“Wait! Can’t Herb handle it?” Rio called out to Sharon. 

 

Sharon’s eyes darted to Agatha nervously as she replied. “Unfortunately he’s rehearsing with the orchestra at the moment.” 

 

“Then what about Ralph?” She asked turning to Agatha. 

 

“He’s a temporary worker; he can't sign off on any changes.” Agatha explained. 

 

“Well then you do it.” Rio half yelled towards Sharon. “I don’t see why it always has to be her!” 

 

“Because I’m in charge, my love.” Agatha sighed as she slid on her shoes and walked past Rio, giving her a peck on her cheek along the way. “It should only take a few minutes, wait here, I’ll be right back!” 

 

Rio let out a huff in disappointment as soon as Agatha was out the door. “Sorry for getting loud with you Sharon. I didn’t mean anything by it.”

 

“Oh honey it’s alright. I wish I could have been of more help. Is there anything I can get you while you’re waiting?” 

 

“No, I’m alright. Thank you though. I’ll…uh…I’ll just make myself at home until she gets back.”  

 

“Alright. If you need anything I’ll be over at my desk.” 

 

“Thanks Sharon.” Rio mumbled as she shuffled over to plop on the couch and wait. 

 

20 minutes passed, then another, then just as she reached almost an hour she heard the door handle click.  

 

“Finally! I thought I was going to have to come look…Ralph?” 

 

“Hey Mami!” He gleamed as he snuck into the room. 

 

“You’re not Agatha!”

 

“Thankfully no! I would not want to be her right now!” Ralph laughed

 

“Where is she?” Rio glowered 

 

“She’s still dealing with the electrical stuff, it’s a bit of a shit show down there. She sent me up here to let you know, she didn’t want you waiting forever.”

 

“How thoughtful.” Rio grumbled dryly. 

 

“She wanted me to tell you she’s sorry, if she could leave right now she absolutely would but, and I quote, These fucking idiots wouldn’t know their ass from a hole in the ground let alone how to properly set up these fucking booths.”

 

“Ah! That bad huh?” Rio huffed “Well… I guess I’ll head out then. Can you keep an eye on her? She really shouldn’t be up and about this place like she is, it’s practically killing her.” 

 

“Oh don’t worry, once she started storming about downstairs I grabbed her a chair and made her take a seat.”

 

“Thanks, and make sure she eats the rest of this, she can’t be running on fumes either.” Rio said as she handed Ralph Agatha’s lunch. 

 

“That was the other thing she sent me for that and…”

 

“Her pills?” Rio finished, shaking the bottle as she handed it to him. 

 

“Exactly! Thanks. Are you good?” Ralph asked, seeing her dismay. 

 

“I will be once this fucking weekend is over! I’m hoping that once things get started she’ll actually chill out a bit.”

 

“You’ve met her right?” Ralph chuckled, “I don’t think that woman has chilled out a day in her life!” 

 

“I know, it’s like pulling teeth to get her to relax, but I’m worried what all this is doing to her and the baby. All this stress, it can’t end well.” 

 

“I get it, I even told her this morning she’s looking a little worse for the wear, and I think she is starting to feel it. Oh that was the other thing, she did say even though she can’t leave just yet she will try and sneak out early.” 

 

“Heh! I’ll believe it when I see it!” Rio scoffed. 

 

“I told her I’d hold her to it. If anything pops up I’ll try and keep her out of the loop and make sure she’s out of here at a reasonable time.” Ralph assured

 

“Thanks man! It's really good to have you back!” 

 

“And I am so glad to be back! The drama on this last ship was getting to be too much even for me! It’s been nice taking a step back.” 

 

“Ha! Can you tell that to Agatha?”

 

“I’ll try. And thanks for letting me crash at your place! First time I’ve had that much space to myself in a long time.”

 

“Of course! I’m just glad it’s getting some use while I still have the lease! Alright, well I’ll catch you later!”

 

—————————————————-

 

Early in the evening, as Rio was working through her physical therapy exercises on the floor with cartoons blaring as background noise, she heard the soft click of the door handle before Agatha stumbled across the threshold and she jumped up to greet her.

 

“My love! You’re home!” she cried excitedly as she took Agatha’s bag from her.

 

“I told you I’d try to get out early!” She replied with a slight, tired smile. 

 

“It’s just after 5:00.” Rio chuckled, unimpressed.

 

“Exactly! I made it home before six.” Agatha sighed as she sunk into the couch. “Help, please!” She pouted as she stuck her feet out for Rio to help her with her shoes. Rio perched herself on the edge of the coffee table, willingly obliging the request. 

 

“How’d the rest of the day go? You all set for tomorrow?” Rio asked as she slid off the shoes

“As set as we can be.” Agatha sighed in relief as Rio began to rub the sore appendages. “It took me another hour with that guy after you left to find a reasonable solution to our power problem but thankfully that’s sorted. Sharon was able to get all the badges made for me while I oversaw the set up of the entryway. Now all that’s left is to hope people actually show up tomorrow.” 

 

“I’m sure it’ll be a hit. I’ve seen it all over social media and even heard them talking about it on the news this week when I was at the hospital. People seem excited.” 

 

“Ugh! I hope so! I can’t afford for this to be a flop after all the work and money we’ve put into it.” 

 

“And all that effort shows! The place looked incredible when I left! I can’t wait to see it all come together tomorrow night!”

 

“I’m so glad you’re going to be there! I don’t think I’d be able to survive the night without you.”

 

“Of course! I wouldn’t miss it for the world!” Rio smiled back though her joy quickly turned to concern as she watched Agatha hiss sharply as her brow furrowed in discomfort. “You ok? What’s going on?”

 

“Nothing…it’s fine. Just sore, my back’s been aching off and on all day.” She said with a wince

 

“Contractions?” Rio questioned, a bit concerned.

 

“No, no, I’m sure it’s just inflammation, a pinched nerve or something from being on my feet too long.” Agatha brushed off with a wave. 

 

“Why don’t I draw you a bath and while you’re soaking I can make us some dinner?” Rio offered

 

“Ugh! That sounds amazing! Why are you so good to me?” Agatha sighed as she reached out a hand, brushing her fingers lovingly along the curve of Rio’s cheek. 

 

“Because you deserve it! You’ve been working too hard and you need to relax.” Rio leaned forward and pressed a kiss to Agatha’s lips, and then to the bump before she stood and shuffled towards the hallway. “Don’t move! I’ll be back in a bit when it’s ready.” she called before disappearing down the hallway. 

 

As she waited, Agatha settled further into the couch, allowing her eyes to flutter closed as she eased into the stillness. Her body was heavy and sore with all she had been putting it through, her feet swollen and pulsing with the rhythm of her heartbeat. Her hips throbbed with the weight and pressure of her son bearing down into the joints. Every movement either of them made now resulted in pain and discomfort. She was tired, tired of the heartburn, tired of being swollen, tired of peeing every hour, tired of being pregnant. 

Yet in her heart the fears still loomed. Though her body was at its limits she wasn’t mentally prepared for what was coming; the labor, the birth, motherhood. It all still seemed too daunting, even with Rio’s attentiveness and support. It was a reality she knew she had to come to terms with but the more she thought about it the further she tried to push it away. She still had time, still had weeks left to go. She could get through these last few hurdles at work and then focus on reconciling the imminent future. Yet even as these thoughts crossed her mind a part of her hummed with anxiety at the shadow of pain that had been visiting her throughout the day and still clung to her now after appearing again moments before. It was nothing…right? 

 

As she washed these concerns from her mind once again she heard Rio’s voice ring out as her footsteps drew close once more. 

 

“Alright, my love! I have everything set, you ready?” 

 

“My heart says yes but I don’t know how I’m going to move at this point!” She cried 

 

“Don’t worry, I got you!” Rio smirked as she hobbled towards Agatha and reached out a hand. She helped her to sit at the edge of the couch then with some effort pulled her to her feet. “You ok?” She asked, seeing the pain in her face as she stood grasping Rio at the shoulders. 

 

Agatha bit her lip as she breathed through her nose, the pain and pressure in just moving to stand was nearly unbearable. “I’m fine…” she grunted as she forced her feet to move. “I shouldn’t have sat down, my whole body is stiff now.” 

 

“It’s ok! Take your time. I’ve got you!” Rio encouraged as she guided Agatha away from the couch. 

 

“Oh yeah?” Agatha huffed as she cracked a smile. “You and that bum knee of yours?” 

 

“My knee’s fine! I’ve got the brace on and the therapist says I’m good to walk around the house at least.” 

 

“If you say so.” Agatha sighed as she waddled down the hallway, holding onto Rio as she winced with each step. 

 

As they made it to the bedroom Agatha began peeling off her clothes. She quickly slid off her shirt and braced herself against the wall as she struggled to rid herself of her pants. 

 

“Here sweetheart, let me help you.” Rio cooed as she guided Agatha to the bed to help her tug them the rest of the way down. 

 

“Fuck! I’m so tired of struggling to do every little thing. I can’t even get undressed by myself!” Agatha groaned as she flopped back, allowing Rio to help undress her the rest of the way. 

 

“I know, Cariño, but it’s to be expected at this point.” She reassured as she pulled Agatha to her feet. “You’ve been so strong, only a few more weeks, my love.” 

 

“Ugh! I don’t know how I’m going to make it a few more weeks. I am so not ready to give birth but I am beyond over being pregnant at this point.” Agatha groaned as Rio eased her towards the bathroom. 

 

“Hopefully this will take your mind off of it, and ease some of those aches and pains, if just for a bit.” Rio smiled softly as she opened the door. 

The room glowed in a warm halo of vanilla and amber, as candles flickered across every surface of the bathroom. Steam curled from the tub along the window as rose petals floated delicately on the surface and soft soothing music lilted from a small speaker across the room. 

 

“You really don’t do anything half way do you?” Agatha chuckled as she stepped into the oasis. 

 

“Not when it comes to you, my love.” Rio cooed as she pressed a kiss to Agatha’s cheek. She led her over to the tub and held her steady as she helped her into the warm water. 

 

As soon as her foot broke the surface Agatha let out a sigh of relief. Slowly, with Rio’s careful assistance, she eased herself into the water, letting out a soft moan as soon as she was submerged. 

 

“Too hot? Too cold?” Rio asked as she laid back. 

 

“It’s perfect, sweetheart, thank you!” She sighed, puckering her lips to invite Rio in for a kiss. 

 

“Alright, I’m gonna go get dinner ready. I have the baby monitor set over there on the counter so holler if you need anything.” Rio said as she swiped a piece of hair from Agatha’s face and placed a kiss on her forehead before heading out. 

 

As she soothed her sore muscles and joints in the warm water Agatha closed her eyes and sank down, submerging herself just above her shoulders. As the pain started to ease she could feel her son begin to shift and move within her. She cracked her eyes open and watched as the crest of her stomach bobbed about in the water. She drew a hand to the surface and danced her fingertips across her belly, circling his movements. 

“Long day huh bug?” She hummed as he continued to stretch. “You’ve been just as busy as I have! Mama felt you movin about all day. I’m sure you’re tired, I certainly am.” She said with a yawn. “You’re getting heavy in there, not sure how much more room I can give you. You just gotta hold tight. Only a few more weeks and then you can join us out here. Mami’s got your room all ready. We’re all very excited to meet you, just don’t listen to uncle Ralph! No surprise appearances ok?” She felt a long rolling shift as her belly button bounced up and down. “I’m gonna take that as a yes.” She chuckled to herself. She closed her eyes as she set her hand to rest on her stomach, letting his little motions soothe her further. It was the most relaxed and calm she had felt in weeks and she nearly drifted to sleep, but as the heat of the water got to her she reluctantly decided to get out. 

 

She slowly sat up out of the water and just as she managed to shift to her knees she felt another tight curling pain begin in her back. It was the same pressure she had experienced throughout that day but it grew stronger and wrapped around the whole of her belly. She gripped tightly at the edge of the tub as the pain intensified and let out a sharp gasp just as it reached its peak. She held on, breathing as calmly as she could until the wave passed and she felt like she could move again. Just as she began to shift, Rio burst through the door. 

 

“Agatha? Is everything ok? I thought I heard you on the monitor.” 

 

Agatha breathed calmly as she smiled up at Rio. “It’s fine! I’m fine. Just having a little difficulty getting out. My back was bothering me again.” She said, not wanting to raise any alarm bells. Surely she had just overdone it for the day and her body was reacting in protest. It was nothing.

 

“I told you to call for me if you needed anything!” Rio scolded. “Here, let me help you out.” She let Rio hoist her out of the tub and wrap her in a soft warm towel. “I’ve set out some clothes for you on the bed, do you want some help getting dressed?” 

 

“No, no I should be fine. The bath helped a lot, I think I can manage now.” Agatha assured, hoping to dissuade any concerns. 

 

“Alright, I’m gonna go finish up dinner. If you do need help just let me know.” Rio replied on her way back out. 

 

As soon as she was out of sight Agatha turned off the monitor and stared at herself in the mirror. She was fine! Everything was fine! Her gaze darted down to her bump as she smoothed a hand over the surface, staring at her profile in the mirror. It was just a fluke, surely! Just a spasm, nothing to worry about. She laughed it off as she ghosted a hand over the surface. 

“Not funny, little bug!” She muttered in a hushed whisper.

 

She hurriedly dried herself off and quick as she could, changed into the large t-shirt and shorts Rio had set out. Once dressed she headed for the door but stopped short, catching her reflection again in the full length mirror. Ralph was right, she was quite round. She analyzed her reflection for a moment longer before brushing the whole thing off and heading for the kitchen. 

 

“Ah! Perfect! Just in time! I made some chicken enchiladas with rice and beans. Go have a seat, I'll bring you a plate.” Too tired to argue Agatha waddled over to the recliner and settled in. Rio buzzed about in the kitchen for a few minutes more then brought her a plate before settling into the couch beside her. “So what’s the plan for tomorrow?” 

 

“Huh? Oh, tomorrow, right, the festival.” Agatha laughed, the question having pulled her back to the present moment. “Well, good news is I don’t have to be in until 11.”

 

“Oh that’s fantastic! Hopefully you’ll be able to sleep in.” 

 

“Hopefully, we’ll see if he lets me.” She said with a nervous laugh. “Bad news is I don’t think I’ll have time to come home and get ready or pick you up.”
