Agatha gave a reluctant nod before Jen dove under the layers of her skirt and pulled off the blood soaked remnants of her underwear. “Fuck!” She gasped as she threw them to the side, out of Agatha’s view, as she and Rio exchanged a quick concerned glance. “Gods, I hate that I’m not wearing gloves right now! Is there like hand sanitizer or anything in this fucking room?” Jen shouted as she sat back on her heels. Rio and Alice began to search frantically just as Agatha screamed out again in pain. Rio immediately turned back to hold and comfort her through it as Alice threw Jen a bottle of hand sanitizer she found in one of Agatha’s desk drawers. 

 

“Alright what’s our timing look like?” Jen asked as she slathered herself in sanitizer. 

 

As Agatha settled again on the other side of the contraction Rio frantically searched for her phone and found it sitting beside her. “It’s…shit, just over a minute.”

 

“Fuck! Ok…ok…” Jen breathed as she psyched herself up. “I’m going in, just try to keep breathing, ok?” 

 

“What the fuck do you think I’m doing?!” Agatha whimpered, clutching at Rio as Jen pressed forward and she winced in pain. 

 

“Oh…OH…ok then.” Jen muttered before she withdrew her hand tinged with blood. “Can I get a towel or a cloth or something?” Jen asked, holding her hand aloft. Alice rushed around to dig through Ralph’s bag and pulled out a hand towel. 

 

“Jen, how we looking?” Rio asked urgently as Jen toweled herself off. 

 

“Exactly how you’d expect with the contractions that close. He’s knocking on the fucking door.” 

 

“What do you mean?” Agatha gasped in panic as her focus bounced between Jen and Rio who were exchanging knowing glances. “What does she mean?” 

 

Jen rested her hands on Agatha’s knees as she turned her worried yet insistent gaze towards her. “Agatha, on the next contraction, I'm gonna need you to push.” 

 

Agatha’s heart sank as her body began to shake in the throws of shock, exhaustion, and adrenalyne. “WHAT?! No…NO! I…I can’t…it’s…it’s not time…it can’t be…I’m…I’m not ready.” she began to cry.

 

“Agatha, you don’t really have a choice.” Jen insisted with a sorrowful lilt to her voice

 

“Can’t…can’t we wait for the paramedics?” She begged as she felt the tendrils of another contraction begin to tighten. 

 

Jen shot a quick look to Rio before turning back to Agatha, “Agatha, I’m not trying to alarm you, but you’re bleeding, quite a bit. I don’t know where it’s coming from but there’s a chance your baby could be losing oxygen and we need to get him out, now! He’s right there, he’s ready, so when you feel the next contraction you have to push, ok?” 

 

Agatha gave a shaky, defeated nod as she reached back for Rio who moved to have Agatha rest against her chest, arms around her sides, their hands entwining into fists as the contraction deepened and she began to push. She bore down with all her might as the pressure continued to build, constricting every muscle in her body as the pain tore through every cell in her body. 

 

“Come on, baby, you got this! That’s it!” Rio cheered her on as she pushed through the last of the contraction and collapsed back in a fit of gulping, heaving breaths. 

 

“Rio…I…I can't, it's too much!” Agatha whimpered as her head fell back onto Rio’s shoulder

 

“Yes you can! You’ve got this! I’ve got you, now just breathe.” She urged as she rested her head against Agatha’s cheek. 

 

Agatha lay there for a moment, chest heaving as Rio held her, before rising her head as another contraction came barreling towards her. She took a deep breath and held it as she curled forward and started to push. 

 

“That’s it girl! Just like that!” Jen coached as Agatha grunted furiously, pushing with every ounce of energy she could muster. The pain was searing as it continued to build and she could feel the pressure growing more and more intense as her son made his way further and further down. Just when she thought she might collapse in exhaustion the contraction released and she cried out with a whimpering breath. 

 

“AH! It burns…Rio it hurts… it hurts so fucking much!” She cried as Rio cradled her in her arms and wiped the sweat away from her forehead. 

 

“I know, I know, Carino! You’re doing so well! You’ve just got to keep going, you’re so close!” 

 

“Agatha, you’re doing great! You’re beginning to crown, just a few more pushes like that and he’ll be here!” Jen encouraged. 

 

“You hear that, baby? He’s almost here! Just a few more, you can do it!” 

 

“This…this isn’t what I wanted! It wasn’t supposed to happen like this!” Agatha sobbed through heaving breaths.

 

“I know, baby, I know, but we’re here now and you’ve gotta push through! I’m right here with you! You can do this!” 

 

She gave a few more heaving breaths before she righted herself and began pushing once again. The pain was white and blazing hot as if it was burning her from the inside out. The pressure between her legs became nearly unbearable as it threatened to split her in half and she cried out in a guttural, primal fury as her legs began to shake. She paused for a moment, catching her breath and gathering every bit of might and power she could as she dug into the depths of her soul to begin pushing again. She fought, pushing hard through to the end of the contraction and as it eased she could, for the first time feel a slight release from the pressure that had only been building up until that point. 

 

“You’re doing so good, girl! You are so close, his head is out. Take your time, catch your breath, when you’re ready you give me everything you’ve got and we’ll get this baby out of there!” Jen cheered encouragingly. 

 

In the wake of the last contraction Agatha lay slumped in Rio’s arms as her chest heaved for air. She could feel a tingling lightheaded sensation as her vision began to grow spotty. She let her eyes flutter closed as her body succumbed to the brief bit of rest she was being granted and she began to drift towards the edges of unconsciousness once more. 

Seeing her begin to slip, Rio gathered her face in her hands and urged her to wake, “No…no, come on baby! Hold on, please! You’re almost there! I can see him! I can see our son!” 

 

“Rio…I…I can’t…I don’t have anything left. I can’t do any more! ” She whimpered breathlessly as she struggled to keep her eyes open.

 

“Yes you can! Just one more! One more and he’s here! You can do this, baby! You are so strong! Jen’s got him, all you have to do is give one more push.” Rio coached

 

“One more?” she huffed as she glanced down at Jen

 

“One more, girl! You can do it! Dig deep! Don’t quit on me now!” Jen prodded lovingly. 

 

“OK…” she breathed as she readied herself with the next contraction.

 

“Let’s go! You got this, Agatha!” Alice cheered from her seat on the couch beside them. 

 

Agatha centered herself as much as she could then took a deep breath in before she began pushing once more. In that moment it was as if her soul left her body and she was nothing but a pure, raw primal force pulling on the very fibers of humanity to deliver her son into the world. As Jen eased him out the scream that tore through her shattered what remained of the person she was before, but on the other side, bloodied and bare, exhausted and drained and limp in Rio’s arms, she was born anew. 

 

“He’s here! Agatha, you did it!” Rio cheered as she held Agatha close and tears began to well in her eyes.

 

Agatha breathed out a soft, relieved laugh as she slowly lifted her heavy head to look at Jen, who had her son stretched over her lap. 

“He’s here…is…is he ok? I…I don’t hear anything.” 

 

The room stilled as if all the air had been sucked out and they looked intently at Jen who was patting urgently on his back trying to get him to breathe. 

“Come on buddy, you’re on the other side, take a breath!” she muttered as she continued her ministrations.

 

“Jen, what’s going on?” Rio finally asked with a nervous waiver to her voice. 

 

“I…I don’t know! He’s…he’s not breathing.” She admitted as she tried to remain calm.

 

“Jen…please!” Agatha sobbed as she watched her urgent actions take no effect. 

 

“I’m trying! It’s not working!” She replied, her voice raising slightly. “I need suction, I think his airway is blocked but we don’t have anything here! We aren’t exactly in a hospital!” She groaned, growing fearful and frustrated.

 

“Here, give him to me!” Rio urged as she reached across Agatha to take him from Jen. His little head fit perfectly in the palm of her hand as his body draped against the length of her forearm. She placed her mouth around his tiny nose and mouth and sucked out the blockage, spitting it on the floor beside her before placing him on Agatha’s chest. Agatha held him close as tears began to stream down her face.

 

“Come on! Come on, just take a breath!” Rio pleaded in a muttering beg as she stroked the back of his head with her thumb.

 

“Please, little bug! Please just breathe!” Agatha sobbed as he lay still in her arms. 




The room fell silent and somber as the seconds passed until a soft mewling whimper broke through the haze. At the noise they all sighed as the fear and tension vanished. Agatha gasped in relieved shock as she felt his hands and feet start to move against her skin. He was alive! Tears of relief and joy burst forth, streaming down her face before spreading to everyone about as they listened to his growing cry. 

 

“He’s ok! Rio, he’s ok!” She sobbed as she looked up into Rio’s waterlogged eyes. 

 

“He’s more than ok, my love!” She said as she pressed a kiss to Agatha’s forehead. “He’s perfect!” 

 

“Jen! You did it!” Agatha gasped through her crying.

 

“That was all you two! I just caught him. Fuckin, House over here saved his life!” she scoffed.

 

“You did! Rio, you really did!” She sighed through shaky tearstained breaths. 

 

“I just did the only thing I could think of. I’m just glad it worked.” 

 

“You’re a fucking hero man!” Alice cheered as she gave Rio a hardy pat on the back. 

 

“I…I feel cold.” Agatha breathed as she began to shiver. She could feel her limbs growing weaker as the faint fuzzy feeling quickly returned. She fought to keep her eyes open but the edges of her vision were starting to fade.

 

“Fuck! I need more towels or cloth or anything!” Jen shouted “She’s still bleeding!” Alice rushed to hand her every fabric within reach which Jen pressed up against the wound. 

 

“Agatha? AGATHA!?” Rio shouted as she watched Agatha’s eyes roll into the back of her head and her body begin to shake. She carefully slid out from behind her and grabbed the baby, wrapping him in her jacket, before Agatha succumbed to a full blown seizure. Just as they were able to roll her onto her side the door burst open and the paramedics rushed in taking over.

 

“Sorry, it took forever for them to get up here through the crowd!” Sharon gasped in the doorway, clearly having run the entirety of the hall to get there. “There’s more coming up the elevator with a stretcher!” 

 

“Thank you Sharon! You might have just saved her!” Rio sobbed with the baby in her arms. 

 

“M’am, we’re gonna need to cut the cord so we can move her.” said one of the paramedics as they dug through their bag. 

 

“Yeah, of course, I can get it!” Rio sniffled as she rifled through a pocket, pulling out her switch blade and severing the cord as the baby wriggled, crying in her arms. Jen rushed over and tied the loose end in a knot as the paramedics turned their full attention to Agatha. Moments later a stretcher was brought in which they moved her onto.

 

“Do you want to go with us or do you want me to take the baby?” Asked another paramedic as they began to wheel her unconscious body out.

 

“I’ll go! I’ve got him, I’ll go with you!” Rio insisted as she started to follow them.

 

“We’ll be right behind you guys! We’ll see you at the hospital!” Jen called after them as she started to gather their things. “Fuck, I am never going to get to wear this pantsuit again after this!” Jen groaned, seeing the damage that had been done.

 

“It’s a shame! It looks really good on you!” Alice sighed, “Maybe you can convince Agatha to buy you a new one after all that!” she shrugged

 

“If she makes it out of this a new pantsuit is definitely on the table.” Jen chuckled though her laugh was hollow. 

 

“You think she will? Make it out of this?” Alice asked, seeing her worry.

 

“I really hope so.” 



—--------------------------------------



Rio hovered in the back of the elevator, clutching the baby now settled into her chest as she watched the team work to stabilize Agatha. They’d strapped an oxygen mask to her face as they collected vitals all the while her head hung to the side with her hair dangling over the side of the stretcher and her eyes remained closed. She was angry, furious that it had gotten that far. That Agatha had pushed herself over the edge to where she gave birth to their son on the floor of her office and now…now it seemed as though she was slipping away. She didn’t get to do that to her! Make her love her so deeply and then leave, nearly destroying them all. How could she live? How could she survive without her? How could she care for their child without her? It wasn’t fair! She needed her! They both needed her! She had to pull through, but would she? 

As they exited the elevator into the surprised crowd she heard a faint whimpering sound at her chest. 

“It’s ok, little bug!” She hummed as she followed the stretcher. “Mami’s got you, you’re ok. Mama…mama’s going to be ok…I hope.”

Chapter End Notes

Hokay, so little bit of a roller coaster but we're nearing the home stretch. Hang in there - there's still a bit to come - we'll see if our girl pulls through.

Rio - gross but hell yeah, she saved the baby.

Also, not to be that person, but it's literally my birthday tomorrow, the 30th and it would absolutely make my day to hear what you guys are thinking, about this chapter, about the book overall! Literally just an emoji would make my entire life. You all are amazing and I appreciate you so much for reading any of this!

Chapter 29: Water and Earth

Chapter Summary

Agatha's fate

Chapter Notes

As always thank you for your patience! This one is a doozy! Also it's way past my bedtime when I'm posting this so if there are any mistakes because I didn't do a final proof read, eh so be it.

See the end of the chapter for more notes

When they arrived in the emergency room that night Rio found herself caught in the maelstrom of doctors and nurses jumping into action as they raced her off towards surgery to try and stop the bleeding. Almost as soon as she had been wheeled out through the doors there was a nurse at Rio’s side prying the baby away from her arms as she stood in shock and worry. 

 

“Tiny little thing isn’t he?” The nurse had said as Rio stared numbly at his fragile body, afraid that if she looked away he might stop breathing. “Just 5lbs and 16.25 inches.” the nurse announced.

 

“Yeah, he’s a bit early. He…uh…I believe he’s starting to show signs of RDS. He’s been having trouble breathing.” Rio mumbled to the nurses who were getting their initial checks.

 

“You are, aren’t you buddy? Poor thing! Don’t worry, Delaney’s getting your oxygen ready then we’ll take you up to the NICU.” The nurse said gently as his little chest heaved and he began to make little grunting noises. 

 

“Are you mom’s friend, sister?” Asked the woman who was seemingly in charge. 

 

“No! I’m her fiancee! This is my son!” Rio growled rather sharply

 

“Oh…oh I’m so sorry! I didn’t mean to assume. We’re going to take him up to finish getting checked out. I’d like to send you out to the information desk so we can keep you updated about your fiancee. We should be able to get him settled in the next hour or so and can have them let you know where to come check on him when he’s ready.”

 

“NICU…third floor.” Rio mumbled, still in shock, still staring.

 

“Y…yes actually…how did you…?” The nurse frowned in confusion

 

“I work here. Very familiar with that wing actually.” Rio answered flatly

 

“Oh, good! Well…not good…but you know where he’s headed at least.” The woman babbled, seemingly incapable of keeping her foot out of her mouth. “And I’m sure you know the team here is gonna take great care of him!”

 

“No doubt.” Rio grunted dryly as they started to wheel him away. She followed along behind him until they passed through to a restricted area where they had to part ways. Though her heart ached at the separation she knew, even if she had had her credentials, it was best to give the team space to stabilize him. Besides, she did need to head to reception and give them her information so they could keep her updated on Agatha, when she was out of surgery and what room she would be taken to. Eventually she pulled herself away from staring at the closed doors and headed for reception. As soon as she pushed through to the other side she heard Jen and Ralph’s voices hurry towards her. 

 

“Rio! Rio! Hey! How are they? How is she?” They asked as they rushed to her side, Jen still in her ruined hot pink pantsuit and Ralph still decked out in his drag best, though he had removed the headdress. 

 

“They…uh…they just took him up to the NICU, he was having trouble breathing. Agatha…Agatha was being prepped for surgery. They couldn’t stop the bleeding on the way in and…and her blood pressure was starting to drop.” She managed to choke out through the lump in her throat.

 

“Shit!” Jen gasped as she clasped a hand to her mouth 

 

“I…I uh, I have to go…” she cleared her throat “go check in at the desk…so they can give me updates.” Rio muttered as reality was starting to set in. 

 

“Do you want us to go with you?” Alice offered. 

 

“Would…would you come with me?” Rio asked Alice directly. 

 

“Yeah for sure! If you guys wanna have a seat we’ll come find you.” Alice instructed as she guided Rio away. They took a few steps across the room and lined up behind an irritated looking woman. “How are you doing?” Alice asked gently to a particularly stunned Rio, still covered in the remnants of what now felt like a living nightmare as she stared blankly at the head in front of her.

 

“I…I don’t really know right now.” She mumbled, not breaking her stare as her mind continued to race over everything that had happened and everything else that might, trying not to let the despair seep too far into her consciousness. 

 

“Fair enough. I’m sure you know this but we’re here for you too, just as much as we are for Agatha.” Alice muttered caringly.  

 

“Thanks, Alice.” Rio replied a little teary eyed before they fell into a patient silence as they waited for their turn at the reception desk. 

 

After what felt like hours but was closer to 30 minutes they had confirmed Agatha was actively in surgery and redirected the group to the surgery waiting area down the hall and around the corner. There they took Rio’s phone number and gave her a patient ID to track her progress on the large TVs on either side of the room, as if they were in a macabre airport. They all quickly settled into a nervous quiet, Jen and Rio pacing back and forth, narrowly missing each other each time they crossed paths. Alice had curled herself into a ball in a chair beside Ralph who was leaning forward onto his knees as his legs bounced restlessly in his red and gold sequined dress. After nearly an hour with no update Rio circled back to the surgery desk.

 

“How can I help you?”

 

“I…uh…just wanted to see if there was any news on this patient.” she asked as she slipped them the paper they had given her. “I have a baby that was admitted to the NICU but I don’t want to leave and miss something.” 

 

“Let me check with the nurse and see if I can get you any info.” The man said as he walked back to call the nurse’s station.

 

“If you want to go check on him we’ll stay here and wait for any updates.” Alice offered as she walked up to stand beside Rio. “I can send Jen up if we hear anything.” 

 

“Thanks. I’ll see what the nurse says and we can go from there.” Rio sighed nervously as the man returned.

 

“She’s still in surgery, they said they can send someone out in a couple hours to give you an update.” A couple hours? It felt like an excruciating eternity, the thought of not knowing, not being able to do anything to help. She felt the tightness in her chest clench further with this news.  

 

“Great. Thank you.” Rio replied solemnly as she and Alice returned to the others.

 

“Any update?” Jen asked, her eyes wide with concern.

 

“They said it’ll be a couple hours before we hear anything.” Alice replied, seeing Rio begin to retreat into herself again in worry. “I think we might go and check on the baby. You two ok to hang out here for the time being?” 

 

“Yeah! Yeah, of course! I’ll come get you if we hear anything!” Jen replied reassuringly as she resumed her pacing. 

 

“Come on, let’s go check in on the little guy.” Alice suggested as she draped an arm around Rio and led her out into the hallway. They wandered into the main entrance as Alice looked around, trying to get her bearings.

 

“Third floor.” Rio mumbled as she started to lead them to the elevators. They shuffled in along with a host of medical staff, a patient in a wheel chair, and a dad with two small children clinging to his legs. As they rose Rio could feel her stomach start to sink. She had been in this elevator countless times and thought nothing of it, but now with Agatha in an indefinite surgery and on her way to see her own son in the ward she had sent many of her own patients to, the box felt hollow and crushing all at once. As the elevator announced their arrival on the third floor she and Alice squeezed their way through the small crowd and headed down the hallway towards the NICU. As they approached the reception desk Rio caught sight of a friendly familiar face. 

 

“Dr. Vidal! I didn’t know you were working tonight! I thought Dr. Jones was on duty.” chirped Gloria, the nurse receptionist she had passed by a hundred times before.

 

“Hey Gloria.” Rio mumbled as she tried to force a smile but it only made her look more weary and dismayed. “I…I’m actually here as family. Patient’s name is Harkness.” She could feel her stomach drop like a stone in water as the words left her mouth. 

 

“Oh, dear! I had no idea! Let me see if they’re ready for you.” Gloria said as she bustled about back into the wing.

 

“Of course, take your time.” Rio sighed as she turned to Alice with a panic now rising in her chest. “Alice I…I don’t know if I can do this.” 

 

“Do what?”

 

“I feel sick, and dizzy.” She groaned as she leaned against the wall. “I know what I’m about to walk into and I…I just don’t know if I can see him like that. It breaks my heart just thinking about it.” She groaned as tears began to prick her eyes. 

 

“Rio, I’m…I’m so sorry! I can’t begin to imagine what you must be feeling right now! We can come back later if you’re not ready to do this yet. I just thought it might put your mind at ease to see that he’s alright at least.” 

 

“I thought so too. But now I…” Rio was cut short as Gloria returned.

 

“He’s all set back there, sweet little thing! Are you ready to head back?” Rio gave a quick glance to Alice before taking a hard swallow, gathering whatever courage she could muster, and nodded to Gloria. “He’s in bay 3.” she noted as she opened the doors for them. 

 

Rio walked cautiously forward as the familiar cacophony of beeps and whirring called her in. She knew every corner of this facility but in the grip of fear and anxiety it all had a haze of unease that further unsettled her. It felt like stepping into the twilight zone. The frigid glow of the overhead lights sent a shiver down her spine and prickled her arms with goosebumps as she eased closer and closer to bay 3. As her eyes landed on the incubator she felt the lump return to her throat and tears return to sting at her eyes. Just beyond the glass she could see his tiny body splayed on the striped hospital blanket awash in the glow of the incubator lights. A series of wires and pads were stuck to his little chest as it rose and fell in a calmer rhythm than she had last seen. They had fashioned a little blue cap to his head and a tiny cpap machine was attached to his face. His eyes were closed and he seemed at ease in a peaceful slumber. Though it was indeed jarring at first, Rio felt a wave of relief at seeing him safe and sound, which surprisingly released the floodgate of tears she had been holding in from the moment they had arrived. 

 

“Look at him!” She sobbed to Alice as her hands rested on the glass. “He…he looks good, better than I expected. He’s already got his color back!” She breathed through a teary smile.

 

“He looks great! Handsome little guy!” Alice chuckled as she rubbed a comforting hand along Rio’s back. 

 

“Ugh! He looks so peaceful. Miles better than when we got here.” she sniffled.

 

“Hey! Dr. Vidal!” called another familiar voice. “Gloria said you were in here. Is this one really your’s?” 

 

“Hey Holly. Yeah, this is our guy.” Rio sighed as she dried her eyes.

 

“Oh my gosh! Congratulations! I knew you guys were getting down to the wire but I didn’t realize how close!”

 

“Yeah, closer than we realized I guess. He…uh…he seems to be doing well. Already breathing better.”

 

“Oh yeah! Carly and I got him hooked up as soon as he got here and started the surfactant therapy about an hour ago, he’s already doing much better.” Rio’s chest eased further at that news.

 

“Did everything else check out alright? Any other issues?” She asked as her gaze drifted back down to the sleeping child.

 

“No, he’s perfectly fine otherwise. As long as he continues to improve I’d say he may only need a day or so of therapy before he’s breathing on his own. How’s your girlfriend doing?”

 

“She…uh…she’s in surgery now, so we’re…we’re still waiting to see.” Rio admitted solemnly 

 

“Oh my gosh! I’m so sorry! I…I didn’t realize” Holly gasped in worry

 

“It’s ok. I know she’s in good hands, it’s just very nerve wracking with him here and her…”

 

“Oh of course! I can’t even imagine! If you need anything please let us know!” she insisted

 

“Thanks Holly, I appreciate it. Is…is it alright if I touch him?” She asked cautiously as her gaze bounced back to the incubator. 

 

“Oh, of course! You know where the sanitizer is, I’ll go grab you a chair.” She said as she rushed off to the other side of the room. Rio shifted past Alice and took a dollop of hand sanitizer from the dispenser mounted on the wall before squeezing back next to the box. “Here you go!” Holly said as she rolled up a chair behind her. “Take as much time as you need.” she said with a comforting smile before stepping away to manage another patient. 

 

Rio tucked her good leg underneath her as she sat and brought a hand up to open the porthole by his feet. She carefully slid a hand in, brushing the edge of his tiny foot with the back of her fingers causing him to flex his toes and pull his leg back. She let out a small laughing gasp in astonishment. She was reminded of all those times she had snuggled against Agatha’s bump, feeling him twist and squirm beneath her skin, and now here he was, still somewhat of a barrier between them, but she could touch him, feel the softness of his skin and see his legs kick about at her touch. She delicately unlatched the other porthole by his head and snuck her other hand inside, grazing his plump little baby cheek with the tips of her fingers. 

“Hey there little bug!” She hummed tearily as her finger wandered down to press at the palm of his tiny hand which quickly curled around it. “You made it! They’re gonna take good care of you here. Holly’s the best. And I’ll be here, Mami’s got you.” She said as she rested her head against the box and let her eyes flutter closed as the tears began to stream down once again. She was so grateful, he was indeed safe and sound and well taken care of, yet her heart ached at being unable to hold him, only able to graze her fingers along bits and pieces of his fragile body. She longed to swaddle him close, feel his tiny breath against her skin, the only piece of Agatha she could touch in this purgatory of agonizing waiting. The not knowing, the waiting, not being able to do anything for either of them was creating a burning ache in her chest that she didn’t know how to extinguish. 

 

She sat there for another hour or so, not breaking contact as she studied every detail about him. Meanwhile, Alice had drifted off to sleep in a chair nearby, her head resting against the wall. A string of drool began to drip out of the corner of her mouth just before she was startled awake by a hand gently shaking her knee. 

 

“Shit! Jen! You scared the crap out of me!” She gasped as she stretched herself awake. 

 

“How’s he doing?” Jen asked as the commotion caught Rio’s attention. 

 

“He’s doing alright.” Rio hummed as she cupped a hand around his tiny head. “Any news?”

 

“They said they’re going to send someone out to give us an update. I thought I’d come grab you if you’re ready.” 

 

“Yeah…yeah. Just…uh…just give me a minute I’ll meet you out in the hallway.” Rio sniffled, turning back to the baby as Jen gathered Alice and they headed out into the hall to wait. 

 

“Alright, little bug. I have to go see how Mama’s doing. I promise I’ll come back as soon as I can, ok? You be good for them while I’m gone.” She sniffled as she withdrew her hands and pressed a kiss to the glass. “Mami loves you sweet boy.” She muttered as she stepped away at last, tears once again pricking at the corners of her eyes. 



As she walked out into the hallway, teary-eyed, Alice and Jen flanked her, wrapping an arm around her shoulders and waist in a hug as they guided her over to the elevators. None of them said a word as the car descended back to the first floor, the air was too thick with worried anticipation and Rio could sense the sinking feeling return as she stepped out and headed back down the hall to the surgery waiting area with Jen and Alice in tow. As soon as they entered the receptionist popped up from behind the desk and led them into another room off to the side where Ralph was already waiting. 

 

“They should be in shortly to speak with you.” The man said as he closed the door behind them. 

 

“Did they say who was coming to talk with us?” Rio asked as she began to pace the length of the small room.

 

“No, but I’m guessing it’s the surgeon.” Jen replied, her leg bouncing anxiously

 

“Do you know who was on duty tonight?” Rio asked as she began to pick at her nailbeds

 

“No clue.” Jen muttered as she interlocked her fingers with Alice’s, who sleepily leaned her head against Jen’s shoulder. The room fell into a hushed anticipation, each of them too anxious to breathe properly as the time stretched on and on. Then, at last, there was a soft knock at the door. Their heads snapped up at the noise and Rio stepped forward to answer. 

 

“Woah! Full house!” said the surgeon as he stepped into the room. “I’m Dr. Stark, just to make sure I’m in the right place, you’re the family of Agatha Harkness, correct?” he asked as he looked at his chart.

 

“Yes, I’m her fiancee, how is she?” Rio practically barked at him

 

“It was touch and go there for a while but we’ve finally got her stabilized. Are…are you all family? I only ask because of HIPPA…”

 

“Yes, that’s her sister and her wife” she said pointing to Jen and Alice, “and he’s the father of the baby!” Rio spat, “Now, tell us what happened!” 

 

“Oh…ok, alright! Just needed to be sure. It appears she had a placental abruption that was causing her to hemorrhage. It was a struggle to remove the rest of the placenta so we could find the source of the bleeding but in the end we were able to locate the source and cauterize it. In the meantime she required several transfusions before the issue was finally resolved. Given the amount of blood loss and the seizures…”

 

“Seizures? She had more seizures?” Jen gasped

 

“One as we were prepping her for surgery and another right before we found the source of the bleeding. Given that, we’ve elected to put her into a medically induced coma and she’ll be transferred to the ICU for the time being so we can closely monitor her recovery. These next few days are going to be critical so we want to make sure we can provide the care she needs. She’s very lucky she got here when she did, if it had been even a few minutes later we might be having a very different conversation.”

 

Rio stood there stunned and numb as the reality of what he was saying slowly seeped into her. Agatha was stable, but just barely by the sound of it. She had come within a breath of losing her forever and that truth was crushing. She felt the slightest trickle of relief that Agatha had survived but the river of fear at the fragility of the next few days was nearly drowning her dry. 

“When…when can I see her?” Rio choked out as tears leaked once again from the corners of her eyes. 

 

“The anesthesiologist and the rest of the surgery team are getting her ready to transfer now, as soon as we have her set in the ICU we’ll let you know what room she’s in and you can see her, though they may only let a couple of you up at a time since it’s after visiting hours.” 

 

“Right, of course.” Rio mumbled as she wiped her raw, tear stained cheeks dry once more. 

 

“Do you have any other questions for me?” He asked. Rio shook her head along with the others. “Alright, hang tight. We should have her settled within the hour.” He said before making a quick exit. 

 

“Fuck!” Jen gasped as her head flopped into her hands. 

“Holy shit!” Alice snorted in disbelief as she banged her head back against the wall.

 

“At least she’s alive.” Ralph mumbled hopefully

 

“At least? Dude she’s in a fuckin coma!” Jen spat

 

“I get that! I’m just trying to stay positive. It could be worse!” He groaned back at her

 

“Not by much!” Jen growled

 

“Guys! Shut up!” Alice scolded them as her gaze fell to Rio who was silent, still staring blankly at the closed door. “Rio? How are you feeling?” Alice asked cautiously as she rose to stand behind her. 

 

“She’s ok…” Rio whispered to herself as she squeezed her soggy eyes closed. “She’s ok, she’s going to be ok, she has to, she has to be ok…” she continued to repeat quietly under her breath, hoping if she said it enough it would dispel the very real fears that loomed in the back of her mind. She could feel her spine prickle with dread as Alice placed a comforting hand on her shoulder, breaking her from her meditative focus and pulling her back into the horror of what was actually happening. Her chest clenched in panic and she could feel her limbs start to tingle as her breath became trapped in her lungs. As her eyes shot open they darted around the small room catching the stares of everyone watching her begin to come apart. It was suffocating, the room, the attention, the knowledge that Agatha had only just survived. It all seemed to close in on her at once. She turned quickly, fumbled with the door handle as her hands began to shake, then swung it open wildly as she stormed out through the waiting room and out into the hallway with the other three following closely behind. 

 

She rushed through the lobby, narrowly avoiding several other patients and hospital staff as she barreled through the exit doors out onto the sidewalk of the receiving bay, all the while struggling to catch her breath as the panic seemed to seep further. She continued down the sidewalk and around the corner where she could feel her legs begin to wobble as her mind began to swim in a dizzy lightheadedness. She stumbled sideways, catching herself just barely on the side of the building as her body succumbed to the hysteric fear that was growing inside her and sank to the floor. Her head fell back against the cement structure as she tucked her knees in close to her chest feeling it heave as her heart pounded furiously throughout her body. She closed her eyes once again as the tears streamed out from the far corners of her eyes and she exhaled deeply, trying at last to calm herself as best she could. 

 

“Rio?...RIO?” She could hear them calling for her as their hurried footsteps grew closer. 

 

“She’s over here!” Jen shouted as she rounded the corner. “Hey, Rio, you ok?” she asked, crouching down as the other two rushed up behind her. 

 

“No, I’m not fucking ok!” She heaved, glaring at Jen. “I….I…I almost lost her…I..I still might!” she sobbed. “I knew…I knew this would happen!” she wailed as she tucked her head against her knees. 

 

“You did?” Ralph asked, confused.

 

“I told her! I told her to take it easy…she was pushing herself too hard… and now look! Look where we’re at! She nearly killed herself!” Rio screamed as she collapsed back against the wall. “I…I should have done something! I shouldn’t have let her do this stupid festival! I should have taken her away when I had the chance! Then maybe none of this would have happened!”

 

“No! No, don’t do that to yourself! There’s nothing you could have done!” Alice cooed, settling beside her. 

 

“I could have insisted! I could have taken better care of her!” Rio cried

 

“Rio this isn’t your fault!” Jen insisted as she shifted to sit in front of her. “Should she have taken a step back? Probably, but knowing Agatha that was never going to happen. And even if by some miracle it did this still could have been a possibility. Even under the best of circumstances shit can go sideways quickly. Don’t blame yourself. If anything you saved them both!” 

 

“Yeah that shit you pulled in her office to get him to breathe? Fucking heroic dude!” Alice lauded

 

“And the way you took control and had Sharon call the paramedics when she did, it clearly saved her life!” Jen praised. “I know this is a horrific nightmare right now but you will get through it, both of you. You know how excellent the staff is here, they’re going to take great care of her and help her make a full recovery.”

 

“And that baby of yours is strong as hell and will be breathing on his own in no time.” Alice added

 

“And we’ll be there for you, both of you, whatever you need, every step of the way.” Jen insisted with a comforting smile.  

 

“Y..yeah?” Rio shuddered, coming down from the peak of her wailing. 

 

“Of course dude! We’re family after all!” Alice chuckled

 

“Yeah, her sister? Really?” Jen snorted

 

“I mean…practically. It was the first thing that came to mind.” Rio shrugged as her mouth twitched in the shadow of an amused smirk.

 

“We’re just lucky he didn’t give it a second thought!” Alice scoffed

 

“He was probably too afraid to question it with the crazy eyes Rio was giving him!” Ralph snorted. 

 

“Yeah, you looked like you were about to rip him apart!” Alice chuckled

 

“I almost did.” Rio huffed. “I’d waited long enough at that point.” 

 

“Touchè!” Jen chuckled. “Well, I don’t know about you but I for one have had enough of sitting on what may be the most disgusting surface I’ve come into contact with today, and considering earlier, that’s saying something.” Jen groaned as she moved to stand. 

 

“And since I didn’t get a chance to try any of the food trucks and all I had was that feuerzangenbowle, I am absolutely starving!” Alice grumbled as she rose and helped Rio up from the ground. 

 

“And I refuse to walk around a hospital barefoot but if I don’t change out of these shoes soon I might combust.” Ralph groaned. 

 

“How about this, now that she’s relatively in the clear, Ralph, you and I can run back to their place and clean up a bit. You can get out of whatever that sequined monstrosity is and I can stop wearing this biohazard of a pantsuit. Rio, we’ll bring you back some fresh clothes and toiletries and shit since, let’s face it, you’re not leaving this place any time soon, and you and Alice can hunker down in the cafeteria until she gets assigned a room.”

 

“That sounds like a plan. Thanks, Jen. I guess I probably should try to eat something, I haven’t touched anything since lunch earlier today.” Rio admitted

 

“Yeah, we should definitely get something in you, it might help you feel a bit better, relatively speaking.” Alice shrugged

 

“Oh and while you’re there can you make sure to feed Scratchy? I’m sure he’s climbing the walls right now.” Rio added as she and Alice started to make their way inside. 

 

“Oh, absolutely! Pretty sure he’d kill us if we didn’t” Ralph snickered as he and Jen started heading towards the cars. 

 

“We’ll let you know when we’re headed back. Just send us an update when she has a room!” Jen hollered after them to which Alice gave her a thumbs up.  



Still in somewhat of a delirious haze Alice and Rio wandered up to the hospital cafeteria where they scrounged to find the most edible looking items from the remnants that were left. Alice built herself a smorgasbord of snack foods while Rio settled on a soup that had been sitting in the warmer for way longer than it should have, the warmth of which soothed a bit of the aching nausea that was still plaguing her. Neither of them spoke as they tucked into their meal, opting to let the tension breathe as they ate. Then, as Alice finished her fourth bag of chips, Rio got an automated text from the hospital.

 

Patient 016931031 has been transferred to ICU bed 333

 

As her eyes flitted across the glowing screen Rio could feel her heart skip a beat as a fresh wave of anxiety washed over her. 

“She has a room.” Rio muttered as Alice tilted the bag over her head, dumping the crumbs into her mouth. 

 

“Nice! You ready to go see her?” Alice asked as she crumpled the bag in her hands

 

“Yes…and no.” Rio replied as she stirred the spoon in her half eaten soup. 

 

“Understandable.” Alice sighed. “There’s no rush. We can go whenever you’re ready.”

 

Rio stirred her soup silently a few more times before she responded. “I don’t know that I’ll ever be ready. It was hard enough seeing him in the NICU when I knew what to expect. With her…I…I don’t even know how to prepare myself.”

 

“I don’t think you can. Which, I know, isn’t particularly helpful, but it’s the truth. It’s probably going to be overwhelming, let it. Don’t try to avoid it. You’ll be no good to either of them if you bottle this up.”

 

“Putting that psychology degree to good use I see.” Rio smirked

 

“Hey, it’s gotta come in handy sometimes doesn’t it?” Alice snorted

 

“Fair enough. I guess there’s no point in delaying it any further then.” Rio mumbled as she grabbed her soup container and pushed herself up from the table. 

 

“Right behind you man.” 





They walked silently into the elevators and pressed the button back up to the third floor. 

 

“At least they’re close together.” Alice muttered.

 

Rio quirked a solemn smile. “Silver linings, huh?” 

 

“Silver linings.” Alice repeated

 

They stepped out into the now barren hallway and walked through the ICU waiting area, up to the reception desk there. After a brief security check they were granted entry and the large mechanical doors clicked to unlock and swung open. With it being after midnight the lights in the ward were dimmed, a smattering of nurses hovered at the station in the center as the rooms splayed out in a circle around them. They passed by a few rooms where the curtains were drawn, the mumbling of a TV could be heard behind one, behind another was the moaning and crying of a tired and confused man. Then they arrived at 333. Rio stilled before the curtain, the sounds of monitors beeping and the wooshing of a ventilator seeped through the thin divide. She drew up a shaky hand, clutching the rough fabric and took a deep breath as she pulled it to the side. 

There, splayed in the middle of the hospital bed, highlighted by the empty glow of the under lights with dozens of wires strung off every limb and a breathing tube strapped to her face was Agatha. Her color was pale and sallow, her cheeks hollow and her eyes closed, heavy and dark. Her long hair was woven like a dark shroud around her, half matted and dripping off the edges of the bed. 

Rio’s heart dropped and her breath stuttered at the sight. She slowly crept into the room and up to the side of the bed. Her hand reached out as she neared the edge and grazed the tips of Agatha’s fingers. They were cold, clammy and felt almost lifeless. Rio startled at the touch, then her gaze lifted, fixating on her pallid expression. She raised her hand drawing it to Agatha’s cheek as she grazed her thumb against the surface. It too was disturbingly cool to the touch. She bit her lip back as she felt the tears begin to swell once again. She leaned forward and pressed a kiss to the crown of her head before resting her forehead against Agatha’s. 

“Oh, my love.” she whispered against her temple. “I…I thought I’d lost you!” she gasped as the emotions that had been building through the night finally overcame her. “You’re…you’re going to be ok…You’re going to make it through this…you have to.” she whimpered as she drew her fingers through her hair. “I need you…our son needs you.” she sobbed as the words sent a dagger through her heart. “I saw him, I saw our boy…He’s beautiful…Agatha, he’s perfect… I wish…I wish you could see him too.” she could feel the pain in her chest tightening with every word. “You will, you will see him. You’ll get through this, baby. And I’ll be right here...” she sobbed as she collapsed into a pool of tears around her, holding her as close as she could manage. 

Cautiously Alice walked up beside her, laying a caring hand on her back as she grieved Agatha’s condition. Slowly Rio rose, drying her raw face as she turned to Alice. 

“It’s…it’s worse than I expected.” She shuttered “Seeing her like this, and I can’t do anything. It’s torture.” Rio groaned 

 

“I’m so sorry, Rio. I wish there was anything else I could say to make this easier for you. But truely, I am so, so sorry.” Alice said as she gathered Rio in a hug just in time for her to dissolve into a puddle of tears. They stood there for a moment as Rio finally released all of the pain she had been holding in since they arrived. Eventually the storm of grief passed and she pried herself from Alice’s embrace. 

 

“This fucking sucks.” Rio huffed as she dragged the back of her hand across her face. 

 

“It does, but it’s not forever. She will get through this.” Alice offered reassuringly

 

“Gods I hope so. I… I don’t know what I’d do if I lost her after all of this. I don’t think I could survive.” Rio shuddered

 

“Don’t even think of it! She’s going to be fine. I’m sure she’s through the worst of it.” Just then Rio felt her phone buzz in her pocket. 

 

“Oh, Jen and Ralph are back.” She sniffled.

 

“You rest here.” Alice insisted as she started to head out. “I’ll go down and grab them.”

 

“Th…thanks Alice. For everything.” Rio sighed as Alice gave her a comforting smile and dipped out behind the curtain. 

 

Now alone, Rio turned back to face Agatha’s battered, vacant form. Though the sounds of the machines told her that she still clung to life it was clear by her appearance that it was only by the skin of her teeth that she did so. It felt as if at any moment she could slip beyond the vale leaving Rio forever. With that fear in mind Rio returned to her side and eased her way onto the bed next to her, careful not to disturb any of the equipment as she did so. She rolled onto her side, cradling Agatha’s body as best she could. Rio rested her head in the crook of her neck as her fingers threaded themselves with Agatha’s, mindful of the IV line as she did so. If this indeed was their final night together Rio would cling to her until her last breath. 



—----------------------------------------



She didn’t remember falling asleep, nor anyone returning, but as her eyes blinked open with the morning light streaming in through the blinds she caught sight of Jen and Alice snuggled tightly into a recliner in the corner. And as her mind adjusted to consciousness she heard the steady beeping of the medical devices around her, signaling that Agatha had at least survived the night. She slowly raised her head and examined her in the fresh light. Though she still appeared pale and fragile, Rio could feel a warmth that had begun to return as she grazed a thumb along her cheek. She let out a small sigh of relief as her eyes fluttered closed and she rested her head against her cheek. 

 

Suddenly her stillness was broken as the curtains scraped to the side and a nurse walked in. 

 

“Oh! Sorry, hope I didn’t wake you! Just need to do my final rounds before shift change.” she whispered, creeping around Jen and Alice as they slept to get a read on the machines. 

 

“Oh, no, not at all. I was already up.” Rio yawned. “How is she?” 

 

“Doing well so far. Her vitals stayed steady throughout the night. No major issues. The doctor’s making his rounds now so he should be in shortly. He’ll be able to give you a better update on where she’s at and the timeline moving forward.”

 

“Amazing, thank you! What time is it, exactly?” 

 

“Just about 7. Is there anything I can get you before I head out?”

 

“No, no I should be fine. Thank you.”

 

“Of course! I know this is the last place you want to be right now so if there’s anything we can do just let us know.” 

 

“I appreciate that! Will do.” Rio sighed as the nurse left and she snuggled back into Agatha’s side. 

 

“Morning.” She heard Jen hum from the recliner beside her. 

 

“Morning.” Rio sighed with a smile

 

“How’s she doing?” Jen yawned

 

“She’s still alive. The nurse just said the doctor would be by in a bit to give us a better update. You guys didn’t have to stay.”

 

“It was like 1:30 by the time we got back up here. There was no way I was driving home at that point only to wake my ass up and come check on you two in the morning. How are you doing?” 

 

“Better after some sleep.” Rio yawned

 

“Glad to hear it.” Jen groaned as she stretched her way out of the chair. 

 

“Knock knock!” Called a voice before the curtain swiftly swung open, startling Alice to wake. “Oh wow! We’ve got the whole crew here!” Admired the doctor as he sauntered into the room. “Hope your stay wasn’t too unpleasant!” He chuckled to which they all glared at him. “I’m Dr. Banner, the attending. I understand we had a rather eventful evening?” 

 

Jen and Rio side-eyed each other. “You could say that.” Rio groaned, irritated by the chipper casualty he addressed them with. 

 

“It looks like things have calmed down a bit post surgery, though. Our vitals have remained stable, organ function looks good. Looks like the seizures have stopped as well. All good signs!” 

 

“Glad to hear it.” Jen scoffed, unamused by his demeanor. 

 

“I’m going to take a quick look at the incisions and make sure there isn’t any additional bleeding.” He said as he snapped on a pair of gloves. Rio slid off the edge of the bed and made her way over to stand by Jen with her arms crossed as they skeptically watched his examination. “There’s definitely a bit of swelling but I don’t see any additional or continued bleeding which tells me we’re on the right track.” 

 

“No shit!” Jen snickered under her breath as she rolled her eyes.  

 

“So with that in mind, here's kind of our plan moving forward. Dr. Stark wants to keep her under for 24-48 hours, depending on how things go, to limit as much stress as possible so her body can focus on healing. We do have her scheduled for a CT scan later to reconfirm that everything internally is still in good shape. After that we’ll likely reduce the sedation a bit to check her general responsiveness and overall progress.” 

 

“What kind of complications are we looking out for?” Jen asked

 

“Any sign of infection or sepsis, blood clotting with the transfusions, then of course organ damage. So far she’s not showing any signs, but it is a little early to say we’re completely in the clear. ” 

 

“When do they have her scheduled for the CT scan?” Rio asked 

 

“Looks like 1:00. And the sedation vacation should be around 2:30.” They all stared at him stunned and unamused. “Any other questions?” 

 

“No, I think we’re good.” Jen replied dryly

 

“Alright! Well you folks have a good day!” He said rather cheerily as he scooted out of the room. 

 

“What the fuck was wrong with that fucking guy? Sedation vacation? Read the room dude!” Jen groused 

 

“He’s young. Hasn’t honed his bedside manor yet.” Rio replied flatly

 

“No shit! I was so close to wiping that fucking smile off his face. Does he think this is some kind of joke or something?” Jen spat

 

“He was probably just trying to lighten the mood.” Alice suggested. 

 

“It didn’t lighten shit! If anything it pissed me the fuck off!” Jen barked 

 

“Sounds like someone needs her morning coffee!” Ralph chuckled as he pushed his way through the curtains carrying a tray of coffees and a bag of food. 

 

“More than you know!” Alice snickered as she grabbed the drinks from him and handed them out. 

 

“How’s our girl?” Ralph asked, unpacking the bag of food. 

 

“Not completely in the clear but improving according to Dr. Smiley.” Jen grumbled before chugging her iced latte. 

 

“Dr. Smiley?” Ralph frowned amused

 

“Don’t ask.” Rio and Alice groaned in unison as they tucked into their breakfast. 

 

“How’s the kid doing?” Ralph asked through a mouthful of breakfast burrito. 

 

“Shit! I meant to go back and check on him last night but I passed out. I…I need to go.” Rio said as she set down her food and started to head out before Jen stopped her. 

 

“Girl, chill. He’s fine. Eat while you can. We can go and check on him in a bit. Besides, you should probably change out of those nasty ass festival clothes at some point.” Rio glanced down, only now realizing she was still in her dress pants and button up from the night before. 

 

“A shower probably wouldn’t be a bad idea either.” Ralph added. 

 

“Last night was a lot. Agatha and the baby are taken care of and safe, you gotta take care of yourself for a bit.” Alice reminded her. 

 

Rio said nothing but a soft smile tugged at her lips. Slowly she made her way over to grab her breakfast and sit at the edge of the bed as the others settled into comfortable conversation around her. 





After a satisfying breakfast, a quick shower in the staff locker rooms, and a fresh change of clothes thanks to Jen, Rio was beginning to feel like a person again. She swung back by Agatha’s room to check on her before heading to see the baby. Alice and Jen, having found their favorite murder doc series on the TV, were more than happy to keep Agatha company while she popped out for a couple hours. Ralph, on the other hand, practically jumped at the chance to go with her. 

 

“I’m like the only one who hasn’t met him yet! Which I think is rude considering he has like half my dna or whatever.” 

 

“It’s not our fault you were busy shaking your plastic tits while Agatha was squeezing him out.” Jen scoffed

 

“I was with Sharon flagging down the ambulance! There was no way they were gonna find her in that crowd! I, on the other hand, could have been spotted from space and cleared their path on the way in.” He bragged, defending himself.

 

“You do know how to clear a room, I’ll give you that!” Jen snorted. 

 

“Whatever. So can I go? Pretty please?” Ralph begged

 

“Yeah of course.” Rio laughed, shaking her head at their antics before leaning down to give Agatha a kiss goodbye. “I’ll be back in time for your CT scan, my love.” 

 

“Can she hear you?” Ralph asked, perplexed. To which Rio shrugged as she headed out of the room. 

 

“Later bitches! I’m going to meet the baby!” He said as he started to follow her out. 

 

“By daddy!” Jen teased 

 

“Ew! I hated that!” 










As they approached the reception desk Rio found herself filled with more excited anticipation than the dread she had carried with her the night before. With the reassurance that Agatha and the baby were both healing and on their way to recovery she had a renewed sense of calm about their situation. As the doors to the NICU swung open and she stepped inside she could feel a spark of joy ignite in her chest at returning to her son, this was only heightened by Ralph’s buzzing anxious excitement as he followed her in. 

 

“You nervous?” She asked as they rounded the corner. 

 

“A little bit.” He admitted “I want to make a good first impression!” 

 

“I’m sure you will.” She chuckled, “though I doubt he’ll remember it.” 

 

“He probably won’t, but I will.” He laughed nervously. 

 

With a beaming smile on her face Rio approached the incubator. “Hey little bug!” She cooed down at him through the glass. “How you doing? I missed you!” She hummed as her eyes grew misty watching him squirm as she spoke. He seemed more lively than the night before. “I brought a friend to come meet you.” She glanced over her shoulder to Ralph who was standing cautiously several feet back. “What are you doing?” She laughed. “Get over here!” 

 

“Sorry! It seemed like you two were having a moment!” He said as he crept forward. He craned his neck as he approached and his eyes grew wide in shock as they landed on the baby. “Woah!” He gasped 

 

“What?” Rio snickered

 

“I…I don’t think I’ve ever seen a baby that fresh before! Granted this probably the third baby I’ve ever seen but damn! It’s wild! He’s so tiny!” 

 

“Yeah, he’s pretty small. That’ll change quickly. It’s hard to believe seeing him now but in a year he’ll be running circles around all of us.” Rio chuckled as she imagined chasing the tiny being around in the back yard. 

 

“Fucking wild! Do they ever let him out of this box?” Ralph asked, his eyebrows scrunched in concern. 

 

Rio chuckled, “Eventually, yeah. Until he’s breathing on his own they keep him on lockdown.”

 

“So you can’t like hold him or anything?” 

 

“No, not yet.” She sighed wistfully. “But you can touch him. Give him a little handshake.” Ralph looked at her skeptically “if you want.”

 

“You sure?” He asked as Rio moved to get some sanitizer. 

 

“Yeah, it’s fine, I promise.” She assured as she opened the porthole. Ralph slathered himself in sanitizer then eased his hand towards the opening but stopped just before entering. 

 

“I’m nervous, I don’t want to break him.” 

 

“You won’t break him!” Rio laughed. “Just be gentle, you’ll be good.” 

 

Ralph took a deep breath then slowly pressed his hand inside. He gently snuck a finger into the palm of his tiny hand causing the little digits to clasp around it. “Woah!” He gasped as his eyes grew wide once more. 

 

“Pretty crazy huh!” Rio chuckled 

 

“This is insane!” He huffed, in awe

 

“You did that, man! For Agatha…and for me.”

 

“It was nothing…” he replied half in a daze of amazement. 

 

“It was everything. Really Ralph, I can’t even begin to thank you for what you’ve given us.” 

 

“You don’t have to. Just take care of them, like I know you will. If the last, what, 36 hours have shown me anything it’s that you are going to be a bomb ass parent and Agatha is so fucking lucky to have you!” 

 

“Thanks Ralph.” Rio replied as a soft smile danced across her lips.

 

“Hey buddy! Nice to meet you.” Ralph murmured as he wiggled his finger in the baby’s hand. “I’m your uncle Ralph. Despite what your moms may think, I’m here to tell you, you got your good looks from me!” 

 

“I don’t know about that!” Rio scoffed. “If anything he inherited your instinct for dramatic flair.”

 

“You certainly did make quite an entrance didn’t you?” He chuckled. “What’s his name?” 

 

“I…uh…we…well we hadn’t really settled on one.” Rio stammered, somewhat nervously.

 

“Seriously?” He scoffed as he whipped his head around to glare at her in shock. 

 

“Agatha said she was narrowing it down but she didn’t tell me to what.” 

 

“So he just doesn’t have a name?” He asked, arching his eyebrow, not hiding his judgement. 

 

“I mean technically no, not yet. Agatha can decide when she wakes up.” Rio insisted

 

“So what have you been calling him? Baby?” Ralph laughed

 

“I mean according to the hospital he’s baby boy Harkness until she names him. But, he’s…he’s just little bug. That’s what we’ve been calling him at least.” Rio explained

 

“Little bug?” He repeated, eyebrows raised in skepticism as he turned back to look at the baby. “Eh. I can see it. He is kind of squirmy. Well, nice to meet you LB!” 

 

“Hey Dr. Vidal! Holly said you’d probably be stopping by.” Called a friendly voice, drawing their attention. 

 

“Hey Summer! Yeah, had to come check on the little guy. How’s he doing?” 

 

“Dr. Jones was in here about an hour ago. Said his lung function has significantly improved. They’re taking him down to just nasal cannula and looking to try some formula later this afternoon.” 

 

“Seriously? What time?” Rio gasped in shocked excitement.

 

“Probably around like 4:00 if you wanna stop by and help.” Summer offered

 

“Oh absolutely!” Rio practically shouted at her in joy. 

 

“After everything we’re gonna take it slow and see how he does throughout the night with the feedings but you should be in the clear to hold him tomorrow.” 

 

“Really?” Rio asked, starting to get choked up. 

 

“Yeah really! He may have been early but he was ready!” 

 

“What…ah…what time tomorrow?” Rio asked, trying to clear the frog from her throat. 

 

“I’d say if you want to stop by after shift change in the morning I can get you two set up.” She smiled excitedly. 

 

“8:00?” 

 

“8:00 is perfect!” 

 

Rio dove forward gathering her in a hug. “Thank you! Thank you so much!” 

 

“Of course!” Summer laughed. “Anything for you Dr. V!” She said as Rio finally released her. “I’ll see you this afternoon?” 

 

“See you then!” Rio called as she left to tend to a patient. “Ah! Did you hear that?!” Rio yelped with glee as she turned back to Ralph. 

 

“He’s a champ! Fucking miracle baby!” Ralph cheered as he brushed a finger along the baby’s cheek.

 

“Feeding tonight then I’ll hold you in my arms tomorrow! AH! Mami’s so proud of you little guy!” She cheered before she quieted and a painful thought tugged at her heartstrings. “I wish Agatha could be here for this.”

 

“I know.” Ralph sighed. “She will be, soon enough.”



After another hour or so of ooing and awing over every movement and sound the baby made, Rio and Ralph reluctantly left to grab a bite to eat before heading back to Agatha. Jen and Alice dipped with Ralph to get some rest at home while Rio remained with her as they took her for the scan. The CT scan went off without a hitch and confirmed the doctors findings from earlier, the bleeding was stopped and hadn’t resumed. As soon as they settled her back into the room the anesthesiologist and Dr. Stark arrived and began weaning her sedatives. 

 

“She should start to wake within the next hour. If you want to go grab some coffee or a snack we can come get you when the check is complete.”

 

“Thank you, but I’d prefer to stay.” Rio said as she shuffled to Agatha’s side. “I need to be here when she wakes up.”

 

“While I understand the inclination, I really must insist. Though I’m sure the results will be positive, the process can be quite distressing.” 

 

“As a medical professional myself, I understand that and am prepared for that potential outcome.” He started to protest before Rio cut him off. “Don’t fight me on this. You will not win.” 

 

“Fine.” He groaned. “All I ask is that regardless of what happens you don’t try to interfere.”

 

“You have my word.” Rio said as she resigned herself to the recliner next to the bed. 



Rio sat and watched carefully as the minutes ticked by. For a good while Agatha remained still and silent, the only sounds in the room being the wooshing of the ventilator, the beeping of the machinery, and the heavy drumbeat of Rio’s heart in her ears as she waited for any sign of consciousness. After what felt like ages she saw the tips of her fingers begin to twitch and she heard the nurse call Dr. Stark to attention. 

 

“She’s beginning to wake.” 

 

“Very good. Ms. Harkness, can you open your eyes for me?” he asked as he leaned over the head of her bed. Rio watched with bated breath as her eyebrows scrunched slightly and her eyelids began to flutter. She seemed to struggle for a moment before finally her eyes cracked open revealing her hazy blue orbs. As they began to search the room a look of fear and confusion overtook her face. Rio stood at the periphery, hoping her presence might bring her some comfort. “Good. You’re safe. You’re here in the hospital and you have a breathing tube in. Try to remain calm as best you can, ok?” She blinked back at him as her face scrunched further in discomfort. “Can you squeeze my hand?” He asked, to which she responded weakly with the action. “Very good…”

 

“Her heart rate is climbing.” signaled the nurse.

 

“Are you feeling any pain?” she nodded slightly as a tear crept out the corner of her eye. “Let's give her 2 milligrams of morphine IV push.” He indicated to the nurse. “You should start to feel better in just a moment. Now, I want you to try and take a deep breath for me.” Her eyes began to widen in panic as her hand came up to grasp at the tube. “No, no, that’s going to stay in place for now. Just breathe around it.” She took a gasping breath in as her chest began to heave. 

 

“Respiratory rate 18, tidal volumes good, she’s triggering the vent well.” said the nurse as she monitored.

 

“Very good. I just want you to keep breathing for me.” Dr. Stark continued his checks as Agatha’s eyes began to dart around the room, taking in her surroundings but never quite landing on Rio. As she did so Rio could see a sense of panic begging to rise within her. Her hands began to wander to the wires and lines attached to her then she tried to pull at the covers around her.

 

“Ms. Harkness try to remain calm, just focus on breathing.” Dr. Stark urged to no avail. Rio held her tongue and her position as she watched Agatha struggle to come to terms with what was happening. She had promised the doctor she wouldn’t intervene but every fiber of her being was aching to comfort her.

 

“Her blood pressure is rising.” The nurse warned. 

 

“Let’s go ahead and resedate, I don’t want her going into cardiac arrest.” He ordered. 

 

The nurse moved to administer the medication and just as Agatha’s panicking eyes finally caught sight of Rio they fluttered closed again. Rio bit the inside of her cheek as she fought to hold back the tears that were threatening to spill. It was harder than she thought, but in the end she was glad she had stayed, Agatha at least knew she was there. 

 

“Ms. Vidal…”

 

“Dr.” Rio corrected. 

 

“Dr. Vidal, as you can see she’s not quite ready to come out from under sedation. Her body is still weak from the blood loss and she’s in quite a bit of pain, though breathing wise I’m happy with where she’s at. For the time being she’ll remain intubated with partial support to relieve stress on her cardiovascular system, though if we’re able to keep her relaxed enough tomorrow during our check I'm inclined to extubate.”  

 

“She might be more relaxed if she knew I was here with her.” Rio grumbled

 

“We can see during tomorrow’s check, but this type of agitation is common when waking up from that level of sedation. For now we’ll just try to keep her comfortable.” 

 

“What time?” Rio murmured as her gaze fixated on Agatha.

 

“As long as I’m not roped into a surgery I should be by around 1:00.” He said on his way out. 

 

“Alright. Thank you doctor.” Rio mumbled as she wandered back over to Agatha’s now limp form. She eased onto the bed beside her, brushing her fingers along her hairline as her other hand grasped at her palm. She leaned forward and pressed a teary eyed kiss to her forehead and as she did so she felt a soft squeeze at her finger tips. “Oh, my love.” Rio sighed solemnly “ I’m right here with you. You’ll get through this.” 





As the time drew nearer to 4, Ralph returned to keep watch over Agatha while Rio left to go feed the baby. Her heart was still heavy at leaving her beloved after the traumatic awakening earlier that day but she couldn’t bear the thought of missing out on their child’s first milestone. 

For the first time since their arrival she slunk into the NICU alone with a spark of joy that was just beginning to shine. As she wandered up to his incubator which was now open exposing him to the room. She immediately noticed his little face beaming back up at her. The CPAP had indeed been replaced and she could at last see the details that had been hidden by it. His plump little cheeks and tiny button nose which held the cannula supporting his breathing. His mouth was scrunched in a cute little pout that instantly reminded her of a face Agatha would make when she was being bashful or begrudgingly amused. 

“There you are, little bug! Miami’s so happy to finally see you!” She cooed as she reached a hand down to cup around the top of his head. At the touch and sound of her voice he turned, opening his eyes to blink up at her. Though they still had the misty sheen of a newborn she could see a shimmer of Agatha’s icy blues staring up at her and her heart clenched in bitter sweet joy. 

 

“Hey Dr. V! You got here just in time!” Summer lilted. “I just got his formula ready.” 

 

“Ah! Amazing! Where do you want me?” Rio practically squealed 

 

“I’ll have you come around to the side here.” She instructed. “And if you want to put a hand under his head there we’re going to prop him up just a bit.” Rio flexed her fingers nervously then gently scooped her left hand under his head as she lifted it up. The size of it barely matched that of a softball in the palm of her hand. He squirmed a bit as his arms flung out in reflex before he quickly settled.”Perfect! Just like that. Now, here’s the formula.” She handed over a bottle the size of a large syringe. “Just go slow, we’ll see how he takes it.” Rio eased the bottle towards his face and as she brushed the nipple against his lips he opened wide and immediately began to suckle. “Look at that! He’s a natural! You both are!” Summer praised.

 

“You are! Aren’t you, little bug!” Rio cheered as her eyes grew misty. “Mami’s so proud of you!” 

 

“I’ve gotta run and check on another patient. Holler if you need anything.” Summer lilted as she crept away.

 

Rio blinked away the wetness from her eyes as she watched him drink. She couldn’t help but be in awe of the tiny creature blinking back up at her. After all they’d been through he had recovered well and was progressing quickly. She ached for Agatha to reach the same fate, to have her by her side soaking in these life changing moments. She hadn’t thought of it before but seeing him now she wondered, what would happen when he was released? It seemed like sooner rather than later he would be freed from the NICU, but Agatha, after her brief bout of consciousness earlier, seemed further behind and likely to linger in the hospital at least for a while. What would she do? She couldn’t leave Agatha but the idea of managing a newborn through her recovery in the hospital seemed daunting and ill advised. She pushed the thought to the back of her mind for the time being, determined not to let her fears spoil the joy of the moment, but she knew as soon as she left she would have to come up with a plan. 

 

Just as he finished the last of the bottle Summer returned to help relieve her. “I told you! He may have been early but clearly he was ready.” She said as she gathered the bottle and handed over a blanket. “If you want to roll him over we can try and burp him a bit before he lays back down.” Rio rolled him onto his side with the blanket in front of him to catch any dribble and began to pat his back. 

 

“He’s so quiet!” She noted as she watched him start to fall back to sleep. “Has he been like this the whole time?”

 

“For the most part, yes. He got a little fussy when we were putting the tubes in but he settled back down pretty quickly. He’s just been taking everything in.” 

 

“Is that right? You being a good boy? Not giving them any trouble?”

 

“He’s pretty perfect! Just gotta hope it lasts.” Summer chuckled just as he let out a tiny burp. “There, that should be good if you want to lay him back down.” Reluctantly Rio eased him back down onto the bed and pulled her hand away. “You’re welcome to stay as long as you like. I’m out of here at 7 and I think Holly will be back in for the night shift.”

 

“I’ll probably dip out once he’s asleep but I’ll be back bright and early tomorrow morning.”

 

“Awesome! I’ll see you then!” Summer smiled and waved as she stepped away once again. 

 

Rio turned and looked back down as she grazed her fingers along his forehead. She watched as his eyes blinked back at her, growing heavy as sleep quickly tugged at him. Her mind swirled with a mix of pride, and hope, and fear at the coming days but that was drowned out by the love that swelled in her heart as he drifted off to sleep. 

 

————————————————

 

The next morning she woke with the dawn as she peeled her face from the side of Agatha’s bed. Though her body ached from sleeping in a seated position, her mind pricked with excitement as the moment she had been waiting for quickly drew nearer. 

 

“Today’s the day, carino.” She hummed as she placed a kiss on Agatha’s cheek. “I get to hold our boy! He’s doing so well, I wish you could see him. He’ll be out of here before we know it.” She murmured as she brushed her fingers through Agatha’s hair. “And you will too, my love. I hate to leave you, but I have to go get ready. I’ll be back, though. I’ll be here when you wake. For now, Ralph is here.” She said, glancing over at the snoring pile of clothes in the recliner on the other side of the room. She crept past his sleeping form and readied herself for the moment she had been anxiously awaiting.




At 8:00 on the dot she was through the doors of the NICU, practically vibrating with excitement. 

 

“Morning Dr. V!”

 

“Morning Summer! How’s my boy?” 

 

“Holly said he did great last night, the other feedings went well. I just got him changed so he’s all ready for you! If you wanna grab a seat I’ll bring him over.” As quickly as she could Rio settled into the nearest recliner and readied herself as Summer gingerly lifted him from the incubator. She could feel her heart begin to race with excitement as she drew nearer and nearer. She leaned down and carefully placed his tiny body against her chest and quickly wrapped a blanket around them both. She could feel his hands and feet squirm against her body as she struggled to adjust and he started to let out a soft whimper. 

 

“Shhh, shhh, it’s ok, little bug. Mami’s got you.” She hummed as her hands moved to wrap around him. She soon felt his head relax onto her chest and she leaned down to kiss him with tears pooling in her eyes. “Oh, little one! You have no idea how long I’ve waited to hold you in my arms.” She sighed as a stray tear broke free. “Te amo mucho, mi pequeño bichito.” She rocked gently as she savored the moment, feeling at last like a small piece of her was healing through this ongoing trauma. She closed her eyes and hummed a soft lullaby she pulled from the depths of her childhood memories, a small piece of her mother that until then had been lost to time. 

 

An hour quickly passed before Summer was back to check on them. “How we doing?”

 

“I don’t think I can ever move again.” She sighed as she brushed a thumb along the back of his head. 

 

“I can’t blame you, you two look pretty comfy!” She chuckled. “It is getting close to feeding time though. I’m happy to bring the bottle over if you want to feed him again.”

 

“Oh, absolutely!” Rio nodded vigorously. 

 

“You got it. I’ll be right back.” Summer chuckled as she stepped away. 

 

“You hear that, little bug? Feeding time!” She hummed as she pulled him away from her chest to cradle him in her hands. His little arms wiggled in shock but quickly settled as he blinked back up at her. It was then that she noticed he had no breathing assistance. There were still a few cords attached tracking his vitals but he was breathing free and clear on his own. “No oxygen?” She gasped as Summer returned

 

“No, we took him off just before you got here.” She smiled as she handed her a blanket and the bottle.

 

“And he’s doing alright?” 

 

“Everything’s stable. As long as he keeps this up he’ll be transferred to the nursery tomorrow morning.”

 

“Tomorrow?!” Rio gasped, half excited, half terrified. “You hear that bug? You might be graduating tomorrow! When do you think he’ll be cleared to leave?” she asked as she began to feed him.

 

“Well, technically he’d be cleared to go home but they’ll need to finalize the paperwork before they can let him leave. They’ll need his name for the birth certificate and social security.” 

 

“Oh right.” Rio sighed, dismayed at this hiccup. 

 

“But we’re not going to rush you. I know mom is still recovering. How’s she doing?”

 

“She’s…she’s doing alright. They’re going to wake her again this afternoon so we’ll see how that goes.”

 

“Well, I’ll keep my fingers crossed for you.” She said with a caring smile. 

 

“Thanks, Summer.” Rio sighed

 

“Of course. I’ll be back to check on you two in a bit.” 

 

As she and the baby were left alone once again Rio began to feel a nervous tension start to creep in. She knew it would be a while before Agatha would be well enough to go home and the idea of having him cooped up in the nursery, nameless for the time being, set her on edge. Yet there was nothing she could do but wait. Wait until she was awake. Wait until she gave him a name. Wait until they could finally go home as a family. And when would that even be? Given her condition just that morning it seemed like an eternity away. For the time being all she could do was revel in the joys of a healthy baby and hope that Agatha would come around soon. 





Rio stayed as long as she could, holding the baby close, feeding him, changing him, telling him of the love both she and Agatha held for him, until at last it was time to leave. She managed to settle the sleeping child back in the incubator with little help and sneak out just in time to grab a bite to eat before heading back to Agatha. Just as she was leaving the cafeteria with a sandwich in hand her phone began to ring. She fished it out of her pocket only to find Lilia calling her. 

 

“Hey! Lilia! I’m so sorry I’ve been meaning to call you!” She said as she answered. 

 

“Oh, not a worry at all dear, something tells me you’ve had your hands full! How is she?” Lilia lilted back

 

“Agatha?…well, she’s alive. They have her sedated in the ICU.” Rio could hear a heavy sigh radiate through the phone. 

 

“I was afraid of that. How are you? How’s the baby?” She asked rather melancholicly. 

 

“I’m doing alright. Just trying to hold everything together while she heals. The baby, he’s doing great actually. They’ve had him in the NICU but it looks like they might release him to the nursery tomorrow morning.” 

 

“That’s wonderful news, dear! Have you been eating? Getting any sleep?” 

 

“Sleep has come. I wouldn’t say it’s been restful but I’ve managed to get a few hours in. You actually caught me grabbing lunch, I just left the baby and am on my way back to see her. They’re supposed to be waking her up here again soon.” 

 

“Well then I won’t keep you. Just wanted to see how you were doing since I hadn’t heard anything in a few days. My intuition was tingling.”
