“Well, per usual, your intuition was spot on. Thanks for checking in.” Rio chuckled mirthlessly.  

 

“Of course, sweetheart! Feel free to say no, but I cooked up a big pot of my stew, any chance I could bring you some for dinner?” 

 

“That would be amazing, actually.” 

 

“Wonderful, then I’ll plan to bring some by. Does 6:00 work?” 

 

“Yeah, that sounds great.” 

 

“Alright, dear. I’ll see you then.”

 

“See you then. Love you Lilia.”

 

“Love you too sweetheart.” 

 

As she hung up the phone she could feel a warmth fill her chest. Having been caught up in the malaise of the last few days it was comforting to hear from Lilia. She hadn’t realized how isolated she felt, despite their friends being there, but the realization that Lilia would be coming gave her a sense of solace she hadn’t realized she had been missing. And now in particular, as she walked in for what was bound to be another stress inducing ordeal, she was grateful for that support to look forward to. 






As she entered Agatha’s room Dr. Stark and the nurse were already at her side and Ralph was now hovering anxiously in the corner. 

 

“Hey, sorry, Lilia called me on my way back. Everything ok?” She asked him. 

 

“Yeah, they got here like 10 minutes ago. You mind if I head out and grab some food. I don’t really wanna be here for this.” He sighed. 

 

“Yeah of course. I’ll let you know when they’re done.” Rio assured as she waved him out. “How’s she doing?” She asked, turning to Dr. Stark. 

 

“So far so good. Blood pressure’s a little low but that’s common at this level of sedation, it should level out when she wakes up. We just stopped the propofol so it should be about 20 to 30 minutes. We went ahead and administered some pain medication to avoid agitation this time. The plan today is to extubate and see how she does.” 

 

“Then…will she stay awake?” 

 

“Possibly. It depends on her comfort level when we wake her. If she’s not handling it well we may put her back under but it would only be a fraction of where she was before.” 

 

“That sounds like good news.” 

 

“Her body’s responding well, the swelling has already gone down significantly and she’s had virtually no complications. It's more about pain management at this point. The more comfortable she is, the faster she’ll heal.” 

 

“Naturally.” This time as they waited Rio situated herself on the edge of the bed next to Agatha, holding her hand as she brushed her fingers through her hair. She couldn’t help but notice that her color was nearly back to normal, the sunkenness of her eyes had lessened and there was a rosyness about her cheeks. She let a small piece of herself hope that maybe once she awakened she would be well enough to remain that way. Before long she felt Agatha begin to stir as her fingers closed around her hand. “I think she’s waking up.” She announced to the doctor and nurse. 

 

“Good. Ms. Harkness, can you open your eyes for me?” This time her eyes blinked open easily and quickly found Rio. “Alright, I’m Dr. Stark, do you remember me from yesterday?” She nodded as her hand reached up to try and pull at the tube. “Careful! Careful! We are going to try and remove that today but first you need to relax and breathe.” She took a struggled, gulping breath at first as she remembered how, then quickly eased into a steady rhythm. “Very good. We have your partner with us today. She and your friends have hardly left your side since you’ve been here.” He nodded towards Rio who looked lovingly down at her. A tear immediately drew to Agatha’s eye as she blinked back up at her. 

 

“You’re doing so good, carino.” Rio hummed as she stroked her fingers through her hair. 

 

“Are you in any pain?” Dr. Stark asked to which Agatha nodded. “Can you show me with your fingers on a scale from 1-10, 10 being the worst?” Agatha slowly lifted her hands, drawing one away from Rio, to hold up 6 fingers. “Alright, we’re going to adjust your pain medication a bit so you should be feeling better soon.” He said as he nodded towards the nurse. They continued to monitor her as she eased further into consciousness. 

 

After a while Rio could feel Agatha begin to relax at her side as the medication began to take effect. About 30 minutes in, Agatha reached over to gather Rio’s attention. 

 

“Yes, my love? Are you still in pain?” Agatha shook her head as she attempted to mumble around the tube. “No, no, don’t try to talk, not yet.” Agatha let her eyes flutter closed as tears once again began to well in them. When she opened them again they held a sense of fear and urgency, then she brought Rio’s hand down to rest on her stomach. “The baby?” Rio asked to which Agatha nodded and cried. “He’s fine! He’s perfectly healthy.” At that Agatha began to sob further. 

 

“Please try and relax Ms. Harkness, you’re doing great, we’re nearly ready to take the tube out.” Dr. Stark urged. “How’s her blood pressure?” He asked the nurse.

 

“Slightly elevated but steady.” she replied

 

“Good. I’m not going to prolong this any further. Ready the respiratory therapy.”

 

“Yes, doctor.”

 

“Alright, Ms. Harkness, this may be a little uncomfortable but it’ll be over quickly. I’ll have you take a deep breath then I’m going to need you to cough for me, ok?” Agatha nodded and took a deep breath in as Dr. Stark readied himself. “Alright, and cough.” She let out a horrendous hacking sound as he pulled the tube free then the nurse quickly stepped in and placed a breathing tube at her nose as she continued to cough for a bit. 

 

“You did so well, sweetheart.” Rio cheered as she leaned down to press a kiss to her forehead. 

 

“Rio…” Agatha rasped shakily.

 

“Yes, my love?”

 

“What…what day is it? How long have I been out?” she croaked

 

“It’s Sunday afternoon. You’ve been out for almost two days.” Rio replied

 

“Two… two days?!” She gasped. “Where..” she started but coughed again. “Where is he? Where’s my baby?”

 

“They sent him to the NICU when we first got here but he’s already doing so well, they’re going to transfer him out tomorrow.” Rio said, trying to ease her worry.

 

“Please! I want to see him!” she begged through ragged breaths as tears streamed down her face. 

 

“You will, Ms. Harkness, but for now you need to rest. You’ve been through quite a lot and your body still needs some time to heal.” Dr. Stark insisted

 

“When…when can I see him?” she panted

 

“Let’s see how you’re feeling over the next few hours. This is not something we want to rush, it could cause further harm and delay the healing process.” he warned

 

“I promise, as soon as I can I will bring him to you.” Rio said as she cradled Agatha’s face in her hands, urging her to look at her. 

 

“Rio…Rio what happened? I don’t remember anything after…” She trailed off as her face scrunched, searching for the memories. “I remember the festival…and Herb…and I…I was having contractions. I was going to find you but someone stopped me…I…I don’t quite remember what happened but I ran to my office and then…it’s all kind of fuzzy after that. Rio…I…I’m so sorry…I didn’t mean…this…this is all my fault!”

 

“It’s ok, it’s alright. Don’t worry about that right now. You’re safe, you’re both ok. That’s all that matters.” Rio hummed as she pressed her forehead to Agatha’s

 

“Dr. Vidal.” Dr. Stark called Rio over to where he was standing near the curtain. 

 

“I’ll be right back, my love.” Rio cooed as she pressed a kiss to Agatha’s cheek and hurried over. “Yes?”

 

“Despite her being understandably upset, I’m satisfied with where she’s at. Her heart rate and blood pressure are stable so we aren’t going to sedate her any further at this time, though we may revisit that later this evening to make sure she rests through the night.” Rio let out a sigh of relief. “We’ll see how she does over the next few hours but I’m inclined to let her see the child sooner rather than later.”

 

“Seriously?” Rio gasped “That…that would be amazing.” 

 

“Though I would like to keep the visit short, I think it would bring her some peace of mind and help her relax.”

 

“I completely agree!”

 

“In the meantime, I know you’ve had a host of visitors but she needs rest, I’d hold off on having anyone come by for the time being.” 

 

“Understood.”

 

“Very good. A nurse will be in around four to see where we’re at. In the meantime I’ll try and arrange for them to bring him after.” 

 

“Wonderful! Thank you doctor!” 

 

“Of course.” He muttered as he exited into the ward. 

 

Rio turned back ablaze with relief and excitement as she wandered over to Agatha.

 

“What did he say?” She groaned sleepily

 

“That you’re doing great. He’s happy with where you’re at, but you need rest so no visitors.” She explained as she snuggled in beside her on the bed.

 

“Visitors?” Agatha grumbled

 

“All your friends. We’ve been worried sick about you! Ralphs downstairs now in the cafeteria. Jen and Alice have been in and out. I talked to Lilia a little bit ago and she was going to stop by later but I’m going to have her hold off until tomorrow.” Rio babbled as she texted everyone the update. 

 

“Mmmm, but you’re staying right?” Agatha hummed as her eyes drifted closed again.

 

“Of course, my love, I’m not going anywhere!” 

 

 —------------------------------

 

The hours passed quickly and before long a nurse was drawing back the curtain once more, waking them both from sleep. 

 

“Hello Ms. Harkness! How are we feeling?” He asked. 

 

Agatha blinked herself awake again as she grumbled her response. “Sore, and somehow tired.” 

 

“That’s to be expected, the sedative is still working its way out of your system. You’ll likely feel groggy and a bit out of it the rest of today at the very least. How’s your pain on a scale from 1-10?” 

 

“About a four. My back actually hurts more than anything.” 

 

“I’m not surprised. You’ve been in roughly the same position since you arrived. Though you’re not quite ready to move around just yet, we can adjust the bed so you’re a bit more comfortable.” He offered as he began to prod at her abdomen, checking the wounds. “Any change in pain?” 

 

“No but that’s definitely uncomfortable.” She groaned. 

 

“Very good. Well, I’m not going to poke at you any more today. We are planning to give you another dose of pain meds in about 2 hours. Is there anything else I can get you in the meantime?” 

 

“Some water? My throat is so dry!” She croaked. 

 

“Unfortunately I can’t give you any liquids just yet but I’m happy to grab you some ice chips.” He explained. 

 

“Whatever you got, I’ll take anything at this point.” 

 

“You got it! I’ll be right back! Oh, Dr. Vidal, would you mind helping me for a minute?” 

 

“Sure!” Rio yawned as she stretched out of the bed. “I’ll be right back, Cariño.” She said, placing a kiss on Agatha’s cheek before she shuffled out of the room behind him. 



Agatha lay there for a moment, slowly coming to terms with everything that had happened while she waited for them to return. She was still so tired and in truth her body ached from head to toe. The room around her still didn’t feel quite real. What exactly had happened? She slowly peeled back the blankets and lifted up the hem of her hospital gown only to find a bandaged wound on her somewhat deflated stomach. The memories of that night were slowly coming together in pieces. She now remembered waking up in Rio’s arms. She heard vague echoes of Jen coaching her to push. Then there was the brief feeling of holding her baby on her chest, his tiny warm body squirming against her as he let out a soft cry. The mere thought of him drew tears to her eyes. She wished now more than anything she could hold him in her arms. As she wiped a few stray tears away the nurse wandered back in. 

 

“Here you go hon! Anything else I can get you?” He asked as he handed her the small cup. 

 

“No, I should be fine. Do you know where Rio went?” She asked 

 

“She just stepped out for a bit. She should be back any minute.” 

 

“Alright. Thank you.” She mumbled. 

 

“Of course! And I’m just a button push away if you need anything!” He said pointing to the call button before stepping back out. 

 

Agatha leaned back and slipped an ice chip into her mouth. The cool cube was soothing as it melted and trickled down her sore throat. She let her eyes flutter closed for a moment as she reveled in the sensation. As she opened her eyes to grab another piece she saw the curtains of her room begin to flutter then Rio popped her head through sporting a delighted smile.  

 

“Where did you run off to?” Agatha chuckled weakly. 

 

“Just down the hall and around the corner.” She shrugged. 

 

“Well are you going to come back in or just hover in the doorway?” Agatha sighed 

 

“That depends, are you up for a visitor?” Rio asked, cheekily arching an eyebrow. 

 

“I thought the doctor said no visitors.” She frowned, unclear what Rio was getting at. 

 

“Well, he did make one exception.” Rio beamed. “Close your eyes.” 

 

“Haven’t they been closed enough?” Agatha scoffed. 

 

“Come on! Close them!” Rio urged

 

“Alright, alright.” Agatha agreed as she leaned back and did as she was told. She listened closely as she heard the curtain scrape and then Rio’s footsteps shuffle in and up by her side then pause. “Can I open them?” 

 

“Just one second!” Rio replied and she heard her shuffle around. 

 

“You better make it a quick second before I fall back asleep.” Agatha quipped. 

 

“Alright, you can open them.” Rio said at last. Agatha cracked an eye open in the direction of Rio’s voice then her eyes suddenly shot open. Rio stood beside her, carefully holding their swaddled son in her arms. Immediately tears of joy began to stream down her face as she reached out her arms for him. Rio inched in closer, sitting on the edge of the bed as she passed the tiny sleeping baby to Agatha. 

 

“H…hi.” She murmured in shock as he settled quickly into the crook of her arm. “I…I can’t believe you’re here!” She gasped softly as she grazed a finger along his little plump cheek. “My sweet little bug!” She cooed as she gathered him close and pressed a kiss to his forehead, breathing in the intoxicatingly sweet scent of her child. Her heart swelled with a love so vast she thought it might explode. He was here, now, safe in her arms and she had never felt more whole. “Rio…he…he’s…”

 

“Perfect, isn’t he?” Rio hummed as she snuggled in beside them. 

 

“In every way!” Agatha sighed as she pulled him back to take him in more fully. “He’s really ok?” 

 

“Clean bill of health! He’s quite resilient, just like his mama.” 

 

“Oh my baby!” Agatha sighed as she felt a wave of emotion wash over her seeing his tiny fragile form. “I’m so sorry I left you!” She sniffled as the tears began to stream again. “I didn’t mean to! Mama loves you so much, little one!” She cooed as she drew him close once more and pressed her lips to his forehead. “But… I know mami took good care of you while I was gone.” She sniffled as she at last looked back at Rio. “Thank you!” She sobbed as she collapsed onto Rio’s shoulder. 

 

“Of course my love! I’m just so glad we’re all together again.” 

 

“Me too.” Agatha huffed as she quelled the tears once again. 

 

“There is just one thing still missing.” Rio smirked

 

“Oh? And what’s that?” Agatha asked as she dried her face with the back of her hand. 

 

“Our little bug needs a name!” Rio chuckled. 

 

“Ha!” Agatha gasped out a laugh. “You’re right! I don’t think we can call him little bug forever.” 

 

“Well we could but that might not go over well when he gets into school. Do you know what you want to call him?” Rio asked

 

“I have an idea, I just hope you’re ok with it.” Agatha admitted as she bit her lip nervously 

 

“I’m sure whatever it is, it's perfect for him.” Rio assured 

 

“I was thinking, Nicholas.”

 

“Ni…Nicholas?” Rio replied in shock. “That was my brother's name.” 

 

“I know. I remember when you said it in the car. It always stuck with me, and now that I see him. It just…fits. Is that ok?” 

 

“Is it ok?!” Rio let out a laugh of astonishment. “Oh, Cariño! I didn’t think I could love you any more than I already did.” She sighed as she pressed a kiss to Agatha’s lips. “I am honored that you would name him after my brother. He would have loved being an uncle!” 

 

“I’m glad you approve.” Agatha beamed. “Nicholas Aloysius Harkness.” She announced as she grazed her fingers along his head. 

 

“Aloysius? Really?” Rio snickered 

 

“He needs a little bit of both of us.” Agatha shrugged. 

 

“Fair enough.” Rio laughed, "Oh, little Nicky, you are so loved.” She sighed as she rubbed a finger along his cheek. 

 

“Our perfect boy!”

Chapter End Notes

How we feeling folks? A little touch and go there but our girl made it! And Nicky finally has his name, officially! Next chapter should be out sooner rather than later!

Afterword

Please drop by the Archive and comment to let the creator know if you enjoyed their work!
